title: So elegant and visually appealing
body: What a gorgeous app- that alone makes me want to open it and track. I love that it there's a water tracker, daily fruit and vegetable and weekly seafood tracker and that they give you a life score with details on what to improve each week. Sure, a few glitches like not currently syncing with Health app (I open both then close both and open once more then it tracks), and the recipes and sometimes the database doesn't have the exact food but does have something comparable, just takes a smidgen more work. The beta camera isn't the greatest if you have a deep dish as opposed to a plate but it sure is handy and easy enough to adjust. And there's not many recipes, but the ones available are easy to follow and pleasant to eat, plus how often does one follow a recipe to a T? I've tried other tracking apps (looking at you MFP) and all the ads and monotone color scheme make them too unidimensional- this is beautiful, too beautiful not to use. And the step counter that equates steps to what you burn makes me just competitive enough with myself to make me want to walk even more (I burned 1.5 croissants?!? Bet I can burn 2!). I'd like to buy the app developers a beer. Then go walk said beer off. I saw a couple of review that say the app is rigid in terms of certain foods like sunflowers, and though I appreciate the sentiment, I am using the app for weight loss and do indeed want to know if a food is high in caloric content.

title: Beautiful! But could use customized notifications.
body: This app is gorgeous! I love the articles and the recipes look absolutely scrumptious. The aesthetics alone are what make this the most effective app, and it is super smooth! Even on this old phone, where everything else crashes. Huge thanks to the devs for achieving this. Now, I turned on notifications expecting reminders to update my water or add my meals and exercise, which would be really nice! Sometimes you get busy and don't track anything; it is the LAST thing on your mind. I did, however, get constant reminders to update my weight. As someone who has a Lifesum of 119 (almost completely perfect! üò≤), I find that a little unhealthy. No-one should be weighing themselves every day, especially if you already have an unhealthy relationship with your weight, body fat percentage, or food. Even on a practical level, it doesn't make much sense. So I turned off the notifications, but it would be nice to be able to select what kind of notifications we get in the future! Such as for new recipes or articles, and reminders in other areas of body and health maintenance. Or a way to change the frequency: Weighing yourself every X amount of days. If there is already a way to do this, I hope the settings for it become easier to find. ‚ù§Ô∏è Thanks for reading!

title: Beautiful and easy to use with some adaptability issues
body: First of all, the visual design of this app is incredible. Other similar apps have designs that make it feel outdated, which in turn can make the data or plans feel outdated even when that‚Äôs not true. Gorgeous color scheme, icons, motion design, etc, and lots of great features like the barcode scanner and ability to quickly select previous days‚Äô meals.

title: Meal plans impractical
body: Just downloaded this today and got a premium subscription for 3 mos. Haven‚Äôt been able to do much but most of the features seem nice! I like that it tells you how good certain foods or meals are for you and tracks how ‚Äúon track‚Äù you are. It puts it a step ahead of most other trackers I‚Äôve seen.

title: Delete My Fitness Pal!
body: I don‚Äôt normally review apps but this is one EVERYONE should definitely try. This is the first app that I‚Äôve actually lost weight with.. it actually helps you develop better eating habits. I know that there‚Äôs a lot of hype behind My Fitness Pal, but I swear, after trying both, LIFESUM BEATS MY FITNESS PAL HANDS DOWN. Nearly everything since the app has gone through updates is perfect. The user-face is simple and easy to use, without the annoying ads other apps have. You can adjust everything to fit your personal goals, even if they go beyond what the app recommends. They even include a macro calculator that makes things easy to calculate. The grading scale is really helpful to see where you can improve. It takes everything into account, calories, macros, sugar, fiber... it‚Äôs pretty comprehensive. Also, I love that I can keep everything private, it‚Äôs not necessarily a competition against all of my Facebook friends. The graphs and diagrams make seeing long term trends quick and easy. One thing I would love to see is something that suggests meals or specific items that would meet the goals of the meal. If I have 200 calories left and haven‚Äôt met my protein, fat, or carbs goals, what can I add to my meal that fits my goals? Other than that, the developers have done an absolutely stellar job.

title: Fun Macro Tracker
body: I really love the design of this app and that you can follow plans that will adjust your macros for you. I also like like that you can capture a photo of your food for each meal, however, unfortunately, this functionality doesn‚Äôt work most of the time. Once I take a picture it doesn‚Äôt show in the app right a way, most of the time I have to take the pic a couple of times, close the app, reopen it and then the pic may or may not show up. So it would be nice if that could get fixed. Also, there isn‚Äôt an easy way to copy a meal from another day to a different meal. So if I ate something for breakfast yesterday, there‚Äôs no  easy way to copy that to lunch the next day. And when searching for foods, your recents don‚Äôt come up. For example, if I wanted to add a food and it‚Äôs not showing in my most recent but I‚Äôve logged it before, it would be nice to have it so up in my search when I go to search the food in the search bar. Another thing this app is missing is the ability to see what foods were highest in each macro. So if I wanted to see what foods I ate that day where highest in fat or protein.. Other macro apps have this, which was nice because then you could see what foods may be bumping up a macro too much or vice versa. Overall I have enjoyed this app and really like the design. However there are a few functionalities that are missing.

title: Awesome, but there are some errors.
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for as long as I can remember and I recently just upgraded to the Premium, which I love! I love the aesthetic of the app and the visuals and colors it uses. I love the wide variety of recipes, even thought I don‚Äôt use them that much. I love the weekly rating I get so that I can look at my past week and see what I need to improve on for the next one. However, there are a couple things I find I have trouble with. The main thing is that when I go to update my weight, I check on it the next day and it says ‚ÄúNothing lost, nothing gained.‚Äù So whenever I update my weight and maybe i‚Äôve lost a pound or two, i‚Äôll update my weight. But the next day when I go to look at my weight it erased it or changed it back to the starting weight. It does this almost all the time and is pretty annoying because I have to delete the starting weight that it put it back on for that day, at the same time deleting the weight that I put in. Another thing that‚Äôs minor is that when I go to take a picture of my food, sometimes it doesn‚Äôt work and the picture never shows up. I do really love this app but I don‚Äôt know if anyone else has the weight changing itself issue or not.

title: Love the app as is but would also love upgrades
body: I started using Lifesum to track my intake.  It is easy to use and very visual.  However, there are a couple of upgrades I would like seeing.  First, I would like to see Fat broken down into Total, Sat, Monounsaturated, and Polyunsaturated.  I would also like to see Carbs broken down into Total, Fiber, Sugar Alcohols, Added Sugar, and Net Carbs.  (Currently, the app simply subtracts fiber from total carbs to calculate net carbs.). Also, since I work with a functional medicine professional who is interested in seeing my intake, I would like to see the ability to export data.  As I used to program (albeit mainframe),  I know how long upgrades take to implement; it is possible some of these are already in the works.  They were meant only as suggestions.  Long story short, I am very happy with the app as it is even if it misses some of my personal desires.  Thank you for the work you put in to bring such a useful app to market.  Oh, last but not least, I think it would be better to let users know that full, continued use of the app requires a subscription.  The cost is nominal for the usefulness, but it was frustrating when I first found out about the cost after downloading the app.

title: It‚Äôll get the job done, but it could be better
body: Calorie tracking and dieting options work well and seem to cover a wide variety of needs. It is cumbersome to find the food and/or measurement needed for accurate tracking at times; requiring the user to do some creative math or mental gymnastics to figure out what should be entered. I paid for a membership and feel it‚Äôs okay‚ÄîI won‚Äôt likely be renewing. The recipes offer some tasty and decently filling alternatives, but are HORRIBLY written, as often as not. If you‚Äôre not familiar with finagling and ‚Äúfiguring out‚Äù a recipe or if that type of this is frustrating, this is not the app for you. This feels most functional for a few scenarios: first, the casual user who already has a decently healthy understanding of food, quantities, cooking, etc., and is just looking for a little guidance, new ideas for recipes or to literally track calories. Second, any of the diets, I‚Äôd bet, would work if you‚Äôre a person who can follow the recipe EXACTLY (I follow ‚Äúclassic‚Äù and ‚Äúvegan‚Äù but would struggle with both if I didn‚Äôt already have experience eating/cooking alternative foods).  This WOULD NOT be for the user who doesn‚Äôt really know at least some about healthy eating (novice) nor would it be for the serious weight loss/health person (expert) as it just doesn‚Äôt support specifics well enough.

title: Support unavailable
body: Loved the interface of this app and found it easy to navigate my way around pretty easily when I did use it. The one star rating is due to my recent experience today. I have tried several times now to contact support through the Contact Us (in app chat) link and it continues to crash. The app is updated to the most recent version and so is the software on my phone. Have tried to resend the message several times and the app keeps crashing. I want to cancel my subscription and plan on deleting the app TODAY. I purchased the Premium version of the app about a year ago at a discounted rate during a promo offer they had at the time. They seem to have it set it up where you subscribe to their Premium services outside of iTunes so the subscription is actually processed through their own website. Renewal dates or expiration dates of said Premium services are nowhere to be found anywhere in the app. They then attempt to auto renew it later on at almost $50 USD with no communication beforehand via email or otherwise that they will be processing this amount. I did not even locate the option to downgrade my account or cancel anywhere within the Settings option within the Lifesum app. Luckily my bank caught the attempted transactions as fraud and did not allow them through. I‚Äôll stick to apps that allow me to manage my subscriptions within iTunes to avoid headaches like this.

title: Won‚Äôt let you choose water bottle size
body: Update 2: Finally responded to my actual review. But they still are not going to implement the simple feature. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed that they are not prioritizing customer concerns.

title: Great app that‚Äôs sure to get even better
body: Ive been using Lifesum for a couple months now. Honestly I don‚Äôt use it everyday (I don‚Äôt track on weekends) but I love it! I love the look of it and the fun and encouraging tone. Love being able to see my macros front and center and seeing how my meal is looking on carbs, fat and protein. Two edits: as a previous review stated, notifications could use some work. Don‚Äôt need to weigh myself every single day, and also don‚Äôt need notifications for things I‚Äôve already done (like log breakfast, etc.). Also get a note at 6 asking how my dinner was and I don‚Äôt eat til about 7:30 bc of my commute (this notification reminds me how much I hate it!! lol).

title: New user- Edited
body: I just started using this app, trying to really kick off my dieting. I like organization when I diet and i just wish you could more closely edit your planner from day to day. How it is set up now- you have to scroll through all of the days and once you finish one day you have to scroll alllllll the way back down to the next day. Also, not sure if it‚Äôs just a diet they are trying to promote, but no matter what answers I choose when taking the quiz I always get the Keto Burn. I don‚Äôt necessarily have a problem with this diet, I just would like to see what other diets I could choose from that would also be recommended. If I am just overlooking how to do this please let me know! Other than these two things I am very impressed with the app and how affordable it is!

title: Good - Needs To Be More Regulated
body: The interface of this app is great, there is little I would change about its functionality. I‚Äôve been using it since late December and recently switched to premium a couple weeks ago. While I don‚Äôt regret going premium because of all the additional features, this app is far from perfect. My main complaint is that the entries could stand to be more consistently regulated across the board. Often times I‚Äôll see multiple entries for the same product, all different from one another, yet still all somehow verified by Lifesum with the blue tick. Sometimes the difference in nutrition info between these listings has to do with how the person entered in the serving size, but other times all the nutritional information is out of whack on two or more listings of what is allegedly the same product. This kind of negates the convenience of being able to just quickly search up a food and add it to your diary. I end up adding most of my food manually in order to be sure my entry is accurate. Even when I scan barcodes, I double check the entered nutritional info with the info on the label. All in all, unless this changes and the info on the app becomes more reliable, I‚Äôll probably try another similar app when my membership is up, maybe MyFitnessPal.

title: Beautiful App and Great Plans with room to grow
body: This app is absolutely beautiful.  If a smooth flow and  easy navigation is important to you this might be a great place to start in your search for the perfect dieting app.  In addition to the look and feel it also has some great content.  My wife and I both tried the Paleo Diet for the first time in our lives. We loved the diet and everything it had to offer.  We also both experienced incredible results in both energy and weight loss.

title: Awful navigation, terrible tracker
body: This hets 2 stars instead of 1 because i do actually use it to track, mostly because there‚Äôs little better out there. But the rest of the app is total garbage. It is inaccurate and poorly sourced, confusing to navigate if you want to change your plan, and the nutritional meals are extremely confusing. First, it only allows you to choose one dietary choice. For example, i try and eat a low carb diet but i ALSO want to keep that diet by eating clean and whole foods. But i have to choose one or the other. I am a pescatarian, and for some reason I still get recipes that suggest chicken or other meat. Also the ‚Äúnutritional tracker‚Äù is literally never happy‚Äîyou could have the healthiest meal and it will say you are nutritionally off track because you didn‚Äôt hit *exactly* the nutritional intake it demands to the exact gram. If you have baked salmon, an extremely healthy food with lean protein and omega 3‚Äôs it says the meal is ‚Äútoo high in fat,‚Äù the same as if you had pizza. It doesn‚Äôt differentiate between good fats and bad. There‚Äôs no pleasing the nutritional tracker. It is annoying to search for recipes, and it seems like just a way for celebrity fitness influencers to make even more money when this could be an actual social app for real users to share recipes, exercises, and fitness data. What a waste.

title: Keep Improving This App
body: I use a few apps for recipes already. Those apps all include nutrition values and labels. It would be nice if I could import/share those into lifesum without having to manually enter everything one at a time. A few of them have options to add those values to Apple health directly from the app. Lifesum writes data to health, but does not read. I think it would almost be better to separate functions out to apps. Have food apps handle entering / removing data into health and then have trackers reading and analyzing what you just ate so you can make informed decisions. I‚Äôd rather have two clean apps rather than one bloated app. I would imagine narrowing the scope would take out a lot of the overhead needed to maintain and update the app, thus making it even more clean and user friendly. Anyways, this is just my observation after using lots of food tracking apps. The interface may be different but functionally they are all kinda doing the same thing. I would also like to see more support for the Apple Watch when it comes to simple things like adding water and quick calories. The front end of this app is really beautifully done. If the back end was doing something unique then I could see myself paying for this app.

title: False Advertising & Poor Diet Poor Diet Entry Choices
body: Images displayed on Apple Apps fail to reflect the reality of the images and options offered in the app after purchasing premium version in all sections. For example I purchased the premium version yet was NEVER offered choices between diet plans as the first image on advertised app provided. I was never offered Keri, sugar free or other types of diet options as advertised. I was only offered choices of goals for weight

title: Easy to use but not enough info
body: Fun and easy to use with a lot of foods in their database. Sadly it really does not provide enough nutritional information and goes against a lot of info I‚Äôve gotten from

title: App is just ok.
body: This app is ok for tracking. However, when you go to enter the food choices several different versions of that food pop up all with caloric differences for the same food. I weigh my foods, & I see different caloric amounts for the weights of the same food. For example, Red grapefruit will have a few different choices to select from but no matter the ounces, the calories will slightly differ 30-50 cals. I don‚Äôt understand this & it can be very frustrating. & makes me feel as though my efforts are not always accurate & ultimately a wasteful purchase. The app has a nice design but could be better. Another feature that is annoying is if you want to review past food logs, & u leave the app open & go to do something else on your phone if you click back to the app it will reset to you viewing the food log of the current day. Which if you had to scroll back 8 days, you‚Äôd have to scroll back 8 days again even if you just go to do something else even though the app is open which again is annoying & there should be a better way to compare past to future logs. The app does have nice recipes thought too. Im not sure I‚Äôll be renewing it, I might look for another food log app before my subscription is up.

title: Beautiful but needs work
body: I got this app after seeing several ads for it in my Facebook feed. I like that it offers many different plans and gives you instant feedback on the quality of food you are eating, but many of the features advertised do not work properly. For example, I chose the three week weight loss plan. It generated recipes and a shopping list, which I thought was cool. But it does not let you add the recipes directly to your food diary -- clicking on the recipe did not do anything and I had to enter each ingredient manually, even though I followed the recipe exactly. This seems like a waste of time and a pretty big thing to overlook. Searching the recipe database for the recipe did not work either, as they are organized by tags and not by title or ingredient, making it even harder to find what you're looking for. I had to delete and reinstall the app to even get the water tracker to show up. There is also no way to manually sync the app with Fitbit; it just kind of does it when it wants to, which I also see as a major flaw. It's a beautiful app, but very clunky and full of dead ends. I paid for premium and at this point I wish I hadn't.

title: Will Not Sync with Apple Health App
body: I really like this app a lot. It‚Äôs very nice looking and motivating. I have been a paid subscriber for about 4 years now but am thinking that I might not be renewing this year. I‚Äôm not sure if the problem is with the Lifesum app or the Apple Health app, but the nutrition data will just not sync properly from Lifesum to the Health app. I am using the Health app to aggregate all of my health data which syncs properly from my sleep app, glucose app, exercise apps, etc., but not my diet/nutrition app which I consider to be essential for getting a complete health picture. I contacted the developer about this issue but was just told that they were working on it and informed as to how to get a refund and cancel my subscription. That was definitely not the answer I was looking for but may just take them up on it. What I really wanted to hear was a timeframe for getting this right. What I got from the response was that it wasn‚Äôt really a priority for them. I would like to know whether it is or not because if it is and they are expecting a breakthrough in the near future I would definitely stick with the app.

title: Pretty, but all the features require premium upgrade
body: So far I like the layout and the user friendly nature of this app. It‚Äôs easy to use and it has a nice aesthetic. The versatility of this app separates it from other fitness apps.

title: My perfect health app!
body: So far I have been using this app for about two weeks, and it‚Äôs actually very impressive. I am coming from Samsung Health, which has helped me a lot over the past year and a half. However, after comparing the two, this app has so much more versatility and it‚Äôs very acute regardless of which diet you choose. I decided that I was going to go with the diet plan Clean Eating, and in doing so realized how off course my diet was. More specifically, my sugar addiction problem. I have been working on improving my cooking and reducing my sugar consumption so that I can live a much healthier life. With everything that is offered, I definitely believe that this app is worth paying for.

title: The only health app I‚Äôve stuck with
body: I‚Äôve tried lots of different apps to help me along my fitness journey and this is the only app I have been able and have wanted to stick with. It‚Äôs awesome when you track your food and are able to see a rating beside what you‚Äôve had. Also, it‚Äôs very easy to track your exercise. As of recently, I have purchased an Apple Watch and it makes it even easier because it just takes the activity information from my watch and coverts it into the app. There is also a cool weight tracker you can use to count towards your weight goals. Tracking water intake is also nice and the app even gives you tips and encouraging words to reach your water, calories per meal, and exercise goals. I thought every app like this was the same and they all seemed so hard to figure out. Lifesum is short, sweet, and simple and I give the creators and developers of this app major props because usually I get bored within this category of apps, but this one has kept me focused and excited to use it. Thank you, Lifesum!

title: Not Great
body: I bought the premium version because I thought it would be friendlier and more helpful than apps like myfitnesspal. Its not very smart, it doesn‚Äôt have a lot of foods in its database, and the recipes provided are few and not impressive. There‚Äôs no way to find easy meals, it seems to be time consuming and not super appetizing. For example, a suggested recipe to me was a tomato and buttermilk shake?? While that might not be hard to make, it sounds disgusting. Most of these recipes seem to be more about looks and ‚Äúinstagram‚Äù quality than nutrition and simplicity, which is what most people loom to food trackers for. In the app‚Äôs attempt to be more millenial-geared and well-rounded, they made a complicated app with a few flashy features (choosing your type of diet, taking a picture of your food to log it-which didn‚Äôt work when I tried-, and recipes-which have limited options and seem complicated). I wish they offered a trial of the premium but I understand why they don‚Äôt because I definitely wouldn‚Äôt have bought premium if I knew that not much would change, and the additional features are less than satisfactory. I absolutely regret purchasing this.

title: Great for tracking calories. Overall discouraging.
body: I read so many reviews to find an app to help me keep track of my food intake when I restarted the 5-2 Intermittent Fasting plan. This app does that, but overall is really discouraging and unrealistic. In 7 days of tracking, I have not had ONE meal that was not labeled ‚Äúimbalanced‚Äù on this app. I‚Äôm either too high on protein or too high I‚Äôm carbs or too high on sugar (ANY meal that includes fruit) and frankly I am already sick of all their frown face icons and impossible standards. Today is my 500 calorie day ‚Äî just finished dinner of a piece of broiled tilapia and a cup of broccoli with a tiny bit of garlic sauce.  Too high in protein and not enough carbs! For goodness sake, I‚Äôm limited to 500 calories! Almost all of my breakfasts have ‚Äúnot enough protein‚Äù, yet I looked through all their breakfast recipes and NONE of the low calorie recipes have the amount of protein they recommend.  Last week on my fast day it said I was too low in protein so I ate a hard boiled egg as my snack ‚Äî and it said it was too much fat. There are no suggestions about alternatives that would be a better choice.  I fear this app has the propensity to lead to disordered eating and obsessing.  Very disappointed and I regret buying a six month membership that is not refundable.

title: Changed my life
body: This app is so great! I have lost 10 pounds with it so far and I‚Äôve only been using it for a little over a month! I don‚Äôt have the premium plan so you can lose weight on it without having to pay for it which is amazing! I will continue to use this app until I reach my goal weight and I truly believe I can do that using This app. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to lose weight while still feeling in control with the classic weight loss plan.

title: Many errors in the food database
body: This has a beautiful Interface, super easy to use. However I really have many issues with their nutritional content, so if you‚Äôre needing this for something like diabetes where you‚Äôre doing insulin to carb ratio‚Äôs, or specific dietary needs gastroparesis, reduced fat things, I don‚Äôt think I would recommend it. There are many times where I will scan an item in and what presents on the screen is not what is on the label it‚Äôs really strange. There are other things were a number of carbs the serving size whatever or just incorrect. Not just of labeled items but regular things like banana whatever. Anyway it doesn‚Äôt work all that well when you don‚Äôt have exactly the serving size and even then a lot of the time it‚Äôs just not right. If you don‚Äôt need that level of detail it‚Äôs very easy to use and adds everything up for the day for the meal. They only offer one snack per day so if you have three small meals three small snacks, you just have to lump all your snacks into one snack. So if you‚Äôre looking at your finger across the day it‚Äôs a little in accurate. If it were only that I would recommend it, but there are too many other issues for me

title: Needs an update!
body: I have used this app for about a year. It has helped me lose 52 pounds. The app works, so it gets 5 stars for working. However, I just upgraded my phone to an iPhone 12 Pro Max. I am finding several issues when going into certain screens where the text at the bottom if the screen is ‚Äúrunning off‚Äù the screen, and I am unable to get out of certain screens because the ‚ÄúX‚Äù that you press to close the screen is in the upper left hand corner and it is partially off of the screen and you are unable to push it (the iPhone 12 Pro Max screen is .2‚Äù larger, so an update is needed.).

title: I‚Äôm FINALLY making progress with my weight loss
body: I really like this app, it might sound silly but I think part of why it really works for me is how good the app looks, and it‚Äôs much simpler (in my opinion) than my fitness pal. I‚Äôve read that the database isn‚Äôt as big as MFP but I haven‚Äôt run into any problems with being able to track my food or scan barcodes. When I first started using the app I lost 8 pounds in the first few weeks, so I‚Äôm finally under 160lbs! I haven‚Äôt been very consistent recently but I‚Äôve just picked it back up again tracking calories and staying under my daily goal. I also love how simple it is to track macros. Overall, I‚Äôve been wanting to lose weight for YEARS and stop gaining 10lbs/year on average and this is the FIRST tool I‚Äôve found that has actually helped me make progress. Only negative I have is the meals on the different plans can‚Äôt be changed so I can‚Äôt really do them because I‚Äôm allergic to shellfish (I could probably just substitute though LOL)

title: Very Good, But Could Be Better
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for a few weeks now, and have to say, the features this app sets out to do, it does very well. The recipes are great, being able to track your meals/diet/and even overall health is very impressive. The only place I would suggest change is, like many have said, the notifications. Unlike most of the other ‚Äúsuggestive criticisms,‚Äù though, my chief complaint/wish is that there are never any ‚Äúnight shift mode‚Äù capabilities in health tracking. Many of us in healthcare like me and hundreds of other careers have had to switch their lives nocturnal. 24-hour gyms and grocery stores have helped, but there is still so much room for improvement! If there were just a way to tell the apps to switch from breakfast/lunch/dinner at 8-ish, 12-ish, and 6-ish to those equivalents during the night! Or for activity and sleep to be better tracked at the opposite ‚Äúnormal‚Äù time! Granted this isn‚Äôt something Lifesum offers at all, but this is such a missed opportunity from health apps!

title: Needs improvement
body: I think overall it‚Äôs a good app. I can‚Äôt afford the premium features so I basically have to ignore the day ratings. You can‚Äôt customize the macro goals unless you have premium and mine are different from the ones they set for me. The one thing that really irks me is their meal rating system. It doesn‚Äôt teach indulgence in moderation, which I think is key to maintaining a healthy diet, and it doesn‚Äôt make a whole lot of sense. If you eat one sweet thing it ruins your entire meal rating. For example: I had scrambled eggs and protein powder in coffee this morning ‚Äî it gave both of those an excellent rating on their own, but didn‚Äôt give the meal as a whole a good rating because I hadn‚Äôt consumed enough calories. Then I had half a serving of honey vanilla Greek yogurt and it gave it a :| rating, which then ruined my whole meal rating. And you can get an explanation for why things are rated that way unless you pay for premium. I try to get good ratings all day so it really bugs me when I get a bad one. I‚Äôm starting to just not take them seriously.

title: Just What I Needed
body: I‚Äôve been struggling to hold myself accountable when it comes to eating healthy and exercising ever since I gave birth to my daughter last summer, but this app makes it possible to keep track of my calories, fat, protein and sugar intake on any given day, and keep track of my workouts and it has made a difference! The first 10 days of using it, I mostly focused on eating healthy and staying under my daily intake. I lost two pounds and have since incorporated working out in the past week and have lost an additional 1.5 pounds plus 1.25‚Äù off of my waist. My pants are beginning to get a little looser and my face is noticeably thinner as well. I‚Äôve been using this app since May 17th and I am happy with my progress so far. I gave the app four stars, however, because I‚Äôm paying $21 for three months but the add-ons don‚Äôt seem worth the money. I‚Äôm grateful for them but they are things so could have figured out with a quick google search. There are also not a whole lot of vegetarian recipes and many of them are not the healthiest.

title: Review and Comparison
body: I‚Äôve compared this to other top food logging and calorie counter apps over the last three weeks and believe this one to have the best interface and work best with my needs and goals. It works to keep me accountable and mindful of my choices without restricting anything. I like that it connects to my Apple devices and adjusts my available calories based on exercise (the more I exercise, the more I can‚Äôt eat)! That feature has been very helpful. The scan tool works mostly well but there have been several items not yet in their database. There is an option to help grow that if you take the time to enter in all the nutritional info on a package. The most difficult thing with this (and all the food logging apps) is entering in homemade food, e.g. the chicken noodle soup I made last Sunday... other than that, I give it 5 stars and will continue to use it. It‚Äôs  already had an impact on my lifestyle (and I‚Äôve lost several pounds)!

title: Interface Design and Glitches Hamper Experience
body: I love this app and it‚Äôs helped me get into the habit of tracking my meals, but every once in a while a poor design choice or glitch really hampers the experience.

title: Totally Inaccurate
body: Lifesum is beautiful and fun. But none of that matters because all the entries are inaccurate or straight up wrong. If I‚Äôm going to have the ease of using a barcode, why do I have to put in more work? If you want to be able to accurately measure and count calories, you should use grams. When I use grams on anything, the measurements are totally inaccurate. They‚Äôll make something that should be 200 calories look like 12,000 calories. Or something that should be 600 calories will come out to 3 calories, all because of inaccurate measurements on this app. Even the ‚Äúverified‚Äù entries are wrong. Sometimes I‚Äôll Enter a meal and the calories won‚Äôt show up until I fully close the app and reopen. Today I tried to search for an item from McDonald‚Äôs, and all the entries were the meal without the biscuit. And even those entries didn‚Äôt match! I‚Äôve tried to continue to use the app because I was conned in to paying for a full year. (NOTE: when it says $3/month it‚Äôs actually going to charge you for a whole year at one time.) Not worth it. I‚Äôll take my losses and use an app that‚Äôs accurate and that doesn‚Äôt make me angry because everything is hard to track and everything is just plan WRONG.

title: Beautifully Designed But Needs More
body: I‚Äôve search the App Store for so many calorie counting and exercise tracking apps and Lifesum has made the biggest impact for me. The app design is visually appealing and really fun to use, which is important because calorie counting is not fun. This app makes it easy to ensure that you are meeting your goals.

title: Good for weight loss, hard for weight gain.
body: Overall a very good app. I like how you can add foods easily (barcode scan, from your previous data entries) and how it seems to have a wide scope of entries.

title: Fix your app!
body: I love this app. However, I am not sure what is going on with it right now. The calories & names are all messed up & it‚Äôs very discouraging to see that a cup of Oat blenders w/ Honey cereal are supposedly ‚Äò956 calories‚Äô, and that a Danamal is 10+ calories than it actually is. I shouldn‚Äôt have to find the exact calorie amount by doing math. The entire point of your app is as an easy way to track your diet, weight, progress, etc. What‚Äôs the point if you can‚Äôt even properly add up the total calorie intake??

title: The best tracking app out there
body: I‚Äôve tried loose it and my fitness pal. I went ahead and went premium for this one so I can see grams of protein. Like the other apps, data for food isn‚Äôt 100% accurate but it‚Äôs good enough. Also like other apps, with premium you can see grams of protein, carbs, etc; but if you want to see vitamins and minerals you‚Äôre out of luck. This is the cleanest, most elegant of the tracking apps out there m. I appreciate it.

title: Life changing
body: I am the master of fitness apps. Weight watchers? Sure. Sparks people? Ok. Fitness pal? Yep. Log it (can‚Äôt remember name but thinks that‚Äôs right) yeppers...

title: Beautiful app but lots of problems.
body: PROS:  beautiful layout, visually pleasing, able to choose meal plans, track intermittent fasting within app, easy to locate information, good tips, food and day ratings.

title: It‚Äôs a good app, but there‚Äôs issues.
body: I really do like this app. Its colorful, positive, and helpful in tracking calories. However, if there is one thing that really ruins my experience, it‚Äôs that you cannot view the nutritional values. It is illegal for packaging companies to withhold nutritional facts, and chain restaurants have to offer nutritional values for their food as well in order to ‚Äúhelp Americans be healthy‚Äù. So why is an app, specifically designed for dieting withholding that information unless you pay for it? I think this is actually quite unjust. Yes, they do display protein, carbs, and fat, however the rest is blocked. The second problem with this app is that there is limited choices for entries. What I mean, is that if you try to log an exercise, there are many that are not included so you must guess on the amount of calories you burned. Additionally, many of the food values and/or portions are incorrect, and many foods are still not on there.

title: Fantastic
body: This might be the first time I‚Äôve ever written an app review but this app is amazing. As long as you‚Äôre diligent with inputting the food you eat, it keeps track of everything for you. Calories, protein, carbs, fat, etc. It tailors all of it to the specific diet you choose and how much weight (if any) you want to lose, based on your height, weight, and timeframe. Beyond that, it gives you recipes, weekly ratings (in premium version, but the free version is well worth the download too) on how balanced and healthy your diet is, what you can improve on, and even gives you additional trackers for the areas you‚Äôre working on. You get fun smiley faces to denote how healthy your food choices are. All in a wonderfully designed and eye pleasing package. They even include stickers too! I‚Äôve already lost weight and feel better and I can sleep better at night being more aware of exactly what I‚Äôm eating. Can‚Äôt recommend this app enough. It‚Äôs changing my life!

title: Great App, Could use some added features
body: I love this app and have been using it to track my food for a long time. I just wish there where better ways to add in my workouts? I feel like there‚Äôs not a lot of customization there and the list of workouts to choose from is very odd. I also feel like theres some issues with entering food, I can‚Äôt always find what I‚Äôm looking for and very often the things I eat don‚Äôt have ratings. I‚Äôm vegetarian and sometimes I feel that this app doesn‚Äôt understand that someone who is a vegetarian or vegan needs different things or nutrients than someone who eats meat. I also feel like the grading/motivation part of this app could use help. As someone who has struggled with eating disorders, the grading can make me feel bad about my eating choices. Other than those things, I think this app is probably the best among its competitors and it actually gives me insight on the food I‚Äôm putting into my body. It‚Äôs also very visually appealing and organized.

title: Cool app but needs more user unique features
body: Let me start off by saying, I really like this app in terms of calorie counting wise. I just need the app to stay consistent and update food options in real time. I love the barcode feature because I can keep track, step by step when I‚Äôm making my own meals. However, when I‚Äôm eating out, I would like the app to be ready to know and look up what I‚Äôm eating. It just makes it a little easier for the user to get an exact match to food while eating out. The other thing is workouts and calories burned. I wish the app would let you track workout videos and burned calories through trackers rather then estimating. It would be a really cool idea to insert a direct link to the video you did, so you can keep track of your fav workouts and closely monitor your progress with said workouts all in one app. Correct me if I‚Äôm wrong in thinking this way. Other than those issues I mentioned, it‚Äôs a pretty cool simple, app to get dieting on track!!

title: Mixed feelings
body: So overall I like the app, and considered switching from MyFitnessPal, however I have a few issues. I can‚Äôt seem to create a new food that isn‚Äôt in the database and there are several foods I‚Äôve noticed that aren‚Äôt recognized. Since I count macros, adding the calories alone is not helpful for me and my goals.

title: Wonderful, except for one thing
body: I‚Äôve had this app for about a week. It‚Äôs awesome. It totally blows MyFitnessPal out of the water. I love that it doesn‚Äôt ask me a million times to sync my social media - I like my privacy! Lots of pros to this app, easy to learn layout, very beautiful design, lots of options for foods.

title: Good but can be better
body: The (free version of the) Lifesum app definitely helped me shred the few pounds I wanted. The food tracking component to the app itself is robust and easy to use. I have had almost no trouble finding the food I eat, despite having a very particular diet. Scanning barcodes makes it even quicker.

title: Almost there!
body: I‚Äôve loved this app for a while, I enjoy how it offers more in the free version than other apps I‚Äôve tried. I love the heath rating system as well because it introduces a veritable some people don‚Äôt think about when they‚Äôre focused on the numbers of calorie counting. However I do think that the notification option could be improved. I saw an earlier review saying that daily weigh ins are not healthy, and I completely agree, due to minimal change day to day and fluctuating weight (if you have a cheat day, for example). I think that notifications such as reminders to drink more water would be way more beneficial, as I (and I know many others) always forget to drink enough. Also reminders to track food if you‚Äôve forgotten to that day would be great. Besides this issue I really do love this app. I‚Äôve noticed these reviews get replied to quite often which I really appreciate, so I‚Äôm hoping this one will get a reply as well!

title: Amazing!
body: Edit: Now that I know how to create foods (thank you for the response to my review with this information) this app has everything I want and need and I could not be happier! This app is the better MFP!

title: It‚Äôs pretty good, but it‚Äôs missing some stuff
body: I first want to start off by saying that I really love Lifesum, it‚Äôs been really helpful to me in seeing what I eat and how much I drink. The fact that I use it so much has just given me the time to see some issues with the App (especially on iPad) that definitely need addressing.

title: Love this app but... Needs more ways to personalize tracking
body: This is a beautiful and great app... though, I'm coming up on my year renewal and I'm unsure about going forward.

title: Weird weight data problem
body: Really enjoying this app so far! I‚Äôve been using it to track daily calories and create healthier habits for about three weeks now, it‚Äôs been great.

title: It needs some work
body: I am 14 and I‚Äôm overweight and trying to lose fat and gain muscle, so I tried this. For most parts of this app, I like it. It shows me what I‚Äôm eating and helps me learn what I‚Äôm putting in my body vs what I need to put in my body. But some of the goals seem unrealistic. I chose the high protein plan as it gives me energy to workout and keeps me full longer, but it wants me to eat 32g of protein a meal and 97g of protein for a snack. I couldn‚Äôt handle it, eating that much protein made me feel awful and super full. I couldn‚Äôt even finish my protein shake, which is very uncommon for me. And a lot of the foods I eat aren‚Äôt recognized on the food searcher. I also wish I could do the thing with the meals but on the exercise option, like ‚Äúwhat you did yesterday‚Äù instead of having to re-enter my exercise everyday. Overall I would recommend this to people who want to know more about healthy eating, but there are definitely some kinks that could be worked out.

title: It Works!!!
body: Before using LifeSum, I felt incredibly unhealthy, bloated, and tired all of the time. I was 5‚Äô6‚Äù and 125 pounds, which is considered to be ‚Äúnormal‚Äù, but I noticed that my weight was only increasing and I started to gain a lot of weight in many areas of my body. I started using this app a month ago and I weighed myself this morning at 114 pounds. Turns out, the culprit for me gaining weight and feeling so terrible all of the time was my diet! Things I thought were healthy before were actually very unhealthy. LifeSum has shown me what is healthy and what is not, and it has also prevented me from overeating - something that I did all of the time. Thank you so much LifeSum! I feel much more energetic and more in shape after using this app. I now have a flat stomach and no double chin, so this app is a true miracle. I‚Äôm not even on the premium plan, so you can still lose weight without it! I highly recommend it!

title: Nice meal plan and rating features but frustrating issues with the app
body: The meal plans and nutrient / day ratings set this app apart from other trackers, but I have a few gripes that make using the app frustrating.

title: Great app, needs a few things
body: Out of all the apps I‚Äôve used, I like this one the most. With premium, you have access to meal plans which truly saves me the time of having to plan each week‚Äôs meals on my own. I like that I‚Äôm able to switch out a meal for a different option that works better with my schedule.

title: Very Inaccurate
body: I like the idea of it but it‚Äôs completely inaccurate for a lot of things. Even though I scanned the exact items I was using to try to make it more accurate, it was saying my bread had half the protein and double the calories is really has, then for my plant milk says it has 27 grams of protein instead of 10? Very confusing and completely wrong. It also gave a better rating to my vegan Caesar dressing than HALF of a small avocado and celery.. Also I put that my food preference was vegan and every single meal suggestion it gave me wasn‚Äôt even vegetarian, they were all meat? It‚Äôs also inaccurate for the amount of protein you need, it shows that I‚Äôm low in protein because it says I need just under 100 grams a day which is literally double what I need for my weight? I feel like I can‚Äôt trust it at all and it‚Äôs honestly annoying how even when you scan the item it doesn‚Äôt pull up the correct nutrition facts and the ratings are so off. Like Caesar dressing is really healthier than celery and avocado.. definitely not a good app. Disappointed.

title: Useless unless you pay
body: I‚Äôll be honest. The original reason I downloaded this app what is to integrate it with the Walgreens app in order to earn bonus points at that store. Once I open the app, I found it useless. I took all kinds of quizzes which were to determine my eating habits and to suggest diets. I can‚Äôt imagine why eating vegetables watch a week or fruits just three times a week would indicate a balanced diet. Then it offered to give me suggestions. After every quiz, in order to get the answers or suggestions or meal plans or diet suggestions I was directed to sign up to get the paid version. This app is a complete rip off. I don‚Äôt have to take the time to go onto my phone just to keep track of how many glasses of water I drink! I have chronic kidney disease and was looking for a few other suggestions. Since I have to pay for everything here, I‚Äôll stick to the FREE Davita app. It‚Äôs easy to set your calorie goals (along with protein and other nutritional content). You don‚Äôt have to have CKD to use Davita, either. Their food database is enormous. Lifesum (free) is useless in conjunction with the Walgreens app.

title: Beautiful design but everything costs money
body: I‚Äôve been looking for a tracker to replace MyFitnessPal because I‚Äôm just over that app. I thought Lifesum would be the replacement but it‚Äôs not. Everything of interest is part of the premium version. Plans and recipes require a monthly subscription. Further macros beyond carbs, fats, proteins require a monthly subscription. Everything requires a subscription.

title: Pretty but not all powerful
body: I am trying the paid version of this app to help me complete my 3 week Keto diet. It has some great Keto recipes and gave me planned meals complete with a grocery list for the whole 3 weeks. I really like the look of this app, especially over MFP. However, I find myself unable to do all of the functions that I could in the former. Mostly, editing or even deleting a custom recipe/meal-- I can only add them not get rid of them. Most importantly however, there's issues transferring a tracked meal the app suggests from my paid meal plan into my food diary. The servings get all messed up and the nutritional information gets significantly reduced. This makes me go back and delete/"untrack" the meal and input it manually, which defeats the point of the feature. I really want to like this app but unfortunately I will not continue using it after my paid trial ends. Hopefully it can be updated in the future.

title: Really enjoying this app!
body: I really enjoy using this app - I‚Äôve used a bunch of free and paid dieting aids like WW and MyFitnessPal among others - what I really enjoy about this is that you can pick from several dieting options, and there‚Äôs no real *pressure* - more friendly suggestions. With other apps and services  I always felt there was an underlying judgement on how or what I ate, and the colors, icons etc. Implied negativity if I did something ‚Äúwrong.‚Äù

title: Best nutrient tracker! Buggy but I still love it
body: After trying MFP and Lose It, I was going to give up. But Lifesum FINALLY works to help me track macronutrients (protein, carbs, fat) simply snd easily. It's much better designed than the competition as others have noted.

title: I really want to give 5 stars, but...
body: Awesome app with two big issues:

title: Great app but some flaws
body: Hello, this is a great app and it‚Äôs helped me a lot making sure I don‚Äôt go over my 13,000 or 1,300 something like that calorie budget, this app helped me a lot with tracking what I eat and what I need to eat more of and cut back on, but the thing is, I took that test and it had this meal plan that I should have to lose weight, the only thing is that I can look what‚Äôs inside , I get the app has to make money somehow but it‚Äôs really annoying when I see some breakfast lunch or dinner food that looks good and I can see the ingredients to make it and if I want to I have to upgrade to premium witch I don‚Äôt have the money for. I‚Äôve been struggling with weight loss a lot and I don‚Äôt get to eat much healthy food since I have so many cravings, the app can respond to this and take this information and update the app so I can view the foods and stuff so I can have a more health diet and stuff please do

title: More than I hoped for!
body: Taking the time to explore a little I have found the free version of this app to be amazing!

title: Why can‚Äôt you delete meals or food?
body: The premise of this app is great and when it starts listening to Apple health to factor in your exercises it really sets itself apart. Our issue appears to be more of a bug than a missing feature: you can‚Äôt delete any meal once you add it. We are in a Keto focus and we cook all our meals from recipes we create (we have a personal menu). When we create a meal with all of the ingredients it exists in the ‚ÄúMeals‚Äù section as a choice we have from now on to enter into our diary any given day we may have chosen to eat that meal. But there are meals we made years ago when we tried this app once and didn‚Äôt know much about nutrition. And we can‚Äôt delete them. A meal just consisting of black beans is in there forever cluttering the list and it can‚Äôt be deleted. The same problem occurs in anything added in the food category. It makes daily use of this app cumbersome and overtime it will become so crowded that it will be unusable

title: Beautiful UI but not remotely functional
body: Giving two stars for the UI. Very visually appealing. But not functional. Lots of basic issues that constrain functionality. 1) you must log water by 8.45 ounces and can‚Äôt change that. 2) if you choose one of their diets, you can‚Äôt edit the calories. I was on the 5:2 diet and it had me eating 1600 calories on non-fasting days. I‚Äôm doing 1400 calories, but there‚Äôs no way for me to change that. And none of their plans allow for different calorie goals for different days. 3) app crashes a couple times a day and I have to log out and log back in. 4) the food insights are very limited. They tell me my nutrients are imbalanced if my meal is a couple grams over/under with one macro. 5) most scanned foods come out with incorrect information. 6) can‚Äôt move foods from meal to meal or day to day. 7) doesn‚Äôt show you the foods you eat regularly, have scanned recently, or generally prefer over others. Even more issues, but this review is getting to long. Back to My Fitness Pal.

title: Love the app, but the bugs ruin it!
body: I really love the concept and aesthetics of this app- enough that I switched from MyFitnessPal as a long-time user. Problem is, more than half the time I go to search a food to add it to my meal or create a recipe, the search turns up blank. There‚Äôs no error message, just no results. And I‚Äôm usually searching simple things like ‚ÄúApple‚Äù or ‚Äúalmond milk.‚Äù

title: Great app with some annoying glitches.
body: I love this app. It is very easy to use and track with for my strict keto diet. My main issue is with adding foods for the next day. I often meal prep and input my food the day before so I can plan for the day ahead at work. However, many times I think I am putting in the food for the next day but the app adds the food to the current day instead. It happens over and over again and it takes me twice as long as it should to meal prep. I really hope this can be fixed or an option is added which allows you to change the day and/or meal on the food itself (the weight watchers app allows this).

title: Great but missing a few things
body: I do really like the app all together. Easy to use, great esthetic, good options for recipes. I will say though I‚Äôm a little surprised there is no paleo option and it feels super focused on Keto. I‚Äôm paleo based, so while I wanted to try out the plan choices, I just stuck with the classic because they aren‚Äôt close enough. With options in recipes too, if they could add in an avoiding soy section, I‚Äôm sure a good portion of their users would appreciate it. I also wish I could customize the water tracker since I drink two 40 oz hydroflasks of water a day and it doesn‚Äôt really let me accurately track that. And also the macro counter would let me input my macro goal since it was over 100% according to the app.. I‚Äôm in a bulking stage, so it was a little frustrating having to adjust it just to track in the app. Overall though I still like it better than MFP.

title: It‚Äôs okay
body: In terms of user friendly interface, it‚Äôs perfect. It‚Äôs very appealing and simple to use and i love the personalized diet plans which are the only positives it has over the other app I am comparing it to. In terms of everything else, I truly prefer MyFitnessPal. I hate the fact you can‚Äôt multi add foods when adding your meals for the day. The most irritating thing about this app is the lack of consistency/accuracy when tracking foods. It seems like most of the foods in this app aren‚Äôt verified and are completely based off of users creations. MyFitnessPal adds a healthy mix of both verified foods and user added meals. For example, I had Chipotle for dinner and I wish I could be able to choose ingredients with verified nutritional facts from the restaurant. Also, it‚Äôs unhealthy and irritating to be told to update your weight every single day. I did pay for the premium plan and so when that is over I‚Äôm heading back over to a MyFitnessPal.

title: Best nutrition app out there!
body: I can definitely say this is the best nutrition/logging app I have ever had. For a number of months I was in a bad relationship with food‚ÄîI was a binger and a restricter. This app helped me overcome this so quickly. What's different about this app from others is that looks much more in-depth than most free nutrition apps. I recommend the subscription for the whole experience, but even without it, it's very helpful. I am now numerous weeks clean from binging because this app gives many more notes. It informs you for approximately how many calories you should be eating per meal, the balance of macros, and the nutrition/rating of food. It even gives you a complete rating for your meals and day! I've tried MyFitnessPal, but it never really gave as much info as this app. It really is a helpful app, and I completely recommend it!

title: Less data but more useful than other apps
body: I‚Äôve tried all the big names in calorie tracking but this is the only app that actually encourages a healthy relationship with food, in my experience. With LifeSum, you get high-level overviews of what you‚Äôre eating along with easy, actionable ways to improve your diet. By contrast, with MFP and Cronometer, I would often get so caught up in the minute details that I wouldn‚Äôt know what to change in my diet. LifeSum strikes a much better balance of giving the details most people need without overwhelming you with data. I highly recommend LifeSum if you‚Äôre someone who gets obsessive when using other apps because I‚Äôve found it to be much gentler on my mental health (although please talk to a doctor if you have a history of disordered eating because any kind of calorie counting can be touchy)

title: Learning how to use this is key!
body: At first I gave this app a bad review because I honestly wasn‚Äôt informed about how to use it. I was having difficulty adding my own items and macro information and I thought you couldn‚Äôt. After getting some help, this app is seriously the best! All you have to do is scan a barcode and bam, all the info is in there and you can easily track what you‚Äôre eating and your macros. It‚Äôs also extremely easy to add your own items if they aren‚Äôt in the system, or if it‚Äôs a home cooked meal you made. I highly recommend this app! I‚Äôm trying to lose weight in the new year, and this has really opened my eyes to how much fat and sugar and crap I was eating that I thought was healthy. This easily allows me to immediately see and track the nutritional value of what I‚Äôm putting into my body. I love it!

title: Good App, Could Use Some Improvements
body: I personally enjoy using this app, however I wish that it were able to compete with other food tracking apps a little better.

title: pretty app, because database is inaccurate, macros calculated wrong :(
body: I have been using this app for two months. I really enjoy the looks of it, how fast it feels to log food and create meals. I have been eating keto, so I need my carbs to be low. You have the option of tracking net carbs, but sadly the data is not being processed correctly. For example any keto eater knows an avocado has a low amount of net carbs. about 4 per avocado. this app logs it as 17. it does not minus the fiber despite me confirming that I am tracking NET carbs. :/ so I cannot track my food. chia seeds it says a huge number of carbs. it does not minus the fiber. so basically if you need to know your true macros then this database is not so good. I redownloaded carb manager app today and wow the avocado has less than 4 grams net carbs. now I know I can eat it and not worry. and chia seeds is accurate on that app (carb manager app) too so I recommend switching to a better app and for the makers of this one to fix the data so it is not only an app with good looks. thank you.

title: So many bugs, double or triple counts activity
body: I loved this app when I started using it, but the bugs with syncing exercise calories from the health app and Apple Watch make tracking a pain. For one run it shows three activities, so that a run that might have burned 300 calories shows as 900+ calories in the app. I used to be able to delete the duplicate entries, but they took away that option in one of the last couple ‚Äúupgrades‚Äù. Now if I try to delete it just takes me into the exercise screen.

title: I really get the value from Lifesum
body: When I'm good about tracking my food I get a lot of value from Lifesum. I miss when each meal had a letter grade instead of just a smiley face, it helped me understand my choices better.

title: Very good app. Easier to navigate than Myfitness pal
body: App has a great look to it with fluid changing colors and cartoonish characters and animated vegetables. It‚Äôs very motivational and clicking on the water icons to report your hydration instantly gives a feeling of satisfaction. You can take pics of food to help you figure out calorie content. My only complaint is that the search feature is very lacking. It can be difficult to find what you are in the apps recorded selection of food. This makes the barcode feature important but so many things have not been scanned by other users that you often have to stop and take time to fill out the information for a ‚Äúnew‚Äù item of food yourself. This issue will go away when more people start using the app however. I found this app when apple recommended it on its health app.

title: Would like to see Paleo option
body: I like the app the interface is clean and premium is cheap with the deals which I like. Seems like they bulked up their database so far everything that I‚Äôve eaten has popped up which is also a plus for me. I appreciate the tips and weekly summaries, they are surprisingly helpful and and help keep you focused if you are determined.

title: Great App for Tracking Eating Habits
body: This is a great app for keeping track of your eating habits. I‚Äôm using it to evaluate what food I intake, the nutritional content of those foods, and how I can eventually make better choices. HOWEVER, if you are expecting to use Apple‚Äôs Health app to sync data from Lifesum (which the app claims to do), then skip it. While Lifesum does record and sync data to Health, its consistency is not reliable at all. Data may sync to the Health app for a couple of days, but for some reason, it will skip other days entirely. But more annoyingly, on days that it decide to sync data, it will sometime not sync every category which you have selected (i.e. water intake, sodium, sugar, etc.). Additionally, the app will sometimes glitch and erase data which you have recorded INSIDE of the app itself. It‚Äôs unfortunate because I really enjoy this app and it has contributed greatly to changing some bad aspects of my eating habits. Hopefully these issues are addressed because the app is worth it.

title: Just minor inconveniences.
body: I used this app the last time I lost a bunch of weight and it really helped, life stuff happened and I ended up gaining most of it back so I'm on the journey again and decided to purchase the premium version of the app. It's very detailed and beautiful, but there are things that drive me nuts, like seriously tracking water is a pain, I have a 24oz bottle I keep at my desk, but I can't customize my bottle size properly to track this, I find myself downloading a different app to track water. Also, the whole ‚Äùtaking a picture of your food‚Äù thing is so pointless it never works and I have to change its predictions anyways. Instead, can I just take a picture of the recipe I used then enter in how many servings it makes and state how much I ate, viola! I have been so frustrated with that. I will change my rating later because I really do enjoy the app it just isn't quite perfect yet. Thanks for reading.

title: Seems latest update has screwed things up
body: I havnt had issues with this app like this before and I've use this off and on for years. The data is now all messed up. First i noticed that the calories per meal didn't equal the number of calories left for the day... then one day i opened the app and all my data was just gone. It didn't remember my goals, it was giving me ads to purchase premium even though it says in the settings its still registering me as a premium member... it wont grab the data for my weight properly from the health app... and right now, i open the app, haven't used it all day no data at all in it and its saying i can only eat 6 more calories today.......??? The whole thing is just all screwy. Im just going to do a reset of my data on the account and see if that helps me until they fix the issue but... yeah, this bug is making this app completely useless to me right now.

title: BUY PREMIUM! -Broke College Kid
body: I had this app for months before I caved and bought the premium version. The free version is nice for basic food tracking purposes, but if you are really looking for an easy way to learn more about your health GET THE PREMIUM VERSION! This is coming from someone who has tried numerous diets and researched healthy eating immensely for over a year. This has made it so much easier to eat balanced meals. I start off with what I know I want to eat and it will tell me if I need to add more fat or protein and what‚Äôs good and bad about the food. I‚Äôve been using the premium version for 3 days and have already learned so much! The life scores are very motivating. I see myself sticking with this for a while. It DID take me a while to figure out the layout of the app. But give it time, you won‚Äôt regret it!

title: Works well enough
body: This is great for tracking calories and planning out meals in advance. As long as you have a good scale and measuring cups you‚Äôll be able to get a pretty accurate calorie count. I tend to ignore the food ratings it gives me, I‚Äôve made veggie stir frys and things that I know are healthy but it will give me a poor rating because there isn‚Äôt enough calories or protein or whatever. That‚Äôs fine, I don‚Äôt rely on those. My only major issue is that it doesn‚Äôt show calories burned while sleeping, sitting, etc from my Fitbit in the calories burned section, it adds them to ‚Äúcalories left‚Äù so I have to switch between apps to figure out my caloric deficit. Also, I can‚Äôt manually add workouts to increase my life score because it will add calories that I didn‚Äôt actually burn, so I guess I have to ignore the life score as well. Not really sure why I bought the premium.

title: Frustrated
body: I really need help in general which is impossible to ask questions is there an email I can have to avoid all this??? I need to delete a ‚Äúbody measurement‚Äù and I can‚Äôt. It‚Äôs asking what units so I put the units because it was already in inches and there was no input for my number. So now my units are numbers. Says my hips are 37 37. Secondarily I can‚Äôt add the photo to my snack I just made a meal, after I just took the photo, I wouldn‚Äôt have thought to take it twice in a row/ there are a lot of things about this I might need to press for a refund for like ..... what meal plan? There are recipes to chose from ? So I'm confused that‚Äôs not a meal plan lol am I not understanding or is there a setting to put on. It keeps asking me the quiz like no I chose already I want it all laid out for me. Might as well use my fitness pal it is much more user friendly these apps are annoying as is. I really want to continue to use this app though because I already invested the past two hours into it.

title: Almost perfect, BUT...
body: I love this app. Like, seriously am in love with this app and have recommended it to multiple people at this point! However, I wish it were possible to customize the plans a tiny bit further by being able to select how many meals or snacks I have in a day (having the choice to modify plans to have 3-5 smaller meals and/or snacks in a day would be amazing). One of my prescriptions is an appetite suppressant, so I sometimes find it really difficult to feel comfortable and not too full after eating a meal, unless I take about an hour to eat it (which is something I simply don‚Äôt have time for). I also wish that plans could automatically adjust macro counts if I have a super-high protein/lower fat or carb meal in the day. But, I have to say, this app makes it SO easy to know what‚Äôs good and what‚Äôs not-so-good for me and why, and I love it nonetheless.

title: Pretty good
body: I‚Äôve been using the app for a week on the strict keto diet.

title: SUPER Helpful!
body: I had been trying for an entire YEAR to lose the (I call it) ‚ÄúHappy‚Äù weight from my marriage. I found this app & started tracking my meals & I noticed that I was getting better about not impulsively eating because I was a little hungry. I‚Äôve also gotten better about making sure I drink enough water with the help from Lifesum!

title: Misleading Free Info! I‚Äôm angry!
body: I don‚Äôt like giving my permission for Facebook or signing up with my email without knowing what an app offers for Free. I thought I would be able to at least see recipes. And, oh, yes, you can see recipes - the title, nutrition, calories- a teaser!! You can‚Äôt actually see the ingredients or instructions without a Premium membership!!!! In fact, you can‚Äôt do anything, but manually add items, without an annoying pop up demanding a membership! What a waste of my time. Now I have to go find out how to delete permissions in Facebook. If you want money, then TELL ME that the free version is useless. I could have found many other apps or ways to manually add tracking data. I am not a serial 1 Star review.  I‚Äôm more of a serial 5 Star reviewer, but I‚Äôm sick of apps acting like there is a free version that offers what‚Äôs in the advertisement (and Premium stands for extra, valuable services.) The Premium in this app means you can‚Äôt do any of the advertised services without paying! That‚Äôs not what Premium means.

title: Life Changing
body: I usually don‚Äôt write reviews, but this is literally the best app I‚Äôve ever bought. I‚Äôm 14 and I want to lose 15 lbs in a healthy way. It gave me a 15 week period and I thought ‚Äúokay that‚Äôs reasonable‚Äù, but then I started using it and it‚Äôs motivated me so much I‚Äôve lost 6.2 lbs, it‚Äôs been 2 weeks. I honestly wouldn‚Äôt be nearly as motivated to use it if it wasn‚Äôt such an enjoyable of an experience. The design is flawless and the little icons are adorable. I love using the barcode scanner, then I don‚Äôt have to figure out if I actually ate what I logged. The life rating is really motivational, and ever since I had a day tracker for fruit and a weekly tracker for seafood, I‚Äôve been eating lots more of those.

title: Guiding me down the path to success
body: So, I am an overweight looser with dreams of getting back into shape so I can join the military and get my dream career. I searched all over for apps that would give me lots of customization and data related to my weight loss and this has been the best one so far.

title: MyFitnessPal is easier and more accurate
body: (I‚Äôm using the premium version) While I love Lifesum because of the coaching and keeping macro and micronutrients monitored, the actual food logging needs a LOT of work. Unlike MyFitnessPal, which is the easiest food logging I‚Äôve ever done, Lifesum is not only difficult in finding the food you‚Äôre trying to log (they don‚Äôt have the database that MFP has), but the serving sizes and entering the amount you‚Äôre eating is more often in grams instead of cups or the MUCH easier options on MyFitnessPal. A lot of the nutrition information is also wrong, meaning that I have toggle with the ‚Äúamount‚Äù of food that I ate in order to get the calorie count correct. I also don‚Äôt love the often negative feedback that pops up if you occasionally eat something that‚Äôs non-nutritious. Because of this, I‚Äôll likely be canceling my subscription at the end of the 3 months and looking back at MyFitnessPal.

title: Almost perfect!
body: I was looking for an app to focus more on healthy food choices than calorie counting and yes, something prettier than MFP. I found it! I LOVE the water and veggies and fruit trackers. The only tweaks I'd make:

title: Wrong Nutritional Info for SCANNED Items
body: My food was cold and I had to reheat by the time I worked out all the problems with this app. I got this yesterday. Got suckered into the 3 month subscription by all of these false reviews (or perhaps completely clueless people). It allows you to scan items and just move along to add them to your food tracking. However serving sizes are wrong, calories wrong, sugars, proteins, fats‚Äîeverything. It‚Äôs different things for different items but when you look it over there is always something that is off. You literally need to sit there and go through every item even serving size, if it is tsp or tbsp to make sure the scanned item is right. I Deleted the app. I‚Äôll be asking for my money back but this trash app and it‚Äôs lazy developers will probably tell me I can‚Äôt..just like they can‚Äôt get the correct nutritional info off a label. These apps are total gimmicks. My back up plan after ‚Äúbeing had‚Äù is salad and running around‚Äîcould have spent the subscription on vegetables.

title: great concept with some key problems
body: I would love this app and service if it were to fix a few important issues. Its integration with other apps like mySugar is a great idea, but it‚Äôs limited in some ways. 1) The inability to make necessary adjustments to information such as meal time. This is an unnecessary constraint on a paid app. I use lifesum to track and plan my meals along with my insulin intake, and this restriction on specifying meal times makes much of my data charts worthless. 2) When exporting the carb counts to other apps, it automatically excludes carbs that it has not verified, even if I have entered the numbers myself. There should at least be the option to include all data. 3) The app is often buggy. It crashes upon opening, and food input sometimes simply doesn‚Äôt work. Clicking to add an item results in a blank field that then disappears. A paid app should not have these problems.

title: Almost there
body: For this type of app, it‚Äôs so important to have a beautiful, delightful, fun to use interface. This app‚Äôs definitely got that. You‚Äôll be looking forward to using it every morning, noon, and night. I‚Äôm starting keto and the recipes have been so helpful for me as a beginner to know what to eat.

title: Food choices have wrong numbers
body: EDIT: the company reached out and showed me where I could change numbers that were put in by other people. They said I need to let them know about mistakes if the problem is on their side. I‚Äôve learned how to put in my own recipes so this helps tremendously. I‚Äôm keeping this app as it‚Äôs been a better help to me than any of the others I‚Äôve used.

title: Big fan! But can always improve :)
body: I love this app! It makes starting a Keto diet super easy. It scans barcodes so well, has so many foods in its database. I love that you can adjust the measurements of foods, ie grams ounces tbsp etc, so you can track accurately.

title: Best thing that happened to me
body: I was pretty overweight when I downloaded this app. I decided to use it and stick with it. I paid for the 1year subscription and stuck with it. I tracked most of the days, forgot to track a few. I lost 64 pounds in a little over a year. The best part about this app is it teaches you so much about nutrition. Enough that now I don‚Äôt even have to track my calories because I can maintain my weight with my own judgement. I still use it though because I have a few more pounds to lose and then I will see how it does with gaining muscle mass. I just love the interface and the ratings as smiley faces, it makes it simple to use. I just want to say thank you to the app developers because of you all my life is tremendously better.

title: Nice, but a bit biased.
body: I‚Äôve been eating healthy and tracking my health for a long time, so I know when something is a little spotty. This app is great for tracking and recommending certain things for my goal weight. However, when I first logged my morning fatty coffee as my breakfast, it gave me the ‚Äúokay‚Äù symbol. I don‚Äôt pay for premium, but it seems to me that the picture of the fruit and bread are recommended as a ‚Äúhappy face‚Äù. As someone who is going to school for nutrition and has a few friends and family who have tested all sorts of things; with different weights, metabolisms, and health, we all can agree that carbs and even protein are not good for us in the least by not raising our insulin too much. I‚Äôm not keto, but I have everything in moderation. So I think that this should be updated or have more research put into it other than what the government or food industry thinks or portrays as ‚Äúhealthy‚Äù.

title: Too many issues - Customer Support severely lacking
body: Switching AppleIDs as part of a phone upgrade caused issues with the app. The watch app doesn‚Äôt work smoothly and doesn‚Äôt update always. Contacted support for each of these with a wait time of over a WEEK for initial response each, and the responses weren‚Äôt helpful. The food database is lacking (still new I guess compared to my fitness) - A lot of the items are way off on accurate nutrition, and it allows you to flag them - had to flag a lot. The barcode scan works pretty well. The app does look and feel nice. But it doesn‚Äôt come close to Fitness Pal food database and functionality and lack of issues... canceled subscription for this and renewed my fitness pal membership - works flawlessly now. I honestly would have stuck with it had customer support not been so horrible. But I would rather trash 11 months of a subscription than to continue with Lifesum (so I did).
