title: The app is great but it needs some work
body: I‚Äôm on the keto burn plan and i like the app a lot, but there are some points that needs to be fixed. First, the recommended daily meal plan in the keto burn have more carbs and or protein or calories than i need, so if i go with the recommended meals i would be exceeding my limits of carbs or protein, the recipes are great i like them but they don‚Äôt suit my plan. I mean i can choose only one and plan the rest of the meals of the day myself. Second, sometimes when i log food it counts more carbs/protein/calories then i have to close the app and open it again or delete the food and re-log it again. And the numbers keep changing inaccurately sometimes. Third, i can‚Äôt decide the amount of water in my glass or bottle my self because the bottles we have in my country are either 330ml or 600ml. Other than that the app is really nice and i hope you work more on it.

title: Has the potential to be a really good diet app
body: This app looks nice and is generally easy to use but there‚Äôs a few things that get me frustrated while using it. I‚Äôve only been using it for 9 days and I paid extra for premium.

title: Almost perfect!
body: I recently got an Apple Watch and wanted an app where I could track calories and macros. UX/UI is a big deal to me, and this app is one of the best looking calorie trackers out there! (It seriously blows the socks off Myfitnesspal.)

title: Love the app overall
body: This app is great for tracking my food and learning how to build healthier habits! It functions well and it makes things really simple to use. One thing I would love to see if more integration with recipe apps. Eating healthily includes a lot of cooking at home for me and being newer to living on my own, I‚Äôm following lots of new recipes and sometimes it‚Äôs hard to find something similar to track and logging individual ingredients or recipes can be very time consuming. One great app I‚Äôve found for healthy recipes is Mealime. Definitely recommend integration because they list full detailed nutritional facts and tons of healthy and easy recipes. Even a simple way to allow Apple health to write food entry data combined with in app tracking because most recipe apps will allow you to track to Apple health.

title: Keeps getting worse!
body: I‚Äôve had this app for about 3yrs or so now. I‚Äôve had the free version and the year subscription. At first it was great but over the last couple years instead of improving it‚Äôs gotten worse. The app deleted all my previous data so I couldn‚Äôt see what I added a month ago, you use to be able to go back a year and see all data. It has reset my updated weight over and over again making it impossible to keep track. The app deletes food you‚Äôve already logged for the day so that you have to keep adding it. You try to scroll down past lunch area and it gets stuck to where you can‚Äôt see dinner or snacks.  Now today I tried to log my breakfast and lunch and the app won‚Äôt even respond. You go in to add the food and click ok and it doesn‚Äôt register at all. The app even deleted half of yesterday‚Äôs meals. I‚Äôve loved this app and it helped me lose over a hundred pounds but sadly now I‚Äôve deleted it because it doesn‚Äôt work anymore! I‚Äôm truly disappointed!!

title: Nutritional information absolutely wrong.
body: Though this App is beautiful and it syncs to all your tracking devices AND it‚Äôs easy to use, do not be fooled. This App has a vast log of

title: Customer service Vs bugs
body: My issue with this application is that my goal was constantly getting reset from losing weight to gaining weight. My weight would constantly be reset to zero, and my meals would just delete by themselves. I reached out to customer service but they were no help. Finally I decided to delete the application and reinstall it onto my phone only to find out that I could not restore my previous purchase of premium. After several emails to customer service I still have not received a refund. It‚Äôs fine, I don‚Äôt need the money back, but in my opinion customer service is lacking. The application is great I loved how it graded food so I knew which foods are good and which foods were bad but the bugs cause me to cancel my premium membership. This is just my experience I‚Äôm sure others have had positive experiences, mine has just been quite buggy and annoying with customer service.

title: Best honest app!!!
body: I found this app having a great ux design and a beautiful graphic design. One of my fav apps. What I love the most is that the free version is as good and efficient and resourceful as the premium . I absolutely recommend the free version at the beginning, you will fall in love with the app and its features so much that you will need to buy the premium that it‚Äôs just like having a personal coach 24/7. In the past I had very bad experience with another app that took my money and never heard back from them. Even if I ask for rectification. Lifesum is an honest app they don‚Äôt take your money for nothing. You pay when you want and they give you the best they can offer that is top. I keep using this app since 2015 it just keeps improving.

title: Great but missing one thing...
body: So far using this app has been really intuitive and fun! It‚Äôs so easy to track your meals and water, I really appreciate the wide range of excellent recipes and that you can add the ingredients to a shopping list. The only thing I wish that this app had was a feature where you could make your own recipes. I do a lot of cooking and have used calorie counting apps before that let you add all of the ingredients to a custom dish or recipe along with how many serving that you prepared and calculates the calories that you consumed per serving. I haven‚Äôt seen this feature on this app so I just enter the calories per serving as a custom item but it doesn‚Äôt include any of the nutritional information. I really appreciate that the keeps track of and sets goals for your nutrition but I feel like when I prepare my own recipes I miss out on that feature.

title: Without Premium, there‚Äôs no point.
body: I initially downloaded this app because I wanted to lose a bit of weight and monitor my calorie and water intake, but after having this app for a few weeks, it has no purpose. The app gave me a suggestion of approximately 1700 calories per day and 8 glasses of water. On most days, I like almost all of what I eat-with the exception of foods that aren‚Äôt listed-and at times I find myself going over the calorie limit, or not drinking enough, or getting a less than satisfactory rating on some of my meals, and what I‚Äôve noticed is that the app recognizes this, but does nothing to help me do better. Even a more in depth analysis of what you ate that day is restricted unless you have premium. Over the past couple of weeks I‚Äôve formed some unhealthy habits that the app recognizes, but does nothing to help me break the habits, or give me tips to eat healthier.

title: Great app with a few personal drawbacks
body: I‚Äôve used this app for a little while now and I‚Äôm really enjoying it! The layout is nice, the style is sleek, and it‚Äôs helping me track everything!

title: Good but needs work
body: I really love this app and I love how easy it is to keep track of macros. However, keeping track of some foods is really difficult because the serving sizes just don‚Äôt make sense on the app so I‚Äôm stuck either weighing everything I eat or doing complicate conversions. My fitness pal is much easier to use because there are many different serving size options. My main point is that when I scan some barcodes, none of the serving sizes come up that are on the packaging. When scanning a barcode it should come up with the same serving size that is on the packaging. It‚Äôs hard to choose which app to use because I‚Äôm trying to gain muscle mass and both apps aren‚Äôt really amazing at it. Please fix the serving size issue. I don‚Äôt want to have to do a bunch of math every time I eat.

title: More features
body: I normally do not write reviews, but I figured I would add some commentary/suggestions and also what I have found that I do like at this point. The app is pretty easy to use, has a decently large database of foods you can search/scan and can be motivating. However, I would LOVE if there was a breastfeeding/pregnancy feature. Pregnant people are meant to GAIN weight and apps like this definitely don‚Äôt encourage that, even if it‚Äôs necessary for a developing fetus. While breastfeeding, you also can‚Äôt lose weight too quickly or else you risk completely tanking your milk supply. I‚Äôve tried to use the suggested amount of calories but every time I do that, I notice the amount of milk I produce plummets quite quickly.

title: So close to perfect
body: This is a really fantastic and easy to use app for anyone who‚Äôs seriously committed to their diet. I recently started a strict keto diet and this has been invaluable for helping me keep very close track of exactly what I‚Äôm consuming. There‚Äôs even a feature that can tell you what percentage of your daily intake has been composed of protein, carbs, and fat! The only way this app falls a little short is it sometimes just doesn‚Äôt work. Often times I‚Äôll log a food in, and then it simply does not calculate into the log, as if I didn‚Äôt just go in and take that action. It gets a little annoying since it‚Äôs pretty common and the whole point of this app is to successfully log my food. But with all the other benefits this has to offer and the attractive design, I‚Äôm so grateful for lifesum!

title: Too Much Tied Into Premium
body: I was looking for an app to replace MyFitnessPal, which is a good app but boring and outdated. This looked like a winner at first, it has a great layout and design. But there are features that require membership when they should be basic. The two biggies are 1. No daily nutritional information (I have potassium issues and I need to see that info) and 2. You can‚Äôt modify your daily intake (macros) based on your needs/desire without paying for Premium. For instance, it locks you into a ‚ÄúClassic Plan‚Äù that has macros and a calorie count that doesn‚Äôt fit with my current lifestyle and I can‚Äôt adjust them because it‚Äôs locked into a membership. With most other apps, including MyFitnessPal, these options are both included for free and pretty basic features. This app is basically a pretty calorie tracker without Membership. I guess if you want your meal plan and dietary needs dictated to you then this app is for you.

title: Love it, but one small bug
body: I've been using Lifesum for about 10 days now, and I really enjoy using it. It's simple, and easy to use. My goal with Lifesum is to help me eat more, since I under eat a lot. While my under eating problems have been getting better since using Lifesum, there is one bug that kinda annoys me. Whenever I log a meal, it says that it is a few calories under, which is a really helpful aspect of this app. Sometimes, this feature bugs out, and gives the incorrect number of calories under. For example, if I log 200 calories of food, it will say that I am 200 calories under the minimum goal, which isn't true. Hopefully this bug will be fixed soon, because it's really driving me crazy.

title: Sadly, requires reading glasses
body: I want this app! But I‚Äôm not willing to carry reading glasses. This style of typography is OK for print publications, because you get in the habit of putting reading glasses on the coffee table. But, with an app you use for a few seconds, multiple times per day, reading glasses aren‚Äôt an option. Sure, I could use Apple‚Äôs accessibility zoom, but again, with something you need to see, multiple times per day, it‚Äôs not a viable option. Just design it to be legible out of the box. I have to believe that even your younger customers will appreciate better legibility. Trust me, it can be done tastefully.

title: Doesn‚Äôt save any details entered
body: Update: There has been an update to the app. It is working better now but still won‚Äôt stay connected to the Apple Health App. Every morning I must go into the settings and resync it to the health app to count my steps. Other this issue I really the free version of the app. When you sync it the your Apple Health app it will bring across all the food nutrients you consume. I will wait till this is fixed to determine if I will pay for the extras.

title: Limited choice
body: I have premium membership and I been using this around week.

title: Great, but can‚Äôt adjust your individual calories if 5:2 diet
body: I really enjoy using this app and even got the year long subscription. It allows me to find new recipes and try new diets to see what works for me. Also really love syncing it with my health app to show how many calories I‚Äôve burned with walking. Two complaints though if you choose the 5:2 diet, it will only show you low calorie recipes for those 500 calorie days. However, I want healthy recipe ideas for every other day too. In addition, you‚Äôre not allowed to adjust the calories you need in this diet. It wants me to do 1550 calories 5 days out of the week to ‚Äúget a better day rating‚Äù but that would be overeating for a person my size! Hopefully you can fix because I love trying the regular recipes as well as the 5:2 recipes.

title: Too much premium
body: I love this app because it is so easy and that it helps in a lot of ways but the reason why I don‚Äôt like it is because that there isn‚Äôt much for a person who doesn‚Äôt want to pay for premium to do. Say for the recipes all of them are for the premium members. I am a person who likes to try things but I didn‚Äôt want to spend my money on this because I know I‚Äôm not getting much from it. So I would just like there to be more things for people who aren‚Äôt going to pay for the premium member ship. I know the whole point in having a member ship is for a person to purchase it and have everything but I just feel like you should give a bit more things for people who don‚Äôt pay because almost everywhere I like it pops out with paying for the premium.

title: Solid app; rough around edges
body: I went from LoseIt to MFP to Lifesum.

title: Who‚Äôs reviewing this food?
body: Giving this 3 stars because I got a free trial of Premium and it was much better. Then when the trial ran out all it did was count up calories and basic nutrients like sodium and sugar.

title: Regret I paid for premium
body: I really want to like this app because it is very attractive, unlike MFP.  However, it needs a lot of work, especially the recipe function.  First, I found a lot of mistakes in the database, too few/many calories etc, and no way to report errors, unlike MFP.   Next, the recipe function keeps making the app crash and when I finally get a recipe entered, there is no way to edit it later.  For instance, you use a different brand a cheese the next time you make it, you can‚Äôt correct the calories/nutrition. Next, there is no website availability so you have to enter recipes in the app and personally, I can type much faster in a keyboard than a mobile device.  Last, but not least, there is no recipe import function so you do HAVE to enter each ingredient and instructions by hand, unlike MFP.  So while MFP may not have the glitzy, cutesy presentation, it is HANDS DOWN a much more functional app even without paying for their premium membership.

title: Premium = fraud
body: Invested in premium thinking it was the way to go per the way it‚Äôs sold, 1: being after the purchase was made I was charged the full amount, yet when the subscriptions are displayed it makes it seem like you‚Äôre paying a small amount for the months you choose. Not the full price!

title: Useless compared to my fitness pal
body: I started using this app because I thought the interface was more aesthetically pleasing than my fitness pal. I was so excited that I even bought the yearly subscription. After a day I regretted it. The food database is incomplete and not accurate. For example I was tracking for a few days and was wondering why it said my fats were so high...it said a serving of grilled chicken breast had 20 grams of fat.....the scanner doesn‚Äôt work either so you‚Äôre out of luck if you can‚Äôt find. The ‚Äúrating‚Äù gets irritating as well. If you‚Äôre trying to center your carbs around when you workout it‚Äôll constantly tell you that you‚Äôre off track because your macro distribution. Would also like to see an app that has the option of Meal 1, Meal 2, Meal 3, Meal 4, Meal 5 etc. rather than breakfast lunch dinner snack. Will be going back to my fitness pal. I just wish I hadn‚Äôt spent 50 dollars on a year subscription (which adds near no value to the app)

title: You can‚Äôt do anything with the free version
body: I couldn‚Äôt even adjust my own macros without upgrading to premium. That‚Äôs the most basic functionality I need out of a fitness app. I can‚Äôt properly keep track of what I‚Äôm eating with a quick look at the app when the preset daily requirements are so far off.

title: Great but could be better
body: Update: Net carb tracking has been added and that is awesome- thank you. My only complaint left is that there are still only a few diets to choose from. Please add more, particularly intermittent fasting. üôÇ

title: Needs Better/Verified Calorie Database
body: I liked the interface, color scheme, basic layout. There seemed to be an overly heavy emphasis on fad diets, but give the people what they want, right?

title: Unreliable Diet Information & Poor Functionally
body: The app itself has a very nice layout. However the functionality seems to be very wonky. For example, one day it says my calorie intake should be1650, the next day it say it should be 500. Not sure what to make of this. Based off two other apps I‚Äôve tried, my goal intake is around 1250 calories. The other thing I noticed was for the ‚Äúeasy‚Äù Keto Diet, it was showing 80% carbs, 5% fat and 15% protein. Anyone familiar with the Keto Diet knows this is incorrect. Finally, one feature I liked was the 3 week weight loss plan that would show menus for the week. The day after I paid for the premium version, this feature was no where to be found. So far I have found this app to be very confusing and not at all accurate with the information it is supposed to track which is diet. Carb Manager is great for those focused on the Keto Diet and MyFitnessPal for all other diets.

title: IF not accounted for
body: I recently started keto up again and have decided to add some intermittent fasting, meaning I‚Äôm skipping breakfast. This app doesn‚Äôt have a way to acknowledge this and therefore their ‚Äútips‚Äù about nutrient recommendations are off, since they‚Äôre counting on me eating three meals a day and not just two. I wish this was an option.

title: Love, but
body: Wow, what an easy app to use. I do have the paid version. This is one of many tracking apps I‚Äôve used before, but this is the first I loved so much that I paid for the premium version. I love the idea of the plans, BUT, I so, so wish I could swap out a single ingredient in each recipe. I follow a vegan diet, but the plan offered for vegans is very limited. Instead, I like to follow other plans, but swap out proteins or cheeses for vegan options. I would LOVE to see an option where I can go into each recipe and swap these out rather than having to fill in the whole recipe myself just because of one substitution. This would also help when making sure I‚Äôm getting as much protein/calories as the meat option would have. Please add this feature; it would help the app become more vegan-friendly!

title: Overall Such a Great App!
body: I really enjoy this app! I initially downloaded it to help count macros because I am vegetarian and sometimes struggle to ensure I get enough protein every day. This app helps keep my protein intake (and fat and carbs) top of mind. One thing I wish I saw more was I take of other key nutrients - like fruits and veggies, which currently are just counted for carb intake. Since all carbs aren‚Äôt created equal, it would be helpful if carbs such as breads and pasta were differentiated from sweet potatoes and greens, for instance. But, a great thing it does do is account for added and naturally occurring sugars, so that helps a bit with fruit sugar vs pasta, packaged goods, etc. I also love the barcode scan function. All in all, I plan to use this app for a long time. Good work!

title: Very disappointed
body: I am so beyond sick of fighting with this app. If you care anything about tracking your macros correctly- go with myfitnesspal. I‚Äôm frustrated that I upgraded to premium only to hate this app so much, I dread using it. Everything I scan- has the wrong info and often times the barcode is associated with the wrong food item. So I edit each time, carefully putting in the exact info off the food packaging, only to have it tell me calories etc are wrong and not allow me to save it! Why bother?  I also hate that it won‚Äôt allow me to track other things, like vitamin content- except for potassium. Also a joke that it won‚Äôt allow you to remove food items you create, or most of all, edit them. Which is exactly why you see so many duplicate items created by ppl on here. I know I sometimes change my recipes up, so why not allow me to change it on here?  This app has been around too long to be this dysfunctional.

title: Beautiful app but for targeted users only
body: Hello, I have been a premium (paying) user of this app, but I had to cancel my membership. It‚Äôs a  beautiful user interface, which was the initial appeal for me as a user. However, without the ability to access simple data from my food intake, this app is not as useful as I would hope for it to be when tracking more than just macros. Calcium, magnesium, and so many other minerals that should be easily imported on the developer side (I am familiar with development), but somehow, even with a user forum requesting such simple tracking, and for years now, this data is not available to users. The alternative for tracking not just macros but the various minerals we need to survive and thrive is My Fitness Pal, which is free, for my purposes at least. I will happily return as a user when these simple yet essential pieces of data are shared and easily accessible as well.

title: Love it- but a few places for improvement
body: The app is beautiful - which may be shallow but the design has certainly made me want to engage with the app far more than other food tracking apps I‚Äôve used before. The reminders and prompts are helpful and motivating, and Lifesum offers a lot of easy-to-select plans (keto, 5:2) that I was interested in. I‚Äôve paid for the 6 month subscription and am using the 5:2 plan. However, the food database to search from is far more spotty than Myfitnesspal and I‚Äôm putting most of my food in manually, and I am unable to move around my fast days throughout the week to account for my schedule, which causes some really discouraging feedback from the app when I‚Äôm either blowing my fast day calories or way under eating on a non-fast day.

title: Keeps me accountable
body: For the past week and a half of using this app, I have logged everything I eat from just a small snack to my meals.  It‚Äôs hard because I work overnights and I log my dinners as breakfast and so on but it does help me maintain accountability of my food.  I like being able to find the foods I eat from popular restaurants to foods I prepare at home.  My favorite part of the app is being able to scan the barcode of the food I prepare and input my portions.

title: Overall amazing
body: Overall I think this app is amazing. I love the reminders and the weight tracker. I love the label scanning and entry capabilities. I love that you can track for different types of diets. Where I think this fell short is in the Keto diet tracking area. I track net carbs and yes it does track them to a certain degree. I occasionally buy low carb treats with three and under in the net carb department they are higher carbs but the majority of carbs are sugar alcohols which should be subtracted from the overall carbs just like fiber to get the net carb total. Like I said overall an amazing app just needs a little tweaking for net carbs to calculate correctly. I should add that I don‚Äôt buy apps but I did purchased this for the three month timeframe to try it out and will definitely be purchasing for the next time frame!

title: Wish the food entries were more accurate
body: I like that this app allows me to make low carb/keto choices without judging me for consuming too much fat (*cough*MFP*cough*). I also like the premium feature of following a plan with recipes and guidance.  The app is beautiful in design. But I feel like if I‚Äôm going to pay for a food/diet journal app when there are sooo many free ones to pick from, the food entries need be accurate. I find myself fixing a lot of foods and barcodes in this database. And making a food a favorite should be right there on the nutrition facts breakdown‚Äîit‚Äôs not straightforward how to access recents or favorites. If I hadn‚Äôt paid for a 3mo subscription, I probably would have returned to another app by now for the convenience of a user-verified and more accurate database. A little more tweaking on the UX and accuracy of this app and it will be the bomb.

title: Great, but could use some improvements
body: Lifesum is a gorgeously designed app, but prefer Yazio‚Äôs Apple Watch complications.

title: Aesthetics can‚Äôt overcome customization problems
body: I‚Äôll start by saying I‚Äôve been using MyFitnessPal for 6 months. I wanted to try Lifesum because I was intrigued by its design and meal recommendations.

title: Overall Look & Test
body: I like this app, but the downside is it doesn‚Äôt have all exercises their are so you can add to exercises on the list. This makes it difficult to track on dieting. I‚Äôve had this app just 2-3 days of premium subscription and I feel it‚Äôs just not for me. The app isn‚Äôt really accurate on intake on calories. I‚Äôve already paid for the subscription for a year, so it‚Äôs a waste of my money now which I paid for a year. The amount of water someone should take is helpful. Also, for someone to be using this, you have to have a decent income to buy most of the healthy products suggested to stay on track of diet plans. For myself I‚Äôm a student, so this is kind of difficult since I don‚Äôt make that much while going to school with a part time job. Overall, it‚Äôs a good app for a little more experience users.

title: Great app but needs improvement
body: I love the app, but there a few key features that could make it better.

title: So much potential yet lacking in support
body: This is a great app for someone who doesn‚Äôt care about details.  The smilie faces and the progress bars make the app easy to read.

title: Great! But not the Best.
body: I‚Äôd love to love the app and currently have the premium version.

title: Good, but has some issues
body: I‚Äôve been using Lifesum for a few months. I switched from MyFitnessPal because the UI of that app was driving me nuts, and LifeSum presented a much more straightforward food tracker.

title: I‚Äôm confused
body: I got this app a couple months ago and than deleted because it was hard for me to track all of my food. Since it is the summer I decided that I might have more time to be able to track my food and activity. I re-downloaded Lifesum and after I signed in it brought me to a page that wanted me to confirm that I had read the he updated policies. The screen was buffering so I couldn‚Äôt read it and it wouldn‚Äôt even let me click ok to move on. Thus went on for a while so I deleted the app and re-down loaded the app. It still didn‚Äôt work. This has been happening for a day now and I would really like to be able to use Lifesum. It may be an issue on my end but I am not sure. If I could get a response that would be much appreciated. Thanks.

title: Outstanding app but it just need a few tweets
body: I just wanted to start off by saying that this app is very convenient, easy to use and extremely helpful. It is by far my favorite calorie tracking app. I have one problem with the app and if you could fix it it would be great. Lifesum offers 4 places to submit meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and snacks. There are only 3 main meals that should be of large portions and a really small snack. However, I eat more meals but in smaller portions and the way of submitting your food when you eat like me gets difficult. If you could maybe make the app more customizable regarding how many meals you eat it could be helpful. I have the premium version of Lifesum and I am really enjoying it!üòÅI really hope you take into account my recommendation

title: Glitchy, doesn‚Äôt sync
body: I paid for the premium version after being offered a promotional discount. If I were paying full price, I‚Äôd be very unhappy. While there‚Äôs a lot to like about Lifesum, the app has many flaws. Mine has not synced with Apple Health since mid-December, despite several reinstallations as instructed by customer support. It displays my calorie count as the next day, for some reason. And the food search needs work. Entering something as standardized as a Chipotle order involves searching through dozens of entries for the same ingredient, all with different calorie counts. I‚Äôve tried editing foods to correct them, but that doesn‚Äôt seem to work either. All in all, Lifesum is better than the My Fitness Pal app, but it needs work. If they can‚Äôt resolve these issues when my subscription is up, I will not be renewing.

title: Great UI but not intuitive
body: This application is beautiful, but from a functionality standpoint, beauty should never be placed over performance.

title: I have a wonderful suggestion
body: First off, I would just like to say that this is an amazing app. It is beautifully designed and was made to be used with ease and I absolutely adore it and I adore everyone who has made this app possible. I just want to give my thanks. I have already lost 12 lbs.

title: Getting worse
body: Used to be pretty cool, but down the line I‚Äôve realized 98% of the nutrition info is always incorrect, the ‚Äúrecipes‚Äù and ‚Äúdiets‚Äù offered in premium are so not worth it. I was excited for the vegetarian option but they don‚Äôt do nearly anything for it. The picture taking ability is always faulty and is not worth the time. Ultimately the only cool thing about premium is measuring all of your nutritional intake‚Äîbut like i said, unless you take the time ALWAYS to correct the info, it‚Äôs incorrect.

title: They Hide Unsub process
body: I liked the app but dislike how sneaky they are with trying to cancel subscription. Scummy.

title: Auto renewed for 2 years without notification
body: The app itself is good. But be aware that it will auto-renew yearly without sending a notification email. I used this app for about 6 months in 2019 and forgot to cancel the membership, apparently it has charged me the premium fee in 2020 and again recently. I have NEVER received any communication or notification about the auto-renewal in the past two years, and only found out it‚Äôs still charging me bcz it showed up in my credit card statement. Be sure to cancel your membership when you stop using the app bcz you will forget about it and they won‚Äôt bother you notify you about the charges.

title: It‚Äôs not working
body: I‚Äôve used this app before & it worked really well. Recently I got it again and it worked for a week. Today I was inputting my breakfast, water, lunch etc. but it wouldn‚Äôt work. I tried to add my cups of water, but nothing happened. My app ending up freezing & not working. I existed out & tried again, but the same thing kept happening. So I uninstalled the app, then reinstalled it and now it won‚Äôt let me log in. It‚Äôs saying my email is wrong, but it‚Äôs not. My email works perfectly fine & I know this because I went in my emails to make sure my email is still working & I was getting a bunch of emails. The app keeps saying to recheck my information, but all of my information is right. I know this because I write down all of my usernames & passwords and I put exactly what I wrote down into the app and it‚Äôs telling me it‚Äôs wrong. I was doing so good with tracking my foods, my water & my exercise and now the app doesn‚Äôt work.

title: Used to be better
body: I‚Äôve used lifesum for the past year and have mixed feelings on the changes. It used to be so much easier to check my progress. I also LOVED the mini milestones they offered of 3-5 pounds. I loved hitting those milestones and felt like a bigger deal to me than just hitting the next 5 or 10 pound mark on a scale. Also, at some point they lost my progress and said I had only lost 2 pounds, which was really disappointing to me. It was very helpful for me to look back on the chart going back many months to see the steady progress toward my goal. I decided not to pay for premium again this year and deleted the app. Developers, if you are out there, please bring back the little milestones for users again, and make sure their progress data doesn‚Äôt get lost between updates.

title: Great start, needs work
body: I downloaded this app, after seeing a YouTuber use it. She said that you could use it to find recipes, even for people with dietary restrictions, which is right up my alley. As someone with IBS and allergies, I constantly need to be recording my food, and is also constantly looking for good healthy recipes around my restrictions, I though this could help me. After signing up and spending a little time on the app I realized that you needed to pay for premium to be able to use the recipes, which was an instant turn off, as that was the main reason I downloaded this app. I wish the recipes were free, because I would actually use this app, but I‚Äôm deleting it, as it is of no use for me anymore. I think that this could be a really great app if everything useful about it was for premium. I hope the makers of this app take this into consideration.

title: Constantly unlinks from my watch and erases my data
body: I have been unable to keep my account set up correctly for more than a few hours at a time. I am logged in, linked my watch to import activity, set up my personal information etc. Everything looks great. Then, come lunch time, I go to add my food and suddenly the app has changed my fitness goal, is no longer importing my watch data and I have to go through the entire setup process Again. Fast forward to dinner, SAME THING.

title: Back to having a lot of bugs
body: April 2019...This is probably my fourth revision of the review in almost a year. Bugs get resolved then come back.  Now I can‚Äôt change the plan to gain weight and it is not adding my daily calories burned back to the diet though it is properly set up to do so.  Bugs seem to last a month or so before the resolve them; then they come back when they ‚Äúfix‚Äù something else.

title: Really great but would change a bit
body: So I love this app: big library of foods/barcodes in its library, great focus on macronutrients, the suggestions on how to increase my ‚Äúlife score‚Äù and I especially love the meal/food ranking smiley faces as motivation. But I would like to see a space where I can upload progress pictures along with my weight and the ability to turn off weight log reminders because I‚Äôm personally not big on tracking what the scale says or setting a ‚Äúgoal weight‚Äù when I‚Äôm just focusing on gaining muscle and eating healthier. I also prefer using my Fitbit to track exercise/other healthy habits so I wish they synced up on a bit more information than just a weak exercise total because it‚Äôs annoying to enter my food/water twice.

title: Horrible Updates
body: I had previously LOVED this app. I bought the premium subscript, and I had absolutely no problems with syncing data from Apple health, Fitbit (my main step tracker since I don‚Äôt carry my phone with me around at work), and lifesum. But this newest update is absolute garbage. I reached out to lifesum support and followed their recommendation to delete and reinstall the app. However, now the app is choosing to import my Fitbit data for random days! So now it looks like I have a ton of days where I ate hundreds of calories over my limit because it is missing my Fitbit data (I consistently reach 10k steps nearly every day). I have tried everything listed in the FAQ and nothing works. I feel as if I have lost all of the progress and work I‚Äôve put into this app and my lifestyle for months now .... I am tempted to just delete this app and go back to myfitnesspal. Hopefully you guys in app development will figure this out soon!!!

title: Great App
body: It‚Äôs sleek, elegant, and relatively easy to use (compared to other food tracking apps I‚Äôve tried). There‚Äôs a bit of a learning curve, but spend 10 minutes just playing around with the app and you should get the gist of everything.

title: Are you kidding???
body: Give us your personal information, then pick a plan. Don‚Äôt worry, they don‚Äôt show you anything really on the basic plan. Literally you can look at some meals, and you get a free workout and meal diary... that is it. If you go with the premium you get recipes and tons of other perks. The dilemma for myself and so many others is that I have such a restricted diet I don‚Äôt know if your app allows all my preferences. I am not signing up for anything without knowing what EXACTLY I am getting in return. $30 to hope that you can provide the recipes I can actually eat??? Pass. This hopefully works for many who do not have serious restrictions but for those that do you are asking us to throw our money on a very unlikely bet.

title: Love most of it but can be glitchy
body: This app is so fun to use and I appreciate the food and macro recommendations so much. The database of foods is super helpful and makes it easier to use.

title: Great idea but buggy. Not actively supported.
body: I used Lifesum to lose over 60lb a couple years ago and loved it. It synced my activity from my Apple Watch pretty well and the interface is so much cleaner than other free or paid options.

title: Beautiful app, ratings make no sense
body: It's a beautiful app that I enjoy using every day. The benefits for paying $30+ a year aren‚Äôt normally enough to make me go premium, but I would just to support the work of the team building lifesum. The ONLY thing keeping me from upgrading is the weird payment system. It‚Äôs monthly but managed by where you upgraded (iTunes or website) and the only way to cancel is to take it up with Apple, or whoever handles the payment. If canceling a subscription with lifesum directly, it looks like you email them and hope they‚Äôll come through on manually cancelling. It‚Äôs just not worth the potential headache later. I would rather pay a one-time fee than deal with a weird, fragmented subscription model.

title: Who‚Äôs the independent audience?
body: I think this app is for females. It‚Äôs difficult to determine because the app seems to have a delightful unisex interface. However articles and content posted by lifesum are geared towards females with almost all imagery being that of women and article titles like ‚ÄúEat Like A Goddess‚Äù. Great health isn‚Äôt bias, but the sex of an individual will affect it. I assume this is why the customizable features within the app are available. That in conjunction with the unisex interface should be more of a reason to creat an app geared towards everyone to enjoy. If this is more about a marketing strategy I‚Äôd assume making that plain would be helpful to users.

title: Great App!
body: Update: developer responded to my initial review and pointed out where the journal on the app was. I guess I haven‚Äôt explored the app as throughly as I thought I had.

title: Needs Work
body: 1- when trying to meal plan for the next day, I‚Äôm adding things to the correct day (tomorrow), but will kick me off of the day I‚Äôm trying to add and add it to the current day, which messes everything up.

title: Okay..
body: I wanted to like this app so badly. It‚Äôs so beautiful and feels like a native Apple app with the seamlessness of it. However, the functionality is where I feel Lifesum falls short. I was a loyal MyFitnessPal user for years and I decided to try Lifesum Premium to see if I liked it. The small library of food items and the difficulty through which food is logged proved to be too cumbersome for something that I KNOW can be easy, as it is through MyFitnessPal. The ‚ÄúMeal Plans‚Äù include eating 500 calories for 1 or 2 days a week... yikes. Every nutritionist will tell you that starving/fasting yourself is terrible for losing weight and your metabolism. The recipes are not worth premium, in my opinion. (Boiled eggs with mayonnaise as an exampleü§Æ) I tried Lifesum for about 2 weeks and I will sadly be going back to MyFitnessPal, even though I have 2 months left of Premium on this app.

title: What can I do without premium?
body: I got this app and immediately recognized the organization which I love as well as the aesthetically pleasing theme. As I was playing around with it for the first time I noticed that many of the features were locked and I need to buy premium in order to use them. Every time I saw something that I wanted to know or a feature I wanted to use, it was locked. Then I realized that without premium there is little the app can do. I think it would be nice to have a month or few week long free trial to test out premium before committing to paying for it, or something like that. Or, the app can just unlock some of the great features that made me download the app in the first place. For example, the camera to take a picture of my meal would save so much time!

title: Well Done Lifesum
body: I‚Äôm pretty picky about apps, but I‚Äôve got to say, I really like this one! From the moment you start it‚Äôs got funny and inviting animations, it‚Äôs very organized and professional, and somehow they managed to pack so many different features in without it feeling cramped. It‚Äôs very intuitive.

title: I want to love it but it‚Äôs just OK
body: I‚Äôve been using this for several weeks now and I want to love it but there are several things that need improvement badly. It has potential to be great and I love that it syncs to my watch so I can track my exercise in the same app as my meals. Several things need improvement:

title: Visually appealing, but meal plans need some work
body: I think the app looks nice and works pretty well overall. But when you have a section dedicated to meal plans, I hope to be given a guided plan I can follow. Most of the ‚Äúmeal plans‚Äù on this app aren‚Äôt actually meal plans, they just change recommended macros etc. With a separate tab full of recipes from that plan.

title: Need personal recipes
body: *updated from 4 to 5 stars* because the developer feedback was very helpful and resolved my issue!

title: LOST 50 LBS!!!
body: I never ever write reviews but this one felt like a must. After I read the reviews and contemplated paying for the $40 yearly subscription, I did. The app and platform itself is simple and aesthetically pleasing, therefore I felt this app would hold me accountable better than I could hold myself accountable. Although I didn‚Äôt log food every day and only used a couple recipes, the ‚Äúupdate your weight‚Äù button kept me motivated to weigh myself everyday and think more consciously about my intake. I also enjoy that my watch activity connects to the platform, adjusting my goal caloric intake based on my plan. After 4 months I am down 50 pounds and I‚Äôm not done yet. Thanks Lifesum!

title: Not worth the price
body: I would say this app has great potential, but it is still in its beginning phases for sure, and therefore shouldn‚Äôt be charging $50 annually for the premium. It‚Äôs just not worth that. I like the look of it, it‚Äôs not too difficult to navigate. But, every time I scan a food item, it is either not in the system and I have to add it, or the nutritional information or measurements are incorrect. (Sometimes the calories are correct but it says the standard serving is 1 cup instead of 1 tbsp, etc). I would say this is the case for 85% of foods that I add to my day and it gets so frustrating having to change everything. I wouldn‚Äôt mind having to add a new food or correct something every once in awhile, but I feel like it happens literally every day.  Even items from big companies like Quaker are not in the system sometimes. Pretty disappointing considering how much I paid.

title: Downfall in the Details
body: I got this app for the advertised meal plans however after paying (since there is NO way to review any recipes or plans before purchase) I was very disappointed. The recipes are VERY vague. Often with ingredients measured in ‚Äústandard serving‚Äù or in grams. The ingredients lists are either odd or so short that I was constantly adding to the recipe to give it flavor. The instructions more or less just say ‚ÄúCook food and eat it‚Äù. There‚Äôs no way to add a custom meal on the food tracker so tracking an actual meal you cooked is a huge pain. There are various diet plans to choose from but very little explanation on how to actually live within that plan. Also the meal plan itself is a pain to try and navigate in order to plan and meal prep. In short use this for a free tracker (it really is pretty) but don‚Äôt waste your time on the premium meal plans.

title: Easy to understand
body: I was never a count your calories guy, and I used to be able to eat anything I wanted and never gained weight. Now that I want to workout and get fit, I don‚Äôt know what I should be eating and I don‚Äôt even know what I‚Äôm eatings nutrition is. This app very simply tells you what you‚Äôre eating and how much more or less you should be taking in. The only thing is you need to be diligent to put what you‚Äôre eating in the app. If you can do that then you‚Äôll be shown how healthy the food you‚Äôre taking in is, quite surprised how many items are in their data base. Every item I‚Äôve eaten or made has been in their system and has a detailed nutrition chart for them

title: Regret purchasing a subscription
body: I had to search the app to find the setting to change the percentage of carbs to protein to fat i should be eating. I accidentally closed the step counter on the home page that has the cool info about how many calories you‚Äôve burned in terms of food, & for the life of me I can‚Äôt find the setting to get it back. I also discovered a bunch new settings in my search that I never knew I had. This app could be clearer, & the meal plan options are all the same & there are few options offered based on the questions you answer (like 3). I‚Äôve yet to see this be updated or more plans/options be added. Some foods you can only measure by ‚Äúserving size‚Äù & they don‚Äôt indicate how much a serving size is. The fruit & vegetable tracker don‚Äôt work, it says i‚Äôve consumed none even though i‚Äôve logged fruit & veggies in meals.

title: Great, but missing a key feature!
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for just over a week now and the user interface and visual appeal is outstanding!  To me, those are very important pieces to any app. How do you expect me to use it if it‚Äôs not easily navigated and looks good!?  The only thing I wish they would add is a way to connect with friends. Unless I‚Äôm missing it, I don‚Äôt see it. Otherwise this is a great calorie counter app! It connects with so many other apps to truly get a full scope of your health and eating habits. I haven‚Äôt ran into a problem with the food database as of now either!  The only addition I would recommend to the food database is being able to create your own recipes. Keep the updates coming!!!

title: Not all good
body: This app has a lot of bells and whistles, it looks great, but it comes with bugs that will make you want to forget using it. In fact I have, but I came back to see if any of the updates fixed them. Items in the food data base aren‚Äôt always what shows up on food item labels. It‚Äôs not easy to add your own, but try and try again, you‚Äôll get it. And the recipes should let you see the nutritional value of each item, and maybe be able to delete items you aren‚Äôt going to use, but then you would find some of the issues with improper nutritional reporting. I‚Äôm have labels that claim there are no carbs, but items in the app assign them carbs. WTH. It‚Äôs been frustratingly, enough to test your resolve. Probably faster and easier to use pen and paper.

title: Not Enough Options
body: I saw an ad on pinterest when looking up keto diets and decided to give it a try with the discounted subscription. I was super excited about the variety of meal plans it promised, but was disappointed to find out that the options are limited. I‚Äôm a fairly picky eater so I assumed finding recipes I liked would be difficult, but there were a total of 3 things that I would eat and could easily get the ingredients for. Even when searching for a recipe I made, there was nothing that popped up besides the few options on the explore page. If I want to make anything other than the recipes on the app itself I have to manually enter every single ingredient. I had purchased the 6 month plan but deleted it after 2 hours due to the lack of options and the overall inconvenience. Would not recommend going that route because now I spend $30 on nothing.

title: Liking the app
body: So I‚Äôm at week 3 of using the app. It‚Äôs honestly helped me learn much more about Macro Balance and I am a person that was like ‚Äúhuh?‚Äù when it came to that. I did buy the premium version because I thought it was worth the investment breaking down the fee per month (please don‚Äôt make it more expensive). Health starts with your diet so give it a try and log everything! (Even the bad stuff because you don‚Äôt often realize HOW MANY CALORIES OR FAT is in 1 item!)

title: Beautiful App; Very Limiting for IF Lifestyle
body: I paid for the premium version.

title: Great tool and interface ‚Äî missing 1 major thing
body: I really like this app and would love to completely switch from my fitness pal - but haven‚Äôt just yet because of one small thing - the ability to scrape a recipe from websites. MyFitnessPal has this functionality and I use it all the time as most of my recipes are coming from Pinterest or other online sources. Saves SO much time and effort  when this is automatically scraped and matched with ingredients/nutrition data. Switching between apps on the phone to manually enter in a recipe is terrible. Please please please consider this!! I love that Lifesum syncs with my Apple Watch health data and not just steps. If lifesum could incorporate a recipe scraper that would be fabulous!!

title: Net Carbs Needed!
body: I just got this so today and while I love the way it looks, and haven't been disappointed by the food database yet, I'm seriously disappointed with the keto plans.

title: Great app but please change the Keto plans!
body: I am currently ketogenic and am so pleased they have a section that caters to this diet because that‚Äôs very uncommon. However, I have to enroll in the ‚ÄòClassic Diet‚Äô pretty much like every other food tracking app because it doesn‚Äôt let me tweak my own macros. The carbs are locked when choosing any of the keto plans (easy, medium or strict). Bummer! Lots of people on a keto diet know their exact macros due to their weight, height, body fat percentage etc. It‚Äôs different for every person. Please let me choose a keto plan and tweak my macros from there! I do love the keto recipes, overall interface and ability to find pretty much any food. Still using it, happy I purchased pro, but please change that! üôèüèªüôèüèªüôèüèª

title: Over Before it Started
body: I recently purchased a Fitbit HR 2 in my multi-step plan to losing weight. The Fitbit app offers tons of guidance on workouts and your sleep, but lacks in the food prep department.

title: Amazing App! Could use more diet plan options.
body: This app is incredible! It‚Äôs beautifully designed more than anything and the functionality is great as well. A few suggestions though:

title: Love this App but would like 1 Modification
body: So, I had this app a couple years a go and really enjoyed using it. I took a break to use a different tracking app and didn‚Äôt like it as much, so came back to the premium subscription for this one. I am an athlete and require a lot of calories for my daily allowance, and the issue I have with this app is that I cannot type in the specific number of calories I need as my base. I like that the macro allowance can be altered, but I‚Äôm still needing to journal outside of this app to account for the other 400 cals + macros I need for my daily allowance. If we could have the option to click on the daily calories and type in our goal amount or calories that would be awesome.

title: Good app
body: I really like this app. The biggest thing I like about it is that you can use the barcode scanner. This makes it so much quicker to add my food versus constantly looking up food. And I also like that it works with Apple Health app which is my go to daily.

title: Excellent app but‚Ä¶
body: This is an excellent app that has helped me change my life for the better. But‚Ä¶. The Apple Watch complication drives me crazy. It hardly ever loads and when it does it‚Äôs because I log out and lock back in and even that is hit and miss. One feature that I would like to see is the ability for the app to read water intake data from apple health (it can already write the data). Good work on this app!!!!

title: So far, not so good
body: **UPDATE** incorrect calories for everything I try to log via barcode scan. Everything. Have to adjust to get the calories right and then it throws the other nutritional info off. This app is more form than function, and I‚Äôd recommend finding another meal tracker.

title: Best app
body: I‚Äôm so glad I found this app. They have thought of almost everything. Great layout for ease of use. Free app good and a reasonable fee for upgrade which I am enjoying. They should have a free 30 day trial for the upgrade which I‚Äôm sure people would want to use. And there is a note section which I love! I use it for ideas, notes on recipes, feelings for the day, etc. I also enjoy the icons! It makes a difference. The faces give immediate feed back. Very well designed! Thank you. One thing to fix, to add your own recipe or add food not found in calorie section, should be able to bring over into recents so you don‚Äôt have to keep adding it.

title: Disappointed
body: I like this app and I want to use this app. But I changed my calorie needs to 1300/day. When I go to the plan I‚Äôm on it says the plan name (classic dieting) and calories goal : 1300.

title: The most beautiful way to lose weight
body: Lifesum is a truly a revolutionary application for those who wish to lose weight or get into shape. When I downloaded the application, I was immediately amazed by the beautiful interface. Carefully designed and crafted, Lifesum includes everything you need to lose weight. It motivates you to stay and eat healthy when your about to go off track. It also makes sure you eat well. If you don't drink enough water, it sends you a notification of what you have done and the affect is has on your diet. So far I have lost 5lbs with Lifesum in the first week, so I'm very excited for future progress ahead.

title: Needs a better summary
body: The app is great, however, would better if it showed the suggested calories, fat, protein, and carbs that are recommended at each meal and snack in every diet plan according to how you set your macros.  I am on the Mediterranean diet now only because it allows me to set my own fat, protein, and carb intake (I am ACTUALLY on a Keto diet) but in the diary it only suggests calories and I have to calculate the fat, protein, and carb myself for my meal preps.  Once I input into the diary the app does the calculation but it would be more useful if it shows it in advance so I can immediately measure out my portions.  Also, the available Keto plans lock the carb count so I can‚Äôt put in my individual carb grams and percentages.  Hopefully, the app team will address these two issues in the very near future.

title: Great App, hard to see
body: Overall this App is amazing and it makes keeping track of ma daily intake easy.  So far it‚Äôs been a week and it by far is better than fitness pal.

title: Would be 5 stars if...
body: This app is almost perfect but has a couple of flaws.  First, the Apple Watch sync feature is spotty at best.  My workouts don‚Äôt always show up on the app and when they do, sometimes they get overwritten‚Äî-especially if I work out twice in a day.  Second, this app doesn‚Äôt track or account for resting calories. I‚Äôve paid for the premium version which is a lot for it not to be 5-Star material.

title: Thank you LifeSum
body: If you are struggling to lose weight, I highly recommend LifeSum. I had tried many things to keep my weight under control (fad diets, intense exercise schedules, you name it) but was not seeing results.

title: Needs a lot of work before its worth the price
body: The idea of this app is great, but it is not executed well. The most annoying issue I ran into was the fact that it doesn‚Äôt save your place if you change apps while you add a food/meal/recipe. If I paused while tracking the meal to get more info and went back, the entire meal was gone, and I‚Äôd have to start from scratch. I had some issues tracking weight and trying to delete info I added on accident, which isn‚Äôt very helpful when tracking. Overall, I liked the look and idea but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend paying for this app until many bugs are fixed.

title: Great App!
body: Lifesum has been a great addition to bettering my health and helping me track and plot my progress.

title: Great app but be careful with your mental health
body: I never had any problem regarding the app, it itself worked magnificently well. I loved the graphics and it was very precise with food and exercise. Besides, I didn‚Äôt have any problem with the digital scanning.

title: Looks pretty but needs works
body: The app UI is nice and the smile icon feedback on foods and meals is helpful. Being able to enter the exact number of grams or mL of an item is great. And Lifesum appears to have a good privacy policy in place. But the technical underpinnings of this app are not as strong.

title: I always quit these apps.. not this time!
body: I‚Äôve trued tons of fitness/food apps, but always seem to quit after a week or two. Lifesum changed all that! I‚Äôve even lost 5 pounds just by being more motivated to eat healthy and exercise. The big difference for me is it rates the healthiness of foods, not just the calories. The app also nudges you if you eat too little, which I really appreciate! When I have an unhealthy day, Lifesum has good tips on how to improve, and congratulates you when you have a great day! I just wish you could turn on fruit/veggie/etc trackers without having to struggle in the Life Score first. Great app, WORTH the subscription!

title: Could be better with some additional features
body: Interface is user friendly and easy to navigate but I have a few overall issues. The food selections are limited. I find myself having to make things up or selecting an option from a source I‚Äôve never heard of. Thus, throwing accuracy to the wind. Secondly, the diet feature is limited. You can only select from a few diets but you can‚Äôt customize your plans or mix them. The options offered are specific and do not cater to dietary restrictions. The helpful hints are catered toward a user who is following the diet perfectly and do not adjust based on actual consumption or input trends. This would be a helpful update as well as the addition of food and ingredients and new and personalized diets

title: Loving This App
body: Totally enjoying this app. I was 309lbs and couldn‚Äôt loose weight. I only started doing this app at first because I had to go on the low iodine diet for testing. I just wanted to track what I was eating. I started loosing weight on the diet and decided since I was finally loosing weight I would continue using the app.  It shows me how many calories my body needs and if I eat something that‚Äôs not acceptable I get a sad face. I‚Äôm just three weeks in and weight 277.4 pounds. I‚Äôve done several diets in the past! This isn‚Äôt a diet, this for me is a teaching tool of how to live a better in more healthier way. FYI, I am just using the free part of the app. üëçüèª

title: Love it, but macro tracking could use work
body: When I put a recipe in, it automatically calculates the number of grams of protein, fat, and my net carbs, as I am on a keto diet. I noticed today after putting a new recipe in that it added almost 5x the amount of net carbs that are actually in the recipe‚Äî using Lifesum‚Äôs ‚Äúverified‚Äù number of each of the macros, it should have been around 2.8 net carbs.

title: Great app with room for improvement
body: The interface of this app is intuitive and visually appealing. It is incredibly simple to navigate, and I love the feedback that it provides for each food, meal, and day. With that being said, there is definitely room for improvement.

title: Great App
body: Literally exactly what I was looking for. Main menu with everything right up front for you to see. Super easy to use. It knows 99% of things you can. If it doesn‚Äôt, you can easily just add the calories (which is all I care about). My one and only gripe about it is the water intake. I wish the water intake configuration was a little more customizable. Even though I‚Äôm an American, I prefer to use ml. As of right now you can only go by a 8 oz glass of water or a 16 oz bottle of water. A lot of people use refillable water bottles that typically like 24-64 oz. so no matter what you do, you can‚Äôt measure your water to the exact amount.

title: Taking another look at this app...
body: I‚Äôve reviewed this app in the past and complained about some functionality issues...these last updates have addressed said issues!

title: A decent, attractive tracking app
body: I‚Äôve only been using this app for a few days, but so far am finding it fairly simple to use. Also, the interface is clean and and has a nice layout. I do wish there were more ways to enter a portion of food. For instance they‚Äôll have tablespoons, but not teaspoons, so you have to enter a decimal if you want to indicate 1 teaspoon. In general, they don‚Äôt offer as many different types of food measurements as other diet apps that I have used.

title: Nice when it functions properly
body: I‚Äôve been using the premium version of this app for over a year now and like it except one huge problem for me. Sometimes it doesn‚Äôt accurately track the food you enter and delete.

title: Quite a lot to say here...
body: This app would be good for certain people...The way you view the app will determine whether or not this app would work for you. For me personally it didn‚Äôt work very well. It‚Äôs what triggered  me to an Ed way of eating.  I lost a ton of weight in a very unhealthy way. Leading my body to not function optionally. I started to ditch the app and educate myself on health and nutrition. Going towards a more ‚Äúlistening to my body‚Äù type of way. That truly helped me gain my weight back and get out of my ed ways. I‚Äôm not saying to not download this app. All I am saying is to please if you feel restricted, unhappy, and making food become a number. Then please do not get the app! If you are happy, feel good, and enjoy using the app. Then by all means get the app!

title: Total fitness app, but can it be more?
body: My hunt for a fitness app came to an end after I found LifeSum! Such a beautiful interface with just the right features keep you on track!The Meal planner is an added health bonus which has an amazing collection of deliciously healthy recipes.

title: Not what I Paid For
body: I bought the premium hoping for a multitude of recipes to swap in and out of meal plans and many options for various food preferences, this is not the case. There are very limited food plans and not a lot of offered recipes. Also it is very difficult to receive a refund if you are unsatisfied. I tried to cancel about 10 min after i purchases after I realized it did not include what was promised, and was directed to Apple Support who will not refund (Lifesum hides behind the fact that they do not directly handle the payment platform). I have tried to use it anyways since I‚Äôm paying for 6 months (whether I like it or not) and now the app keeps crashing randomly when I try to view the plan section. Disappointing, not worth it for premium, might be useful if you stick to free but my fitness pal is just as good with a larger database.

title: Visually appealing but lacks accuracy
body: I bought the premium without trying the app first, my mistake!

title: Almost unusable constantly broken no connection with watch or other apps
body: Brand new user. Read all the reviews. Really excited to find an app that helps me keep up with Keto. Unfortunately the App barely works. It‚Äôs constantly ‚Äúlosing‚Äù my profile goals are changed items aren‚Äôt tracked and it‚Äôs so frustrating to have spent $30 bucks for a premium plan only to have it think I‚Äôm a new user every time I open the app. Even worse it tries to offer me 30% off to go premium AFTER I already did!

title: Best weight loss program EVER!
body: Love this plan. This app is a MUST if you are on the Keto diet program. Highly recommend the app upgrade. It keeps you on track every meal and gives you hundreds of amazing Recipes. I have lost 19 lbs in less than a month. My max lifetime weight was 243 two months ago, I started the keto diet with this app 25 days ago and I weighed 224 this morning!  It is changing my life. I haven‚Äôt felt this good in years. The food is delicious, the recipes easy to prepare and I never get hungry. I also lost my cravings for bread, cookies and snacks. Amazing results for me. Highly recommend if you want to lose weight and stay healthy. Two thumbs Way  Up!!

title: Best app i‚Äôve used!
body: Over the years i‚Äôve used different fitness apps trying to be healthy (I‚Äôm 17 now) and now i‚Äôve been on the journey to build muscle, so that means eating more. Over 2020 i‚Äôve gained 15 pounds!!! But even with my progress it was so hard to keep track of actually how much protien and calories I ate through the day. This is my fav app and I use it like everyday now!!!! It‚Äôs free for the basic version which works perfect & it‚Äôs so easy to look up the foods you eat or you can just scan the barcode which is my favorite. Literally 10/10, and I NEVER write app reviews because i‚Äôm too lazy but this one I knew deserves a good review‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Majorly contributed to my ed
body: *TW ED* I used this app throughout my ed and I can say that it made it 100 times worse. I just got out of a 3 month long stay in inpatient and residential ed treatment at 15 years old and am still in a partial hospitalization program. This app lets you set ridiculously low calorie limits and doesn‚Äôt fight you on them with more than a notification that the goal is too low. In addition it sets your original goal at 1200 cal which isn‚Äôt even enough to feed a person in a coma. We need at least 1400 per day to exist in a coma and at least 2000 per day to exist a normal life. It encourages people to eat way under the amount their body needs. If you want to lose weight please do NOT use this app. Restricting your calories will not work long term. Listen to your body. It knows what it needs. You don‚Äôt want to end up where I and many others are.

title: Frustrating
body: I like this app for so many things. Scanning in food. Tracking macros. But I‚Äôm pretty tired of my exercise not syncing from my Fitbit, or having exercise I‚Äôve manually input just disappear. The app also changes my weight on its own accord. No, I did not lose weight or gain that weight....I clearly haven‚Äôt entered the amount it decides for that day. Sometimes it just reverts back to my starting weight for no reason at all. If you‚Äôre looking for an accurate graph for weight this is NOT the app you should be using. I‚Äôd be better off with a pen and paper. I‚Äôve reported this issue many times, yet it still seems to be broken. Funny....my LoseIt app doesn‚Äôt do this....and neither does my FitBit app. It‚Äôs frustrating keeping food tracking in one app and weight tracking by in another.

title: Used to be amazing, just keeps getting buggier
body: I used to love lifesum, and I still want to! I love that it has multiple plans, all the tips analyzing how you might be feeling or how to adjust your food intake, the way you can Target your calories....They even finally added net carbs! And I really love how beautiful but functional the design is. But after paying for this for a year, almost two, I find it hard to justify the cost. Net carbs is the only feature improvement during this time I've actually used. Fitbit exercise syncing gets worse and worse. The food database has lots of mistakes that I have to account for when tracking calories. I don't need fancy recipes or a bunch of new plans... I just want the core features I use to work but it feels that's not what the developers want to focus on.

title: Let me input my own caloric needs!!!
body: This app is wonderful except for not being able to adjust my total calories without resetting all of my data. I don‚Äôt like that the app tells me what my calorie intake should be and doesn‚Äôt allow me to adjust it. I like that you can adjust the carbs/fats/protein ratio but ONLY AFTER purchasing a subscription and the ratio HAS to fit within the calories which are not accurate for me! Please allow users to adjust total calories and ratios based on our own goals. The calculation doesn‚Äôt even take into account your activity level, just height weight and age - which aren‚Äôt totally accurate indicators of how many calories you should be consuming.. I bought a year subscription and want my money back because of that frustration alone..

title: Paid for premium but...
body: While the interface is much nicer to look at than previous calorie trackers I‚Äôve used, there are many features that are lacking. For example, I paid to see more nutritional information about what I‚Äôm eating, like fiber and potassium, but they offer no other micronutrients like vitamin C, or Iron.

title: Best One Out There
body: Personally I feel this is the best app I could ask for. It‚Äôs so good that I want to be on it 27/7. It‚Äôs very simple but shows great new things to try and it has all in one so you don‚Äôt have to pair it with other ones. I also feel you don‚Äôt need to buy premium but it is a good option if you want to branch out on new ways to record you food. I also like the fact that you can delete old recordings like I started last year but stopped because I got lazy. But now I‚Äôm trying it again for the new year and I was glad I could delete the old stuff and yea this app is so great and I‚Äôm glad I found it.

title: Much better since the update.
body: Lifesum has been much more reliable since the update. It's a beautiful app, and is much more motivating than others I've tried (e.g. MyFitnessPal).

title: Best Interactive experience
body: I‚Äôve used a few different calorie tracker apps, and Lifesum provides the best in app experience overall. They don‚Äôt have the most extensive library but it is still pretty good. With it being the most user friendly out of all of the apps I‚Äôve tried, I‚Äôll compromise a bit on having a good, not great, library to choose foods from. It should be noted though that we do not eat out hardly ever so I have to do a lot of creations of meals in the app. A great benefit though are the recipes that are already included in the app. I haven‚Äôt figured out if I can import a recipe from Pinterest or anywhere else, but that would be a huge win if they could figure that out.

title: Good but needs some improvements
body: I like the app for tracking macros (and the user interface is fun and motivating) but need a couple major things fixed/added:

title: Lost Two Years of Data
body: I used this app for two years, and during the first year I used the paid version, but I never cared for the recipes/meal plans and such, so switched to the basic version. It works as well for weight loss as any calorie calculator, you‚Äôll get out of it what you put into it. However, my issue was that with a recent update, I lost the last two years of weigh ins that have shown my progress over nearly 40 pounds. I‚Äôve had multiple issues with this function, such as glitches with updating my weight (I‚Äôd put it in, but when I checked the chat it would have spiked to my original weight). I‚Äôm just annoyed and done overall. Deleting this app today, unfortunately going to just lose all my past data and I‚Äôll be trying out another app.

title: Good diet tracking app, but a lot is locked behind Premium
body: Overall, this is a nice diet tracking app. I enjoy that the free version is not riddled with ads. The interface is very clean and straight forward. Daily tracking info is clearly displayed.

title: Great app
body: I like this app for tracking food and trying to eat a healthier menu. I like the elegance and easiness. The different ways it shows visuals to display info is very helpful in understanding how much ive consumed and have lost.

title: This app is good
body: I like using lifesum to track what I eat and I‚Äôve been liking it a lot. I also like the idea of tracking calories and nutritional value in the foods I eat. I didn‚Äôt give it a full star because I am a user who likes to cook and there‚Äôs no option to save my own recipes in the application to track macros. The recipes in the app is great don‚Äôt get me wrong. I‚Äôm just saying the app would be better if users are able to save their own recipes with all the macros for their recipe and then add it to their daily meals. I think this would make it easier than having users reenter all the ingredients every time they want to track it. Overall a good application.

title: Really good!
body: I got this app because I was feeling self conscious and I wanted to get skinnier. This app really helps! If you put in all the effort to track your meals you really become more aware of what your eating and how many calories it is. The reason I only put 4 stars is because they give you a lot of pop ups for their plans you pay for and I was really just looking for something free and easy to help me feel more self confident. This app is totally free unless you chose to pay for one of the special plans which I don‚Äôt intend to do. I would say the free version is probably better then the paid plan. So I would definitely recommend using this app! Really helps.

title: Good start but information is a bit simplistic
body: This app seems like it would be a great way for those beginning on a health journey to start out. It offers three options (get healthy, lose weight, gain weight), which is a refreshing change from all the apps who think everyone‚Äôs priority is to shed pounds. Another positive: it tracks water intake!!

title: Good idea, but didn‚Äôt work for me.
body: I started using this app to get in shape prior to my college ROTC classes. I started in early June 2018, and my the end of the month, I had made no progress on the scale. I was always under my calorie limit, I ran 1.5 miles everyday and lifted weights, but I wasn‚Äôt going anywhere. I had used MyFitnessPal before and had lost 15 pounds, but I wanted to try something new.

title: Great app.
body: Great app. Opportunities for improvement are the barcode scanner (it doesn‚Äôt pick up bar codes as easily as it should) and the food database (not nearly as comprehensive as other apps).

title: Beautiful Design
body: I paid for the premium version and am happy with it. I love the design and functionality of the app - because it‚Äôs lovely to use, I use it consistently and find myself drawn to it to update my food and exercise. I don‚Äôt necessarily trust the macronutrients and calories that accompany a lot of their search results for the foods and drinks so I always double check those, but beyond that the app is great. Would love for them to audit their search results though to weed out the foods that are incorrect. As long as you are paying attention you can still track everything accurately, I just wish I didn‚Äôt have to double check anything new I try to add.

title: Almost perfect!
body: I love this app, it makes eating healthy SO much easier and it‚Äôs super cheap to have a premium subscription (if you can afford $3 a month!), the only suggestion I have is that it would be super cool if during your evaluation you could add in certain things like ‚ÄúI need extra calcium‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm allergic to nuts‚Äù just simple stuff like that. Having foods tailored just a little more specifically to what the individual needs would make this app absolutely perfect in my opinion. Lots of the foods I choose to eat have higher sodium because I have a sodium deficiency and as silly as it is, it makes me sad when the food rating smiley face looks disappointed in me for eating high sodium lol.

title: Fantastic!
body: I‚Äôm on a muscle bulk diet after dropping weight. I have a general diet planned out, but also enjoy snacking. I use my planned diet as my template, but this app is fantastic in that I can always track and keep notes about what I eat throughout the day. It makes it to where I can just glance rather than question what I‚Äôve eaten. It‚Äôs also nice because you can even make your own meals to use (I made a chipotle bowl on my cheat day). I compared nutrition next to the official Chipotle website and it was spot on! Using this with my Apple Watch in order to keep track of my net calories! So no more guilt or questioning. This is what I‚Äôve needed!

title: Great app!!
body: I really like this app. I‚Äôve used a couple apps similar in the past, but this one is beautiful and I‚Äôm enjoying the premium features. The only things I am hoping are added are the ability to customize the water logging AND being able to log calories with the option to add the nutritional information. I eat a few meals that I have the nutritional information for, but I have to log the calories instead. I feel a feature like this would not only help with the meal rating, but also save users some time as their only other option is to manually log (and maybe even guess) every ingredient. Thanks for all the work!

title: Pretty Good
body: I like this interface way better than MyFitnessPal and I like that you can see calories, macros, and water intake. I also love that each meal has suggested amount of calories and the smiley face rating system.

title: Disappointed
body: I bought this app because it boasted about having over 200 recipes and its many diet choices. I got the 1 year subscription and hoped it would work for me. So far it hasn‚Äôt. I am trying to go keto to lose some weight and I am also vegetarian (not vegan, so not that restrictive) and when I looked for recipes to fit the bill they only had maybe 10 available.
