Granted I can look up recipes but I was hoping for more ease with this app. They also don‚Äôt have a plan ahead feature which means if I want to plan a meal in advance I have to go through and add it to my daily count and try to delete it after. I disappointed to say the least, never have I felt compelled to leave a review but this app is a waste of money. Do NOT buy the subscription, you won‚Äôt get a refund if you don‚Äôt like the app and then you‚Äôll be out $40.

title: Inaccurate, and therefore useless
body: There‚Äôs a lot that I like about this app, including the feel of the design and the aesthetics. Unfortunately, the calories gained/burned associated with different foods and activities are so wildly absurd that the app is unusable. No, I did not burn 1000 calories at my water aerobics class. If that were the case, all of the little old ladies there would be going into hypoglycemic shock. No, I did not burn 800 calories walking around the grocery store. No, I did not burn 160 calories from going on the elliptical for 10 minutes. The app also suffers from a mediocre and inaccurate food library, seemingly comprised mostly of user-inputted data. I wanted to like this app because it‚Äôs prettier than some others that I‚Äôve used in the past, but it just doesn‚Äôt function.

title: really nice app
body: I love this app honestly, it‚Äôs set up nice, I had my fitness pal before but ended up forgetting about it and never tracked my food or anything. I‚Äôve had this app for about a month now and have kept up with my tracking the whole time! there‚Äôs only one thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars, more types of exercises need to be added. it has the basic kind but I‚Äôd like them to be more specific. but otherwise it‚Äôs a really fun tracking app, I‚Äôve lost 7 pounds in the month since I‚Äôve had it, I‚Äôm sure it could‚Äôve helped me lose more but I‚Äôm taking the whole healthy eating thing a little slow so I don‚Äôt drive myself crazyüòÑ

title: Good but needs some work
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for awhile now and it‚Äôs got some really nice features! Beautiful layout and way of showing progress. However I do have a big problem with the ‚Äúpremium‚Äù content that you have to pay for.  Without paying for the premium, this app is just meh. It seems like every time there‚Äôs something that could potentially further help you, you have to pay premium for it. You see that they offer specific diet plans and all this great stuff but that‚Äôs only if you pay premium for it. If you aren‚Äôt willing to pay the price, then this app is basically just a calorie and exercise recorder. That‚Äôs my one issue with this app. If more things were available to those not paying, then I would‚Äôve enjoyed this app more.

title: More plans
body: Very nice app, but I‚Äôd love to see more meal plans that are built for more variety of goals. For example, I have a metabolic rate that‚Äôs faster than normal and I struggle to keep weight. This means, when I go over the amount of calories, and the amount of carbs and fats, it‚Äôs actually considered good rather than bad; (but going over the amount of protein remains not recommended) It would be nice to see a plan that would have these things in mind. Another feature that would be nice to see in the future is nutritional values like vitamins and such that you can keep track of from the foods you eat.

title: Incredibly easy and effective
body: I‚Äôm a 29 year old female. I started logging with Lifesum on January 8. It‚Äôs February 20, just less than two months later, and this morning marked the 19th pound I‚Äôve lost. Seriously - JUST LOGGING. I scheduled my ideal weight (140) and put my current (169) and set it to classic dieting which sounds limiting but is just being aware of your calories. When I reach the calories for the meal, I stop. It‚Äôs almost over-simple. I can‚Äôt believe I‚Äôm losing weight like this, and I haven‚Äôt worked out even once so imagine what would happen if I did. Lifesum is my favorite tool for counting calories and weight loss!

title: I love it! except for ...
body: I wish they had more options for meal plans with allergies. if they did i‚Äôd give 5 stars. they do have a recipe section and you can look for nut free things, but I wish they‚Äôd update it so that if you have soy allergies and choose vegan for a week, it can help you around that. Or people on keto who are vegetarian, etc. Other than that this app is INCREDIBLE! the accuracy is great unlike some other apps i‚Äôve used in the past. So much so I bought the premium version. Helps me track my water intake, my carb intake, all my food, my exercise and the meal plans (if you don‚Äôt need really special diets) are great! It‚Äôs definitely worth the money to upgrade to premium.

title: Currently broken
body: As others have mentioned, used to be probably the easiest and most pleasing nutrition tracker to use. However a couple of critical bugs have plagued it for a couple of weeks now... I work in dev and I understand that critical bugs especially can take time, however there seems to be some radio silence on the newer, more serious bug introduced by last weekend's patch (which was itself supposed to fix a critical bug).

title: Love it!
body: I love using this app to help me track macros. I really like that you can pick between certain ‚Äúdiets‚Äù and it adjusts your daily needs accordingly! It has a water tracker too for those trying to stay more hydrated! There are 2 things I wish they included:

title: Great app unlike its kind
body: I have only been using this app for about a week, but I don‚Äôt imagine anything changing. I paid for the 3 months premium subscription and got a discount for signing up for my first time. I‚Äôve been having A difficult time enjoying certain meals on keto, and this app is perfect at telling me what I need to eat and giving me plans and being able to track them for a day. I would highly recommend this, even if it‚Äôs just for a few short months to get you on track for the day that you want. I‚Äôm hoping to lose more weight with this in the upcoming weeks

title: Good, but can‚Äôt add own recipes
body: This is geared toward packaged products and restaurants. If you‚Äôre geared toward that, this app seems fine. Yet if you cook, there‚Äôs no means (certainly not an intuitive one) for putting your own recipes into the app. So if you make, for example, egg roll bowls (essentially the innards of an egg roll, but as a stir fry/salad without the shell), you have no practical means of just entering ‚Äú4 oz golf egg roll bowl‚Äù based on a pre-entered recipe with its nutritional info. That makes the product useless as a food diary unless you totally rely on the lazy forms of food a good diet plan should encourage you to avoid. Disappointing. Will reconsider if you can explain (and make way more visible) a way for entering your own recipes. And if that‚Äôs a premium feature, it‚Äôs not obvious...it just says access to more of yours.

title: Terrible app
body: This app is so frustrating to even try to use. I can‚Äôt believe I purchased the premium version based on other reviews, only to find out that it is so bad. The premium version has very limited functionality, and trying to enter real food is a battle that just isn‚Äôt worth fighting. It seems to think that all food comes from restaurants instead of my own kitchen. Too bad if you didn‚Äôt have a side of potatoes with that omelette. The app just decided that you did and you‚Äôre stuck with a food journal that isn‚Äôt representative of the actual food that you actually ate. And just try adjusting your macros to something you would want to track. The app pigeon holes you into one of a few predetermined meal plans and expects you to stick to that.  I am deleting the app even though I paid $30 for it.

title: I've loved everything about this app so far, EXCEPT...
body: I've been using this app for several weeks now and I love it. I use the barcode scanner to enter in tons of foods and I've also linked my Fitbit to keep track of my exercise. The only thing I can't STAND about this app is that there is no setting for net carbs on the meal/eating plans. On a low carb/keto diet, fiber is subtracted from total carbs to give you an idea of the number of grams of carbohydrate that are actually impacting your blood glucose levels (net carbs). Without net carbs, it shows that my daily carb intake is WAY over what it should be when almost half of that is fiber. Please fix this and the app will be perfect!!

title: Disappointing and Subpar
body: I really wanted to like this app and even got a trial of the paid version. I liked the idea of the recipes and health scale. Quite frankly, it‚Äôs underwhelming and seems like it wants to be more like MyFitnessPal or Fitbit. However, its scanning function hardly works, and a lot of the information it does have is wrong or incomplete. It also does not track vitamins and minerals, which are really important, especially if you‚Äôre dieting. You also have limited control over what information you can input for a meal or recipe. I will say that I like the faces next to individual food items, but again, this is only effective if the information attached to the food item is correct. This app has a long way to go before it can be real competition for some of the other diet and nutrition apps out there.

title: Crashes constantly
body: I decided to try Lifesum after several fitness vloggers did sponsored videos about the app. The only draw of it over my fitness pal is the aesthetics. I used it daily for months and it drove me insane that it constantly crashed. I should mention that I currently have an iPhone 8 so it‚Äôs not an issue with an old phone. I don‚Äôt mean once and then it would work if you opened it again. There are just periods where it doesn‚Äôt work at all and you can open it 20 ones in a row and it will just continue to instantly close. It is insanely frustrating. Once you‚Äôve got some of your favorite foods in the history, it‚Äôs annoying to switch to another app. So my advice is not to invest in it at all. Go with my fitness pal. Lifesum is cute but gimmicky.

title: Prettiest Calorie Tracker But Limited
body: This is by far the best looking calorie tracker I have used on iOS, but also one of the most limited.  It has the most limited food library of the calorie counters I have used.  But where it really falls down is in its customization.  It doesn‚Äôt allow for custom snacks or meal types only 4 meals and doesn‚Äôt allow input of time for meals.  Doesn‚Äôt allow input of supplements.  Doesn‚Äôt allow custom food entries.  It should also be noted there aren‚Äôt complications for all Apple Watch faces, if you have a favorite face make sure there is a complication for it.  In short this is an app for someone looking for the most basic of calorie trackers in a pretty package, but if you are serious about tracking anything more then your macros look else where.

title: Subscription /premium
body: I would love to have this be my primary app for food logging, because it‚Äôs very friendly and adorable. However, it seems I need to pay for a subscription to do absolutely anything.

title: Almost Perfect!
body: Lifesum is so easy to use and helps me feel so much control over my health! I love not only being able to track but getting insight into what I could improve about each choice. The ONLY thing I would change is that there needs to be a desktop experience to allow users to more easily enter recipes and meals... this can be so tedious on a phone screen. If not a desktop functionality, the app should at least be able to flip to landscape orientation that way iPad users could use a keyboard for the same purpose! So MyFitnessPal wins in that category. But overall, it‚Äôs the best nutrition tracking app I‚Äôve used!

title: Sublime
body: So helpful, so easy.  But, the weight check in.

title: Not bad
body: I‚Äôm new to Lifesum and just getting acquainted. Generally pretty easy on the eyes and tracking food/water/etc is pretty intuitive. Login with Apple gets a big thumbs up from me. Not sure about the canned eating plans - I‚Äôm not into ‚Äòdiets‚Äô, just want to track overall calories, maybe macro and fat/carb/protein balance so I started the ‚Äòclassic‚Äô plan. At the end of the day the app yells at me for not eating enough, even though my body says I‚Äôve had enough. Thought the vegetable tracker would understand that a salad counts as a vegetable and clock it accordingly - guess not. Must be a manual thing. I probably just need to use it for a while longer to get comfortable.

title: Exactly what I needed
body: This app is fantastic! I use it all the time and I have no complaints. I have only ever used the free version and it works wonderfully. I used this app and set my goal and, after a few short months and regular exercise, I lost twenty-three pounds. The only problem is that once I got the update, couldn't open the app. Still can't, actually. Other than that, the app is beautiful and very well programmed. I still can't believe how well it worked. I feel great and energized, and I really appreciate clean, healthy food. get the app, you will not regret it by a long shot!

title: Works Well But Very Basic Unless You Pay
body: I like the way the app works, and it syncs very well with Apple Watch and Apple Health. It‚Äôs very visually appealing and fairly easy to use. BUT it can be annoying to track your food by hand since you can only use the camera feature if you pay Premium, and you can‚Äôt switch plans unless you pay for Premium. Not that I want everything for free, but as an app that is advertised as free, you are VERY limited on what you can actually get for free. Not being able to change plans really bothers me, because as everyone knows, every individual is different and has different nutritional needs, which LifeSum will only support if you pay for it.

title: Love it!!
body: I don‚Äôt normally write reviews but I thought this app deserved one! I‚Äôve been trying calorie counting/fitness apps for years and Lifesum does a fantastic job and I can safely say I won‚Äôt be trying another app soon. It‚Äôs appealing to the eyes, helpful for macro counting and offers meal plans that look and taste delish! I recently just noticed that it rates the food you log and tells you which ones are good for you and which ones are bad. This app has made me enjoy tracking my food, exercise, weight, and water intake. I highly recommend this app!! Can‚Äôt wait to try the pro version soon!

title: Five stars well deserved.
body: I have nothing but good thing to say. I didn‚Äôt have a lot of weight to lose so this app helped me get back to my goal weight pretty quickly. I was so happy with it, I purchased the full version. I now use the 5:2 plan to maintain.

title: Wanted to love it
body: Love the UI, color scheme, and intiuitivity of the app but there just isn't a big food library available yet and I often find the nutritional information to be very inacurrate so it's back to basic my fitness pal for this girl.

title: I was expecting more
body: When I downloaded the app, I immediately took the quiz on what diet to follow. After completing this quiz was directed to subscribe, which I did. I thought for what I paid I was getting a meal plan to follow, but instead got recipes that I have to search for and try and figure out my meal plan. And if I find recipes, I don‚Äôt have an option to create a shopping list, which would make this even more convenient. Considering one of the questions in the quiz asked why I don‚Äôt eat better, with an answer of because of time, this app doesn‚Äôt help with that.  It takes me more time to plan everything out and make a shopping list. Waste of money. I wish I had put it elsewhere on an app that actually did what it says it will do.

title: Good Diary but....
body: I‚Äôve been using it for a couple days and it seems to have a great food diary and is very user friendly but I can‚Äôt seem to get my Apple Watch to get to log my water like the devs say is possible. I tried swiping up on the middle screen to log it and couldn‚Äôt. So then I tried to use Siri to do it ant it said to check in the app. I made sure to have everything on and correct but it didn‚Äôt work. I would like to be able to easily just log my food and water from the watch, it would help out so much seeing as I‚Äôm not supposed to have my phone out at work and that‚Äôs the main time I‚Äôm drinking my water.

title: Love the interface but would love more customization
body: I bought the premium version of this app because I thought it was so cute and I really wanted something that could show my macros at a glance both in grams and percentage of my daily calorie intake. However it‚Äôs really annoying that you cannot set your calorie intake yourself AND if you exercise it increases your calorie limit for the day. I‚Äôd like to see functionality where I could set my daily calories, and macros, perhaps with a slider and have more control over this than the presets provided by the different ‚Äúplans‚Äù on the app.

title: Easy to use but poor weight tracker
body: The database for food is extensive and the option to scan bar codes is really convenient but it doesn‚Äôt work all of the time. Logging food is extremely easy.

title: Great app and has helped so much but..
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for 2 months so far and have already lost 15 pounds. It has become part of my lifestyle. The only thing that I wish would be improved would be for there to be more exercises for me to look up and log. I have been adding the approximate amount of calories burned for each exercise that I do, but it would help a lot if more exercises were added to the database. A thing that I find odd is that things like ‚Äúcleaning the house‚Äù and ‚Äúplaying drums‚Äù are exercises in the database while things like battle rope and vertical pull-ups aren‚Äôt. Love the app but this is my only advice.

title: Easy and Fun!!!
body: I‚Äôve had SEVERAL ‚Äúweight loss‚Äù apps and this one so far is my favorite‚Äî mainly because the free options are better than most and i don‚Äôt feel much pressure to download and pay $25 for the premium version. It gives me the option to log my water which is great because I really try to drink a gallon of water per day so it‚Äôs easy to log. The meal logging options are easy and he little apple animations are super cute! I gave it 5 stars because you can use almost every feature for free which is not the case for most apps like this. Highly recommend!

title: Great tracker, ok plans
body: The meal tracker features are really sharp and the amount of food in their database is really top notch. It‚Äôs not hard at all to find the food you‚Äôre looking for. Although some entries are not correct it‚Äôs pretty easy to recognize that someone had made a mistake creating that food item, and you could usually go find another one easily.

title: Not the best option
body: Switched to Lifesum from MyFitnessPal just to try something different. Aesthetics is pretty much all this app has going for it. The emojis that judge your meal choices are cool, but when the food info isn‚Äôt correct, they‚Äôre not much help. The search database is completely off calorie-wise and most things are misspelled (even cell phones have spell check now..), so if you don‚Äôt have a barcode on what you‚Äôre eating, you‚Äôre screwed. I found myself Googling how many calories were actually in foods - most of the time, MyFitnessPal was the first search result - and adding it manually. When you add manually, you can only input calories, no other nutrition info. Also, with MyFitnessPal, you get recipes/articles without upgrading to premium.

title: Love this APP Lifesum
body: This is by far the best tracking system I‚Äôve found to help support weight loss or to just track food.  I personally use for weight loss.  Love how I can upload pictures of the food I eat per meal.  Love the smile icon/emojis!  Great recipes!  Love the charting information too!

title: Absolutely Amazing
body: This is the first time I have EVER written a review on an app, but I just couldn‚Äôt help myself this app is amazing! The design is beautiful and it‚Äôs so simple and easy to use. Wow that sounded like something a robot would say but for real, it‚Äôs so fun and I actually really like tracking my food intake and exercise thanks to this app. I don‚Äôt even know how there is a free version because there are so many things on this app! It even has a barcode scanner! Overall I definitely recommend downloading this app whether you trying to lose weight, gain weight, or just be healthier!

title: Great App With Caveats
body: The app is beautiful and great, but the meal planning and the recipes are very limited. There‚Äôs a huge library of recipes, but they all show as ‚Äú4 Servings‚Äù with no way to change it. The meal plans don‚Äôt last more than 3 weeks, which definitely isn‚Äôt enough time to meet most people‚Äôs weight loss goals. The water tracker doesn‚Äôt let you customize the size of a bottle or glass, and the notifications don‚Äôt work at all (they're enabled in the app settings and the iOS settings). It would be great to pick recipes from the app and turn them into a shopping list, or even the ability to import recipes from the web (via the share buttons in browsers), and have the ingredients auto-import into a meal plan with a shopping list.

title: Nice layout, solid data presentation but buggy
body: I like Lifesum because it is a fresh look on nutritional data that makes it easier to manage how much I eat for each meal. The meal plans are thought and valuable. The photo the food works surprisingly well too. However the app is buggy, crashes a good portion of my uses and sometimes the data gets munged but quickly fixed with a restart of the app. It probably deserves 2 stars, but I am hopeful the quality will improve, features will be added and the food database is cleaned up. I‚Äôm not sure I would spend the 40-50$/annual subscription. The $20 I spent on the ‚Äúpleas come back‚Äù offer was a fair price for quality right now.

title: It's a great idea, but...
body: It's a great idea for an app, but it needs to function better.

title: Really poor experience adding nutritional info
body: Great UI, lots of very helpful features but users are limited by the extent of Lifesum‚Äôs database and the company‚Äôs ability to update it. If users can‚Äôt use the barcode scanner, they can only enter calories without macros. It defeats the purpose of having any plan that tracks those, and makes the premium account kind of useless UNLESS you‚Äôre eating foods that are already in the database. Combing through customer discussion boards, this has been a requested feature since 2016. Clearly this customer concern hasn‚Äôt risen to the degree of import necessary to compel a design or architectural change at Lifesum in four years. Something is rotten in the state of Denmark, and I‚Äôm not staying to find out what. Keep my money, I‚Äôm out.

title: Annoying and limiting
body: Is there not a way to add your own food? If I‚Äôve purchased something made by a keto bakery and have the macros, why can‚Äôt I add this food? The only self add I see is the simple calorie add. I was forced to purchase the app in order to use the keto strict plan, and now it‚Äôs limiting me in how I can use it. Also, i don‚Äôt always have a barcode for my food. Some eggs are naked in a bowl and have no carbs. But when I take a photo, they show up as .9 carbs. This is a big deal when you can only have 20 carbs a day. Another annoying thing: I don‚Äôt have time to enter an entire recipe for food or meal and allow the app to determine the macros. I have a good idea based on what I can read for myself. Why can‚Äôt I just input it myself when need be? It‚Äôs very limiting and frustrating to be this expensive.

title: Love, but keeps crashing
body: I am really loving this app because it provides great information on what I‚Äôm eating beyond calories. I‚Äôve been struggling with losing my last 10 lbs and although I eat healthy this app makes me pay more attention to the full picture tracking calories, fat, carbs & protein (plus some) for a more balanced meal/day. The only issue I‚Äôm having is that it crashes at least 5 times a day. I have also noticed that it takes a bit for my iPad to catch up with what I log on my phone - but that is minor compared to the crashing. Hope this is fixed soon & I‚Äôll come back with 5 stars!

title: Renewed subscription but didn't receive premium features
body: I did enjoy using this app when I started out eating healthier, I even bought premium a few months ago. My subscription ended and I didn't feel the need to buy it again but as soon as I linked my card to my Apple ID in order to renew my Apple Music, the Lifesum app decided to renew my subscription & charge me for 3 months of premium as well. I didn't ask for this subscription but when I realized the payment was made and went to check on the app none of the premium features were there and the app was still insisting that I buy it. So essentially I was unintentionally paying for an app that wasn't even offering me the perks. Pretty annoyed and won't be using it anymore.

title: Befriend your hunger?! Absolutely not.
body: Took the test to see which meal plan I should follow and my ‚Äúnutritional advisor‚Äù, Lykke, told me ‚ÄúWhen you befriend your hunger, you can lose weight without actually changing your lifestyle‚Äù. My recommended meal plan was to eat what I want 5 days a week, and fast 2 days a week. Are you KIDDING ME?!?!? Please someone else agree with me that this is unhealthy both physically and mentally. I mean really??? A NUTRITIONAL ADVISOR is helping me meal plan by telling me NOT TO EAT FOR TWO DAYS. Outrageous. This type of ‚Äúmeal plan‚Äù is what encourages eating disorders. I pray this portion of the app can be removed in order to spare others from the damage it may potentially cause. I understand in limited circumstances the reason for a fast, but encouraging ongoing multi-day fasts is damaging in more ways than one. Thanks, but I will never ‚Äúbefriend my hunger‚Äù.

title: Getting further and further from useful
body: I‚Äôve had this app for a long long time now, I use it from time to time to re-evaluate where I‚Äôm at with how I currently eat. It‚Äôs nice to look at and functional, however with each update more and more functions disappear and can only be used if you ‚Äúgo premium,‚Äù the latest being adjusting macronutrients. I have recommended this app to so many people but I‚Äôll have to stop if you can‚Äôt even adjust your macros to your lifestyle. Looks like they‚Äôre getting rid of workout tracking too which is sad. Please bring those 2 things back to all users. I‚Äôm not going to commit to a ‚Äúdiet‚Äù and track everything I eat for months, let alone a full year which is the cheapest per month.

title: Super simple and intuitive
body: This is a super simple and intuitive app, and with really nice design. Has a modern user interface. Tried my fitness pal but found this much more  pleasant to use. One advantage of my fitness pal is that they have more products added by other users. Fx here in Iceland I was able to find allot of local food brands. One drawback with that though is that the nutritional information might not be as accurate. It really came as a surprise to me how easy it is now to track your calorie √≠ take using apps like these. Highly recommend this app!

title: Calories complete off
body: I do love the design of the app and all of the behavioral nudges that it provides. However, it is useless to me if it cannot get my calories right. It gets the workout calories right but the step calories are completely off - first of all, they double count between steps and workouts (when I go for a run, the app adds calories for the workout and then for all of the steps); second, the amount of calories per step is huuuuge. When I compare the active calories with active calories within Apple Health, the Lifesum ones are much higher, despite Lifesum loading the info from Apple Health. I so want to use the app but if this does not get fixed, there is no way I will keep paying for premium subscription.

title: Love!
body: Still love this app but I do wish one thing. I wish there was a place to save your own recipes and be able to add them to your food journal that day. Example, I make my own Peanut butter and oatmeal balls. I know the cals and everything to these but I can‚Äôt find a pb ball that‚Äôs close to it when I look it up so I would have to type in ever ingredient separately in my journal. If there was place to do that then save that as a recipe that could then be chosen as a meal, would be amazing. Other than this it‚Äôs a great app. And even if you don‚Äôt pay the free portion is extremely useful.

title: Weight loss
body: My husband and I decided to focus on health and lose some weight as well. We started with your app the end of Nov. using the 5:2 plan. We knew we didn‚Äôt want a diet or eating plan we wouldn‚Äôt stick with. So we picked 5:2 for it‚Äôs flexibility.

title: Feature recommendation for Recipes
body: Love this app so much! It‚Äôs helped me so much on my weight loss journey. One feature I wish the app could include is the ability to customize recipes. Sometimes I don‚Äôt have all the ingredients for a recipe, or maybe I would rather not eat a certain ingredient like bacon, I would still want to be able to track the accurate food items I‚Äôve eaten in my meal. There should be an option to check off optional ingredients and calculate the updated calories and nutrient intake. I think that would make life so much easier on the app!!

title: No freshman 15!
body: Seriously, get this app. I would pay premium if I wasn't a college student (and I don't pay premium for anything!).

title: Important functionality, but marred with bugs
body: I generally like Lifesum. The aesthetic is nice, there‚Äôs a lot of food in the database, and most importantly it adds back calories to your day from the Apple Health app into your calorie total.

title: Last update made it horrible
body: I will give 4 stars, because so far I havent had any problem. BUT the last update is horrid. The search mechanism is busted. You removed the brand name from the search which is pretty important. When someone tries to search something there is no longer the tab ‚Äúrecent‚Äù and ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù. I lost 2 days from my diary, I have to scroll past all my favorite items to get to my meals. Really I dont know who thought that would be good, but UX is falling behind. It literally adds tons of unnecessary steps to reach the same goal as before. I would call it downgrade and not an upgrade.

title: Needs improvement
body: Love the app, but it‚Äôs glitchy, sometimes runs a day behind somedays it‚Äôs on schedule.  Shopping list gets a little screwy and will add items not even on your list, units of measure on the list takes a little getting used too but well worth it.   Would love to see the ability of generating the list for two instead of an individual.  Also am I doing something wrong?? Doing the 3 week meal plan and when I check off the food it‚Äôs not adding it to my calorie counter.  Premium membership worth it, meals and quick and easy... I love this app so far minus the glitches I seem to be having

title: Not sure what I paid for
body: Upgraded to premium with the promise of meal planning and specialized diets. What the cost actually unlocked was a few specialized diets that largely were all comprised of the exact same meals. In addition the meal planning feature had a small handful of meals available with no real flexibility. For example - you can‚Äôt even block a day out. I downloaded today with the intention of shopping and starting at the end of the work week and yet I was required to have a meal selected and added to the shopping list for days I didn‚Äôt need. I also couldn‚Äôt rotate in other meal options - even ones found within the app.

title: WONT LET YOU UNSUBSCRIBE
body: WHAT A NIGHTMARE!!!! I didn‚Äôt mean to sign up for a year. And when I followed the app‚Äôs link to unsubscribe, the developer only gives you the options to renew various packages. No way to unsubscribe or cancel!!! They also automatically auto renew at the end of user package you subscribe. So if you sign up for a month or a year, at the end of that period you will be automatically renewed and charged again. I tried to cancel through Apple but as this is a 3rd party developer, Apple doesn‚Äôt have the ability to do anything. And when I went to the Lifesum website and emailed customer support, I received an automated email about 3 days later informing me to follow the unsubscribe link through the app!!!! So basically the developer has locked you into a subscription with no way of canceling.

title: Perfect
body: I love this app. I have lost 25# following the 5:2 plan. It‚Äôs easy to make recipes follow a plan and track my macros I love that it links with apple health and my work app. It‚Äôs perfect there hasn‚Äôt been anything I‚Äôve wanted to do that I can‚Äôt with this app. I also tell everyone I know about it only thing I hate is I can not change the calories in my meal plan so I just have to remember to subtract like a 100 calories a day. I just wish that feature actually worked. It‚Äôs there but when I change it it just changes right back. Other than that perfect

title: Amazing app!
body: I'm impressed! This app is so good! I started taking care of my nutrition a couple years ago, and this app that I found a month ago has been a really helpful tool when tracking my meals and calories. I strongly recommend it! Reason I give it 4 stars is that it doesn't have monthly plans. I know many apps manage yearly subscriptions but that's something I don't like. I prefer to pay a month and if I like it I keep it. This one has a 3-month but the price ends up being too high and close to a yearly payment. It's good even for its free features, but if it had a month by month I would pay for it.

title: Great, but difficult to figure out
body: I have honestly have never had this much issue figuring out an app before. The premise is great, the calorie counter/home page is super useful, but I cannot for the life of me figure out how to use the plans and the calorie count at the same time. Maybe I‚Äôm just missing a major step, but tracking food from the plan doesn‚Äôt automatically add it to the calorie counter so I‚Äôm spending way too much time importing nutritional info-which is exactly why I paid for the premium, thinking I could just use their meal plans.... no such luck. If I knew I was going to have to do this much research into how to use it, I never would have paid for it.

title: Change the way you charge people!!
body: I enjoyed this app for years. It‚Äôs easy to use and personalize. I like it a lot more then fitness pal. However!, I used to be able to use so many of the features. Now if you even want to set your own Macros its premium. If you still want to make money, charge for the app and make the subscription only for the plans. That way if someone isn‚Äôt interested in the plans they still pay and if someone is they pay a subscription. This has been frustrating me so much because I don‚Äôt want to pay monthly for the regular tracking options. I can‚Äôt even change my macros for god sake. You may as well get My Fitness Pro at this point, a lot of the things locked here are free there.

title: Indispensable‚Ä¶ If you're serious
body: Incredible application! This app has become an indispensable part of my daily life. Once I decide to get serious about my health, Fitness and eating habits, I started looking for hey simple to use comprehensive means of tracking and I found it in Lifesum. With little effort, The application provides detailed information, feedback, Coaching, Insights into daily eating habits. Oh hell, it provides everything important to nutrition to help anybody achieve their nutrition and health goals. I would highly recommend this app to anyone serious or just curious about what they eat

title: Needs better nutritional data
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for about 2 months now and have a couple issues.

title: Nutrition settings lacking
body: I really enjoy the layout and concept of this app and subscribed for a premium membership, but I realized too late that the nutrition settings are lacking.

title: So Engaging and Easy to Use
body: This app is nicely made. I‚Äôve used many nutrition tracking apps, and this one is most engaging by far. There‚Äôs great little touches like the grocery store beep when you scan an item, cute icons and characters. I love that it syncs with my health data to auto update my calorie allowance after exercise. I do wish there was more flexibility in setting days for 5:2 diets, since schedules can change from week to week. It would also be helpful to have an easy recipe builder for counting calories in home meals. But overall, I‚Äôm very happy with it!

title: SO DISAPPOINTED!
body: I paid premium for 1 year and regret it. So much of the information is inaccurate. The measurement and the nutritional data IS NOT ACCURATE. Even using the barcode scanner provides incorrect information. Very frustrating. I end up calculating everything myself and then trying to find a correct entry that is close which is a waste of time. Because of these issues I stopped using the app for the last few months and decided to try again, hoping it might have been corrected and updated. But it has not been fixed. I really do not understand how this app has high ratings. If you check the accuracy of the information you will see how ‚Äúoff‚Äù it is. Very Disappointed. Do not waste your money on this app. Verify for yourself using the free version. üôÅ

title: If only it linked to my Apple Watch
body: I love this app and the customer service team is great. The ONLY two downsides are that it doesn‚Äôt really sync to my Apple Watch and it clears the search after you add an item to your diary. On my watch it doesn‚Äôt show the correct macro breakdowns for the plan I‚Äôve chosen, adds in exercise calories even though they are not added in my diary, and the complication doesn‚Äôt update on my watch face. When I search for a restaurant and want to select multiple items I can‚Äôt and have to search after each selection. Kinda time consuming and frustrating.

title: Poor Customer Service
body: I had bought the premium of this app (was not offered a trial) so I could track my specific macros, given to me by a nutritionist. Once purchased, the app was nothing like I expected (I could not input my macros as they are over the ‚Äú100%‚Äù limit) - therefore I wanted to cancel. I have tried multiple times to reach customer service to see if they could help me in anyway, and I have yet to hear back.

title: Good app but some bugs
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for about 2 weeks. I really like how everything on the app is set up, and I‚Äôve been able to keep myself in check more than I would have if I were tracking my calories, water intake, and exercise on my own. However, today I‚Äôve been trying to input my lunch and it is not registering no matter what I do. I closed the app, restarted my phone, and tried inputting only my calories and not by food type, and still it simply will not allow me to put in my calories. I like this app but if I can‚Äôt continue to put in my data, what‚Äôs the point?

title: Bad Meal plans
body: So first off, I love the recipes-they are delicious! And most of them are super easy. The app itself has been a little frustrating to figure out. I don‚Äôt think you can create your own recipes. I‚Äôm doing the keto burn plan and likes the idea of not having to think about the food or plan it out. However, I‚Äôm only allowed 20 carbs a day and I just ate the breakfast on the plan without looking at the nutritional info, and it was 16.5 carbs. Looking at the rest of the day, my carbs are WAY over the limit, which will put me out of ketosis. So I‚Äôm either going to have to go hungry or get knocked out. The whole point of paying for this was so I didn‚Äôt have to figure out my amounts. I ASSUMED that the recipes they used would be within my range.

title: Great Minus The Glitches
body: Overall, this app is great. I enjoy the interface & recipe suggestions. However, there are a few glitches I‚Äôve experienced. Sometimes the app will close when I‚Äôm trying to open it. Another glitch is when the food I‚Äôve tracked disappears but then it comes back after a while. My last complaint is that I‚Äôm very underweight, so underweight that the app won‚Äôt let me enter my weight. It keeps saying ‚ÄúAre you sure that‚Äôs what you meant? Try a different number.‚Äù This was discouraging to me as I am trying to gain weight and this makes me feel more upset about my current weight.

title: Good but it could be better.
body: Overall I like the app, very easy to navigate and get used to it. It has a variety of colors that makes it very attractive for the user and a large selection of products. It's an eye attractive and user-friendly app.

title: Recipes should be modifiable
body: I am enjoying this app and the meal plans, but the recipes and meal plans could be way better. I am currently doing the keto plan and a lot of the meals have salmon, or random ingredients like halloumi or bresaola. I tried to find those last two in multiple grocery stores, but haven‚Äôt been able to. These ingredients and some others are also too expensive to eat very often. I‚Äôd prefer if I could easily swap the ingredients (like there were substitutes I could edit the recipes with rather than having to enter an entire meal into the tracker just because I changed one ingredient), or the recipes used more accessible and affordable ingredients.

title: Visual beautiful, but bad choice in recipes
body: I was excited about ease of use. Once I was using it I found the following issues:

title: Love it!
body: I love the smiley face or frown face icon beside each food item I scan in, and the one beside my meal overall...it helps me to know which food items to choose again and which ones to avoid in the future. Plus, the app creates a graph of my weight gain or loss to show me visually how much progress I've made over time. Love that! Helped me get past a plateau. I've never bothered to rate an app before, but I love this one enough to actually take the time to share my opinion... five stars... totally recommend! I hope you get it and use it, because it works!

title: Has Potential (Free Version is Very Limited)
body: Clean look, fairly intuitive to use. Unpaid option, however, is pretty limited. I like the thought of having recipes tailed to my diet but this is a paid feature, as is connecting your other fitness apps, like Fitbit, and personalized recommendations. So the free version is basically a food/calorie tracker.

title: Too many synch issues
body: I really really want to like this app. I love the interface, how it gives the different diet plan options and breaks it down in an easy way to show if you are following ( the smiley faces really have made it simple!) What I don‚Äôt like is that every few days the app does not read my activity from my watch or lately load the information into my Health app. I‚Äôve had to uninstall and reinstall the app to have it function every couple of days. For something that I am paying a $35 subscription for, the support team has yet to rectify these issues. It really devalues an app the has the potential to really make weight loss easy.

title: If you can‚Äôt upgrade...
body: I like tracking with this app better than fitness pal but I may have to switch back because I cannot customize my plan to fit me. I have goal macros but unless you pay to upgrade you can not set the number of calories you eat or your macros. I understand that the app needs to make money to improve but the ability to customize a plan for individual needs should not be something that doesn‚Äôt come standard. Also, I love that you can enter in a recipe and save it for the future but lately that feature has not been working properly.

title: Keeps crashing when accessing plans
body: I just started using the app and purchased the premium version, I was able to open ‚Äúplans‚Äù and picked my plan, the app suddenly crashed and it keeps crashing since every time I click on ‚Äúplans‚Äù, I tried restarting my phone and reinstalling the app but it still crashes. I am able to track food but noticed that some of the caloric data is drastically inaccurate.

title: Fitness minded
body: I do not purchase apps often but during my fitness goals I hit a plateau, so I found this app and decided to give it a try. This is one of the best applications I have ever used! The cost is very affordable, the app is very well designed and easy to use as well. I‚Äôd like to be able to create recipes and divide it into food portions plus save them like ‚ÄúRecipeIQ ‚Äú but for the most part I love the app, that‚Äôs a suggestion not complaint. I love the fact I can choose what type of diet I want to be on,  Intermittent fasting is what works for me. (5:2) how about you?

title: Impossible to unsubscribe
body: Lifesum is a great app for meal prep. The user interface is aesthetically pleasing, and easy to use.....

title: Helpful but recipes not always ‚Äúdiet approved‚Äù
body: I do like this app and find it helpful when following a specific diet plan. However I‚Äôve noticed that a lot of the recipes you can look through outside of the ones designated for your plan don‚Äôt actually follow the plan you chose. For example, the keto plan. It suggests you stay under 20 net carbs per day, which is fine! But then you go look at the ‚Äúketo recipes‚Äù and they have recipes that are 15 net carbs in one serving alone. It would also be helpful if you had a basic recipe nutrition calculator to put in your own recipes to make sure you stay on track. Otherwise an intuitive and easily used app

title: Lacks functionality if not choosing a plan
body: This is a pretty app, I give you that. I think if they added more features it would be great. But, for instance, even after purchasing Premium, I would not be able to plan my meals or use the shopping list premium unless I chose a Plan. Furthermore, you cannot copy or edit items you create. Those two things were very frustrating and I thought there were not going to be a problem. If you are looking to follow a plan or just track your food, it is a very good app. But if you want more functionality, specially when not following a Plan, do browse for other options.

title: Not as streamlined as it could
body: This app fails to eliminate redundant taps on the main path to calorie tracking.

title: Great for those who love a clean, simple interface
body: While not as robust as apps like Lose It and MyFitnessPal, Lifesum offers a different experience. They‚Äôve done a great job with simplifying the process of tracking your meals and workouts. The general workflow is quick, easy, and the emojis featured with each meal keep me engaged in providing updates and improving my overall health. When I eat well, I get a super smiley emoji to reflect that, and the positive reinforcement keeps me motivated. Contrarily, when I don‚Äôt eat well, a sad or angry-faced emoji appears, prompting me to do better.

title: It definitely helps
body: It‚Äôs just a new simple and effective tool for weight loss or maintenance. The app is easy to use and it encourages you to stay within your calorie limit and gives a good breakdown of the nutritional value of the foods you‚Äôre eating. I also like the ability to enter almost any exercise you‚Äôre doing and have those calories added to your daily allowance. The water reminders are also a definite aid for me. I‚Äôm never drinking as much as I should. I still don‚Äôt- but I don‚Äôt go a day anymore without several glasses of water.

title: Meal Plans are a Bust
body: I subscribed to Premium to access the meal plans. I‚Äôm on day 3 and am very frustrated with the recipes...the Carrot Soup with Garlic Creme Fraiche omits most of the instructions and I had to search through the Recipes tab to find something similar (but not exact). The measurements are in an odd combination of deciliter, cups, grams, and the occasional teaspoon or tablespoon, all in one recipe. The Turkey Spinach Omelette and Quinoa with Eggplant and Spinach are terrible recipes...they do not include anything in the way of spice or flavoring and are inedible as-is. Tracking plan meals is buggy - sometimes they do not show up in your calorie count and sometimes they do. The recipe for the Crispbread with Apple, Cream Cheese, and Walnuts tracks as 2298 calories and there is no way to fix the calorie count. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed...I do NOT recommend this app.

title: Not really useful?
body: The app is really good to keep you on track for the day. Without premium you can get an accurate measure of how many calories you should be eating and how many you do eat. It also keeps track of the amount of water you drink. The problem is if you can afford premium the app really doesn't do much for you. You cant get help with dieting, personalized insights, recipes, or any suggestions on what you should be eating. Without premium the most you get is a smiley or sad face that shows that you didn‚Äôt eat enough calories. I feel the free option should include mote features rather that almost being a journal of food.

title: Recommendation
body: Really enjoying the app, has really helped making sure I stay consistent with my calories and helped make me realize when I‚Äôm falling off.

title: Beautiful interface, but lacking features
body: I love the interface and was excited to have a new tool that would track a keto diet for me. However, it doesn't track properly due to not counting sugar alcohols. Also, I'm unable to import recipes or create my own recipes. Therefore, I have to guess how much of which ingredient I'm having in each serving. I also wish there was a desktop version as well for when I'm at work.

title: Mostly love it, but a few little things
body: I love what the app looks like!! It‚Äôs for a great design that makes me want to track my calories. And I like that it recommends how many calories I consume per meal.

title: Disappointed in the meal planning features
body: I purchased the premium version of this app for the weekly meal planning feature / grocery list. You don‚Äôt have the ability to 1. Create your own recipes 2. Create a grocery list. With this app you HAVE to pick from a very limited number of diets in order for it to generate a meal plan (I only had the option of 2 diets) and you can‚Äôt add anything in addition to what the app gives you. It seems kind of like a waste unless you only want to eat exactly what it gives you in there. The only thing I will say is that the layout / look of the app is nice & great if you want to track daily ingredients that you eat, but any features beyond that are lacking.

title: Not for me!
body: This is not a bad review but just my opinion. Like everyone who downloads the app (or any app) - you are asked to pay more to see more. I thought it was worth it and it was 15$. Instantly regretting my decision, I asked for a refund and was denied. The thing is I already paid for it and I tried using the special features but there‚Äôs nothing there that‚Äôs really accessible! All of the recipes call for expensive and unattainable (only available at whole foods) ingredients. I didn‚Äôt think it was helpful in suggesting where I needed to go and what I needed to do. The only reason I haven‚Äôt deleted this app is because I paid 15$ for it but I seriously never ever use it. Not for me but hope it works out for you!

title: Will not use
body: I purchased a 6 month membership to use the plans and was charged for the 6 months and when I went to start a plan they asked me to pay all over again. I contacted customer service and they told me the error was on my end and I hadn‚Äôt purchased a membership. I have a receipt from apple showing I paid and they still wouldn‚Äôt do anything I needed to purchase another membership. I told them I reached out to apple for a refund and they said they hoped apple would resolve the problem and that was it. Horrible customer service, wouldn‚Äôt admit there was a problem with the app and offered no guidance to resolve the problem but to spend more money without receiving the product. Hope they improve the app and their customer service.

title: Best food tracking app out there üëåüèº
body: I‚Äôve tested so many different ways to track my macros and nothing could make it as easy as this app. Lifesum checked off everything on the list. Recipe ideas, beautiful and seamless UX, great customer service when I emailed them to resolve an inquiry regarding activity tracking, and what‚Äôs best is that it‚Äôs lightweight and FUN. I even subscribed to premium because I loved the added functionality and insights but found that it‚Äôs super useful even before upgrading to premium. Would certainly recommend giving it a go!

title: Good but needs fixing
body: I really love the app and would give it five stars if creating your own recipe wasn‚Äôt so uncomfortable to find, and forget about editing the recipe once it‚Äôs in you can‚Äôt fix it or change it- at least I can‚Äôt, I go in and change what I did differently on a particular day and when I hit done it doesn‚Äôt go through and neither does the X so I have to close and relaunch the app. Also i wish the app gave me the flexibility of viewing my own recipes and foods without having to set it up like I‚Äôm about to add a meal.

title: Used to be better
body: I used to love love love Lifesum, until I had I update the app today. UI changes make it less easy to get at a glance info as I‚Äôm adding meals (huge wasted space when scrolling, where the calories available, burned and eaten used to show up at).

title: Great app, but...
body: The calories, carbs, protein, and fat shared to the Apple Health app are rarely correct, In 2019 this is a basic and fundamental feature that should function correctly and be put front and center over pushing users to subscribe to their premium plan. Paying for an app that‚Äôs missing this basic functionality is criminal (hyperbolic I know). I‚Äôve been using Lifesum for ages and this issue has been present from day one after Apple released the health app.

title: Read through nutritional stuff you scan in!
body: So far I like this app. Lost some weight with the keto light diet and have been drinking three liters of water religiously! My only complaint is tracking food items!

title: (Updated) Binary gender choice with no opt-out
body: (Updated under the line)

title: Amazing
body: Totally worth every penny. I‚Äôm so happy I got Lifesum it‚Äôs amazing, it just makes eating healthy so much easier. I don‚Äôt have to guess or count calories or look at fat blah blah blah. I just punch it in and it lets me know what‚Äôs up. There are multiple plans(classic diet, Keto, vegan for a week) it has recipes and workouts... and my hands down favorite WATER TRACKER!! I can easily keep track of all the water I‚Äôm drinking and I love it!

title: Best App out therr
body: I have fallen in love with Lifesum - I chose the keto strict plan - have been using this app for almost 2 months, I did purchase the upgrade & it is worth the extra bit of $$ ! The scan feature is so helpful - most restaurants come up - and I live & die by the daily ratings! The days I do super good with my macros are the days I have my losses, if I have a rough day (which thats ok!), I know to prepare for a stall or minor gain, but always get back on & keep following the plan! The app is also extremely user friendly - which is a huge bonus!

title: won‚Äôt give me my money back
body: I really liked this app. Very nice and organized, but when you go to pick a plan I selected the $30 for the year. A couple hours after I purchased, I decided to cancel for my own reasons. I requested for a refund after cancelling my subscription and it told me flat out I couldn‚Äôt get a refund. I could understand if I used it for a month or weeks why I can‚Äôt have a refund but not a couple hours after I purchase the plan. Ridiculous!

title: Too Glitchy
body: I love the look of this app and prefer it over MFP in a lot of ways, but at the end of the day it is just too glitchy to continue using. Food will randomly show up on a different day that i didn‚Äôt log it on, a day‚Äôs data will be missing from the daily progress section, and just yesterday all of my step counts for the week disappeared messing up my calorie intake. I also believe it is a bit generous with how many calories my steps are burning. MFP says 70 while Lifesum says 400 ‚Äî something must be off. I also wish there was some way to set a calorie goal without selecting a meal plan.

title: Almost perfect
body: I really love this app. Maybe more that Fitness pal bc it lets me take a test where I can pinpoint what diet would be better for me. I am on the Keto strict diet and from the research and endless videos I‚Äôve seen I should be counting net carbs not total carbs. Unfortunately this app counts total carb and not net carbs so that really limits me on my eating. I would love it if it keep track of my net carbs instead of total. Since that is what we should be counting when on Keto diet. Also there are a lot of recipes not found when I search and it would be nice to be able to add a recipe if i have all nutritional information.

title: Helps a LOT
body: I‚Äôve been using Lifesum for 3 days and have really enjoyed it so far. I like being able to scan and track my meals, track my water intake, get inspired for my own recipes using theirs and track my weight loss. I‚Äôm down 1.3 lbs in 3 days and I attribute that to keeping a closer eye on my portions and macros using this app. The only things I don‚Äôt like about this app are my inability to create and save my recipes, as well as, the somewhat inaccurate count of my macros. Otherwise, I‚Äôll keep using it because I‚Äôm seeing results already!

title: Failure without support
body: I eat healthy foods and my weight is healthy and stable after two kids. I eat almost all whole foods but have been cutting down on carbs to improve. I bought the premium membership to learn about macros. Almost every meal I log is classified as imbalanced including my breakfast today of kale, avocado, tomatoes, and eggs with coffee/table cream and coconut sugar. All meals are shown as too high in something but there is no way to click in and see where you went ‚Äúwrong‚Äù so there is no learning. The algorithms seem overly restrictive and are not designed to educate. The added sugar algorithm also does not show you where the too much sugar is coming into your diet.

title: Fitness tracker is so much better
body: I‚Äôm so sad that I used 20$ on this app... the fitness pal tracker is so much. I‚Äôm a college student and I was really excited to get my calories checked and check my macros but this app is so inaccurate and does even put down the foods serving size or calories.... also the calories restrictions are so limited and don‚Äôt really cater to your weight and how fast you want to lose weight when you are doing the specific meal plans such as the weight loss, keto or Mediterranean. It‚Äôs only been 2 days using this app and I really want my 20$ back..... I was really looking for more. I hope I can contact this team and get my mom back bc I will not be using this for 1 week let alone 3 months

title: Love it! Would like to see 2 improvements
body: I am greatly enjoying the app. It‚Äôs functional, intuitive, and the design is beautiful. I wish there was a way to see your own added recipes and recipes native to the app in separate sections and not all together under ‚Äúfavorites/recipes.‚Äù Moreover, it‚Äôd be great if the app could incorporate intermittent fasting on a daily level as well as weekly (i.e. not only selecting days in a week when you‚Äôll eat fewer calories, as presently, but also which hours in a day you are eating every day). Thank you!

title: Really great app, but...
body: I thought I was going to be able to put in my own macro percentages/grams. But since you‚Äôre kind of forced to pick a diet it does the calculations for what the app thinks they should be, except I have a nutritionist and he wants me at different percentages/grams. I can not for the life of my figure out how to do this, so as of now I‚Äôm thinking that it is not a feature. It‚Äôs pretty disappointing, I really need to be able to customize my macros to what I want them to be at. I guess I‚Äôm gonna have to keep looking at apps, it‚Äôs a real

title: Great layout, some glitches
body: I love the aesthetics of this app and the number of recipes and diet plans available. I‚Äôve noticed some annoying glitches with the tracking though. For instance, it seems to switch back and forth between adding back exercise calories and not. This isn‚Äôt a huge deal but it‚Äôs pretty annoying when you are 400 calories under your limit then suddenly 50 over without having eaten anything new. Ideally there would be an easy way to switch this on and off as a user. For the free version at least there isn‚Äôt.

title: Could be a 5
body: Moved to iwatch from Fitbit and needed a food tracking solution.  I‚Äôve been using Lifesum for 90 days now and have 1 major complaint that keeps my rating a 3 vs 5.  Lifesum allows you to save food ‚Äòfavorites‚Äô like Fitbit, BUT Lifesum does allow you to sort you favorites, and in fact the order in which they are listed when you access them seems different every time.  To Developers:  Please fix this to add sort option, or at least have favorites display alphabetically every time you access them.  It‚Äôs very annoying to have to search through random ordered favorites every time with the current app.

title: Loosing weight
body: Like anything in life (and Lifesum) one gets out what ones willing to put in.  It‚Äôs not easy to keep ones self accountable by ones self. Discussing weight and guilty pleasure foods can be hard to do - shame ridden with face to face admissions about weight, blowing the diet, photos, measurements....I‚Äôm cringing; most of us just lie to avoid of that shame.  When I keep myself accountable of Lifesum, I can record the truth, things I‚Äôd rather not share, and feel ok with my choices without stigma and opinions.

title: No major progress in years
body: - we need more flexible meals. You can‚Äôt have a program for gaining if you force people to account for all of their meals in 4 slots a day. This structure prohibits success when you have to compound all your food into not enough slots. (This has been one of the most requested features for YEARS - check the forums)

title: Great features and easy to use
body: My daughter uses this app and loves it so I thought Id see what all the fuss was about. Ive been using this for 2 weeks and I am really impressed. My fav part is scanning bar codes and having the info instantly pop up. Saves me time and hassle.  You can adjust everything, whether you want it to track 3 or 4 veggies or fruits; it is all adjustable. You can even set how many calories you need to eat. It is so versatile!  I have had so much fun with this. Ive lost 10 lbs (some water weight) so far.  Thanks!

title: Changing macro levels is premium now
body: Today I deleted lifesum and downloaded my fitness pal. I didn't want to. I like lifesum much more as it has a nicer user interface and minimal clutter. It is pleasing to the organized eye. The reason is when I went to start food tracking again, I wasn't able to change my macro percentages unless I switched to premium. I used to be able to change this no problem with the free one, and was so shocked I decided to switch immediately. Changing macro levels should be no different than changing your calories. Fix it lifesum! I would much rather use your app, but I will not be paying for it.

title: Very helpful
body: I use the free version and it‚Äôs very helpful at keeping me on track for calories, exercise, and water. I LOVE the barcode scan to make tracking food way faster. The carb/protein/fat tracker is also a nice bonus. My only complaint is that it seems to be operating for someone who has a traditional 9-5 life. So when I get up at 10:30 AM it‚Äôs telling me that it‚Äôs almost time for lunch, it gives me a bad score when I haven‚Äôt eaten enough by 7, and stops notifying me and updating by like 9 PM. Rather annoying for a night owl like me, but it‚Äôs an easy thing to ignore. Overall I‚Äôm very pleased!

title: I love it!
body: I love this app and all of its features, I use the free version and still feel like it‚Äôs helpful! The only thing I wish was different would be the ability to enter foods specifically to what you ate, (i.e. I made a breakfast sandwich this morning that was a plain bagel, provolone, chicken and egg, but they didn‚Äôt have anything similar to choose from for my breakfast so I had to choose a chick-fil-a sandwich instead) rather than making you choose from pre-made selections, it would allow your calorie intake to be more accurate and help with your program (whichever you choose to do).

title: I gave it a shot
body: I really wanted to love this app.  I was excited for a replacement of MyFitnessPal and with all the positive reviews, I jumped in with a subscription.  However the app is glitchy and some of the functionality really annoying.  This morning I logged my breakfast with a picture.  It only correctly identified the red pepper (it was eggs with veggies, banana, peanut butter and English muffin).  So after adding the rest, it didn‚Äôt actually save the picture.  I originally was excited thinking you could take a photo, log the details later, but that doesn‚Äôt work.  <<highly recommend you add this for people who can‚Äôt log at meal time.  I am going to move on and hope to give this app a shot another day.

title: Great app when it works
body: I was loving this app, great way to keep track of everything and it would work with my Apple Watch and transfer all the info I needed it too. Lately it‚Äôs not keeping my profile info and I have to constantly update it on a daily basis which makes this is a pain to have to go thru. Can you fix it please. I‚Äôve never paid for an app and this is the first and I was living it till the last week or so having this issue makes me not want to renew... fix it and I‚Äôll bump it up a star, but if the problem persists I‚Äôll have to take away stars

title: I‚Äôm happy
body: Even though there is some premium thing, doesn‚Äôt mean you have to pay. There‚Äôs already a lot of things that it has for you that is free! I‚Äôm very happy with this app because it helps me control my weight. For your meals and snacks you can type in what you had and it will tell you about that food! I also really like that test you can take to tell you if you‚Äôre healthy or not. If you aren‚Äôt as healthy, it will help you! I suggest getting this app because of how helpful it is. I‚Äôm definitely happy.

title: User friendly except...
body: I‚Äôve only used this app for a couple days so far and I like it a lot. I only wish the shopping list was a little more user friendly. I‚Äôd prefer that when you add items to the list it doesn‚Äôt organize them in any way. It would save time in the grocery store.

title: Gorgeous interface, helpful features, amazing customer support
body: This app is wonderful! And VEGAN FRIENDLY!

title: Very unhealthy
body: For someone who suffers with an ED this app has not helped. I have gained the weight back and tried using this app to maintain my weight. Normally females should have around 1,600-2,000 calories. The app was recommending for me to have only 457 calories a day! And as I continue using the app it recommends I only eat 328 calories!!! Calories are energy and that‚Äôs what your body needs. To eat less than 1,000 a day is not healthy. For the app to even recommend that is not ok. While it is good to eat healthy like fruits and vegetables, carbs and protein should be included. The app recommended me to only eat 41 grams of carbs a day. The app is promoting orthorexia and should be reevaluated.

title: Great app with too few food options
body: I love the look and feel of the app. I love that it integrates the best with my Apple Watch of all the similar apps out there like MyFitnessPal. I want to switch over from MyFitnessPal to Lifesum, I really do! But MyFitnessPals ability to scan bar codes to input food, to manually put in the calories and nutritional information of a food and to save my own collections of meals is really what‚Äôs keeping me from using Lifesum. Also the database of food, restaurant menus on MyFitnessPal is way WAY bigger, accurate and better than Lifesum. And MyFitnessPal provides all these better things for free no less!

title: Like it but it would be better if it had more plans available
body: I was using this app to track my macronutrients while I was on the keto diet, but now I switched out to paleo. I really love the details it shows you from what you eat, my only issue with this is that I wish there was a paleo plan but I can also see a difficulty in that existing since paleo doesn‚Äôt track calories nor does paleo track macros. I guess it would just be an open nutrition count. It would be cool if they added some hints or guiding info on how to work on the paleo diet for others to follow as beginners.

title: Easy, informative
body: I‚Äôm usually not good at maintaining any diary, but Lifesum makes it easy.  I haven‚Äôt used the camera successfully yet, but I have found comparable foods in the app.  I like that the app incorporates information from my Apple Watch; less info for me to enter.  Having actual metrics available at any time is enlightening.  It‚Äôs easy to think I‚Äôm doing well with my diet, but Lifesum provides me with real data.  It also gives little tidbits and supportive comments throughout the day for encouragement and education.  Glad I got it.

title: Some issues
body: I got the app on recommendation of the google health app. I was looking for something that would sink easily with the data from the health app. I got the app and it showed I needed to go premium to be able to see everything. No problem, just a few bucks a month. Issue is now that I‚Äôve paid for the premium membership the app keeps telling me I need to upgrade, but when I go to upgrade it tells me I already have. I have tried signing out and signing back in and even deleting the app and then re downloading. Neither of these seemed to help. I have also reached out to the developer and not received any response. Seems like it would be a nice one stop app to monitor calorie intake and physical activity, if it would just work.

title: Inaccurate Food Data
body: I was not a big fan of this app due to the lack of accuracy of Lifesum certified foods in calories, macros, and/or serving size. About half of the foods I looked for in the first two days were not accurate in serving size or calorie amount. I quit after that because that‚Äôs the one thing that a calorie tracker needs to be - accurate; otherwise, what‚Äôs the point?

title: Inaccurate nutrition facts
body: Even when you scan the barcode the nutritional information does not match, making it cumbersome to accurately track your macros. Pay close attention... you scan a package of sliced pepperoni (for example) the package gives the nutritional facts, per serving. A serving of pepperoni in this instance is 4 slices. The application however extrapolates that that is the nutritional information per slice. It has done this with every single thing I have scanned. The data is the same for what is already cached in the application. Which is why I have been scanning my food, because it‚Äôs wrong. The application itself looks great. Developers just to step it up a bit on the accuracy.

title: Makes being healthy a habit
body: I love this food tracker! Unlike other trackers it wants you to create healthy habits that will last long after you‚Äôve lost or gained the weight you want. Other food tracking apps are ugly and too complicated while Lifesum is a gorgeous app that simplifies healthy eating. The only thing I don‚Äôt like about the app is the frowny faces it gives when you eat ‚Äúbad‚Äù foods. The app should promote balance in healthy eating and not make users feel guilty for enjoying a square of chocolate when they want to.

title: Not worth premium
body: I bought the premium version and it‚Äôs not worth it. I‚Äôll log an exercise and it‚Äôll be gone the next time I go in. I‚Äôll log my weight and then it‚Äôll be different next time. This happens on all sorts of areas, even my birthdate has changed on me, and I continually need to check back on things and correct. And it‚Äôs a little weird. It measures water intake by 8.45 ounces, and it‚Äôs hard to enter the exact the nutrition facts, like it‚Äôll recalculate my calories to be 59 rather than 60. Also, I can‚Äôt set my own nutrition goals or macros, I have to use one of their five preset plans. It‚Äôs just odd. Also, huge annoyance is that it doesn‚Äôt sync steps with Fitbit, only workouts! So I have to manually enter steps into Apple health. Just so frustrating.

title: Nice app but needs some improvements.
body: I have an iPhone 12 Pro Max and parts of the UI are getting cut off in the corners. Also, the keyboard gets in the way when trying to enter a value for potassium in a custom food. I would also like to be able to edit the name of scanned foods because the names are either incorrect or excessively long; e.g., scanned name: ‚ÄúBreakfast nutriflakes cereal 40% bran flakes‚Äù, actual/shorter name: ‚ÄúNutriFlakes Cereal‚Äù. Being able to edit the brand would also be nice, just in case. Another feature I would like are more micronutrients to track, not just potassium.

title: Needs Notes!
body: This is a great app that‚Äôs super easy to use and I definitely be down to pay for premium but it‚Äôs missing a basic notes section that I can just put in thoughts about how I feel and other notes about my health. When it comes to tracking, data is super important and being able to add as much as possible is very helpful. When you go to the doctors and they ask you to track your food intake they almost always tell you to just write down the stream of consciousness rather than just static calories and stuff.

title: Food database is way off
body: I was just kinda sick of the MyFitnessPal UI so I decided to try out Lifesum for calorie counting. I thought there would be more plans with the paid version, but turns out there are maybe 10 tops and I wouldn‚Äôt call them ‚Äúplans‚Äù per se, more like ‚Äúgeneral themes without much personalization‚Äù.  I like the Lifesum UI but when I‚Äôm without a barcode and have to use the search bar to enter food, I end up with lots of odd, misspelled options with ENTIRELY different calorie counts!  One of the first options that came up for olive oil said there were 58 calories in a TB, roughly half the actual amount.  Despite prepaying for 6 months I think I might have to go back to MyFitnessPal just for reliability.

title: Great but Missing Some Features
body: Overall, the food tracking and recipe portion of this app are pretty good. I wish I could get more specific about the types of meal plan I‚Äôm following or want to follow. But mostly I wish it would also allow tracking of physical and mental wellness as well. Like it‚Äôs great to be able to track on a given day that my mood and/or energy felt high, and also I did or didn‚Äôt have a stomach ache. All of these things are so important when looking at trends and big picture for our health & wellness. I‚Äôll keep looking for an app that can incorporate this as well, and hopefully one day Lifesum will be that app.

title: Clean Eating could use improvement
body: I got this application as a vegan/plant based eater. The clean eating intrigued me, but I‚Äôm disappointed to find there is no meal plan for it, just recipes. I also find it disappointing that recipes are usually imbalanced or off track, even though they are suggested from the app. I‚Äôd like to see balanced, on track recipes, so that I can have an idea of how to eat better.

title: Don‚Äôt buy the premium subscription
body: I used the free version and finally decided to upgrade to premium. They make you pay for the whole subscription (in my case I did one year) up front. This wouldn‚Äôt be a problem except my account STILL doesn‚Äôt show that I have the premium subscription even though I paid for it. It‚Äôs been three days and I‚Äôve sent emails and followed instructions from their ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äù page. Also the premium Lifesum subscription isn‚Äôt eligible for a refund from the App Store. Don‚Äôt buy premium unless you feel like throwing $40 away without receiving what you paid for or hearing back from the company support. Very disappointing because I was so excited to unlock all the extra features.

title: What I have been looking for
body: This app is awesome! I wanted something similar to the Fitbit app not that I have an Apple Watch and my steps and workouts dont transfer correctly. Tried a few apps out and this one takes the cake. Even better than the Fitbit app and less expensive. This app collects steps and workouts from apple watch without issues and what i really like is how it breaks down the different nutrients you are or not eating. It has been really helping me change bad habits I didn‚Äôt know I had.

title: Everything I ever wanted
body: This app is the best tracker in all things health I have ever used. And I‚Äôve used a lot. I won‚Äôt say all of them but .... I‚Äôve used a lot of apps and tracking systems since I started being cognizant in 2008. It makes me want to be better with my diet and exercise and explains exactly what is going on with my health and fitness in terms I can understand. It has SO many options for diets and explains the benefits of each and why each macro breakdown is suggested. Can‚Äôt recommend it enough. I‚Äôm obsessed!!!

title: Amazing helper!
body: I‚Äôve been running semi-competitively for years now, and this app helps me keep up with my nutrition! I‚Äôm constantly trying to find ways to eat as healthy as possible and it gives so many reminders and options for recipes to live a healthier lifestyle. I will say though, if you sincerely want to change your eating habits with this, there is the premium option which opens the door for all of the recipes, diet and exercise plans for all to try. Overall an amazing helper to live a healthier lifestyle!

title: Pretty but buggy
body: ETA: Got the paid version assuming it would be more useful after so much time. Realized that you can‚Äôt measure custom recipes in grams or anything but servings. Useless, am changing to one star.

title: Good Premium Product, some annoying app bugs
body: Overall, a good product. Love the diet suggestions and premium product is good. Diet tracking is okay, lots of missing barcode data so not as good as other mainstream diet trackers. A few bugs in the app around food entry, specifically doesn‚Äôt refresh and even if you put in food it doesn‚Äôt seem to process entries. I suspect this is an issue with the latest update. Although the lack of refresh in the diary has been a recurrent problem. Overall, I enjoy the product however I‚Äôm neutral on the premium product, it‚Äôs okay but their are other more viable alternatives.

title: reverting my weight tracking,  lacks meal plans, recipes obscure limited dietary preference
