body: Truly wish i didn‚Äôt go premium before the trial expired, wasted money and want a refund.  Too difficult to use, consistently reverts my weight back to previous weigh ins so while i‚Äôm progressively losing and NOT regaining weight the tracker looks like a yo yo, (i was at 158# last week and when i went to log my new weight is 157# today, the tracker had changed my weight to 162, has happened multiple times) lacks dietary preferences options, only very broad categories available to choose from like vegan, vegetarian and one other,  recipe ingredients in meal plan are complex and unrealistic, not enough dietary preferences and lacks meal plans for most dietary preferences.  Do not like at all.

title: A little disappointed
body: The interface is beautiful but difficult to navigate. Some foods I‚Äôve scanned don‚Äôt match the package nutritional content at all.  I do a lot of my own cooking and adding recipes would be a lot easier with a bulk ingredient import option. Getting to your saved foods and adding new ones is not intuitive.

title: Great app but buggy
body: Lifesum‚Äôs done a great job with diet goals and making recording food consumption easy (barcode scan database is impressive).

title: Why premium?
body: I give this app a 3 star rating because if you don‚Äôt have premium, then when you go in recipes or need the IMPORTANT information, you need to pay to get premium which is not fair... We should at least get the important information... The good things about it is that it‚Äôs fun to use when you want put what you are and it really is a good diary! Then if you are too little calories, then it will say you need to eat only a little bit more and it will also say if you are too much! I got this app from a YouTuber! Anyway, that‚Äôs what I think about this app! Ok but also horrible at the same time! ü•≥ü•∫üò°

title: Would love to use but
body: Offers no free trial, offers no free recipes, offers really nothing. In order to use anything, you have to shell out money straight away and with all the different apps out there for helping with weight loss, being able to try before buy is extremely important.

title: Love it!!
body: I‚Äôm back to 5 stars because the bug that didn‚Äôt allow me to add foods to the tracker has been fixed. The developers responded to everyone complaining about the issues by fixing the problem and I‚Äôm really glad I can use the app again, the problem was solved pretty quickly and efficiently and I applaud them for that, many apps don‚Äôt care to fix problems quickly. It‚Äôs a great app, and I‚Äôve tried just about every food/nutrient tracker out there, this is by far my favorite.

title: Worthless
body: Downloaded the app and got stopped in my tracks. Unless you go premium, some of the basics needed don‚Äôt work. So this was deleted immediately.  So I get a response back but all they want to do is justify the cost. I don‚Äôt even know what it costs because one key factor not in the trial is key to know if I want to spend the money. I‚Äôm not spending a dime without knowing if this really works. You talk about your 60 employees but never asked what the issue was.

title: Beautiful mess
body: (Disclaimer I absolutely never write reviews but this had to be said.)

title: App could use marketing work
body: I haven‚Äôt actually used the app yet because when I open it (a few months after I downloaded) and I had no idea what the app did. Having a splash screen with benefits is key to explain your product - my only other option was to approve the use of my data...

title: The app is saying the server is down
body: I went to input my exercise for the day and when I tried to search the exercise , it wouldn‚Äôt load. I waited for about 10 minutes, exited out of the app and turned my wifi on and off. It still wouldn‚Äôt load. I went back out of the app one more time and when I went back in, the option to track my workouts was gone. I tapped the plus button and it still let me click on the workout tab, but still wouldn‚Äôt load the workouts. I decided to delete the app and re-download, hoping it would reset whatever was wrong. Now it won‚Äôt let me back in and is saying there is an error with the server, which disappoints me because I like using this particular app.

title: Updated ( sometime went wrong with the new update)
body: I started using Lifesum about 3 months back and it had been amazing. It used to be user friendly and straightforward. I managed to loose 2 kg / monthly and still going . However, something went terribly wrong with the new update. It crashes and requires logging in and gets stuck when I try to log in with my apple account. It made me regret paying for the next 3 months. I also noticed that the number of calories of the classic diet plan has been changed to 1600 , why? Please fix all these glitched and get it back to how awesome it used to be.

title: Easy to use
body: I absolutely love the ease of this app. The Bella Twins from WWE, shared info about this app. Of course I thought , here goes - another celebrity endorsed product , but it‚Äôs a great food diary. The best part is that I can scan in my food items with the barcode scanner. I tried out the free app for a couple weeks and wasn‚Äôt bombarded by ads which I was very surprised about. This made me upgrade to the premium app because the makers ‚Äúgot it‚Äù. You can get more users when you don‚Äôt overwhelm users with ads . Thanks!!!

title: Self entering macros
body: I have really come to love this app! It‚Äôs a bit overwhelming at first but once you get into a groove it‚Äôs very user friendly. I actually prefer this app over MyFitnessPal personally. I like that you can just add in calories if the app does not have your food items stored though I wish we could manually enter macros in ourselves also. Sometimes I have a recipe with calories, carbs, protein and fat written out but I am limited to only entering my calorie number in the app. It would be nice to be able to put in the macros myself to keep an accurate count!!

title: All the features!
body: Everything I didn‚Äôt know I was missing in those other food tracking apps. Love that it correlates with a diet plan and adjusts for your individual needs. Love that it connects with my Fitbit so I don‚Äôt have to enter as much data. Love the tips and reminders to help me know I‚Äôm doing alright and keep me on track with the plan. Love that I can save groups of foods as a meal and reuse it again next time I eat the same meal without hunting down each individual ingredient again. Button line, love.

title: A Great way to be healthy
body: This app makes recording your meals and tracking your calories so much easier than any other app that I‚Äôve ever used. Plus all of the feedback that you get when you‚Äôre recording your meals helps you to know what‚Äôs better for you and worse for you all without forcing you to be on a meal plan. Premium is definitely worth it if you‚Äôre trying to get your health on track plus they give you a discount for like 30% on your first year subscription.

title: Great foundation for a better life
body: Without paying, there is already a great number of resources to help track my calories and know what foods I‚Äôm eating are good for my desired diet. Visually interesting enough to provide a sense of accomplishment when being healthier and already feeling the results in the first week. Would love for the option to see why certain foods are unhealthy for my diet to be a ‚Äúfree‚Äù addition to the app, but understandably an app needs paying customers to keep running without huge advertisements plastered over it.

title: I lost 32 lbs in 10 weeks!!
body: I love love LOVE this app!!!!! I wish I could‚Äôve given it a bonus star! In just 10 weeks, I went from 249lbs to 217lbs, my waist went from a 47 to a 44, and my BMI went from 44.1 to 38.4! I did this with just the free version. This app kept me accountable and is beautifully designed. Watching my charts change and been so motivating! I coupled this app with the Fitness22 Workout app to achieve my results and I couldn‚Äôt be more grateful! Thank you so much for such a fantastic app! I recommend this to everyone!!

title: Great app, wish it persisted data better
body: I really love this app, the ease of use, design, thoughtfulness of features. I wish it persisted data a little better. Every few days it will reset my weight back to my starting weight and log that instead of my input, which has gotten annoying. It also loses connection to the Fitbit every other day and I have to go connect it all back up again. I‚Äôm sadly searching for a new app even though I love this one the most. I hope they fix those issues because otherwise it‚Äôs perfect!

title: Beautiful, Buggy Mess
body: I've been using this app for over a year now. This is the only food tracking app that I've stuck with solely because of the UI. But the user experience is made awful by the clunkiness of its execution. Surprisingly often I'm unable to scroll past my lunch entry when I attempt to input dinner. Or looking at past days I'm unable to scroll. Syncing is also hit or miss. Overall, using this app is sort of tragic since it's so close to a seamless experience but they haven't yet taken the extra step to make it as reliable as it could be. I'm hoping they can update this app to be as seamless as other cloud-reliant services.

title: Can‚Äôt customize a ‚Äúplan‚Äù for vegetarian or Vegan
body: Unfortunately even though this app is lovely and easy to use, it‚Äôs hard to customize vegan meal plans with limited choices. You are forced it‚Äôs choices for dieting but when you click vegan there are about 3-4 choices for breakfast, lunch and dinner qhich gets boring fast. Additionally adjusting your cal goal is also nearly impossible, while it‚Äôs under settings, it doesn‚Äôt actually adjust no matter how many times you save so it‚Äôs hard to track how on target you are. Lastly you can‚Äôt change your macros by day so you are stuck to whatever macros you enter as the target regardless if you likely have variations by day. üòû

title: Good But ...
body: This is a good app ! I like all the features and how easy it is to use , I also like how you can add water and have veggie / fruit / sea food goals as well for the day / week !! The only thing I don't like about this app is that the water tracking feature only allows you to track two different amounts , this makes it very hard to add in water when your water bottle / cups aren't that amount . it would be great and would really help the apps likeability if the delevopers could make it so you can add your own custom amounts to their liking !

title: cool app, BUT...
body: Think this app is awesome. The layout is great and beautiful. I love that you can get a feel for the app before paying for it, which in my opinion is awesome. I love that you can customize your settings, and make it fit your goals. So it truly is a beautiful app.

title: Videos on cooking
body: I sign up for three months, not sure if I‚Äôll renew. The application is great but it doesn‚Äôt give any feed back. There‚Äôs not a coach on line to give you ideas on what to do, where to cut back exercise. For the price I was expecting more. I like that I can keep track of food and with the faces I know I‚Äôm on track or not, but then I could do that with other apps for free. I‚Äôm a visual person I would like to see videos of the recipes given on the app. I really hate the measurements in grams there should be a way to change them to cups, teaspoon, etc.

title: Wonderful  BUT...
body: This app really helps me be aware of the things I eat and serving sizes . The only problem I have is that I will click a day and log my meal then I will go back later to log my snack and my progress is gone . I looked at the day before and my information had moved days . Thinking it was user error , I would double check to make sure that I‚Äôm logging my progress on the correct date only to have the data move again . I‚Äôve had several sequential days shifts dates and this has happened on several occasions .

title: Needs more
body: Cool app and very helpful to track macros. Really helped me on my start with keto. However, the diet options are pretty minimal and I really wish I could construct my own goals rather than buy into pre-set ones.

title: Confusing units
body: I like this app a lot. The design and features are helpful for successful and consistent tracking. However, the units listed for many foods when trying to add to the food diary are often confusing or just wrong. You might see something listed as ‚Äúone serving‚Äù or listed as 190 calories when you know it to be 100 calories. I believe it is possible to edit these, but I do not always know the number of calories in my foods or I‚Äôm in a hurry. This is not a great app if you‚Äôre often on the go, because you may have to double check the number of calories using other sources.

title: Will there be new plans?
body: So far I‚Äôm really enjoying the app, so much in fact that I have become a subscribed user. I enjoy the way it recommends meals and allows you some options. So far my only question is whether or not there will be anymore plans added in the near future. Personally I‚Äôm looking 16/8 hr fasting option. The last option that would really advance my experience would be if there was an option to enter your personal MACROS to try and follow. Are either of these options available in the near future? Thank you.

title: Could be better
body: Lifesum is a good app that could be better. I started this year trying get on track with my health and weight. I like the ability to track my calories, however with this app there are some problems. Most of the things you want to track are premium.

title: Please change this !!!
body: I‚Äôm only give four stars because everything is perfect in the app EXCEPT for the fact that you‚Äôre not allowed to change your carb intake! I don‚Äôt know why they would lock that SINGLE feature. It says pay for premium to be able to edit your macros but when you do you can only change your proteins and fat. I‚Äôm so annoyed with this because it‚Äôs saying I need to intake way too many carbs for my ketogenic diet. Please PLEASE unlock this feature ASAP, this feature alone might make me cancel my newly paid subscription.

title: I‚Äôm Amazed by this App
body: This app is amazing. It is so easy to use. If I want to record the cereal I ate for breakfast, all I have to do is scan the barcode and it pulls the item right up. It pulls all my activity/calories burned from my Apple Watch. Literally it does not get any easier, and this is all free! I love that they made a widget, I put it on my Home Screen next to my activity widget and I can quickly see where I‚Äôm at for the day. The app is also very well formatted and nicely designed. 12/10, I love this app so much

title: Lifesum seems to be working.
body: I started using this app 3 days ago. I already lost 11 lbs. I know. My wife said it‚Äôs water. The meal plans are great. I don‚Äôt feel hungry all day.  The food is delicious. The step by step cooking is wonderful. (JUST ONE MAJOR COMPLAINT.)>>>>>I have to fit all the ingredients in a measuring cup. That is extra work.  Instead of or in addition to using cups to measure the raw ingredient it would be nice to see the measurements in grams. Ingredients are weighted fast and accurately.

title: I LOVE THIS APP.... but there‚Äôs only one thing
body: This app is amazing. The layout is user

title: I want a refund!!! Too rigid to use if you actually cook
body: I want a refund because this app is very rigid.   The list of foods has odd ‚Äústandard‚Äù measurements (who measures eggs in ounces!?) so you have to do a lot of scrolling to find a normal item.

title: Almost perfect
body: So far my experience with the app has been great in leading me to weight loss, but I do have a few things I would like to see improved. It would be wonderful if there was a net carbs feature for ketogenic diets. I have been under eating carbs because I assumed the app took the fiber out of the carb count but as it turns out it doesn‚Äôt. Also, I have scanned certain foods like an avocado, and my avocados get a bad rating but other avocados are okay. Is this because some foods do have their fiber subtracted out of their carbs? Either way... confusing.

title: Glad net carbs have been added! Still a few kinks
body: So glad to see they‚Äôve added Net Carbs as an option to help those of us on a keto diet. I noticed the ‚ÄúNutrient Distribution‚Äù still reflects the Total Carbs not net carbs though, so it shows as ‚ÄúImbalanced‚Äù nutrient distribution, and that your food is high in carbs even if it‚Äôs low in carbs, which is confusing...This also means some of the meals i eat inaccurately show a frowny face when they‚Äôre actually very balanced. Hopefully the developers fix this...adding net carbs is definitely a good start!

title: Overall nice app, hard for US users
body: Overall I really like this app. The interface is really nice and colorful and easy to use and the option to follow different diets (paid subscription feature) is great. My only criticism is that it‚Äôs hard for me in the US to gauge what I‚Äôm eating because almost everything is measured using the metric system. I wish there was a capability to toggle between different measurement units. I also noticed that some of the calorie information that comes up when scanning the barcode doesn‚Äôt always match up. These are small things, but occasionally annoying.

title: Love this app! Needs a little improvement
body: Firstly I‚Äôd like to comment on the aesthetic of this application it‚Äôs calming and smoothly runs on my iPhone however adding food seems a little hard because adding specific portions that aren‚Äôt based on serving size requires decimal conversions that off the top of my head I don‚Äôt know making logging the food a much more tedious task than using the app lose it however i still prefer this over the other so i will continue using Lifesum.

title: Not worth it!
body: This app may be beautifully designed and user friendly compared to their competitors out there. That‚Äôs what drew me in, but it is the glitchiest thing on earth. I‚Äôm a customer who recently upgraded to premium in order to fully access all the features of the app. I recently noticed that this app always disconnects from my smart watch, reboots the calories, and provides macros of 0 carbs, 6% protein, and 0 fats. Wouldn‚Äôt you be in awe when you are trying to log your calories, open the app and all of a sudden only be allowed to consume 6 calories?  I‚Äôm not on a water fast...

title: Beautiful App - where‚Äôs the search?
body: I have used a variety of health/calorie trackers and this is the best I have seen! Lifesum has a beautiful UI, wonderful, flavorful, quick, healthy recipes! Meal Plans that seem really achievable - thank you for the cheat day!! - and positive reminders that make me want to stay committed. Excited to see how it evolves and grows!

title: Awesome but one tiny glitch
body: I have been using Lifesum off and on for years and have been very satisfied with it. However, there is one tiny thing that I‚Äôve always had a little problem with. Whenever I look at a weekly view of calories, all the counts are off. Scrolling through each day individually everything is correct, but when I pull the tab down to see the measurements all lined up for the last few days, nothing matches. I would really appreciate if this could be fixed!

title: Best Tracking app
body: I can‚Äôt thank enough the creators, creatives and developers of this app. It‚Äôs absolutely amazing. I feel in control everyday without feeling too restricted. I‚Äôve used many tracking apps in the past but Lifesum surpassed every expectation I had for this. Premium is worth every penny, user friendly, no bugs, the meal rating makes meal planning so easy and fun, I don‚Äôt drag doing it anymore. Takes all the guessing out and makes it EASY! So happy with it! Keep up the good work!

title: You have to pay for net carbs??? Really?!
body: I‚Äôve been eating Keto for about 4 months now but I downloaded this app to really help me stay on track without cheating.

title: One Big Weakness
body: When it comes to weight loss the app won‚Äôt let you work your weight loss goal around anything shorter than 15 weeks.  For me that‚Äôs 1.1 lbs a week.  Basically that‚Äôs me not eating chips every few days and maybe subbing a salad for lunch twice a week.

title: Do NOT recommend for macro tracking
body: I‚Äôll admit this app is absolutely easy on the eyes & seamless. HOWEVER, as someone who has been tracking my macros for body building purposes for some time now, this app is TERRIBLE. There are SO many problems with this app:

title: A few requests please
body: Love this app and I‚Äôve been a paid member for over a year now. Just got my hubby on board and got him paid too. Here is what I would love to see:

title: Love the app! But confused...
body: I‚Äôve been using the app for a while now on the weight loss setting and it works very well for me! It keeps me motivated and even though I struggle greatly with my relationship with food.

title: Wonderful but needs more allergy-safe plans
body: Great app! It‚Äôs visually appealing and offers great tracking features such as water, fruit, and vegetable trackers. It‚Äôs helpful tips keep me motivated and on track. The recipes are helpful but I wish they had more allergy friendly meal plans. As someone with a ton of food allergies (most of which aren‚Äôt listed where you can mark your allergies) it would be nice to see some more healthy non soy, peanut, tree nut, etc free foods. Overall it‚Äôs been a big help to keep my health in track but it would be nice for some more diverse plans

title: Amazing appü§©
body: This app is amazing and is helping me reach my fitness goals and I just really like it a lot. I used to be a lot more overweight than I am now and it is because this app helped me to lose weight and also helped me get on a better diet so I really do think that every one who wants to loose weight should try this app. Also another cool thing is that if you get premium there is so many different recipes on so many yummy things to make and so I think you should try it

title: Best health and calorie tracking app!
body: I have been using this app for over two years and I now can not go a day without using it! It keeps me focused and aware of what I‚Äôm consuming and putting in my body. It helps me maintain a healthy weight and diet, which is incredibly important to me. I have a background in nutritional science and this app is not only reliable but easy to use for someone with a high understanding of food and nutrition, as well as someone who just started focusing on healthier living!

title: Glitches here and there
body: Been using this app since September and have lost 16lbs out of the 20 I‚Äôm wanting to before the wedding. Love that I get to eat whatever I want but in smaller portions and not snack as often as I use to, I also love the info it gave on workouts. Now, it keeps freezing up on me and doesn‚Äôt show all the necessary things like working out and having a hard time clicking on how much water I‚Äôve drank to give an accurate reading. I‚Äôm almost there and I don‚Äôt want to give up this app because it freezes up.

title: Adding and subtracting Meals
body: Diets have become more complex now, where as just 3 meals a day and a snack are not enough to be able to track certain things properly.

title: Horrible Update
body: I tried to find a way to contact Lifesum before posting this review, but it‚Äôs apparently impossible so I‚Äôll post here in the hopes that the creators will see. I‚Äôve been paying for premium for probably 6 months and have never had any issues with it. My phone automatically updated Lifesum yesterday and now the app keeps crashing, it won‚Äôt let me update meals I‚Äôve created, and it won‚Äôt let me delete meals. Some meals I‚Äôve created are showing no ingredients at all, and some won‚Äôt let me add additional ingredients. If this isn‚Äôt fixed, I have no reason to keep using the app, let alone pay for premium. I hope this is resolved soon.

title: Great app
body: I wish I would have found this app before getting another one. I feel like I have energy though the day and am able to keep up with my diet without feeling like I‚Äôm dead during the day. Excellent start. The only thing that is a down fall (which is my personal preference) the snack section is what I eat pre workout to avoid low blood sugar. But doesn‚Äôt show up until I have put my dinner section in. Other than that I‚Äôm happy with everything.

title: Love this app!
body: I was looking for an app to help me with a strict Keto diet.  Before finding this app I thought I was doing the diet correctly. However, after I found this app I realized I was eating too many carbs. I have never gone into ketosis and after only three days on this diet I went into ketosis and had lost 10 pounds!!  I‚Äôm not sure I can ever do without this app again!  I had tried some others but this one has so many options on premium and is definitely worth the moneyüòÄ

title: First Time User
body: Hi Lifesum, I was referred to you from Nike Training Club! I love all the colorful images/illustrations and how seamless your app is (from my 1st day experiencing it). Is it possible to make a meal plan for ‚Äúcarb cycling‚Äù? As a personal trainer, I‚Äôve come into contact with a lot of body competitors and experienced coaches who stay carb cycling but I don‚Äôt think I understand it well enough to apply it to my own eating. Or is it perhaps already part of some of your plans and just not highlighted in the descriptions of the plans?

title: Please change it back
body: I used to be able to look up items by searching restaurant, brand name when I didn‚Äôt have a barcode to scan- and now everything is so general, how do I know I‚Äôm logging the correct thing if I don‚Äôt have the specific labels or brands. Example: I had an egg white grill sandwich from chic fil a this morning. I know this sandwich is 290 calories listed from the restaurant. I went to log it and multiple egg white grill food variations popped up all with very different calorie amounts and none that identified as chic fil or for 290 Cals. So I opted for the egg white grill that said 240 and I guess I‚Äôll adjust the serving to 1.21 to make it the equivalent of 290. I hope it‚Äôs the correct macros because idk if it‚Äôs even the right food

title: Just okay
body: I should have read reviews ahead of time; I agree with all that say the meal plans are not helpful. While there‚Äôs a couple of good ideas, there‚Äôs only 4 to choose from for each meal; hardly worth paying for a premium membership. Also, I use the suggested meal and the nutritional tracker STILL tells me I‚Äôm off track, whether it be too high in carbs or protein. So, again, another user noted you can never please that tracker and I feel like that can be ultimately sabotage a users mental health. I don‚Äôt know how this app got rated best overall in the article I read, I definitely won‚Äôt be renewing:-(

title: Best free food tracking app
body: A full free app, with lots of perks for the subscription option. I‚Äôm using only the free version, which allows you to calculate the calories you should be in taking based on your goal and current weight. Afterward, you plug in what you‚Äôre eating so it can track your actual calories eaten. It also used your phone or Apple Watch to adjust for physical activity.

title: You are money greedy pieces of crap
body: People aren‚Äôt made of money, everyone is low on money and I‚Äôd rather have something that doesn‚Äôt even work than pay you people that are trying to steal our money. I‚Äôm under 18 and my mom is obviously not going to pay for this crap, I don‚Äôt even get an allowance. I was hoping this would actually work but no, I just wanted to try a few of the things it suggested, but you just want money you greedy pigs. You have the IQ of chewed gum, and you look like a sewer rat that is slowly dying because it couldn‚Äôt find food and no one ever cared about it enough even to give it just a scrap of food. Everyone hates you. Edit: I can‚Äôt even pick a meal plan because you just want money.

title: LOVE IT
body: This is by far the easiest way I‚Äôve found to track my calories, of course it‚Äôs not perfect but it‚Äôs close enough to where you get a pretty good idea where you‚Äôre at. I also love how you can make your own recipes so you can‚Äôt track exactly what you made a lot more accurate then if you were to just choose the closest thing to it. Only complaint right now is the snack section is bugged right now where once I log something it says I‚Äôm 1,000 calories left or I‚Äôm 1 Calorie over but that‚Äôs not a big deal imo, just weird

title: Tracker is great, meal plan feature needs WORK.
body: The app itself is beautiful and easy to save meals you eat often. They have an easy water tracker, and they track your progress for you over long periods of time. I didn‚Äôt pay for the subscription, but so far they don‚Äôt push too hard for it with pop-up or any of those annoying things like most other apps will do.

title: Not that helpful
body: While the app looks great and has a wide variety of recipes, it is essentially just another tracker app. I think the claim that it can help you plan meals is pretty misleading. It is true that you can collect recipes into favorites, but (unless Im using the app wrong) there is no way to create meals for the week and to generate shopping lists from there. You have to go into each recipe to find out what ingredients to use. I can find the same recipes by searching keto sites and I can track my fitness through my fitness watch. I signed up for three months but unless it suddenly becomes a helpful meal planner I wont be renewing. Considering asking for a refund.

title: Super convenient, but...
body: I really like the way this app looks and functions. So far it has really helped with staying on track. I have noticed that a lot of the nutrition facts on the scanned barcodes or search option for foods are inaccurate, so you really have to pay attention to what you are entering. Otherwise your macros will be way off, and it kind of takes the simplicity out of having an app to log your food/calories. Other than that it is a great app!!

title: Love it!
body: I‚Äôm a terrible cook, never have any idea what I want to eat and end up making the same things all the time. I‚Äôve also ended up putting on weight because my job is so sedentary and there‚Äôs always snacks. I love being able to search for recipes, having pre planned meals that I can switch up and the pre made grocery list is possibly my favorite thing. It‚Äôs not too expensive and I think for someone like me who hates meal planning, it‚Äôs quite possibly the best thing.

title: Restaurant Options
body: Great app! Has Keto! Now all they need to do is not just add restaurantwith full menus, the menus should have OPTIONS to remove items from from the food and we will be all good. If I go to Fatburger and get a Skinny Burger Large, I should be able to say what I had on my burger or be able to build it to how I ordered it. That is the only thing that Myfitnesspal has over this app imo. They may not have it as specific as what I wrote, but at least they have a single chicken leg option when I order chicken. Increase your food database. PLEASE!!!

title: Beautiful app, almost as functional as Lose It
body: I‚Äôve been a Lose It user for years, and I‚Äôve never found an app that came close to its excellent logging functionality. I‚Äôm happy to report that LifeSum is close. There are still some issues with accuracy, but in general it has most foods that I want to track, and the barcode scanner works like a charm. I‚Äôd appreciate a clearer representation of the serving size...I still find this app to be confusing in that regard, but overall is beautiful and good enough to replace my previous go-to app.

title: Lifechanging
body: So I will start out by saying, I did not mean to get the premium account for this app. BUT I am so grateful that I did (everything happens for a reason)!! This app is SO easy to use! They have recipes that are actually AMAZING! and easy to make (not with a million weird ingredients that you‚Äôve never heard of lol) and it has this ‚Äúsmart camera‚Äù which you take a photo of your meal and it figures out the amount of calories, cholesterols, sugars, and so on!! GREAT FOR EATING OUT!! And I have lost 3 pounds and this is the first week!

title: Like but...
body: I like this app a lot. It‚Äôs easy to use and is well organized but: the nutritional information is wildly inaccurate.

title: Nice app design, but frustrating calculations
body: I paid for the premium membership so that I could enable the Ketogenic plan. When you enable that plan and try to use Net Carbs (super important for Keto) the app calculates it incorrectly. Unfortunately that‚Äôs not something you can see until after you enable the paid version.

title: Pretty good app!
body: I really do love this app and the premium is actually very inexpensive for the options you get I‚Äôve tried many different apps for the keto diet and this one is one of the better ones it has helped me reach my goals for sure! The only thing I don‚Äôt like about the app is that you cannot add in your own recipes as you can on other apps. Other than that this one is probably the closest to five stars that you‚Äôre going to get when it comes to diet apps!

title: i like it for the most part :)
body: i have downloaded many different calorie tracking apps. i have been trying to lose weight & tracking really helps put what i eat into perspective. did you know 5 ritz crackers  are like 100 calories? that‚Äôs crazy for how tiny they are ‚Äî and i would eat like the whole sleeve!!!

title: Nice app but...
body: I gave 3 stars because of the obvious amount of work that went into developing this app. It looks like a great app. Two things. More than half of the recipes I was able to view have a startling high percentage of fat‚Äî45-56%. It‚Äôs just my opinion but there shouldn‚Äôt be any recipe, let alone many recipes, on a health app or site that is that high in fat. Any kind of fat. Second is sugar, fiber, sodium and saturated fat are locked in the free version, items that are free in other food trackers. I‚Äôm all about paying developers. They deserve it. But I was surprised to see that. Otherwise I like the motivational portions and health tests.

title: Nice UI, but lack of food options to input. More time-consuming than it needs to be.
body: Really nice user interface, I love the option to track water, vegetables and fruit. I also really like all the smiley faces to let me know how healthy or not my meal was. However, My Fitness Pal has a much better list of food options to choose from, probably because it has been around for so much longer. It would be a better app if the developers could pre-load more nutritious information from brands and restaurants without relying on users to have to input it. Really takes away from he ease of using the app and makes me want to go back to MFP.

title: Better than MFP but...
body: I only did a quick look around the app and really loved the design and usability of it! I love the taking a picture of your food function and having the app act as a food coach in a way. Compared to my fitness pal I already knew I would use this app more and I would actually enjoy it too... but, I wish in your diet plans there was a whole food plant base or a vegan option. I know the app seems to cater to the keto diet but would be nice to have an option and would have definitely gotten me more on board.

title: Pay before seeing any functionality, I think not!!
body: Seriously, there are hundreds of apps out there and I am not looking for recipes or details but I would like to see if there is a Whole30 or an Atkins or whatever type of recipe assortment BEFORE I sign up for a plan and give you a credit card.  I have no problem paying for a subscription but I would like to see what I am paying for before I buy.  I don‚Äôt buy a TV, car, music subscription without understanding what I am getting.  With all the other apps out there, web sites and the like I am not throwing away money just to confirm it was a waste or not.

title: Great app... but could be better
body: Ive never written a review on an app before. But this app is so amazing.... but i feel its missing some key control options that could make it absolutely perfect. And i hope the developers read this.

title: Awesome!
body: I‚Äôm very impressed with this app! I home cook all of our food and with other apps I‚Äôve typing in what I‚Äôve eaten and most of the time it didn‚Äôt have what I was looking for. This one has found everything just about every time. The down side is that a good share of the neat things on it are locked unless you buy premium...and it has a lot of adds that try to get you to buy premium too. But you still can do a lot without buying that.

title: My only complaints
body: 3 bugs:

title: Not that great
body: Some things don‚Äôt quite seem to be adding up percentages don‚Äôt match with what the numbers are saying like some how my % of protein for the day is 37% and carbs are 35% yet I‚Äôm eating way more carbs than protein gram for gram. Some how in the meal summary it‚Äôs showing that I‚Äôm under my goals by more than my daily goal over all such as saying under 50g of protein this meal and adding up all the ‚Äúunder goal‚Äù numbers and it‚Äôs way more than my daily goal over all. Numbers don‚Äôt add up which doesn‚Äôt create a accurate count of macros in turn making it more difficult to reach your goals.

title: Could be really good
body: I‚Äôve been using Lifesum on and off for about a year. I love the interface but hate the Fitbit syncing. Mostly because it doesn‚Äôt sync. I sync my Fitbit daily and even after trying to manually sync in lifesum it won‚Äôt update my workouts until 2-3 days later. Highly frustrating.

title: Beautiful Interface Awful Frustrating Inaccuracy
body: I downloaded this and another food tracking app.  Both offer free and premium subscriptions.  I was drawn to using Lifesum because the user interface is both attractive/fun and logging seemed easy and intuitive.  Unfortunately, that‚Äôs as much as Lifesum has going for it.  Even when scanning my food via barcode the calories, serving sizes, and other specific nutrition info is BLATANTLY WRONG.  I logged the same food on the other app the same way by scanning barcodes and everything came in correct.  I definitely won‚Äôt be getting a premium subscription with Lifesum when it‚Äôs free service can‚Äôt even log food accurately.  Don‚Äôt waste your time or money.

title: Total waste of money
body: I paid for premium in order to get access to the so called ‚Äúdiet plans.‚Äù What a waste of money. There are no actual meal plans associated with the selected diet plan, just a very brief explanation of what you should and shouldn‚Äôt eat. However, you can browse through the limited list of recipes that they have to build your own meal plans. That is tedious though because not all of the recommended recipes are appropriate for your selected diet plan. There is also a feature where you can select diet preferences and allergies. That doesn‚Äôt seem to inform any of the recommendations either as most of my recommended meals contained dairy of which I‚Äôm allergic to. This app was a total waste of time and money.

title: Encouraging!
body: I have tried a couple different calorie counting apps but one thing that stands out about this one and not the others is their approach. This app encourages you to get healthy. If you make a good choice it tell you ‚Äúgood job‚Äù. If you make a not so good choice it says ‚Äúthat‚Äôs ok. There‚Äôs always tomorrow ‚Äú. Most apps in this genre don‚Äôt do this and in fact what you do is usually not enough. Trying to change eating habits is anything but fun and it‚Äôs nice to have that extra pat on the back.

title: Net Carbs Doesn‚Äôt Work...
body: I love this app and have used it for almost two years, but I hate that there isn‚Äôt a way to contact the team except through a review. I‚Äôve been try to calculate my macros for my vegan & ketogenic lifestyle with LifeSum Premium, but have had an extremely difficult time. The app will tell you your net carbs, but only uses total carbs in all of its calculations. This, it tells me I‚Äôm way ahead in carbs and that I‚Äôm consuming 15-20% of my diet in carbs, when in reality it‚Äôs more like 3-4%. Please fix this, or I‚Äôll have to put my money elsewhere!!!!

title: Almost the perfect weight loss app
body: Everything about this app is great except for a couple of things. 1. When I ate something that was not in line with a keto diet, the app did not warn me that that food wasn‚Äôt in my diet. I had hoped this app would help me control my cravings. 2. I cannot figure out how to do a shopping list that is pictured in the app preview. This is important as I cannot remember all the ingredients to the recipes when at the grocery store. Fix these issues and I‚Äôll gladly give you the 2 lost stars. Overall it‚Äôs not bad for the price especially during the 30% off sub special.

title: Carbs set at 50%on free version
body: Love this app. It is easy and helps you stay focused. Many items already loaded. Some calorie errors but you can correct them. One thing to watch is the free version is set at 50% carb level which is high. 40% is more the recommended but I just do the math and adjust. There are may adjustments if you purchase the monthly plan, wish it was a purchase and not a subscription. Recommended! My husband started using it also.  Enjoy! üòä

title: Pretty, but Needs work
body: First, I‚Äôm willing to change my review if these issues are fixed.

title: Enjoy the interface
body: This has been a very easy to use app and I‚Äôve enjoyed tracking calories and meals. You have to buy premium to access the different eating/diet/fasting plans other than calorie tracking ‚Äî I was disappointed in that at first, as that's what I had wanted, use BUT I‚Äôm giving 4 stars still because the daily tracking has been very simple, water count is part of free plan, you can easily see where you‚Äôre at and it adds exercise from my phone health app automatically. üëçüèªüëçüèª

title: Barcode scanner and search functions - significantly lacking
body: This app is extremely sub par when it comes to searching for food and scanning barcodes on food items.

title: Very helpful save some bumps
body: Certainly above average but not perfect. It‚Äôs very convenient in keeping track of your calorie count and finding the best foods for you. I love the option to scan barcodes. I like how the app adjusts your allotted daily calories according to your current weight and how many calories you burn.

title: Poor nutritional database and customer service
body: I signed up the annual subscription with the option two cancel within two weeks for a refund. I liked the various options for different kinds of diets and recipe ideas.

title: Grams please for recipes, otherwise good stuff
body: Updated: Thanks for the response‚Äîfeature request submitted, and I‚Äôll update stars to 5 when the feature appears, or I‚Äôll have to go back to Chronometer, which has more functionality but doesn‚Äôt do as good a job of showing data. Also, how about water entry on the Apple Watch? Thanks!

title: Life sum is great.
body: I personally think this app is good because it makes plans for you that are nice and easy and for the water you can keep track on your fats, protein and carbs. Also this is good so you can see how many steps you have made if you think you are lazy you will be impressed on how many steps you have made. I recommend this app for people who want to be healthy or just for people to know if they are good or bad so you can go see a doctor if you are bad.

title: Could be better
body: I loved using the free version enough to purchase it. Only then is when I realized that you can‚Äôt customize anything. I like the layout more than fitness pal and it‚Äôs all together a beautiful app, but for almost $50, you should be able you customize as much as you‚Äôd like. There‚Äôs a limit to how many new measurements you can add, you can‚Äôt adjust your macros, you can‚Äôt adjust your water, and there‚Äôs only a hand full of plans. If the app had the option to do all those things it would be the best tracking app out there I‚Äôd say. But it doesn‚Äôt and I don‚Äôt recommend spending your money on it. The paid version is just like the free version. You aren‚Äôt missing much.

title: Less is more...
body: I love the simplicity of the app, and upgraded to premium for 3 months.

title: Never even was able to use the app
body: WELL, I would love to write a review of the actual app if I could. BUT, I couldn‚Äôt even get logged in to the app because I never got past the general information page, where they ask for age, height, current weight and goal weight. It kept telling me the ‚ÄúToo low BMI‚Äù when I put in my goal weight - even if I put the weight as 1 pound less than my current weight. Or if I put my current weight as 50 lbs heavier than I was. I tried several different weight combinations with no prevail to get past this page. I tried looking up this problem online and found no answer. Therefore, this app went straight to delete and I guess I‚Äôll try another one!

title: Missing piece:
body: This app is amazing, whether you want to gain weight or lose it via your diet.

title: Great app!
body: Beautiful to look at and add things. I just started to get into tracking my food and tried a couple before this one won me over. It‚Äôs so sleek and nice to use. I do wish there was an option where the app could get used to your eating habits and you can add your foods for a couple of weeks before commenting on how much healthier you could be. Also instead of just saying less carbs or fat suggest recipes you could have made. And one little gripe I wish there was an option for a 32oz water bottle

title: Pretty good
body: It‚Äôs a pretty good app all together. It has pretty diverse meal options to track and it has a water counter. It has lots of different diets if you‚Äôre willing to pay the extra money.

title: Option to add your own recipes
body: I actually really don‚Äôt like the fact that I can‚Äôt seem to find (or easily find if it‚Äôs there) a way to add in my own recipes.  I like to plan ahead my meals and add them into my food diary the night before.  I‚Äôm not going to have the option to take a picture of it to see if it can figure out what I‚Äôm eating.  It‚Äôs also a bit lacking in recipes in general in the data base, when I do a search.

title: The app keeps saying I‚Äôm too young
body: I have heard many great things about the app, but I tried to set up an account and the first question they ask is what‚Äôs your weight and what‚Äôs your goal weight. After I finished typing in my information the keyboard popped up again. So I clicked next and a thing popped up saying I was too young for the app. When I clicked the next button on the bottom of the screen the questions about my weight were still on the screen. So I filled everything out and put my age in and it still said I was too young for the app. I tried deleting the app and re-downloading it, but it still didn‚Äôt work. I really hope this gets fixed soon.

title: Pretty great, room to improve
body: This app is excellent, except I've been cooking my own homemade meals lately, so I can't really track my eating habits with this. It would be great if there was a way to have a recipe book and be able to add each ingredient you have in each recipe. Then you could add any of your recipes with the information already set aside for you so you can add a portion of homemade meals to your daily diet. I know there is a way to do this kind of, but you have to insert each ingredient one by one each time you eat it.

title: I love this app BUT
body: All of a sudden, my burned calories portion of the daily overview just stopped working after updating the app. No steps are counted either ‚òπÔ∏è I love this app and have the premium subscription. I love all the things you get with it, but it‚Äôs really annoying to have the burned calories feature completely stop working. I‚Äôve tried every option to fix it - deactivated my iPhone and Apple Watch connection, restarted my phone, and even redownloaded the app. Still no luck and haven‚Äôt heard back from supper yet üòï

title: Great App but needs improvements
body: I like how I am able to track everything on this app compared to others. It‚Äôs great that you can measure your overall fitness and choose a food plan to follow based off your health. But the food recipes in my opinion are lacking. I find them to be a little too much with ingredients. I‚Äôve seen people lose weight just by eating simpler meals than what they offer. I‚Äôd appreciate it if they could dumb down the meals for beginners that are starting out that way they have a chance.

title: I have a suggestion that I believe would help many
body: I enjoy this app, it‚Äôs very wonderful and easy to navigate. My suggestion is to add a body type feature to help men and women cater to their body type. I‚Äôm speaking of the categories of Ectomorph, Mesomorph, and Endomorph. I‚Äôd love for the daily caloric intake to be shaped around certain people‚Äôs body types. It would help people to target their dietary preferences. Thank you for reading and hopefully this feature will be added in the future as I believe it would be helpful to me and many other people!

title: Helps me stay on track
body: I was using my fitness pal app for a while cuz my doctor recommended it i got a Apple Watch and tried syncing it to my fitness pal it would add my calories burned to what I could eat so I thought work out more eat more but with Lifesum they don‚Äôt do that your calories burned are not added to ashy you can eat what you can eat it stays the same  it also helps me with recording how much water I drink it‚Äôs awesome give it a shot you won‚Äôt regret it.

title: Great app except for one thing...
body: I have been using Lifesum to track my macros and calories and it's played a major role in losing 11 pounds in 5 weeks.

title: Very good app, but...
body: The app is very good, but it does not recognise my strength workouts from my Apple Watch as strength training. Instead, it logs it as ‚ÄúTraditional‚Äù Strength Training.

title: It‚Äôs good, but not GREAT
body: I enjoy this app. It‚Äôs very aesthetically pleasing. I‚Äôm not a fan of the recipes. They‚Äôre for people have a whole lotta time. I love the scan barcode feature, but I feel it‚Äôs necessary to log food because whenever I search for something, it rearely matches up to the nutrition label or I can‚Äôt find it at all. Is I scan 99% of things and have to make sure to save it as a favorite in order to find it again. It also doesn‚Äôt minus carbs for fiber. But I like that it reminds me to log my weight. I love that it has the smiley faces or the üòë face of it isn‚Äôt in guidelines with my plan.

title: Be careful before you subscribe!
body: I was recommended this app by someone and decided to try it out. I liked the interface and the kinds of tips they had to offer. Hadn‚Äôt been on the app longer than a few minutes before they were offering plans. Premium says it was only a few dollars a month for a wide variety of benefits. Thinking it was a month to month plan only to find out they outrightly charge you $50. They also don‚Äôt email you to let you know that you subscribed to it except for a receipt from Apple for an amount. Apple won‚Äôt process a refund either. $50 isn‚Äôt worth the basic features they give you for weight loss. Spend carefully.

title: Love it, but...
body: I love the interface of this app. It‚Äôs really intuitive, thoughtful and aesthetically pleasing, but lacking two major things that other Macro managers come with:

title: The 1st app to help with unhealthy patterns
body: This is the best health/fitness app I‚Äôve come across (and I‚Äôve tried many over the years).

title: Helpful for tracking my keto diet
body: Great app! Downloaded it to help me track my keto macros. I love how it easy it is to type in the food I‚Äôm eating. The scanner is especially impressive because it recognizes most foods with barcodes. Also love that it syncs to Apple Health. Only downside is how many features are limited to premium and how often that‚Äôs advertised (kind of annoying). Since I just got the app I‚Äôm not sure I want to pay $30+ for it a year, but if I continue using it a lot then I might upgrade to get more features.

title: Can‚Äôt get past the sign up page
body: I was really excited to get this app because it‚Äôs. anew year and i vowed to become healthier overall. I‚Äôve seen it be promoted by all of my favorite youtubers so i thought why not download it. When I finally got it, I tried to create an account, but after I entered my name and hit ‚ÄúDone‚Äù the app would give me the loading symbol for about 5 minutes before I gave up. I tried again the next day, but the same thing happened and the app wouldn‚Äôt load. This has nothing to do with my wifi because all of my other apps have been working just fine. Please fix this, thank you

title: Carb counts/food records
body: I have been using this app for about a week now. I have found that the carbohydrate counts don‚Äôt seem to be accurate. For instance, today my tracker is telling me that after 1 tablespoon of butter in my coffee I still have 50 g of carbohydrates available. Even for the keto medium as this is called that is way too high. Also, as I read a package and get the net carbs they don‚Äôt match what you have in your records. They always seem higher. Also, every time I have taken a picture of a UPC it just says this is interesting. I would suggest fine-tuning the keto side of your app.

title: Good concept but buggy app
body: It's very difficult to find and calculate many of the foods, even the ones with recipe suggestions. It's not consistent with measuring, frequently making you select Kcal versus grams, tablespoon, cups, etc.

title: Very happy + results
body: I downloaded this app Jan 6 when I started my ultimate life style change. I‚Äôve tried many other apps like my fitness pal and 8 fit, and none of them really helped me. This app is the holy grail though. I do pay for the premium, but it‚Äôs 100% worth it. This app has so many great resources and it tracks steps now which is awesome. I‚Äôve had the app now about 23 days and I‚Äôve lost 19.1 pounds. If you‚Äôre looking for a good app this is the one. You got this!

title: Lifesum helps me stay on track
body: I‚Äôve been using Lifesum for the past two weeks, and find that not only am I drinking more water but I am much more conscious of opportunities to walk and taking better note of when I eat just for the sake of eating. I was taking in  a lot more calories than I knew! It‚Äôs super helpful to have this simple way of doublechecking myself; makes me think twice about eating that second piece of pizza or that tempting donut at work.

title: Okay app
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for a few days now, it‚Äôs okay.. it does half of what I like but I‚Äôm trying to learn around it. I‚Äôm frustrated that I can‚Äôt edit a meal I have already created and when adding a new food it doesn‚Äôt allow me to enter in certain measurements without having to convert it or figuring out another way of documenting which is also super frustrating. I chose a 3 week meal plan but there aren‚Äôt a ton of different food options likes other than about 8 which some I don‚Äôt eat

title: Small issue but good overall
body: Whenever I add a meal from the meal plan to my diary as tracked it takes a little bit for it to show up. I end up having to add something manually for it to update my diary. I‚Äôll have to go back and delete what was manually entered to keep my diary accurate. It can be frustrating to have to do several times a day, it‚Äôs just not as seamless as I feel it could be. Overall, the information is great and the layout is nice. If I had to recommend any premium nutrition app, this would be it based on the plethora of information alone.

title: Very helpful but wish I didn‚Äôt have to pay for good features
body: I love this app, it‚Äôs super useful, accurate and has a nice layout. It‚Äôs wonderful for anybody who wants to be healthier, and it‚Äôs pretty easy to use...BUT I don‚Äôt understand why you have to pay for literally all the REALLY GOOD features! I mean, I get that they need to pay for it somehow, but I think that‚Äôs a bit excessive. Also, the way they tease you with it. Like ‚ÄúWanna make healthy choices with a meal plan? HAHAHA that‚Äôll cost you!‚Äù I think this app is good, but I‚Äôm probably going to download and actually free food tracker and delete this one.

title: Great app so far but...
body: Great app so far but I tried to upgrade to the premium and it just sits there trying to load for awhile so I have to force close the application. Also, I don‚Äôt understand why it shows ‚Äúmonthly‚Äù rates for 3-6-12 months but then takes the whole sum out in one transaction - I feel like that‚Äôs pointless and you may as well have it make sense and make it into a 3-6-12 mo contract and take out monthly. Otherwise it‚Äôs a great calorie tracking tool and I like the smiley faces, it‚Äôs a nice little touch of motivation.

title: This app is motivating!
body: My son uses this app and lost 50 lbs and has kept it off 4 months now! I asked him how and he said Lifesum. I would ask him again and he said ‚ÄúJust check in with Lifesum every day! Make sure you record everything you eat!‚Äù He made it sound easy and he reassures me it is once you get going! He helped me chose a plan and I‚Äôve started! The easy to use app has lots of fun features and encouragement along the way. Already love it!!

title: Beautiful, clean tracker
body: The app works great for tracking intake and monitoring calories and macro nutrients. Sometimes it's a pain to look up foods, especially if you cook a lot at home, but the "scan the barcode" feature really helps. I wish there were a way to create a food, ie home cooked recipes, by listing all ingredients and quantities, and then choosing a single serving of that total to track for my meal. Would love more variety (and spell checking!) in the recipes, they are really limited and difficult to understand.

title: Overall Great App
body: Love using this app to track my diet and water intake. One suggestion would be to allow more water setting options. I drink from a 64oz water jug on most days and when I‚Äôm not using that one I‚Äôm using a 32oz jug. I feel most people are using those two water jugs. It would make it easier allowing one of those as option. With the two options available now, I am not able to calculate my water intake exactly

title: Fantastic
body: I simply wanted to make sure I wasn‚Äôt eating too much junk and now I can ensure i‚Äôm getting enough proteins along with steps and exercise. I‚Äôve actually been eating a bit more (good food) than normal as I realized i‚Äôm not eating enough, and I‚Äôve noticed I‚Äôve been loosing fat.

title: I Didn‚Äôt Like It
body: I had been using MyFitnessPal, and I decided to try this app based on good reviews. LifeSum is less intuitive to use than MyFitnessPal. The biggest problem with this app is that most of the foods I scanned pulled up the wrong nutritional information. Others had a default serving of an entire package of an item, instead of a serving.

title: Nice design but inaccurate
body: I downloaded and decided to give this a shot to see how it compares to some of the other food and calorie tracking apps that I use. The first food I tried to enter was totally inaccurate a d there was no way to change it without creating a new food. Accuracy is pretty important if you are counting calories. On the particular item it was over by 40 calories. I wanted to give it a shot but the inaccuracy straight out of the gate made me decide to delete. The design is really appealing. For accuracy I would recommend Cronometer. For simplicity Lose It.

title: Have to pay
body: As a watcher of the BramFam channel I saw a video where you sponsored them and then saw the app and decided to get it. That video was made a while ago. The app seemed nice at first but today I tried to see the recipes and found out you had to pay for it. I know when people get sponsored they leave out details so you want to get the app but there‚Äôs nothing making this app different because you have to pay for EVERYTHING else. It doesn‚Äôt really let me put in the exact thing I ate or drank but I really mainly wanted to try some recipes and I can‚Äôt now.

title: Just ok
body: While there are some features I like about this ap (user-friendly and ability to sync my health ap to it), there is a glitch that has been happening from the moment I downloaded it. I enter my weight and it‚Äôll log it in. After a few days, it automatically goes back to my original weight (and loses the data that I entered). So, it keeps fluctuating and jumping back to original weight even though I‚Äôm not entering that info. I mentioned it to the ap company. They said they knew about it and it hasn‚Äôt been fixed in 2 months. I would have bought premium if not for that glitch.

title: Nice app BUT a lot of kcal are wrong.
body: At first I really loved this app and all the features; but as I began using it more I noticed that when I would scan a barcode it would give me the wrong kcal for all the food. This would not be a problem if there were some way to correct it. There also doesn‚Äôt seem to be as many stored food options and restaurants as MyFitnessPal, which requires me to go to google to look up everything I eat on cheat days, which is annoying. I really liked this app but I‚Äôll be going back to MyFitnessPal until kcal are corrected and more restaurants and food items are added.

title: Pretty good- could be better for Keto
body: I really like this app a lot overall. Nice reminders and tips without being too annoying. Food searching pretty easy and plenty preloaded.

title: It‚Äôs great, but...
body: One thing I do not enjoy is all the brand suggestions the app gives me. None of the brands are the ones I buy, many of them are fast food (I don‚Äôt do that either) and a simple homemade option is buried someplace (if even there). So, entering foods in my diary is a bit cumbersome and time consuming. Sometimes I give up on trying to find the fit and choose whatever from the list. But then my score goes down because the app thinks I had fast food. Grrrr.  Otherwise I love this app. Great job, you guys!

title: Love this app!
body: I‚Äôve tried a lot of tracking apps and Lifesum is by far my favorite. I like the challenges to boost my weekly score. My favorite part is that it teaches me the pros and cons of the food I‚Äôm eating! There are a bunch of different plans to chose from and a simple quiz to help you find the best plan for your lifestyle.

title: Lif sum not syncing to Health Properly
body: I started to use Lifesum, and after a couple of days I realized that my information wasn‚Äôt being synced to the Health app. So I went to setting in Lifesum and turned on the exporting of data to Health again. The next day, the same thing happens, then the next day, again. I sent an email but they haven‚Äôt responded. I hope they tell what‚Äôs wrong or I think I move to another app with less glitches (in case this ends up being one or that I‚Äôm just doing something wrong)

title: BEST. APP. EVER.
body: seriously. if you‚Äôre looking for something to encourage healthy eating, get you started on your fitness journey, or loose weight, this is totally perfect for you. it has a beautiful design, and I love that it still works amazing and has great features without having to go premium! although I can only imagine how much cooler it would be with the added features! if you‚Äôre considering a food and exercise tracker, get this one!! you won‚Äôt regret it. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Great for nutrition, mediocre for exercise
body: Pros:

title: The free part is an outdated ‚Äúclassic‚Äù diet of approximately 1600 calories
body: You have to buy a subscription to do anything besides track weight, water and food.

title: Highly recommend
body: First off I love how they give you a test of what you e been eating and what you do during your time throughout your day! You can make your own account (which I love) and they send you notifications about things to eat! ( you can choose if you want notifications or not) I love this app so much! If you want to gain or lose weight or just even keep track of your food levels please download this app!!!!!

title: Good app but won't let me purchase premium
body: I had this app before on an old Apple ID and loved the premium features. However, now it is not letting me sign up for premium. It advertises 30% off, but then when I try to purchase it does not let me- saying that I am ineligible and the purchase did not go through. Honestly this app isn't worth it to me if I can't go premium, so it's very frustrating that I can't purchase this product when I know it will help me reach my fitness goals. Please fix this glitch!!! I've been trying to purchase premium for days.

title: Unless you opt for premium, this is not worth the time
body: Found this through the Apple health app. Advertised as free. Answered 41 questions about eating and exercise habits. Was given calculations for goals. Then, to access recipes or suggested eating plans I will need to upgrade to premium. I‚Äôll stick to MFP which has all of the same free tracking options and does waste my time with pop up cartoon questions that require a premium membership for a generic evaluation or suggestions. . So be advised, know if you want any guidance through this app opt for premium or you will waste your time giving Lifesum personal info bec/ no help is given without a cost. There are plenty of other app available.

title: Love it ‚ù§Ô∏è
body: I‚Äôve never been good at tracking what I eat. I started putting on some weight and decided I need to know where my calories are going. Lifesum shows me good choices, bad choices and where I stand at the end of the day. The notifications are great encouragement to drink, eat or move. It syncs with my Fitbit so I know what I burn and what I eat. And that‚Äôs just the beginning! There are diet plans, recipes, blogs and so much more to help you get to where you want to be.

title: Obsessed, Small Problem
body: I'm OBSESSED with this app. I've been testing it out for the week before paying for the subscription but I'm really happy so far. It's very helpful and a great tool for those who want to loose weight, just get in shape or stay on track. It's got a hand food journal and a lot of really positive aspects.

title: Great health app
body: Definitely a great app with a lot of potential. I love how it connects with my Health app on my iPhone and it allows me to scan the barcodes of the things I eat for easy access. This app is great for anyone who is health conscious or trying to loose/gain Weight. I see a lot of applications in this app to be used for people trying the Keto diet. My only recommendation would be to work out some of the bugs with the scanner because sometimes the app didn‚Äôt give me the right calorie to portion ratio that was printed on the box

title: Easy to use
body: I tried a few different food tracking apps and this seemed to be the most accurate in tracking my exercise and it is easy to use. The only thing I would like is if I could manually add food with any known nutritional values like protein, fat, etc. instead of just having the option of putting calories in only. I also wish there was an option to maintain weight versus only lose/gain weight. Sometimes it stops recording your exercise as well.

title: Good, but Very Buggy
body: Was loving this app both in its design and ease of use. The most recent update pretty much ended that. All of my personal information, custom food, and settings in the app were erased or reset. Causing me to waste quite a bit of time resetting things and emailing support. If these bugs are not fixed soon I probably will not continue using this app.

title: Tedious
body: The reviews were overwhelmingly positive so I thought why not and went for a 6-month subscription. Big mistake! One of the things that appealed to me when I previewed the app was the variety of plans. The downside was that it doesn‚Äôt explain the details of each forcing me to try and research each. After signing up I found that the meals did not appeal to me. I grew up on the Pacific Rim cuisine of Hawaii and I could not see preparing and eating the recipes included. Also it‚Äôs extremely difficult to enter food consumed. The inventory is not as comprehensive as another app that I am not naming. Expensive lesson learned as I am not going to be using this for most of the 6 months that I purchased.

title: Unfriendly app & total waste of money
body: I am not sure how this app got such high rating.   Now I understand why the app would not let you have a free trial period before you pay for subscription.  I took a leap of faith based on the ratings & positive reviews which i am sure now are all fakes.

title: Not worth it
body: This app does not synchronize with your Fitbit or step counter. It doesn‚Äôt allow you to update nutritional information of foods that are missing such information on their database. It doesn‚Äôt give you a full report of your macro nutrients at the end of each day. It doesn‚Äôt allow you to see graphics of your macro nutrients. Long story short, all of these features that are missing are free on my fitness pal. I regret paying $50 to use this app when I could‚Äôve gotten all of this for freeWith my fitness pal. You do get recipes that are specific for your type of diet (vegan, keto, etc.) But you can find it for free extensively on the Internet. This app is not worth it.

title: Just the best
body: Honestly, I‚Äôve been looking for something simple, easy to use, and still fun/motivating/nice to look at  and this is it. Tried My Fitness Pal, Noom, and a few others I didn‚Äôt use for more than a day. Then this one was advertised on IG and I just loved it right away. Still held off on premium for a week first but it‚Äôs even better now that I‚Äôve upgraded. It‚Äôs helped me stay on track for weight loss a lot.

title: Can‚Äôt make your own meals
body: I enjoy this app and it‚Äôs recipes, however I get things like sub bakery delivered every once and a while and I cook homemade dinners as well, so I would love to be able to make your own meal and edit nutritional information. Sadly it only allows you to enter food items into a meal instead of letting you just input the nutritional values of everything, which makes it extremely difficult when u have many ingredients but I know how many carbs, fats are in it. Sadly disappointing for having to pay for the full service.

title: So-So So Far
body: Frustrated that I cannot go back and change my starting weight.  I was off when I entered during set up and trying to go back and edit only makes it look like I gained the difference, instead of showing it as my starting weight.

title: Great overall
body: Very easy to use. Gives you just the right amount of notification, encouragement, nagging, advice to keep you wanting to use it.

title: No custom macro targets
body: I just got an Apple Watch and I was so excited to find this app since the one I currently use to track macros isn‚Äôt compatible with the watch. But as soon as I downloaded it and put in my info, I realized it doesn‚Äôt let me set my macro targets myself. What‚Äôs the point of this then?? The carbs were waaaay too high for me to lose weight and the protein was way too low. It‚Äôs not useful as is. I have to pay to go premium to get a bunch of features I‚Äôm not interested in just to be able to set custom macro targets? There‚Äôs not even a free trial to see if going premium is worth it, which every other app I‚Äôve seen has. This is very disappointing. Deleted the app immediately.

title: So mad
body: I paid for the premium membership, I went to log my food in and it had log me out of the app, I tried logging back in and it said i didn‚Äôt have an account. So I tried signing up again.( Mind u I‚Äôve had the app for a month or more, using it with no problem, then I which from free to paid membership.) When I did that all my information was still there except my membership that I paid for. I tried contacting them of course I get a auto email saying they are too busy to answer my email right now but they‚Äôll get to me as soon as possible. I paid for a service I would expect a little better customer service response than that.

title: Amazing Free Version
body: For most food tracking apps, the free version is temporary and full of ads for the more expensive, but this free version includes meal water, fruits, veggies, weight, and exercise tracking. Meals are rated on a simple scale for their health and calorie tracking is based on whether you intend to lose, maintain, or gain weight. You can search up almost anything you eat to track it or scan the food itself. It‚Äôs really helpful!

title: Awesome for Built In Plans but Not Custom or By Macros
body: I‚Äôve tried many apps like this, I always got annoyed and deleted them. Lifesum is really easy and user friendly, I actually WANT to use it. Now that I‚Äôm trying to go by macros I wish there was a plan to calculate or custom input your macros & calories. I‚Äôm not paying premium just to switch the plan to make it more accurate to what I‚Äôm actually trying to achieve. So I leave on its current plan & just mentally check against my own personal macros/calories.

title: 3 calories count issues that should be addressed
body: Good app overall, but:

title: Easy to Use‚Äîsmall complaints
body: This is a simple app to use. Pick the type of diet you‚Äôd like to follow and if you don‚Äôt like it, switch it up. There are a wide number of foods already available to choose from and you can add new foods and recipes. When adding new foods, it would be helpful to be able to differentiate between added sugars and naturally occurring sugars, especially since the app considers added sugars to be less healthy.

title: How Do I know What To Shop For?
body: I just signed up for the premium version of this app. So far I really like the look of the app and it has selected the Paleo plan for me. The recipes seem pretty easy and straightforward to make, however the description said that there was a digital shopping list. I can‚Äôt seem to find that. How do I know which foods to eat on a Paleo plan that are not part of the recipes? There doesn‚Äôt seem to be any food lists in this app that I could work off of and perhaps create my own recipes. Can someone give me an answer on that? Thanks!

title: Go-to calorie and macro tracjer
body: Been using this for over 6 months. Physically I've improved tremendously all that's to tracking my diet and setting goals. This is basically the full version of MyFitnessPal. The only things the subscription gives you are "ease of use" features like setting your own macros and calories rather than what it calculates for you. Subscription might be worth it but I've gotten on fine without.

title: Nice App
body: I got Lifesum and it was a great experience but I ended up not using it and I decided to delete my account. It was really easy to delete and that is what made me decide to write a review. I have never seen a app that could be deleted easily. I always have to search online for a half an hour and then find out that I have to call a number and say why, but with Lifesum I could just go to the website, log in and hit delete.

title: Really great for monitoring overall health
body: I really like this app for monitoring overall trends in my diet. It‚Äôs very helpful for creating a balanced meal and I love that you can add your own recipes and meals. I also really enjoy how they made it easy to copy previous days meals from one diary entry to the next. I just wish it gave micronutrient information as well as a way to track supplements! If they added those features it would be a practically perfect health app haha

title: Constantly Promoting Premium DO NOT DOWNLOAD!
body: So I got this app because I kept hearing great things about it, how easy it was to use, all the great recipes they offer, etc. Any time I tried to look at anything it would tell me to get premium. The app gave me a suggestion to look at certain recipes and then I would try to scroll and look and BAM ‚ÄúGet premium‚Äù would pop up again. It is incredibly frustrating and impossible to even use the app when I keep getting badgered to join premium. It seems like all this app is trying to do is take your money. I will be going back to using MyFitnessPal which is way more user friendly and not constantly pushing premium.

title: Nutrition and recipe breakdown
body: As a former subscriber to other meal tracking apps, Lifesum is definitely an improvement. What I miss from some other apps is the ability to adjust recipes to remove certain ingredients. You can adjust the nutrition information but I rely on the app to calculate the nutrition info based on what‚Äôs in the recipe. It doesn‚Äôt seem accurate to if you can simply delete all of the net carbs from the nutrition info.

title: Life Changing!!!
body: I‚Äôve lost (and kept off) over 5 pounds just through making smarter, more informed decisions about what I put into my body. I‚Äôm not paying for any of the premium subscriptions, and I‚Äôm not going on any extreme diet to get the results that I‚Äôve gotten, and I absolutely love love love that. The barcode scanner and database of foods make it so easy to log my food intake and the water tracker pushes me to get my daily water in. The recipes are amazing and taste great!

title: i would die for this app
body: this app makes me aware of what i‚Äôm eating and the calories, fat and carbs that‚Äôs in it. I‚Äôm aiming to eat healthier foods now and it even records my steps from the health app. this is the only app i‚Äôve actually made progress with. i‚Äôm extremely dehydrated but this app has made me to drink from a cup a day to at least 6 cups, which isn‚Äôt a lot, don‚Äôt get me wrong, but it‚Äôs a start. i changed me and i‚Äôve already lost weight. thank u :)

title: Doesn‚Äôt work on my Apple Watch
body: Update: so the next day the app showed up on my Apple Watch. It‚Äôs working great now. No clue what happened but I love this app.

title: Food database needs work
body: I love the interface of this app. It is so great for tracking based on whatever way of eating you prefer. However, the food data base is a mess. First, the scanner functionality works about 50% of the time; and second, the food database is SO difficult to use. Users have entered information and, instead of correctly entering serving sizes, have entered unreliable data which makes it incredibly hard to track with accuracy. I wish this app‚Äôs interface and My Fitness Pal‚Äôs food database could have a baby.

title: Buggy & notifications are buggy, but love this app
body: I have a non-life-threatening, but moderately annoying stomach issue. My doctor recommended me keep up with what I eat as well as increase my water intake and exercise.
