Lifesum has been an excellent all-in-one app for all three of those. They are always quick to update and I really like their Apple Watch water notifications.

title: jj
body: I think this app is good but I feel like it‚Äôs hard for me to use cause sometimes when I make food and there‚Äôs not a specific name for it, it‚Äôs hard to track it in my diary and it would be better if you could customize like the ingredients so that you can be exact instead of choosing something that‚Äôs close to what you made. Also with the exercises I put some of them in but there aren‚Äôt searches for it when I look it would be easier if you could do like a way to put in the exact workout you did.

title: Not at all what I needed
body: I'm a hardcore dieter. I've been on the Paleo diet for a couple days and I was hoping the is app would help get through it. Instead, It's ruined my diet streak. In the Paleo diet, I'm not allow to intake any carbs, sugars, or fruits. But the "unhappy face" doesn't really know what my body needs, nor does this app have any good recipes for the Paleo diet. It's a pure meat and veggie diet. How hard is this to understand?

title: Should not be subscription based
body: I bought the subscription because I was excited to see they had a ketogenic ‚Äúplan‚Äù but the app doesn‚Äôt offer much. There are maybe 20 recipes in each category (breakfast, lunch, dinner) and 80% of the breakfast options are basically just some variation of the same egg dish. Also if you select to view all recipes in a category you can‚Äôt back up and return to another category. You have to restart the app.

title: Changed Everything
body: I‚Äôve suffered from eating disorders since I was 12, and I started using this app to keep track and regulate what I eat. I loved it so much I bought premium and wow, this is definitely the best out there. Lifesum is super user-friendly and fun to use. It has a wealth of features without feeling tedious or confusing. It‚Äôs changed and helped my eating habits so much, and really helped me make progress towards beating my disorder. Thank you Lifesum!

title: Be careful when purchasing premium
body: This app is very misleading when purchasing Premium. It gives you a break down of how much you would pay each month when purchasing multiple months. This leads you to believe you paying monthly and can choose to cancel at anytime if you choose. After receiving a $30 bill, I realized that you pay the total upfront and you are not billed monthly. When I reached out to the App Store, I was told the purchase is non-refundable. Even though I am now stuck with the app for a year, I doubt I will even try it now. I am disappointed that I was lead to believe I had the flexibility of cancelling if I chose to do so.

title: Useful only if you pay
body: Don‚Äôt get this app unless you‚Äôre willing to take cash out of your pocket just to get a suggested meal plan from a test. Some other person here wrote a similar review and I couldn‚Äôt agree more. I deleted the app right away and downloaded it again just to write this review because I don‚Äôt recommend it unless you really want to pay for it. I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre gonna get many people wanna download this app if you‚Äôre asking for them to pay for something for a suggested meal plan. You‚Äôre better of getting more people to want to use your app if you earn money through ads because this just seems like a rip off.

title: Meh.
body: I like the aesthetic of the app so far, but there are a few things that I‚Äôm struggling with. It‚Äôs slow to sync with my Apple Watch, and it‚Äôs impossible to add meals by their macro amounts. For example, i wanted to add a treat (soy green tea frap from Starbucks) and I can‚Äôt add it unless I submit each ingredient, rather than inputting the nutrition information from starbucks‚Äô website (title, number of carbs, protein, etc). So I end up just putting it in by number of calories (which rarely works on the first try) and it defeats the purpose. I paid for a year‚Äôs subscription‚Äî hopefully it gets better from here or I will probably cancel this month.

title: Great but needs a little work
body: Great app but definitely some glitches. I‚Äôm doing a keto diet and had the strict plan, I wanted to see what the keto medium plan had as a limit for carbs but found it to be too many carbs and now I can‚Äôt go back to the strict one. They should let you see all of the plans available vs limiting you based on the quiz. The quiz on a web browser is also different. Making meals/recipes is a little wonky too. Everything else works out great tho. Love the barcode scanner!

title: Just need accurate calories
body: All I ask from these apps is that there is an accurate calorie database. I don't even care about macros. I've use this app for two days and it's incredibly inaccurate. Bush country style baked beans - it says 80 cal for half a cup and it's really 160 for a half cup. Van de Kamp beer battered fish fillet says 210 for one fillet when it's really 220 for two. Skippy natural peanut butter is 190 for 2 tablespoons but the app says 190 for 1 tablespoon. These are all listings with a blue checkmark beside them saying that Lifesum has verified them. I am 5'3" with a small frame so being that far off in calories would make the app completely useless to me.

title: Okay, but not great
body: It seems to be a bit glitchy, old information in my measurements tracking where I had mistyped kept popping back up. I would delete it and it seemed to be gone when I closed and reopened the app throughout the day, but reappeared the next day.

title: Love it but not inclusive
body: I love these kinds of apps and recently switched from FitnessPal (was using for years) because I like the iWatch complications better but all these apps lack inclusivity for other cultures. Really hard to add meals that are my general homemade Mexican dishes because I can never find anything or will have to add everything one by one which defeats the purpose of the app.

title: Great Health Tracker!
body: I‚Äôm loving life sum because it doesn‚Äôt push you hard to eat healthier. It just helps you set your goal and accomplish it! It is a amazing app in all but I have one problem. I would like to count my steps. When I go to count my steps it says choose you goal. I choose my goal. But when I hit set it doesn‚Äôt save it! If you could possibly fix this I would be very thankful. But overall this app is incredible!

title: So many bugs.
body: I really want to love the app but I‚Äôm having so many issues. The app never connects to the internet so I can‚Äôt use certain features, I have to click ‚Äú+‚Äù for every single pound I weigh instead of being able to type it in, I can‚Äôt connect through FB or my email (the buttons just don‚Äôt work), I can‚Äôt update goals because the app can‚Äôt connect to Internet (I also have it okay to use data), and the calories eaten and burned are always at 500 and 300 respectively. No way will I pay for an app with so many issues. I do enjoy the branding aesthetic and food tracking.

title: Great app BUT
body: So I started my diet today and after really liking the app I went ahead and paid for the premium for 3 months, well not so happy after purchasing the premium I went to hit the plan icon and it keeps shutting my app out/ closing the whole app.. so after trying over and over even making sure the app was up to date I just went ahead and cancelled the premium would have gave it 5starta if it didn‚Äôt shut down hopefully I get my money back!

title: I love this app!
body: This is my favorite tracking app ever. And no this is not a paid review. They do have a membership that you can pay for to get more ‚Äútools‚Äù but like other people I don‚Äôt want to pay for a membership. Unless you want to use the app to find and save recipes or want more food ratings, then you don‚Äôt need the paid membership. Anyways, I don‚Äôt usually do reviews but I just had to share how great this app is.

title: It‚Äôs Okay
body: This app is just like every other calorie counting app on the market, but what adds a little value is the real time ‚Äúfeedback‚Äù you receive in the way of emoji faces to indicate if the food you‚Äôre eating is good, neutral, or bad. My only complaint is they keep trying to promote this new Life Score thing, but every time I take the test it crashes while I‚Äôm halfway through and then it won‚Äôt allow me to try taking it again for like a month. I‚Äôve gone through this cycle like three times. Seemed like a cool feature if only it worked.

title: Nice visually, but tons of bugs
body: I purchased the premium version yesterday to track keto. I like how it calculates net carbs and the app is visually appealing. However, I am so disappointed with the bugs! First of all, I‚Äôve used many diet/fitness apps and never had calories and macros so off as this! One listing of a cup of pistachios says 170 and another says 617!! Also the measurements are way off on a lot of items. One tablespoon of half and half is 3.5 ounces?!! And then the calculations are off. For example I put in 2 tablespoons of half and half which is 40 calories, and then 3 tablespoons is 105! Please fix these issues!

title: So glad I found this
body: I‚Äôve been struggling so much to plan meals and stay healthy because of a cognitive disability and this tool has FINALLY made me feel more empowered to plan meals, do meal prep and meet my nutritional goals after looking for months and not finding anything that worked. It‚Äôs more helpful than professional providers I have go to for help. I wish I had found it sooner and the paid plan is worth every penny!

title: wont let me record my weight
body: I started attempting to lose 15lbs about a week ago with help from Lifesum. I accidentally forgot to record my weight yesterday, and needed to update my weight today. For some reason, every time I put in my weight (only 1.5lbs lighter than the last time i updated it in app) the app gives me a notification saying they thought I typed the wrong numbers and wanted me to try again. I‚Äôm super frustrated as I obviously want to track my progress, but cannot. Is it because it thinks I lost weight too quickly? I‚Äôm pretty young and have had an active lifestyle my whole life, so losing 1.5lbs in ~2-3 days isn‚Äôt concerning to me.

title: Lacking in homemade foods.
body: Lifesum does a pretty good job if everything you eat is from a known restaurant. The database for homemade foods in extremely lacking. You can always look up brand name foods but if you eat chicken breads with rice and broccoli good luck finding and accurate nutrient spread without adding it yourself. Really makes me angry because this is basic foods. I made a half pound Hamburger and salad and I can‚Äôt get a proper count, but a Big Mac or some obscure fast food is easily found. Honestly the only reason I‚Äôm using this app is because I made a mistake and purchased it because I thought I was choosing Lose It. Maybe check them out before paying for this one.

title: Change of heart
body: I‚Äôve been using the premium version of this app for almost a year. I loved the interface and how easy it was to use. I also enjoy the ability to connect my exercise and my scale so that I don‚Äôt have to manually enter those things in the app every time. As of late the app has been very glitchy! It logged a weight for me incorrectly and I can‚Äôt figure out how to remove it. I was missing the updated plans and only had the option of 4 plans. Like other users have stated the food log database is way off and the scanner will not work sometimes just keeps scrolling. Back on the hunt for something better!

title: Loving it for years.
body: I've had this app for about 2.5 yrs and even though I haven't been super consistent about notating my meals and workouts, I absolutely love it. The recipes I love. I love that I can give myaelf a check up on how I eat and drink and the type of workouts I do.

title: Nice app, but..
body: i really enjoy this app aesthetically and it is really nice with tracking.  unfortunately, what you get without a subscription is really minimal.  i‚Äôve had it for a week and while i‚Äôm not certain i‚Äôll get rid of it, it appears things i had when i first downloaded it are going away as time progresses.  for example, at first it allowed me to see my day summary, which was nice, now i can only see it if i buy premium.  WHICH i wouldnt be so against if i had the option to pay monthly, not the entirety of a year all at once.

title: Still no progress with the app...
body: The app still has its tracking issues. There was an obnoxious work around of logging out and back in and resetting the automatic tracker. Now it is no longer saving the want to track NetCarbs, as well as not being able to set my personal macros. I think it may be time to cancel my subscription. I kept giving it a chance after the update that killed the tracking because all of my stuff has been stored for months. At this point, i‚Äôll just count it as a loss and find a reliable app to use. I really liked LifeSum, so disappointed.

title: Waste of money
body: I spent money for a 3 month subscription, and I honestly regret it. The app is beautiful, but I feel like that‚Äôs all it is. Trying to search for foods, even just basic ones, is like pulling teeth. I searched eggplant, and nothing came up. The meal plans themselves leave a lot to be desired, and honestly, seem a little bit sketchy to me. I also don‚Äôt like feeling like I‚Äôm being shamed for food that I eat with the little frowny faces or smiling ones. Especially when they‚Äôre not even necessarily accurate. Healthy foods that I‚Äôve eaten have been given an :|. I‚Äôll stick with My Fitness Pal. It might not be as pretty, but at the very least, it seems more accurate.

title: Been loving the app up until a few days ago
body: I had been loving this app up until a few days ago when I noticed the calculations of my macros eaten was NOT matching up to the total calories eaten. It is off on multiple days. For example. Today remaining macros are 49c 16p 19f. That equals 431 calories but app is saying 465 remaining. This has been happening everyday. Might not be a big deal to some for for those of us trying to dial in our nutrition it is incredibly frustrating. Not satisfied with this app anymore. And no I am not consuming anything like alcohol that would affect the calories and not the macros

title: Aggravating
body: I did like many aspects of this app, but there were some things that were very aggravating which is why I deleted instead of purchasing premium. 1. I answered vegan in my questionnaire and yet I was recommended non vegan meal ideas. 2. I accidentally entered a whole day of meals on the wrong day and could not find a way to easily change the date instead of having to delete everything and re-enter on the correct day. 3. Food database isn‚Äôt the best and I could not figure out how to add my own foods or my own measurements.

title: Easy to use app
body: So easy and fun to use. Has most everything I need to follow my healthy meal plan and reminders to weigh in and exercise. Only request: add options to customize workout/ exercise plans. Some of us are starting over after surgery or long term inactivity. So, these limited choices-‚Äúmoderate aerobic exercise‚Äù are not applicable for us. No option for stationary biking that I can see....Otherwise, this app is just right! Thanks!

title: Yesüëèüèª
body: Honestly my favorite thing about this app is that it‚Äôs not enforcing that you need to eat less to lose weight. It gives your meal a bad rating not only if you overeat but also if you undereat. Also I love that I can just scan the barcode of something. And also how it factors in different types of exercise. Lastly I love how it gives you water tips. Overall great app! Even without the whole premium thing!

title: UPDATED: Bad start gives me little hope
body: Prior rating low because I couldn‚Äôt login. Very pleasantly surprised the developers saw my review and addressed the problem. The Login with Apple ID now works. Thanks for addressing. Haven‚Äôt yet determined whether I‚Äôll subscribe but will update rating again if/when I do. Personally, I‚Äôd prefer a free trial of seven days like most subscription apps offer (with automatic renewal payment at end of trial), otherwise pretty expensive service to try without full confidence it will do and track what I want it to track.

title: Great Fitness App
body: This app is very easy to use! Most apps are confusing and get you lost in the settings trying to do anything.

title: I like it but would like to see more
body: I like the app and I think it have a

title: Good but some flaws
body: This app tracks calories, daily protein, carbs, and fat very well and it is very quick easy to use. However, you can‚Äôt do much because most of it is limited to paying for premium. Also, one thing I would like to change is that this app sends you lots of spam mail. There is an option where you can unsubscribe from it, I have tried to unsubscribe multiple times but it always fails to deliver the unsubscription mail so I don‚Äôt know how to stop getting them unless I delete the app.

title: Unexpected Crash
body: I love this app and have been using it for awhile and with the new year was really excited to try the 3 week weight loss meal planner. After planning all day and buying food to complete all the recipes, the app decided to crash every time I click the plans tab. Now I just updated yesterday to the newest version, and the plans tab has worked fine all day- until I finally decided to track a meal. Since then it‚Äôs crashed every time I‚Äôve clicked the plans tab, I‚Äôve restarted redownloaded so just beware!

title: No longer retains information
body: I started using Lifesum based on reviews.  Initially the app worked great and I liked it more than MyFitnessPal.

title: Was great until update
body: Now it‚Äôs completely useless and I‚Äôve been trying to get someone to help for a week with no success. All I‚Äôve been told is to log out and log in which has done nothing. My data is gone, the macros are way off, I have to resync with phone daily, and the exercise tracking is waaaay off. Used to love this app but the latest update has rendered it useless and getting support is like pulling teeth. I‚Äôve emailed, tweeted, and contacted in app but have had minimal response just telling me to log out. Case was closed by company without resolution :( I hope they fix this because this was my go to app for calorie and exercise tracking.

title: Enjoying this App
body: Very simple to use. Helps me stay on track. Especially nice for reminding myself to drink water. I have been using this app for a week now. I have been using it mostly to track my net carbs since I am a newly diagnosed diabetic. With eating less refined carbs, drinking water and intermittent fasting, I‚Äôm down 5 lbs this week! This App is a huge benefit to reaching my health goal. I go back to see my endocrinologist in Jan and I am hoping my A1C will be down!

title: Can‚Äôt add anything since the ‚Äúupdate‚Äù
body: I really like the idea of being rated on the quality of food I‚Äôm eating instead of just the calories in it. It‚Äôs more helpful to be told why a food is unbalanced instead of getting on the scale every week or so and wondering why your hard work isn‚Äôt paying off. However, whoever programmed this app kind of dropped the ball. Whenever you give it too many commands in row, it just crashes which isn‚Äôt ideal for an app, especially one that‚Äôs being paid for.

title: Okay product, prefer FitBit but only this tracks with Apple Watch
body: The app is handy for tracking apps and easily picks up barcodes, but the calorie tracking isn‚Äôt as flexible as FitBit‚Äôs. For example, it automatically defines your serving as, let‚Äôs say, 2 tablespoons, but you can‚Äôt edit the number. So if you only had 1 tbps, you‚Äôd have to write it as 1/2 serving. Not that big of a deal, but annoying if you‚Äôre accustomed to more flexible UI. Similarly, the ads for getting premium service are obnoxious and make navigating the app frustrating at times.

title: Watch app not good
body: While this app is pretty good (if you pay for premium), it leaves a Lot to be desired for the Apple Watch version.  Very little functionality for the watch. It doesn‚Äôt really do anything, and won‚Äôt update my ‚Äúcalories burned‚Äù which always stay at ‚Äú0‚Äù, despite my workout, health, and activity apps showing that‚Äôs not the case.  Not impressed with this app. Even less impressed they force you to pay for subscription for just basic functionality, and again; nothing useful for Apple Watch.

title: Great for tracking
body: This app is great for tracking your calories and macros. However, I don‚Äôt recommend following the amount of calories it tells you to eat especially if you input how many calories you burned during your workout. The amount is way too high. As long as you know how many calories you need to eat this app is great. I chose the lose weight option and it told me I needed to be eating over 4000 calories which is way off.

title: Love it!
body: The aesthetics of this app are great, as well as the functionality of it. I‚Äôve used a lot of apps and food trackers, and the fact that this reminds me to drink water, gives me calorie goals for each meal and provides the option of following different diets, makes it easy and streamlined.

title: This app is great üëç
body: So I woke up one morning, realized I wanted to lose weight, so I downloaded an app that my friend told me about, and that was this app. The day I got it I felt motivated to eat healthier because I could see how much I was eating way better than I originally could. I even tested the app myself and the calorie counts are very accurate. If you want to keep track of what and how much you eat I definitely recommend this app!

title: New to the app
body: I just downloaded this app because I‚Äôve heard good things about it. I was thinking of buying the upgrade version but I just realized I input my lunch and when I opened it again it was missing. I‚Äôd hate to have to input my meals over and over because it‚Äôs not being saved correctly. I really like everything about the app but that one thing would frustrate me. Can it be fixed?

title: False advertisement.... be warned.
body: I just paid for the premium, the app advertises that you get a shopping list and meal plan. Well none of that exists on my app once I paid. So I basically just spent money on nothing. Why don‚Äôt I have these features? What am I paying for? I see that other people are able to make the meal plan but I can‚Äôt. This is very frustrating, I do like the rest of the app but the fact I paid for your 3 week program advertisement and it‚Äôs a false advertisement. The 3 week program is not on the app. And premium does not give you access to it. Very disappointed....

title: Love it
body: Love this app! So user friendly and it really gets me motivated to eat healthier. I‚Äôm fairly conscious of what I eat already - or so I thought - but this makes me think twice before I mindlessly snack on something because I know I‚Äôll have to log it later. I feel full of energy and excited to eat well, which is no small feat! Also love the barcode scanner which makes keeping a food diary so much easier.

title: I lost weight but...
body: The app works. If you stay on the program, you will lose weight. However, their recipes lacks variety. I wish they constantly add more inspirational recipes from all over the world. Personally, because I'm from Japan, I  wish they include more REAL Japanese good. After three months, I get bored looking at the same recipes and having hard time to go back on my diet. People at Lifesum, if you are reading this review, please work on this matter. I won't renew my subscription if there were no improvement.

title: Freezes up just as soon as look at you
body: This app has long had its quirks and annoyances (I‚Äôve paid for a subscription since 2015). But it continues to get changes instead of fixing old bugs, or new bugs instead - or worse, in addition to - existing bugs. Recent versions (since even before the new version 12) have frozen frequently and at very inopportune times, usually resulting in the app crashing or my having to force restart it. Then it takes minutes to start up again (iOS 13 and 14). I won‚Äôt be renewing my subscription this year.

title: App Bug or Simply Not Working?
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for about a week and a half now and I‚Äôve enjoyed being able to track my food intake. With that being said, users who are using this for free already have such limited access to features on this app so I will admit I became quite frustrated when I noticed that the graph that depict ones overall calorie intake over the course of the week was not showing the calorie intake every third day despite having filled out my food intake for those days (also frustrating I can‚Äôt show my proof but that‚Äôs neither here not there).

title: Very little recipes and menu options
body: Was very excited to try the Keto Burn Plan option, after making a 3 months purchase I saw the plan and was surprised to see only few menu options to choose from, only around 8 dishes to choose from for each meal. This is not worth the monthly commitment. If I were only looking to track my macros many apps does it completely free, really only signed up for the menu planning but with such few choices it is worth paying for the app. I also reached out to the Contact us and no response after 4 full days after multiple efforts on my side to reach out. Very disappointed :(

title: You get what you paid for
body: I‚Äôm currently using the free version and it‚Äôs okay. I‚Äôm not in the habit of tracking my meals, so I won‚Äôt be paying for the premium version just yet. The free one doesn‚Äôt have much to entice me to purchase the full version. Maybe when I use it more often my opinion will change.

title: 6 stars if I could
body: This app totally turned my life around, premium is affordable and offers you the ability to transform your lifestyle easily without prior knowledge of advanced nutrition and exercise. The barcode scanner is AWESOME!! My only problem so far is that I have to double check all labels when adding new items since I‚Äôve noticed a few discrepancies (very minor ones though, I‚Äôm just way anal)

title: 5 stars!!
body: Beautiful app, very useful. I only just started the app so haven‚Äôt seen any results but I definitely feel better. I‚Äôve been trying to lose weight for a really long time now and it‚Äôs been really hard. But I believe this app will really end my struggles. It makes keeping track of calories so easy and provides lots of encouragement. I feel like I have to prove to the app that I can, and I WILL!

title: Can‚Äôt build my own recipes
body: I‚Äôm searching for a food tracker that is straight forward, doesn‚Äôt freeze constantly, and doesn‚Äôt automatically assume that I only eat packaged foods.

title: I love the new UI update, but...
body: I love this app, and I love tracking my meals; however, with these new UI improvements, I liked using it even more.

title: Vegan propaganda
body: I eat mostly animal products, because they have the most bio available and highest amounts of micronutrients compared to plant products. Protein too, because I want to be fit and plants are lower in protein by calories and amino score. Though this is basic knowledge, this app doesn‚Äôt allow you to specify you eat grass fed only and that all the meat you eat must be conventional low quality meat. Your health score is based off the amount of plants you eat and though I hit all my micronutrients almost everyday, I‚Äôm classified as ‚Äúunhealthy‚Äù. Also, the biggest issue is the premium. It‚Äôs not monthly, so if you want to cancel, well there goes $40 to $80.

title: Says its vegan/allergen friendly but its really not
body: Has no diet plans for vegans or vegetarians. Fighting to get my money back now. What a disappointment. I can see how this would be useful for people who eat meat, though‚Äîotherwise, not many choices or options to choose from, and not as customizable as advertised. However, the calculator for the macros isn't beneficial and doesn't guide you through what the proper % balance would be for your goals. It presets it but not to what would be accurate for what your goals are. The app isn't exceptionally user friendly all in all. Great concept of an app, though; just needs a lot of work.

title: Weight reset?
body: I really love this app, the aesthetic and functions are awesome, but it resets my weight to my starting weight randomly and doesn‚Äôt let me change it. This is frustrating because I like to see my progress on the line chart and the data is incorrect and doesn‚Äôt give me an accurate representation of how my weight loss has progressed. I have tried to delete my account and start over but it seems that this is not an option. I am very tempted to delete the app altogether and try something else.

title: Wish I stayed with the standard
body: Upgraded to the premium version so that I could sync it to my Fitbit. Wish I never did. Ever since upgrading the app has been so horribly inconsistent. In my food diary one time when I open the app my Fitbit data is there, and gone the next time I open it up. Its hard to keep track of the recommendations on what I should eat when there‚Äôs no consistency in the app. Besides the diet recommendations, my weight and water intake are constantly being reset on me as well. So many bugs in the premium version. Hope they get this stuff figured out.

title: Brand New User! - But Slight Issue
body: So far I love it! I have been reading about Intermittent Fasting and was thrilled to see a 5:2 plan being offered. The one issue that was bothersome for me was that the Daily Progress bar is a day ahead of my tracked day. Ex: I recorded my meals on Wednesday July 24th but then see it portrayed in Thursday‚Äôs Daily Progress bar. It‚Äôll then tell me I ate too many calories that day because it was meant to be a fasting day. I‚Äôm not sure how well I explained that but perhaps it was my own mistake.

title: This App is AWESOME!!!
body: I‚Äôm LOVING this app! This my 3rd attempt at the Keto Diet, and this app is making all the difference for me. The meal plans are great- simple, yet very delicious!

title: Good Concept But...
body: I like the idea of this app-- tracking food/exercise weather it's to get in shape or stay in shape. However the food ratings seem to be way off. Whenever I add a healthy food it always has a frowny face saying it is high in carbohydrates-- honestly we NEED carbs for energy and I just find it pathetic that a banana has a frowny but a frozen food high in sodium has a smiley face. I find it upsetting and I think it could lead people in the wrong direction! Is there anyway to turn off the smiley+frowny faces because fruit+veggies+legumes+etc. are NOT unhealthy :)

title: Great app but doesn‚Äôt load
body: I love everything about this app, and it works fine when I‚Äôm at home. But once I leave my house it‚Äôs stops loading everything! I go to look up foods in the search bar and nothing comes up, and it‚Äôs not like it‚Äôs loading, there‚Äôs no loading bar. And my service isn‚Äôt bad, even when I‚Äôm under a different WiFi or have 4 bars of service it still doesn‚Äôt even try to load anything. PLEASE fix this it‚Äôs so frustrating, especially because I paid for the app.

title: Ideas
body: I actually really love this app and have been using for a solid month and have seen an improvement in my life. However, I have my preferences set to be lactose intolerant and have a dairy allergy yet this morning it informed me I should try drinking milk to get vitamin d. Huh?

title: Helping the struggle bus!
body: I have always struggled counting calories and staying balanced. Then I would give up, it was to hard so what was the point! This app has kept me on track, and really made it easier! I actually feel bad when I eat something I know it‚Äôs not going to give me a smiley face for(kinda wanna lie to it sometimes üòÇ). But it‚Äôs holding me accountable and I‚Äôm seeing progress for the first time in a long time!!!

title: One problem
body: I really like this app. I can set my goal and play around with entering my food in before I eat it to see where I am on my macros. I like to cook allot and Lifesum allows me to create recipes using the foods I use. It‚Äôs great! My only problem is I like to make my food for the day before but, when I go to enter in my food there seems to be some glitch that adds that food to the current day. I‚Äôm always have to go back and erase data and renter it on the correct day

title: Good app
body: I‚Äôve been messing around with Keto for 3 years, this app helps keep you honest and on track. It makes tracking food is super easy and pretty fun actually. I think I bounced in and out of Ketosis a lot before I started using this app, I feel on track all the time now. I‚Äôm sure there are other good apps and this is the only one I‚Äôve tried, but I don‚Äôt have any reason to look further.

title: Best tracking app!
body: I absolutely love this app. I HATED tracking my food until I found this. I love that it actually grades your food and gives you a breakdown on how well you ate for the week and where you can improve. It‚Äôs a game changer. I‚Äôm so much more aware of how much I‚Äôm eating and it allows me to still have ‚Äúbalance‚Äù and not worry about eating perfect 100% of the time. I even upgraded to the premium version.

title: Good app
body: She actually really like this app. I do t really have anything to say as far as changing the app other than maybe add just a few options of personalizing the color and also making a way to be able to change your profile picture. If there is a way to change profile picture than can we make it easier to because I‚Äôve looked everywhere to be able to change it.

title: Great app !!!
body: I absolutely love this app I have been tracking my food and workouts for a week now. It helps me eat less calories and I have already dropped 2 lbs. The reason I got this app is because I am going on vacation and trying to slim down a little before I go. If your busy mom  like me you will love this app. Plus , you are able to scan the labels to food as well! Overall , I am very impressed ‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Sooo helpful!
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for a little over a month now and track my food, exercise & water everyday. It‚Äôs extremely helpful and I‚Äôm able to hold myself accountable. By using the app I‚Äôm more aware of my choices and I strive to eat healthier, eat more (I wasn‚Äôt eating enough before), stay hydrated and continue to make progress in my personal fitness and general overall health goals. üòä

title: Missing/hard to find feature?
body: First off, I just downloaded this today and I‚Äôm super excited to use it. It appears to have a ton of helpful features including meal plans and recipes. But my only gripe is that if I add my own food item I can only enter the calories. There‚Äôs no way to add fiber, carbs, fat, etc. I would love this so I don‚Äôt get frowny grey faces for cooking my own food. If this feature is in here and I‚Äôve just overlooked it then disregard this and it would be 5 stars!

title: Great!
body: Awesome app and I highly recommend the premium. $35 for a year, you can‚Äôt go wrong. But should work on making small things more organized. Ex. Your favorites by what kind of meal they are (breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack), also should keep the plans page the same, but extend it so that underneath what it already has you can see all of the plans and not just the ones it shows. Don‚Äôt let this opinion get in the way of the app though. Definitely a great app!

title: Great app, when it works
body: This is by far my favorite app for tracking calories. It is super easy and functional to use. I appreciate all of the awesome diets and the way it motivates you to keep your diet balanced. Yet, it randomly stopped syncing with my watch, so it no longer tracks my active energy, and often times I have to update foods multiple times before it actually accepts the changes.

title: Bad customer service
body: I would like a refund for this app.  I requested via email per lifesum instructions and received a response about longer than usual wait times. They have never responded back to me at all.  The app is pretty easy to follow but has limited capabilities.  You cannot pull in recipes which makes it impossible to track and very limited food choices after awhile.  Great things is ability to scan bar codes & ease of use.  But customer service is very important to me for any service so due to that situation I would not recommend it.

title: Really liking it!
body: After having tried a couple of other popular food trackers, I have stuck with this particular one because you can see the general macros for each day.  It also helps that the interface is pleasing to the eye and although the database for food isn‚Äôt as extensive as those from the other apps, I find that it‚Äôs enough for what I need.

title: Pretty nice
body: I‚Äôm mostly using this for a food journal, and I‚Äôm largely satisfied. However, it does glitch sometimes and randomly changes my birth date or my calorie goal (and not because of exercise, sometimes I wake up and haven‚Äôt done/eaten anything and it‚Äôll have changed already). It also doesn‚Äôt always scan barcodes correctly (i.e. the wrong kind or flavor of drink even if the brand is correct). Other than that I do really like the app.

title: Decent but a lot of glitches
body: I decided to splurge & purchase the premium version of this app. The app seems easy to use at first, but once you start using it on a daily basis it fails, and fails hard. To put it bluntly, it‚Äôs been a big disappointment and I will be requesting a refund from apple.

title: More water size options
body: Love this app, it‚Äôs beautiful, but I would love to see more water bottle size options, I always carry my 40 oz water bottle with me as it is a more sustainable and eco friendly option. I would love the app to encourage the use of refillable water bottles in various sizes, such as 8 oz, 12 oz, 16 oz, 24 oz, 32 oz, or 40 oz that way it is much easier to keep track. I also would love to see more options for portions such as measurement and weight options. Other than that I love it!

title: Ok App but could be a lot better!
body: There isn‚Äôt much explanation as to what the features are. It shows Carbs but doesn‚Äôt tell you if it is net carbs! Why not show both.

title: Pretty good, annoying ads for premium.
body: I‚Äôve been using this for about a week and I really like the interface.

title: Good App
body: This is a good app. The design is great. The problem is that the daily intake tab isn‚Äôt worked my correctly. I have my daily calories set to 2800 and it always says ‚Äú/3000‚Äù to start. As I enter food throughout the day it rises. And usually ends up around ‚Äú/3600‚Äù. This doesn‚Äôt make any sense? Also the serving size calculator is incapable of simple math and will say one serving of something is 200 calories, but when I type two servings it says 399 which is frustrating. Fix these things and the app will be much better.

title: Great app, but don‚Äôt pay for it!
body: I like how this app gives you a rating for each food you eat so you are more aware of what you are putting into your body. However I don‚Äôt feel like it is beneficial enough to pay for it. The app doesn‚Äôt have tons of foods you can search like on MyFitnessPal which is frustrating. A lot of foods i do search are off on calorie count. Makes me question their accuracy on macros as well.

title: Team MyFitnessPal
body: I got a bit carried away with the aesthetics of Lifesum and purchased the premium version without much thought, I was quickly disappointed. I would scan in my everyday food items and the nutrition facts were off by a lot on about everything, taking the time to edit each item of food was enormously inconvenient! I‚Äôve used MyFitnessPal since 2013 and I‚Äôve never had any issues with it! It‚Äôs way easier to use and most importantly it is actually accurate which is the entire point of counting calories and macros. I‚Äôm currently waiting on my refund from Lifesum and will be back on MyFitnessPal ASAP!

title: dont worry i wont whine about water bottle sizes because this is great
body: the app is visually appealing and nice to use.  i do wish they would add more diet plans like diabetic or other such restrictive, but necessary plans but I understand each user can still customize.  Peole need to think for themselves and tailor their plan to fit their needs, without the whining about customizing water bottle sizes or extreme maco counting.  think for yourselves and rock on

title: Amazing I love it!
body: I previously used this app for free just to track my eating habits I love how it‚Äôs easy to understand and use. I recently upgraded to premium and omg best thing ever! The recipes are easy and quick to make and delicious and I love the shopping list feature were you can just tap the recipes and it adds what you need to your shopping list and you can easily cross off what you have. AMAZING !!!

title: User appealing, less user friendly if free
body: I love the design, layout, & concept for this app, but unfortunately can‚Äôt justify purchasing the Premium version. Because of this, I can‚Äôt save recipes/meals I often make, so I have to manually enter each ingredient & estimate amounts... pretty tedious. The free version almost discourages home cooking & encourages pre-packaged foods because of this inconvenience. The Premium version seems awesome, and the app is cute enough I‚Äôll keep it, but I‚Äôve fallen off & on of using it because of the tedium of logging things.

title: I love this app
body: It has so many great features! There are several plans to choose from to help you decide what your macros should be. The graphics are super cute. It‚Äôs very easy to track food. But it‚Äôs also great to track weight and other body measurements. You can easily customize the measurements to include anything that you think is missing. The graphs are amazing for measurements and for food.

title: Like don‚Äôt love
body: The app really won‚Äôt do much except track your food and exercise. Unfortunately after tracking a meal or work out, it will randomly disappear and either end up on another day or just be gone. It‚Äôs kind of frustrating.

title: Very limited weight loss/health resource.
body: I have purchased apps that promote similar attributes to assist in weight loss and healthy eating. In all honesty, this has been the most disappointing. Here are my reasons:

title: If you are not a rich 5-star chef, might want to reconsider
body: I read all of the reviews and was super excited to try this because myfitnesspal is just so blah.

title: Terrible
body: I'm greatly disappointed by this app. So after a few days of using the app I noticed that the app doesn't have customized foods like for example a hamburger with no bun and I bought one of the premium memberships and realized that the recipes that come with it are extremely limited for the price that I payed for. I could've bough 4-5 large cookbooks with the money I used. Other fitness apps like fitness pal is a lot better than this and it's FREE. Don't bother with the membership. Wish I could get my money back.

title: Would recommend
body: This app is great because you can set goals and get help along the way. Of course there‚Äôs premium like there is for everything, but they shove it in your face in a way that‚Äôs not as annoying as other things. You can also not get premium and still use 60% of it, unlike other apps where if you don‚Äôt get premium you get like 10% of the thing. It‚Äôs pretty nice overall and I would recommend it.

title: Issues Syncing Apple Watch
body: I pay for a premium membership and sync my data via my Apple Watch, however, I very consistently have issues where probably twice a week the data and steps do not upload to the app. This is very frustrating as this happens quite often. Other than that, the app is great, but the issue with step and calorie tracking makes me consider using a different app. But I paid for a year long membership, so that is why I continue to use the app.

title: Could be perfect but very deceiving at moment
body: The description sounds like you will be able to generate a grocery list from the recipes in your program to plan the week based on your meal plan. Why is this feature missing?

title: Make tracking a little easier
body: Love the app overall, have been using for quite sometime and love it. One suggestion I have that I think would tremendously helpful would be to be able to adjust the water settings for tracking. You have a glass and a bottle and that‚Äôs it. I wish we could change the ounces to match our reusable bottles or whatever container we use to make the tracking easier. Otherwise great app.

title: Love but disappointed
body: I‚Äôm a premium subscriber because I love the app and the various plans, especially the variants of Keto.  However....the foods ‚Äúverified by Lifesum‚Äù are often wrong! This makes me crazy. I‚Äôm a weigh and measure person who knows food and labels. They‚Äôre wrong more often than they are correct.  I‚Äôm tired of reporting them in app.  For example, ‚Äú1 cup‚Äù of pumpkin seeds is reported as 170 cal‚Äîthat‚Äôs the correct info for 1/4 cup.  Please have someone review the entire database, especially the ‚Äúverified.‚Äù  Whoever did that work doesn‚Äôt understand labels!!!

title: Great app
body: Love this tracking app along with recipes and stats.  Keeps me on track.  I also like the varied meal plans.  Only comment would be if you select USA during set up to put the ingredients in ounce measures.  Everything is in grams and to convert most of the time is a bit of a pain.  Other than that I think this is the best tracking and meal plan out there that syncs with your phone and Apple Watch.

title: Really great but wish there were more plans
body: Really like the layout and aesthetic of the app and especially with premium. Only wish there were more fasting plans for ‚Äúintermittent fasting‚Äù on daily basis and not just the extreme 6:1 or 5:2. So something like skipping breakfast and then having calories consumed during late lunch and dinner etc. just a thought hope to see more premium features!

title: Horrible experience + Free features made payable
body: Waste of money! I payed for 3 months and I had terrible experience. There are only a couple of plans, like weight loosing. They say that there are different of plans but no, it‚Äôs a lie! Also you cannot change your plans after you choose it, cause there are tons of bugs. I contacted several times the support and they didn‚Äôt care about my concern. Time passed and they didn‚Äôt refund me. And what is the worst part, they offered some features for free, now they made them payable! I hate companies that does that.

title: Cool app
body: Super amazing app overall if you‚Äôre trying to track calories and what makes this app even better is that it als tracks the calories you lost and matches it to the calories you still need to eat. Personally I think thats a really neat trick and also I love the fact that you can sync your Apple Watch to this app to track the cals you lost on the watch !! Pretty amazing if you ask me !

title: Good app, terrible support.
body: I ran into an issue where I had an empty account attached to my email and was trying to attach that email to the app to avoid losing the data I had already logged. When I emailed support about the issue, making it clear that I wanted to avoid losing the data in the app, they responded a day later telling me to logout of the app, which would erase the data. When I responded stating that was exactly what I wanted to avoid and asked them to delete the account attached to the email they never replied back. If you‚Äôre worried about ever needing tech support, avoid this app and look for another option.

title: Great App, But....
body: I‚Äôve been using his app for a while and have been pleased up until recently. I‚Äôm noticing that when I try to add food/ingredients to a meal, the app will not update that meal. I created a meal recently and tried to add more ingredients (after the app unexpectedly shut down). After an ingredient was entered, the app wouldn‚Äôt let me exit to update the meal. As a result, I haven‚Äôt been able to accurately track my meals. A little frustrating, but I‚Äôm still keeping the app üòä

title: This app has potential
body: This app is so user friendly I had to try it. I love that with the premium version I can set up my macros for Keto- def a plus! My disappointment is I can import recipes from online like with MFP... that is annoying and cumbersome. As a health coach, I also can‚Äôt see my clients profiles like MFP. This tool would be much easier for them to use but without being able to check in with them... it can‚Äôt serve as a tool for them. So close! Some slight improvements and this app would be the ultimate!

title: Not enough customizing food
body: The app is very nice, been loosing weight after downloading it. The only thing that I have an issue with, is the adding calories. That‚Äôs all it dose, is add the calorie count. I do a lot of cooking. I know the nutrition values, but can‚Äôt add those in. So if you eat something high in proteins or fibers, the app will not recognize that when you manually enter the calories. If they add the option to write your own nutritional label I will give it a five star instead.

title: It‚Äôs Okay
body: This app is okay. I like the look much better than My Fitness Pal, but the servings are difficult to figure out. Who is eating 1.5 servings of bread? It‚Äôs either one or two slices, not 1.5 servings. I‚Äôve no need to try to figure out the math of what I‚Äôm eating. I bought the premium for the recipes, but am probably not going to use it for tracking.

title: Good App
body: It‚Äôs very good app, I‚Äôm always used myfitnesspal‚Äù, but I was looking for a change and I found this app, it‚Äôs encouraging, I like it . The only thing that I think that should need to have , its the option to add  your own recipes and get the calories, like my fitness app‚Äù. But for the rest it‚Äôs a great app, the scan food it‚Äôs excellent.  I want to remark that I am using the app without the membersy, only the free options.

title: The best calorie counter on the market!
body: This app is the best I have seen. Been using it for a week now and I have to say great work!! It has everything you need to get started. The only thing I have to say is that just make sure to use it all the time for yourself. Great free app! Will be getting the prime version soon! I have started to feel better and started working out more. Thank you!

title: No meaningful updates in years, limited features with premium price tag
body: I‚Äôve been a Lifesum Premium user for years, and I‚Äôm finally ready to give up and switch to MFP. You cannot do simple things like editing your meal categories, changing the size of your water intake options, changing macro distribution between meals, and many more. These are features that have been requested since 2015 that Lifesum has acknowledged they are ‚Äúlooking into‚Äù yet for some reason had yet to do anything about.

title: Can‚Äôt customize macros
body: I really, really love this app. I love the overall aesthetic and it has come a long way in terms of the food bank. It‚Äôs fun to use. However, the fact that you need a paid premium membership to customize your macros is a huge let down. Especially when there are free tracking outs out there that let you do it. It‚Äôs the reason I always go back to MyFitnessPal. I would switch to LifeSum if they let up on this feature and made that free.  My nutrition goals change and I need the ability to change it myself.

title: Good app but...
body: The app is visually appealing and easy to use. I love the fact that you can take pictures of your food and it gives you the calories for it, but when it comes to logging in workouts it‚Äôs annoying. Some workouts you don‚Äôt time, you do reps (Ex. Squats, push-up, etc.). It‚Äôs annoying that you can only log in the amount of time that you did that workout for. If this gets changed then u would give a a five star rating but because of this issue I can‚Äôt do that.

title: Good, but a few things...
body: This is a great app with a wonderful concept that is very helpful. However, 1: The age that you have on the App Store doesn‚Äôt match on the app. 2: It was quite confusing to navigate at first. If a tutorial was created that walked the user through everything before letting them access the app, I feel that it would be less confusing.

title: Fatal bugs
body: This app was great at first, but after 3 days the step counter stopped linking up to my fitness app. After an hour working through the troubleshooting and another half hour to find the place in the app where one communicates directly with the designers, they insisted I send them screen shots of the relevant apps rather than simply believing that I had an issue. Then they told me, essentially, ‚ÄòToo bad, so sad, you‚Äôre SOL.‚Äô They don‚Äôt know how to fix the problem and don‚Äôt know when it will be fixed. And, no, they won‚Äôt refund what I paid. I‚Äôll have to go through Apple for that. The moral? Don‚Äôt give them any money.

title: Helpful
body: I have been losing weight with the help of this app. It has a clean, fun look and hasn‚Äôt crashed on me.

title: Keto or bust apparently
body: I am vegan, meaning no meat or dairy. Typically vegan is also high carb, low fat, whole foods (whole foods meaning fruits, vegetables, nothing processed). Keto is a low carb, high fat, meat galore diet that I am so not interested in. I was excited for this app until I realized their diet plans are entirely tailored to low carb keto. It‚Äôs infuriating. This app is exactly what I wanted until I realized they are front runners for keto. I want a plan for EVERYONE. Meat eaters, paleo, keto, vegetarian, all the other diets out there, AND VEGAN. It‚Äôs not fair to push one diet in an app that‚Äôs made for people looking for options.

title: Great app for staying on track and getting ideas
body: I have been really enjoying using this app. Easy to track your food, very visually appealing and not too cluttered like some others. I always double check new food I track, because I have found several incorrect foods. I would love to see the ability to create a manual or custom plan based on your individual macros. I think that would make it a five star app for sure.

title: I love the app!
body: I liked it so much that I paid for the enhanced version. Adding your food is super easy! I just wish there was a way to set up your own macros. I know the ones in there working really well, but I‚Äôm trying to play around with mine and wanted to enter them manually, but can‚Äôt. Do you know if that‚Äôs a future feature you plan on adding like a ‚Äúcustomize your own‚Äù?

title: Disappointed
body: Got the app to specifically log daily intake through Apple Watch because that feature isn‚Äôt offered on my My Fitness pal app but apparently I can‚Äôt do it with Lifesum either. All it shows you on your watch is what you‚Äôve logged on your phone with no option of adding intake through the watch itself. A little bit upset since I‚Äôve already paid for a premium account had I known I can‚Äôt log right through my watch I wouldn‚Äôt have purchased premium. Other than that the little Apple character is a cute touch.

title: Let‚Äôs see
body: So I‚Äôve been using this app for a few weeks and was doing the three week plan but switched to the 5:2. I think it will go well but I have two complaints. I‚Äôm the calorie tracker it has the amount of calories on the wrong days. Saying I skipped somedays and ate on days I haven‚Äôt started yet. Also on the plans tab it no longer has a summary of my plan just the ‚Äútake a test‚Äù screen. I liked the meal layout the 3-week had. Not saying it needs meals but maybe tips and goals for the diet.

title: Food Tracker is frequently Wrong
body: I bought this app because I was looking for a simple food tracker. Eating restricted calories is easy. Screwing around counting everything in an app is a pain, and I am disappointed that this one is no different. Half the things I track have incorrect values, when you click on ‚Äúedit food‚Äù it won‚Äôt let you change the mistake in the database. It is also common to scan something and have it come up as another. Sorry guys. I had high hopes, now I feel stupid for paying the fee. Maybe I‚Äôm just hangry.

title: Took My Money and Ran.
body: I was a loyal user of Lifesum and have seen success with the app. However when I automatically reviewed my subscription, it took my money but never updated my app. I googled the FAQS to see if I could solve the problem myself. I couldn‚Äôt and had to email the app developers it‚Äôs been a week in a half with no response from them, and I still have no access. I‚Äôm upset because this app is not cheap and I have been needing to use it. I‚Äôm very disappointed and would like a refund. I only have 14 days, but idk if they‚Äôll even see it by that time. Who knows?

title: Very Disappointed
body: Very disappointed with the premium version of this app. On 98% of the plans, you cannot adjust the macro percentages, which is essential to the plan I follow. Of course, you don‚Äôt know this until you pay the $30 for a 6 month subscription to their service. I attempted to contact the company to get this remedied, they offered a refund, but Apple is not working with me on this. I am so annoyed I wasted $30 on a program I can‚Äôt even use. I really like the design and other functions of the app too, if only it worked as expected.

title: DO NOT GET FOR KETO
body: I was hoping to use this for keto. They advertised keto recipes. When you buy it, you find out that there are not a lot of recipes that are keto compatible (less than 10g of carbs per meal). There are less than 20 recipes. They are still working on building their database for tracking macros, so it‚Äôs difficult if you are in the US to just find a meal that already has the macros. It‚Äôs also difficult to find very common foods and ethnic food. Yes it is pretty and the user interface is better than MyFitnesspal ‚Äî but I will take function over UI any day! You also have to at minimum get 3 months. Save your $20!

title: Amazing app
body: I‚Äôm thankful for something like this it helps me stay on track all day long I work 12 hours a day 5 days a week so it‚Äôs hard to meal plan and remember all the things I need to lose weight and body build but it‚Äôs been a great help and the recipes are great it‚Äôs worth the subscription if you run out of ideas to cook it can help and help you lose or gain what you need.

title: Wishing for a Vegan Option
body: I only have the free version right now, however it is really fun and easy to use, I only put 3 stars because I was hoping there would maybe be a vegan dieting option. I have a vegan lifestyle and that would make this app loads better! I will probably give a rate of 4 so as long as the premium is worth its price. That‚Äôs really the only complaint I have! Please look into that, I would really love to see a vegan option on the app. Other than that I really like it so far! :)

title: Great app, would love to add my own recipes tho
body: This app has been very helpful while starting Keto for the first time! I‚Äôve lost 5 pounds in 5 days! I purchased the upgrade and I‚Äôm very pleased with it. My husband downloaded a different app and it‚Äôs not nearly as good. The design is nice and it‚Äôs very user friendly. I just wish so bad that I could add my own recipes, it would make it so much easier! I find myself entering lots of ingredients and guessing the quantities I ate.

title: Meal Tracking Fun!
body: One issue I have with most meal tracking apps is that the user interface is unappealing. The colors and ease of use in the Lifesum app make meal tracking an enjoyable experience.

title: Nice interface, buggy graphs and calculations
body: This app has a good interface for tracking calories. However, I‚Äôve noticed a few bugs and quirks, which I don‚Äôt know how to report, such as,

title: Great for Calorie Counting
body: If you are counting your calories and generally keeping track of your carbohydrates the app is great. It‚Äôs low profile and integration into Apple Health is pretty seamless. My chief complaint is the ability to to count my Active & Exercise   against my carbs and not just my calories. I find that counting carbs and using my net carbs is a great way for me to lose weight fast. I signed up for the year and after six months I dropped the app. That alone is a testament to how many good features the app has.

title: Several bugs are inaccuracies
body: I got really frustrated having to look up calories elsewhere to confirm them - sooo many foods are listed incorrectly in the database. Measurements for foods are all wonky too. Weight tracker kept reverting to my starting weight. You can‚Äôt edit or remove favorite meals.

title: Don‚Äôt bother with premium or maybe this app at all
body: I just paid for premium. I started a planned meal program and there is a button to add things to a shopping list... but that shopping list doesn‚Äôt exist anywhere that I can find. Also looking through thing they just recycle about 4-5 recipes so really repetitive. Finally a future start date to plans would be cool. From what I see these are things others have said for a long time, so probably not changing. Sad I paid now, but glad I did it for the shortest amount of time.

title: New details interface ruined the only reason I used this app.
body: The details interface used to work perfectly for tracking my macros intake and ratios. I eat a keto diet and need to make sure I always have enough fats and protein and not too many carbs. The old interface showed a pie graph and the exact macros already consumed. With the new chart you can only see what you have left to consume according to the diet you‚Äôre on. Now you have to pay for the premium account to see any graphs and change the diet so it fits your needs. The current free version of Lifesum is merely a sampler and no longer works for my needs.

title: Keto Repeat entries
body: There are no Keto recipes in the program. My husband and I are both trying the Keto Genic diet. He eats different things than me but we eat the same stuff a lot of the time. I prepare the food and he enters the food items on both our phones in our logs. I wish we could just enter the food items one time and not have to re-enter entries. Though we‚Äôre glad that it remembers our recent entries. Now our phones need to connect.

title: Great App but...
body: I love the app and have been using it for sometime. I just wish we could still choose our own plan while using free but have to pay for access to recipes and other things in the plan. The app also doesn‚Äôt accurately track my step telling me I had 0 when my phone said I had 10,000. I wish we could connect it to other apps so it could be more accurate but otherwise great app

title: Wish I had tried it out before committing
body: I have only used it a day and I like it but I immediately saw one thing that is making me want to cancel my purchase and that‚Äôs the ability to add a recipes ingredients to a shopping list so I don‚Äôt have to keep looking back at the recipe to figure out what I need to buy and I hate to have to write it down. That‚Äôs a feature I forgot to look for before I hit yes to sign up. Now I‚Äôm gonna have to look for another app that will do that ugh buyers remorse.

title: So far so good
body: So far I like this a lot! Last year I used MFP which I love for all the food options and how good it was to save recipes. But this is visually appealing and helps me more with macros and other health goals. Hopefully as it expands more foods will be added. I also wish I could manually enter the number of categories burned from exercise, I have to play around with minutes/such until I get the right amount (or close enough).

title: Helping me lose weight
body: I really enjoy this app.  I needed something where I could put in my weight loss goal and it could tell me how many calories per day to consume in order to meet that goal.  It connects with other work out apps to keep track of calories burned that ways as well.  It‚Äôs exactly what I needed and so far I‚Äôve lost 1 lb per day since I started using it.

title: Great app
body: I‚Äôve been using the app for only a few days now, but really appreciate the feedback that is given about your food choices & how to improve them nutritionally.  I was on WW for 6 months & although I lost weight & learned a lot, I find this app easier to use & provides more individualized guidance. The premium version is definitely worth the price!

title: Gorgeous interface, fun ...but needs a data cleanup
body: This app offers a gorgeous (and motivating) user interface. I love the veggie, fruit and fish trackers. I would upgrade to a Premium account ...but the calorie tracker links to data that‚Äôs not always clear or accurate (e.g. multiple options for a Coke - some correct, some wrong such as 140 calories for 0.4 ounces of coke?) App relies on users to report incorrect info but this user sourced approach does not seem to be working.

title: Great, but needs minor improvements
body: Absolutely love this app BUT could use some

title: Well
body: I loved this app it has a lot of good uses to it. Ultimately though it has some downsides. I cannot connect my fitbit to it without paying a subscription, which I dealt with, but I just updated it and now it closes itself out everytime I open the app, before even making it to the home screen. It is a great app if you do not want to use a Fitbit with it, but if you‚Äôre on a budget that is not feasible. They also should really do a better job ensuring that their updates are not going to ruin the app experience completely.

title: Useful app, but...
body: Attractive UI, but UX has a long way to go. I‚Äôm not going into to details, just one example. First I gave you 3 stars, because I could not switch to metric system. Later I tried to search google ‚ÄúLifesum metric‚Äù and found out that it is possible to switch to the system, through many levels of menus I found it.

title: Working out
body: When I workout it says how many minutes, to me it isn‚Äôt fair because I can do 25 sit ups 4 times in a row and still not get the right amount of calories I burn, I can lunges or go for a 3 mile run in 20 min or something and still not get the rightful amount of calories I like the food I think there just should be more for people who can‚Äôt pay 3.99 a month because they can‚Äôt pay it there should be more and the workout area needs to be improved..

title: I really wanted this to work
body: But unfortunately the food database is too limited. Adding foods was next to impossible, so that didn‚Äôt help either. If this app had a more robust and dependable database of foods, the ability to enter in more foods with more specific measurements, and the ability to enter eaten servings by more specific measurements it would be perfect. Maybe I will check back in a year or so, but for now I‚Äôm sticking with clunky old MyFitnessPal. It‚Äôs ugly, but at least it is flexible and accurate.

title: My Daily Partner :)
body: I have been active my entire life and never had an issue with weight...until that life change and age :(  Slowly weight kept creeping up on me and no matter what I did I would continue to gain.

title: Don‚Äôt get if you‚Äôre doing Keto
body: I had high hopes for this and subscribed for a 3 month premium subscription since it was cheaper than MFP. First of all, you cannot put custom macros in this. It does their own calculation for you. Secondly, the way it calculates net carbs is different than any other app (and way) I have seen, and you cannot change it. The meal plan is ok. Food is good. BUT they had some food on there that was 7-10 net carbs. I cancelled it and downloaded Carb Manager instead. I‚Äôm mad that I bought someone that I‚Äôm not even going to use for 2.5 more months.

title: Diabetic
body: I love this app to start on good terms. I wanted to lose some weight without keeping a paper pencil and math! The only problem is that I have type one diabetes. And I have to take a certain amount of carbs a day. This app doesn‚Äôt have something where I can show in which I am a diabetic to help with a meal plan. I‚Äôm also a vegetarian. Which is harder as well since I do not eat meat. Other than not using some medical problems, I love this app!

title: Premium user: can‚Äôt edit meal times or track micros- fail
body: I like the app but won‚Äôt be renewing.

title: Extremely unreliable food database
body: The app is visually appealing and user friendly. But the food database is extremely is unreliable. Almost always, the database is different that what the label says on common packaged food. Many, many times the nutrition facts are correct, but the serving size is wrong. For example, the label on Organic Valley Cottage Cheese (4%) says 1/2 cup = 110 calories. But the Life Sum database says 1 cup = 110 calories. And, to make matters worse, there is an icon that says ‚ÄúVerified‚Äù. Clearly they are not verifying anything. Unless you are willing to manually enter your own nutrition facts for everything you eat, this app is pretty much unusable.

title: Inaccurate information
body: This app has been very helpful to use and has a nice design also. My one problem is that the calories on the app are usually never right when going to put food items in. Even the ones with a verified check mark are wrong 98% of the time. If this issue were to get fixed I would give it five stars. But for now 3 stars will do because one of the most important things about the app is constantly wrong.

title: To difficult to cancel subscription
body: I didn‚Äôt want to purchase this app and when I tried to get in contact with the company I got an automated response. In the response it say that they can‚Äôt cancel your subscription in order to do it you need to go thru what ever way you payed and cancel thru them. I don‚Äôt usually rate any things I buy but all the stuff that I need to do just to cancel (now mind you it was only to cancel, not even get a refund back) is not worth the app. It does not make any sense to me that they can‚Äôt cancel your subscription. But then again that‚Äôs just my thought on it.

title: Total calories 30% off, big bad bug
body: I used it for 2 days. The second day, when i added 350 calories for breakfast, the app showed the total as 570.  I used my fitness in conjunction, and it correct. I double checked each entry. Uninstalled app. Useless if the calorie count add another 30% error to the errors we already get from processed and restaurant food.  This was while using it on the iPhone.  Then I checked the sync on the iPad app. It showed the correct calorie count. Looks like a bug. A big one. Also the iPad app does not go to landscape mode. Unusable on a 12" iPad Pro if I can't see it in landscape mode.

title: Great App, but needs a better exercise tracking option
body: The app is great for tracking my caloric intake. Lots of built in foods and the ability to custom add my own is a plus. I wish this ability to add custom items extended to exercises as well. I‚Äôd like the ability to create an exercise and routines with weights and reps completed including the option to add calories burned if they are not calculated properly through the app. I would like this app to continue sending all the info to the Apple Health Kit.

title: Nutrition facts all wrong
body: App is user friendly and easy to navigate but when I was scanning bar codes all the nutrition fact for everything I scanned were wrong. You also can‚Äôt adjust the servings. Example: peanut butter 1 serving = 2tbsp but the app was set at 1 serving =1 tbsp and there was no way to change it. Sure you could just change it from 1 serving to 2 but the very few nutrition facts that were actually right would double. It‚Äôs not accurate that way and will mess you up! I deleted and went with another app that‚Äôs all been accurate. Would try again if this was fixed.

title: Better than my prior app but...
body: This is so much better that the app I‚Äôve been using. It could be because it is newer and has less wrong input from the world. However, I have in just two days found calorie data that is incorrect. On McDonalds food so it is readily available and should not be wrong. Also, It has been randomly adding foods from yesterday to my log. Not just suggesting, but adding it when I log my food.

title: Not suitable for most Americans- European App
body: They do not have any tool to convert measurements to the imperial system within recipes and meal plans. I have to use an additional app every time I use a recipe, write down the conversion for each ingredient. I also have to use the conversion app when entering my meals. It really makes me avoid using their built-in meal plans which would otherwise be great. However because of this issue, this is basically a calorie calculator (they have many of these available on the App Store that have imperial measuring system). If this was changed I would really like the app.

title: Signed up was supposed to get 30% off charged full price
body: When going premium there was a discount of 30% listed in the app. When i upgraded it charged me the full amount. Received an in app response from support asking me for more info but wasn‚Äôt able to reply because support closed the issue, before I could respond as soon as they sent it to me. I would not have purchased the upgrade for full price. So watch out when upgrading. Bait and switch!

title: motivator
body: I have really enjoyed using this app.   It is very user friendly, and give so much information.  I love that it syncs to the Apple Health app and adjusts calories according to your activity !

title: Love the app but have suggestions
body: I have been using the app for about a week and I have a few minor suggestions. I don‚Äôt think the way to custom add a food is very intuitive. From a good UX perspective I think it would be helpful to have the option to custom add a food on the screen where you can search and add recent food. That is where I would expect to find this feature - a fellow mobile app developer

title: Carefully read your subscription!!!
body: Overall a great app, I love that it can track so many different kinds of food. However, I wanted to pay for the yearly subscription and it said it would charge me monthly but instead charged me for that whole year and overdrew my account. I would watch out for that. The app itself is fantastic though for getting fit and healthy so I will continue to use it.

title: Hard to cancel, very complicated
body: You can buy it through about five sources of payment, which makes it hard to cancel the recurring membership.

title: Lifesum
body: First of all, amazing app. It has really helped me start gaining weight. But, I wish they would show your progress better. Maybe showing if you are on track for how much weight you have lost(or gained) each week so we know if we need to eat more or less. Also, it said that ‚ÄúDave‚Äôs Killer Bread; Good seed‚Äù is unhealthy, but I don‚Äôt see why at all. I eat it everyday and it lowers my score because its ‚Äúunhealthy‚Äù. But all in all, really good app

title: Comparable Apps are Better
body: I would like to get premium, just because this app works better on my Apple than Samsung Health does. Unfortunately, Lifesum doesn‚Äôt allow you to set your own eating times (for things like intermittent fasting) and ends up telling you that you‚Äôre bad for eating too much for lunch. I also can‚Äôt create my own recipe meals with a higher detail and I can‚Äôt input nutritional value. So, I‚Äôm sticking with Samsung Health until updates are made to fit multiple lifestyles

title: Beautiful app
body: This app looks amazing... and that‚Äôs about it. They don‚Äôt tell you until you‚Äôve already created an account and given them your information that nearly every feature of the app is locked behind a premium subscription pay-wall. The only thing that‚Äôs free is the food and calorie tracker. If that‚Äôs the only thing I wanted I would just use the basic health app that comes preloaded on my phone. I‚Äôm tired of things that pose as free and end up requiring premium plans and ‚Äúin-app purchases‚Äù to access. We‚Äôve officially reached the technological version of ‚Äúnickel-and-dimed to death.‚Äù

title: Love!
body: So much prettier than MFP. I love the fruit, vegetable, seafood (great idea!), and water trackers.  My only complaint is not being able to add another snack and rename the labels in diary.  I‚Äôd like a spot for post work in the morning and an afternoon snack.  Currently snacks all have to be lumped together.  It‚Äôs not a big deal right now, but I‚Äôm amping up for a marathon.  I need to see food for preworkout/breakfast, postworkout/snack, lunch, snack, dinner, and pre bed recovery.

title: Pretty good
body: I like the tracking system for food. Simple and easy to use. However I can‚Äôt change any of my notifications for when I need to log my food! Every change I make, I leave the app, come back, and they have all reverted to defaults.

title: Mostly ok
body: Overall design is well conceived, but there are an unusual amount of errors when it comes to calculating calories, specifically with macros.

title: Great App, could use some improvements
body: I love the interface of this app and all of the personal details it gives. Daily updates and ‚Äúscores‚Äù help keep me motivated and on track. However, I feel like several functions don‚Äôt work properly. I am unable to delete certain measurements and if I am able to, it does not save. It also does not upload my Fitbit data despite being connected and synced. As a premium member, I would love to see these fixed.

title: Great Health App
body: I have been using this app for more than a year and I really love it. From the diet choices to the daily support with my exercise programs, this is the best app for the day to day support of my health. You can change your plan whenever you want.  I recommend you turn on the notifications as it is so helpful in keeping me on track. üòáüçâü•ëüçéüíÉüèΩüë©üèΩ‚Äçü¶Øü§∏üèΩüèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

title: Free version lacks features
body: I was looking for an app that would be a little more user-friendly to track my meals then my fitness pal. I really liked the look of this one end it certainly beautiful and seemed to be a little easier to use.

title: Easy to use
body: I really like how easy it is to use with one exception, it‚Äôs not always possible to edit the amounts of foods/calories.  You just have to pick something close. I like how it breaks down carbs, fats, and protein. I like the quiz which helps you pick the right diet for your lifestyle.  The connection to Fitbit needs a little work but after a few syncs the information pulls in.  It is much more encouraging than Weight Watcher‚Äôs app.

title: Wish you could customize
body: I really like this app, WAY better than 3 other macros tracking apps I‚Äôve tried. I will say that my protein goal needs to be way higher than what his app allotted me and there‚Äôs no way to customize it.
