So I‚Äôm technically like 50g over my protein daily but i know that going into it. Still a bummer though.

title: Don‚Äôt subscribe
body: Very disappointed that there are all these diet choices to cater the app to but there are so few recipes to chose from. I‚Äôm trying to follow a ketogenic diet and am not losing weight. I upgraded hoping there would be more recipe choices to help keep me on track but there‚Äôs like maybe 10 recipes for each breakfast, lunch, and dinner and they‚Äôre not even appetizing or common foods. Vanilla cod tartare?  Very limited selection.  Atkins has a free app and actually has a decent recipe selection. The only positive is seeing the breakdown of the micronutrients for protein, fat and carbs.

title: Great in general; could use consistent serving size measures
body: I‚Äôve enjoyed using the app and generally have found it easy to use, but it would be great if each food item came with the same suite of measurements. Too many of the foods only allow for measurements by weight (ounces or grams), which aren‚Äôt intuitive or easy to know for all users. Adding cups, tablespoons, and teaspoons for everything would be really helpful.

title: Visually appealing - pushy on the Keto diet
body: I‚Äôve used other food tracking apps and have lost interest quickly because it wasn‚Äôt engaging enough.  This app keeps things appealing and so far has had all the food I‚Äôve eaten so far.  I am dropping 1 star because it has been very pushy about the Keto diet.  I‚Äôve gotten emails, taken the test (which does not give an option to choose if you‚Äôre a vegetarian) and it‚Äôs always the Keto diet.

title: Exercise tracker Works for three days
body: I started using this app recently (paid for 3 months ). First three days no glitches. However, fourth day comes, the app is no longer connecting with my iwatch to track the exercises. I can‚Äôt use your exercise tab on the app because it‚Äôs not accurate to my workouts. Please let me know what to do step by step! (Btw my iwatch is not even a year old it‚Äôs a 5.3 version)

title: Sync Problems
body: Great app, however it lacks consistent updates to my Apple Watch. I enter my meals to the app on my phone, however it rarely syncs the information to my watch. For example- right now it reads the caloric input from breakfast. However I entered information from all of my courses. I want to purchase the upgrade however, I am unsure if this glitch will repeat itself during the upgrade as well.

title: Most of the services are premium
body: Recipes? Tips? Advice? Got to pay the premium. Dissappointing, but they have to be paying health experts and healthy chefs in order for their work to appear on it. The little quizzes they offer are free though, so you can take your results and research what to do separately.

title: Love it but..
body: I really do love the app, it‚Äôs really helpful. The only problem i‚Äôm currently having is that ever since the recent update i haven‚Äôt been able to log my water intake. To try and fix this i logged out, deleted the app, then redownloaded the app but now my email is invalid and when i try to make a new account any email i put in is now invalid.

title: Love It!
body: This is a great app and fits my needs almost perfectly. My only issue with it would be in the workout section. For some things (swimming, running, etc.) having it so you can set it for __ minutes is perfect. However, for things such as sit-ups, push-ups, etc. It would be better if you could enter how many you did, instead of how long you did it for.

title: Very unsatisfied
body: I bought the app on 8/26 and was quickly prompted to get the Premium upgrade. I unfortunately decided to do the year because it said $3.99 a month well it charged me the whole this.... 1st strike. Then I realized that I really didn‚Äôt need the extra stuff as there are support groups and Pinterest for Keto recipes and decided to unsubscribe from the Premium before the 14 days were up. I have reached out on the App several times and no response I have emailed only to get an automated letter saying they will get back to me. Beware don‚Äôt do the Premium Upgrade you can find the recipes free on Pinterest

title: Great app, easy to use!
body: This app is very easy to use. It also is visually sleek and pretty. I love the helpful reminders and encouraging tips. The only thing that‚Äôs making this not a five star review is the fact that finding the right foods is a little bit tricky in the search menu option. I haven‚Äôt really used the photo capturing method, but I‚Äôll give that a try and give another review. So far so good, I‚Äôve lost 5 pounds in one week!! yay!!!

title: Solid.
body: Good app, visually very nice. Obviously a competitor to MFP. A couple things, aside from the library that I‚Äôm sure LifeSum is working on, that MFP has over this app is the ability to manually add protein carbs and fat. Currently LifeSum allows adding only calories. Also, the Apple Watch compatibility, MFP allows adding calories/water consumption via the watch, which LifeSum does not. Overall, good. I‚Äôll keep trying it out until I find one to stick with.

title: Great, but....
body: I love the organization and user-friendliness of the app, but I mainly came to this app for help with getting a balanced diet due to the fact that I‚Äôm medically required to be on a liquid/soft food diet for the next 6 weeks. I‚Äôd love if there was a diet catered to that, since I‚Äôm finding it hard to reach my 2,000 calorie goal/day. I‚Äôm sure this feature would be useful to many other people who are either on this diet temporarily (like me) or long-term.

title: Great calorie tracker
body: I‚Äôve been using Lifesum as a calorie and weightloss tracker for two weeks now. I love that it has meal ratings and helps keep me on track of my food intake! I‚Äôm obsessed with getting smiley faces! üòÖ I was working out for about a month and saw no change in my weight, but when I added Lifesum, I started seeing results!

title: Calories never add up, lots of bugs.
body: I‚Äôll be over by 3 carbs and over 200 calories. Doesn‚Äôt add up. I emailed about it and they needed all this info from me and it wasn‚Äôt fixed. Also my recents are never available for each meal it‚Äôs only the ones I had for that specific meal. And sometimes my recent food is not available at all and I have to scan it again or find it again. Last but not least I have to go back one step every time I want to change the amount of servings of the food.

title: Keep getting kicked out
body: I have used the app for a long time. And it‚Äôs a wonderful app that I used everyday and it helped me get to where I needed to be. However... recently the app will randomly kick me out so I have to log in multiple time. Finally after logging in five times in a row, I just deleted the app. Hopefully that ‚Äúbug‚Äù will be fixed.

title: Great app but few issues
body: I love the app it‚Äôs helped me make a lot of progress.

title: I like but...
body: This is my favorite app, with one exception. When I set my calorie intake to be 1800, I want it to stay there, no matter what my workout is versus increase calorie intake! It is so frustrating!!  Is that only an option on the premium version? If so, I am considering other apps that hold the calories once set versus having to remember daily to input food for the day BEFORE I workout, else it is going to change.

title: It‚Äôs ok..
body: This is the second time I‚Äôm trying this app. The first time I really did not like it, but I had been hearing great things so I figured it had improved. Wrong. I‚Äôm not finding it very accurate when it comes to nutrition labels, many foods aren‚Äôt even stored in the app unless they have a barcode, and it seems like people add things in but have many typos so it makes it difficult to find the right foods. I really wanted this app to be my go-to, especially for the price, but I may be going back to my old tracking app.

title: The worst ‚ùå‚ùå‚ùå
body: I was struggling with my weight for a long time until a friend recommended this app and I was at 165lbs before downloading this app. But after I downloaded this app and let it control the amount of calories I intake during my day I didn‚Äôt lose but I gained 4 pounds instead. Please fix whatever problem caused this. It took me only 4 days to gain 4 pounds and now imagine how long it will take me to lose those 4 pounds and get back on track?? A very long time and I am very disappointed right now. Please fix this. I don‚Äôt want anyone to go through the same thing as I did.

title: It‚Äôs Ok
body: I‚Äôve lost 12 pounds following the Ketogenic Medium plan from Lifesum. It is by far my favorite tracking app, however, I‚Äôve recently switched back to another app. I do a lot of my own cooking, using recipes from internet sites. The other app makes the input of recipe data much more simple and less time consuming then Lifesum. I was spending too much time putting in every ingredient to get an accurate count. If Lifesum ever gets this feature I‚Äôll definitely be back!

title: Took All My Money At Once, Don't Upgrade
body: I decided to upgrade to premium and since I didn't have much money, I chose what I thought would be the cheapest option. On the screen, it said I could buy a 12 month subscription by paying about $3.50 a month. That would be fine with me, $3.50 is no big deal. I could easily take a small amount from a part-time job paycheck. I look at my bank statement later today and it says that it billed me THE WHOLE $44 ALL AT ONCE! What the hell??? So now I have no way of getting my money back and have to pull from my savings just for a stupid app.

title: FACEBOOK INTEGRATION!!!
body: Functionally speaking this is a great app, and I‚Äôve already lost 5lbs in the first week and a half....but I have friends and family who are following my progress and REALLY like when I share the recipes I use with them. With MyFitnessPal, I can share those sorts of things on Facebook, and several apps I use also syncs with my friends list to show me who else is already using them...but not lifesum. Add Facebook integration and this would automatically be a five star review for me.

title: Glitch
body: I just bought premium for 3 months to test this out and do the Keto diet but for some reason when ever I press on ‚Äúplans‚Äù (which is where you plan the diet out) the whole app shuts down. I am very upset and disappointed because this seemed like such a great app to become more healthier but I can‚Äôt even use it anymore. Please respond quick because you will be continuing to bill me for three months and I know I cannot cancel it so I would like to know what is going on so I can continue to use this app.

title: App isn‚Äôt tracking Apple Watch exercise calories right anymore
body: This was my favorite app for a while. However, in the past few days the calories burned number is random and nonsensical. It‚Äôs lower than it should be and the ability to change your fitness goal no longer functions.

title: Features and Bugs
body: Wish there was a way to change calories burned with exercise.... the calories shown for X minutes of an exercise are wildly inaccurate for my body type.

title: I like it.
body: It‚Äôs a good app, but it irks me that so many things are premium only and every single sale is 30% off. Including the supposed Black Friday sale. That‚Äôs the same sale they have every month. Black Friday sales are supposed to be enticing. I‚Äôd love to try premium, but I‚Äôm not really interested in the price tag they‚Äôve got. I‚Äôll stick to the basic option. My Apple health app lets me manually enter in the info this app won‚Äôt track without me paying for it.

title: Pretty, but not reliable
body: I considered paying for the app, but decided against it for one main reason: wildly inaccurate calorie counts on common foods. I suppose that the verified foods was meant to correct for that, but it doesn‚Äôt.

title: Review
body: Ok im 49 but still love the smiley faces lol. The little guy tapping his foot to enter your weight makes me smile. Had used ww for years love this app too. I wish you could manually adjust your calorie goal and also if u track something at wrong time just hold on it and change from breakfast to lunch without deleting and then rewriting. But that is minor. There are a few apps less expensive but On the whole I like this app!!

title: Disgruntled
body: I spent years as an RN in cardiac & diabetes care. Initially I was impressed with this app, but found it to be regularly grossly inaccurate, representing daily sodium ‚Äúsums‚Äù as being lower than actual sums.

title: Awesome app!
body: I absolutely love this app! Not only is it beautifully designed, but it‚Äôs so simple to use! It‚Äôs also great how it‚Äôll sync to other health apps on your phone / watch. Inputting food is also easy, whether it‚Äôs already in the system or something new! I just wish you were able to use other meal plans besides the classic without paying for premium. I‚Äôd like to be able to adjust my macros!

title: Best App I‚Äôve used so far
body: This is the best app I have found so far to keep track of all my food consumption, but it falls short on you ability to add food that isn‚Äôt found on your app from recipes you may find in other places. This would be the best app if you can save custom meals with all the nutrition information, not just calories. Their food choices are are very limited and it can make it hard to track all of your meals. Hope they fix it.

title: Really Helpful
body: Having struggled with an eating disorder for a majority of my life, this app sends me cute notifications reminding me to eat and to drink water which is really nice since it is easy to get distracted and let myself go without eating. I would really love if it had more of a customizable home screen, but other than that I am incredibly grateful for this app.

title: Helpful, but would love to see caffeine tracking and larger food catalog
body: The app is helpful for tracking your progress through the day and seeing your status on the watch. Would love to see caffeine tracking added and an expansion to the food catalog. Also would love to understand what the little green guy is doing on the watch. Doesn‚Äôt seem to be consistent with my food and water consumption, so would love to understand how to make use of it.

title: Great app, but keeps crashing
body: I just downloaded this app today and I am already obsessed. It‚Äôs very useful in nutrient insight and what I need to watch in order to lose weight. However, whenever I click on the ‚ÄúPlan‚Äù tab, the app freezes for a couple of seconds and then force exits the app. I cannot see what recipes are recommended for the upcoming day, which is part of my membership. Please fix!!

title: Buggy
body: So I really love *almost* everything about this app! I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs because my phone is newer, but it just seems to be super buggy and crashes and freezes a lot. It‚Äôs to the point where I can‚Äôt even use it. It‚Äôs also not tracking my calories burned and my eaten calories stay the same (it doesn‚Äôt update when I add food to the day) so I‚Äôm still having to manually track a lot. Kinda defeats the purpose of having an app.

title: ABSOLUTELY GREAT APP!
body: We have been using this app for 1 week so far and my husband has already lost 9 pounds by following the Keto Diet Plan!! We‚Äòre so excited because my husband has been trying really hard to lose weight, and hit the gym, and this app has been so motivating for him, even with meeting his daily goal of drinking water!

title: It‚Äôs alright but not great.
body: The app will add food onto the wrong day if I decide to add more food/calories the following day. As in if I want to add food onto ‚Äúyesterday‚Äù it somehow forgets that I said it‚Äôs food I ate yesterday and then changes the day while I add the new food adds it onto the current day. This has happened numerous times in a row, more often than not.

title: Notes
body: I never write reviews for apps but I use this app quite a bit and wanted to add this part I feel is missing from the app. I think this app could use a notes section. Don‚Äôt get me wrong it is a wonderful app and I don‚Äôt have a thing wrong to say about it but I really think it would be beneficial if it had a place to write things about your food/workouts/and water intake.

title: Great app but at times inaccurate
body: I love using this app it‚Äôs a lot easier than using myfitnesspal or something else. But over time I have noticed that some things are not accurate. Like serving sizes for different foods and the calories in those foods. I ate some Waffles by Kodiak cakes this morning and went to enter the calorie information and found that on the box the calories say 250 however the app tells me 230.

title: Really nice app!! One small issue.
body: Although this app has been so helpful and is so simple to use. I think that the feature of syncing wearables and other apps should NOT be a premium feature. I'd like to have it all in one app and not worry that my Fitbit's usage will not go to as much use because I cannot sync it up. Please hopefully fix this üôèüèºüíï

title: Need Widget
body: I think we need quick widget so that we can do quick scan of the food that we are about to eat or more precisely this widget should be able to help us in doing everything quickly without the need to open the app for every small activity like to track how much water we have drink.

title: Crazy good
body: I don‚Äôt ever rate apps or count calories but since downloading this and letting it count calories I realize it‚Äôs just that simple. I now pay attention to what I eat and have lost 2 pounds a week for four weeks. That said I exercise five times a week as well, even before the app. But before the app I never actually lost weight.

title: Watch Complication Broken
body: Overall a great app with a delightful UI, but I don‚Äôt understand how LifeSum could leave the watch complication broken for six weeks and counting. I counted on it as a source of feedback when I logged to quickly tell where I was macronutritionally at any given point in the day.

title: Lose it is WAY BETTER
body: All this app wants to do is to get in to your wallet. Lose it is the best trust me. The smiles that say how good your meal is made me eat foods that I didn‚Äôt like beacause I just wanted to please the app I lose 0 pounds on life sum but on lose it I have lost 6 and haven‚Äôt changed a thing about work outs or eating so get the app lose it if you wanna see change

title: Love flexibility/access to barcode scan, don‚Äôt like restrictions behind paywall
body: I love that I can create and save my own re pies as well as scan barcodes for quick nutritional info. Do not love that for more detailed nutrition info beyond calories, I‚Äôd need to pay for the premium app. Calories are such a poor indicator of overall health. Would be nice to try the premium for free to see if it‚Äôs really worth the extra money.

title: Home cooked recipes
body: Like the app a lot but I wish you could put in your home recipes and portions. Also the portions on like a raw onion you don‚Äôt get to put in your  portion only the few options they give u and I don‚Äôt have a scale and u better know fraction decimal conversions if you want to put in your portion. But a pretty good app. Wish I could try premium for one month instead of having to commit for three.

title: Inaccurate database
body: 2020 update:  Food database is still not accurate. It would be worse if it was way off, but it is off like 3 calories which is more frustrating.  I have no idea how this app gets such good reviews when the database is so poor.

title: Mixed feelings
body: I‚Äôve used this, and even the unlocked version, and have decided to stop at this point. While the app interface is nice on my mobile devices, without a synchronized desktop app the program just doesn‚Äôt work for me. MyFitnessPal has that, as well as better integration with other devices and applications. I tried to like it, and I do, but it‚Äôs missing a critical component to be my one go-to app for tracking food and exercise.

title: Buggy App
body: My water settings NEVER stay at 7 glasses instead of the default 8 glasses which is too much for my weight. Trying to add food to the previous day always adds it to the current day instead on the first and sometimes second attempt. These are just two of the more prominent bugs currently in this app.

title: Judgmental with no explanation.
body: This app is well made. However, it rates your food choices with smiley faces and frowny faces...I eat very healthy, I just wanted this app to help keep track of protein intake. I entered a banana as a snack and it showed me a frowny face...so now bananas are bad for you!?? When I clicked on the face to get more information as to why it is labeled with a frown face, ofcourse it says you have to upgrade to premium. It‚Äôs EXTREMELY LIMITED if you don‚Äôt pay for the premium. Disappointed. Don‚Äôt need an app telling me I shouldn‚Äôt eat a banana. Going back to LoseIt app.

title: Just downloaded, already a bug
body: I just downloaded this app and when I go to the app it automatically goes back to my home screen and it keeps on doing that repeatedly, which is my only problem. I've heard many good things about this app and I'm have really

title: No cal count
body: Even though it is a counter I like this app because it helps make it easy for me to log in my food every time I eat and is more of a food journal also the people help and give you some good advice and is very nice on this app too. I had this a few years ago and now I‚Äôm decided it‚Äôs best to just keep it on my phone so I can stay in track of my goals.  Go forth and wander. ‚úåÔ∏è

title: Ok so far but needs improvement
body: I just got done with support and was told the app cannot log exercise correctly that‚Äôs imported from partner apps. That‚Äôs a pretty big issue for a weight loss app. I have to manually log each exercise even though the information is being imported. Also, the nutrition information for several foods I‚Äôve scanned for meals is highly inaccurate according to the label on the food. I won‚Äôt be renewing my premium subscription if these issues aren‚Äôt fixed by then.

title: Great app but...
body: This app is absolutely amazing and I love the easy way to use it. Sometimes it hard to find the exact food that I am eating but that is fine. My one complaint is that, I know that you need to make money but, there is an option for ‚Äúhow to make this meal healthier‚Äù and that is the one thing that I think should be free because without this the app doesn‚Äôt really help you with losing weight, because it doesn‚Äôt tell you how.

title: Love this app
body: This app is great. I love the habit trackers for things like fruit and fish. I just wish we could set meal frequency (6small meals rather than 3 and a snack) and the weight tracking goes back to your starting weight every time you don‚Äôt enter your current rate. Would love to see that addressed. Other than that I love this app. It is motivating without leaving me with a guilt trip when I forget to do something.

title: Super simple way to track meal habits!
body: Love how easy the app is to track daily nutrient intake, especially with the built in barcode reader! The recipes are also tasty and made with ingredients that that I am already familiar cooking with.

title: Great but needs a few adjustments.
body: I like the way the app is set up it‚Äôs really cool and I haven‚Äôt seen a calorie counter quite like this one. But I am concerned for the users of this app. This app is very popular among young people suffering with eating disorders and anorexia. It is very easy to use this app for the purposes of starving yourself. It would be great to see a diet option for eating disorder recovery available on the app considering so many people use this app to track their eating disorders.

title: New to the app
body: Just downloaded this app today and was super excited about the grocery list planning! But when I chose my meal plan and swapped a couple meals, it would still add the old meal‚Äôs ingredients on the grocery list. So even though I chose veggie omelets for breakfast, it would add chia seeds and bananas and coconut flakes to my grocery list when I clicked the add button on the omelet... I really hope this can get fixed soon ‚òπÔ∏è if it gets fixed, this app would be great!

title: Fix activity calories
body: Wherever you guys are getting the caloric expenditure data from, its overestimating by almost a double. For example running 6mph for 30 mins does not burn 500. It‚Äôs 300 at most. Or climbing for an ‚Äúhour‚Äù which the climber is not excepting full force during the full hour will not burn 1000 calories.

title: I love lifesum!!!
body: Lifesum is so versatile. Every app I‚Äôve tried using is strictly for weight loss & there‚Äôs such a minority of small-framed people looking to gain weight and Lifesum has this option! It tells me how many calories I need to eat for each meal as well as in a day. So far I‚Äôve gained five pounds & counting since my fitness journey :)

title: Terrible Food Data Base
body: I bought this subscription because I loved the format and layout of the app way better than others I have seen before. But after buying the subscription I‚Äôve noticed that the food data base is very flawed. There is limited food options listed, and often it will not pull up options for simple searches such as ‚Äúegg‚Äù or salad. In addition, there is little to none data of any sort of fast food. So overall I‚Äôm pretty disappointed since I payed for it.

title: Food database is too small
body: I like this app but the database is too small. I like how it keeps track of my calories, fat, protein, etc but when I try to add food items they aren‚Äôt always there. Also, if they are in the database, the portion doesn‚Äôt match and you can‚Äôt change it. I‚Äôve used other diet apps in the past that had a much larger food database. I think if the food choices and portions were altered it would get a higher rating.

title: Forced Portrait Mode on the iPad Makes the App Unusable for Me
body: I can‚Äôt believe after all this time that the app still forces Portrait mode on its iPad app, which is primarily a landscape device for most people.

title: Promising but buggy
body: Overall great app for keeping a food diary, good database of food although relying on customers to input nutritional data leads to lots of inaccuracies. The biggest downfall is the lack of consistent syncing with Apple HealthKit in both directions and must be fixed to make this a top-rate app. Tips and game-ification aspects are pretty tired in 2019, but you can turn them all off. Personally less interested in their diet plans and recipes so I can‚Äôt comment on those.

title: UI is awesome, nutrition tracking is not
body: I‚Äôve found that some of the barcodes scanned don‚Äôt show the accurate nutrition information.

title: Best app for weight loss and healthy living!
body: I don‚Äôt ever leave reviews, so that‚Äôs already saying something. This app is SO user friendly and has the largest database of foods I‚Äôve seen yet (for the daily diary). It‚Äôs extremely detailed, informative, and versatile. I like how you can track everything from water intake to exercise. It‚Äôs also quite visually appealing!

title: Premium is simply big disappointment
body: It seems very promising from non premium look but once you get the premium it‚Äôs not what you are expecting it to be! Not all meal plans have the ‚Äúshopping list‚Äù option (only about 10%) and their meal preparation instructions are super simple, most of the time it is just 2 sentence instructions ü§£ you might as well just write nothing. I wish they let you try it for a day to see what you are signing up for. And it was featured in ‚Äúapp of the day‚Äù ?! It should be on top list of worst premium apps! They need to change a lot.

title: Great Interface & Easy to Navigate
body: The water, fruit and fish trackers make it super simple to keep track of your intake. The food database is leagues above what else is currently out there. But best of all are the diets and meal plans ‚Äî they make it super easy to test out different ways of eating. Also, love the iPhone widgets. Simple and helpful, that‚Äôs all I want for a nutritional app.

title: Pretty but less functional than it should be
body: App looks nice, but doesn‚Äôt write to Health and you can‚Äôt export. Competitor apps do. Widget is nice but I assume that other apps will catch up to that. In their FAQ there is a question of how to share data with healthcare professional, and their answer is to ‚Äúgive them your log in info, then change ASAP.‚Äù

title: Wanted to use
body: It was starting to grow on me, after switch from my fitness pal, however to the best of my knowledge you can build recipes/meal and that‚Äôs a deal breaker. I don‚Äôt want to input every food item separately when I eat the meal frequently, or calculate a portion of a recipe I cook for my family. For me, being able to do so really gives me a better understanding of what I can and can‚Äôt eat, while tweaking the recipe to fit my needs. Hope this can be added some day, I‚Äôll probably be back if it is.

title: Helpful but limited
body: I like how easy it is to plug in calories and exercise - extensive data list. I‚Äôve not found anything not in there in the 2 weeks I‚Äôve used it. However it keeps pushing to buy the upgraded version. App should give a sample of what the upgrade offers. I‚Äôm curious to know what the different smiley faces mean but enough for that price. So the smiley faces are ignored. I am disappointed the recipes aren‚Äôt really available on the free app either.

title: I love this app!
body: This app has been so helpful for me to track my calories and eat the right amount of foods! It also helps me to get my exercise in and can connect to your healthy app if you have an iPhone and can track the amount of calories you burn by walking or exerting when you have your phone with you!

title: Not the greatest but okay
body: I like the fact that I can track my meals and it gives some recipes but I think it would be better if there was a meal planner and shopping list included. Could that be added? In fact, I bought the app thinking they were included bc the pictures include a shopping list pic but I can‚Äôt find it. Thanks. Will continue to use the app for my year membership but after that year, we‚Äôll see.

title: Excerise
body: When you record your exercise, I think you should have the option to not go by just minutes of your workout (ie treadmill). I like to intensify my workout on the treadmill to burn more calories. What it says on the treadmill vs the app are totally different. And also crunches. You should be able to record how many you did. Not go by how many minutes. Please fix this.

title: Will not let me upload meals
body: I just got this app 3 days ago and have been adding all of my meals very easily. I have been staying on track and have loved it. However, today I have been unable to add any meals. I have tried deleting and re-downloading the app, I even had to delete all of the progress that I have made so far. It is very frustrating and it doesn‚Äôt help that there is nobody to call or get in immediate contact with. Very frustrating. Although I really enjoy the app, the customer service needs work along with the technical issues.

title: Don‚Äôt do it
body: I bought Lifesum to help me lose weight. They said if I got the premium it would be like 12-14 a month, I thought it wasn‚Äôt a bad deal until it charged my account over 50 dollars when it said the charge was monthly. I tried to delete it and receive a refund but the app is awful to navigate if you want to actually delete your account. On top of that it said I had to get rid of my subscription before I deleted my account and they gave me no information on how to do it. Overall this app is something that you shouldn‚Äôt get.

title: Do NOT get Premium
body: I think this app is visually appealing and it makes me want to use it. So much so that I purchased 1 year of premium.

title: Recipe instructions need work
body: Great app for tracking food, I go between this and MyFitnessPal as the best ones. I love that Lifesum has recommended recipes but when I go to actually make them the recipe instructions are usually confusing or lacking information. Would also be great if you could see recipes from other diet plans without having to switch your plan.

title: Pretty good watch app. Odd designed app, can be confusing to navigate.
body: One really frustrating thing is that it doesn‚Äôt read water data from other apps from the Health app so it never knowns my water intake. I use WaterMinder app.

title: WOW! So far, it's Great!
body: I can't believe all the options in the food diary there are. Like, even generic food options from my local grocery store. I like the food plans it has an an option, it has synced to my Fitbit, and has been user friendly. I'm excited to see how this plays out. I'm always a skeptic, but off to a great start!

title: Database is lacking
body: I switched from MyFitnessPal to Lifesum so I could follow a keto diet plan more specifically and see my macros more easily. Layout and aesthetics of this app are great. But the database is seriously lacking compared to MyFitnessPal, which makes tracking a hassle. Even creating your own recipe is a lot of work bc of the small and sometimes in accurate database. It would be nice if things you logged as one meal would auto populate for other meals as well.

title: Like it!
body: I do like the app. Been using it for several months... My problem is when it tells you to take a pic of your food, it's almost always wrong and they only give you a few options of what they think it is. You can't take a pic and say what it is. So I end up putting each ingredient in one by one and it gets a little annoying. I like the day ratings and the little advice they give. Overall it's a good app!

title: Easy to use but has some bugs
body: This app is easy to use but I have been having some issues. For example I selected a food and it said ‚Äú5 calories‚Äù per serving.  This seemed off but I continued using the calories I knew I had eaten.  Upon leaving a renter if the app my calories were way off and it when I went to edit the food the calories per serving was 350.  I have to close the app and restart it and the verify my entries every time.

title: Overall love the app but they need to fix...
body: This app is great and visually appealing which helps motivate me to use it but recently I‚Äôve been experiencing a glitch that basically ‚Äúforgets‚Äù when I‚Äôve updated the amount of food entered.

title: Good idea, poor execution
body: I have been using this app for about a month now. In principle, I like the whole concept and design. It is very easy to use and makes calorie tracking very convenient. That being said, the weekly statistics of the calorie intake never matched up with the 1-month or 3-month view. Worse, all of a sudden my history of the calorie intake got corrupted with some meals missing now and other meals shifted to random days. In other words, the whole history has become useless.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your money
body: This app could use a lot of work. The nutrition information isn‚Äôt always accurate when you try to log items by scanning barcodes. The app constantly glitches and disconnects from my Fitbit, so my exercise calories are rarely correct. It usually takes me 4-5 tries to get the app to show the correct information. You also have limited access to features if you don‚Äôt buy the premium version. Which is a waste of money due to all the glitching. Sure it looks cute, but myfitnesspal is a better app.

title: Can‚Äôt change serving description Update
body: I figured out how to add a new food and just put in the correct nutritional info. I think this will have to be the only way to have correct nutritional info.

title: Something you should read first!
body: This is in the Terms and Conditions. ‚ÄúNutritional information found in our database has not been verified, investigated or reviewed by Lifesum. Lifesum cannot guarantee that the nutritional information provided in our database is accurate, reliant or complete. Lifesum is not responsible for any personal injury or any other damages that may have been the result, direct or indirect, of any use or misuse of the Services.‚Äù

title: Not letting me enter in any food?
body: Yesterday it was fine and let me search and enter in any food and meal and it would add my eaten calories like it normally does, and now today after my app updated, it won‚Äôt let me put in ANYTHING I go to add in my breakfast and I put all of the ingredients I used and when I went to add it to my log, it cleared everything and all of the food I entered in, got put in as 0 calories and nothing was added to my calories eaten. And I‚Äôm so frustrated because it keeps doing this and I‚Äôve tried everything to fix it and nothing‚Äôs working

title: Useful... sometimes
body: This is a great app with amazing features and really has gotten me to eat healthier. Along with eating healthier includes not eating out as much. Home made meals are near IMPOSSIBLE to track with this app unless you want to take out a ruler and measure each noodle of spaghetti you eat. I feel like this app is more tailored towards people trying to get in shape and have a healthier diet, because to a lot of people a healthy diet is one you cannot simply buy at the store.

title: Customizable Calories & Macros
body: I like this app, but it would be a a lot better if you could customize your daily calorie & macro goals/set them yourself. For those of us following a program where these numbers have been personalized for us, it‚Äôs frustrating that we can‚Äôt set this up ourselves. If this is already an option, it needs to be much easier to find because I haven‚Äôt been able to do so.

title: Good but could use work
body: I enjoy the app and the interface but my allotted calories for the day seem to change frequently, without adding any exercise, and my Fitbit is connect but will not sync which is the most frustrating of al.  The calorie and nutrition entry could use a bit of a cleanup and the barcode scanner as well.  Overall i genuinely do enjoy the app, the diet plans and the recipes but I also feel like I‚Äôm working with a beta app.

title: Great weight loss app
body: This app has so many plans to help you reach your goals. The constant track of carbs and calories really helped me. I lost over 50 pounds over 9 months and have used this app to continue maintaining my weight while dropping toward my final goal. Also the exercise tracker is helpful to track calories burned.

title: Good app - wish it had more
body: Really enjoy the app more, I totally understand not everything can be free.  However I wish it had more options for the free version instead of just going to premium. You can basically put in your food, exercise, weight, & water. But you are unable to get any insight on anything else. I wish it allowed you to get some feedback without having to pay for the premium.

title: Poor Food Log
body: The app itself is great to look at.  its easy to navigate and has a decent widget for ios. Compared to MyFitnessPal, the search option to find foods is awful.  When searching for a food item, your list is littered with nonrelevant or incorrectly entered items by other users.  There is also no option to find only verified items which is disappointing.  will be switching bad to MFP until Lifesum improves.

title: A much better lifestyle!
body: I have been using this app for about a month and have already seen great results! I have lost 8 pounds in the first two weeks and have found myself to feel happier, drinking more water, and doing exercises! Would definitely recommend this app to anyone who finds eating to be a hobby!

title: Charged me more than anticipated
body: Cool app. Great concept. Excited to give it a go. Learned about it from a sponsorship. But when I was signing up for a subscription, the fees were presented as a small monthly charge, come to find out I was charged an almost bank-breaking fee that I had to cancel through Apple. Had a panic attack while trying to fix what happened. Gonna keep playing around the app, but I‚Äôm definitely avoiding the subscriptions.

title: Continually signs out of Apple Watch and other minor issues
body: Would be perfect if it weren‚Äôt for some minor issues here and there as well as for the fact that it keeps signing me out of the Apple Watch app every morning.

title: Great way of keeping track
body: This app really keeps me in perspective of what I‚Äôm eating in terms of calories, carbs, fat, and protein. I eat less processed food and more fruits and veggies. The only complaint is that my recommended calorie intake is only at about 1700. That‚Äôs a bit low even for someone with a small frame like mine. I do not follow the calorie tracker to the extreme, more to keep track of my nutrients and vitamins.

title: No Control
body: I took a look at this app and it looked nice. I was considering moving to it but then realized that I had no control over the settings. The free pay off the app only had the one plan, Classic Dieting. However,it didn't let you customize it and you are locked into the calories and macros it sets for you. I don't follow those guidelines and would need to change the macros to what I do try to follow but couldn't find any way to do that. Then I also realized that to change the diet plan your had to pay a subscription. Totally useless to me.

title: Love it but..
body: First thing is I wish when you plug in your own calories they also would have the option to plug in your fat protein and carb content. Just plugging in calories is not what everybody‚Äôs tracking. Second I wish the scan barcode mode would actually scan the correct macros, I‚Äôll scan something and it pulls up different macros causing me to plug it in.

title: what‚Äôs going on with the app lately?!
body: I LOVED this app. For the last 2 years, it has been my life. I went from a size 16 to a 6 using the classic dieting plan. But as of this past weekend, it automatically says I‚Äôve consumed 500 calories and burned 300 even on future days. To top it off, it doesn‚Äôt register the calories burned anymore and it won‚Äôt register the calories consumed either. There‚Äôs a bug and it needs to be fixed. Please help!!

title: Beautiful UI, Very Buggy
body: I have premium and am constantly having to restart the app to make it recognize that. The weekly summary screen is off by a day ( saying today is Monday not Sunday for example ) and also not actually showing the correct data for the past week.

title: Really great except...
body: Really great, comprehensive, great price, works with Apple health. Almost has everything you could possibly need!

title: Very helpful
body: Even without the premium features, this app has really helped me keep track of what I eat and to cut back on certain types of foods in my diet. I do wish that I could see what my daily rating for the different food groups is without having to pay, but all in all, this app is pretty great!

title: Disappointed
body: You can barely do anything on the app without paying for premium. I understand that the app needs to make money but you should be able to follow plans and see some recipes for free. Not all of them but some, and some stuff on the plans could be premium. But I can barely do anything and the app is almost not worth it because of that. I would appreciate if you guys could make some stuff free.

title: I love it but..
body: I originally gave this app a 2 star review but I gave it another shot and now I‚Äôd put it at 4 or 5 stars.

title: What happened to regular food?
body: This app is beautiful & it functions like a dream but is a total waste of money if you‚Äôre looking for quick easy meals to prepare to help you lose weight. The recipes are insane & include things I wouldn‚Äôt even think about eating on a normal day. Lots of smoked salmon, fennel, pur√©e and other things that my local grocery store don‚Äôt even carry. If that‚Äôs your thing go for it but as a single mom of 2 I don‚Äôt have time to cook like this & furthermore my kids wouldn‚Äôt even touch this mess.

title: I got charged when I cancelled almost a year ago...
body: I got the year subscription just to try this out. I cancelled right after because I only wanted a year. Anyways fast forward a year later LifeSum charged my credit card for a new year. I double checked in my subscription on my iPhone to see if I still got it and to cancel. GUESS WHAT?!?! It‚Äôs not in my subscriptions on iTunes. Not only I have to contact multiple parties to cancel I can‚Äôt even do it manually because I did and they still charged me. Just don‚Äôt do it. Don‚Äôt get this app. Very deceptive

title: Enter own calorie and macro count
body: I appreciate everything about the app except for the fact that you can only custom enter the calories of a meal/recipe but not the fat protein and carb of the meal/recipe. If I know the exact macros as well as the calories, I want to be able to enter all of it for tracking without creating my own recipe. If I have a meal planning system or a recipe, I don‚Äôt want to enter each ingredient of the recipe, I just want to enter the calories and macros.

title: Awesome app (one suggestion)
body: This app is great and I love all the features only thing I would suggest is that on the app icon the ring around the ‚ÄúL‚Äù should move as you fill up your calories for the day, kinda like how the hands on the clock app move. I think it‚Äôd be a cool detail and it‚Äôd mean I don‚Äôt have to open the app to see where my calorie intake is

title: Lost 10lb in 1 month
body: I followed the keto diet plan on the app and lost 10 lbs in 1 month. This app really helps! Having a diet plan the whole time and giving you step by step cooking instructions made this diet effortless! The meals are all tasty and simple to follow. I highly recommend doing any of the diet plans from this app and using it amazing features!

title: garbage
body: This app doesn‚Äôt deserve a single star. MyFitnessPal‚Äôs free version is way better than this garbage. Lifesum doesn‚Äôt update your weight when you update it on apple health. There‚Äôs no way to customize your food diary meals setting (I like whole day instead of worrying about each meal and ONE snack) or customize the micronutrients. Why did I pay for this again?! The premium for MyFitnessPal allows you to customize so much more, even MyFitnessPal‚Äôs free version is more customizable. I want a refund. I used this app for a total of maybe four days. I hate the UI.

title: Why can‚Äôt you plan and make grocery list with classic
body: One of my favorite functions of the app is that it can create a grocery list based on the recipes you like for you..... however this is unavailable for the classic plan - which is the only plan that shows all the recipes. Please make a plan that allows all recipes to be used and you can make grocery list of everything you need for those.

title: pretty app, needs a little bit more functionality
body: a very pretty app, easy to use overall. Recently though, I‚Äôve had trouble with the calories updating needlessly though. I‚Äôm supposed to be a certain deficit, I try entering another plan and suddenly my deficit changes wildly, and hasn‚Äôt changed back even though i switched back my plan. Very infuriating.

title: A great way to track food, workouts and life.
body: This app is amazing! Very well designed user interface and the application is very quick and responsive. Highly recommend to those looking for lifestyle change, and a digital companion to keep you motivated to eat well, stay hydrated and keep moving!

title: Makes My Life Easy
body: This is the app that helps you find your way into weight loss, or gain, while keeping track of nutrients and calories. I am recommending this app to everyone! I suggest you subscribe so that you can list choose your particular diet plan. Mine is Keto. This app literally walks you through each day. Thank you.

title: No option in AppleID LifeSum subscription to Cancel subscription
body: I am VERY disappointed and quite frustrated to find that the developer did not provide an option to cancel the subscription under the AppleID Subscription setting as they direct users to do if seeking to cancel, allowing only to change the duration of the subscription. This seems very underhanded.

title: Very useful but..
body: I love the app, I‚Äôve been using it for a while and everything about it is wonderful and easy. Although.. you have to pay for almost ‚Äúeverything,‚Äù and that gets in my nerves sometimes. There‚Äôs very little you can do on the app without buying some type of thing. Basically, everything that I want to use.. I have to buy.

title: Recipes and measurements
body: The recipes are not thorough. A lot of them turned out really bad. And I‚Äôm a good cook who uses recipes a lot.

title: Consistently Helpful
body: This app has been a godsend during my weight loss. Plus I love the little vegetable/fruit emoji people. Since downloading the app, I've lost 16 pounds! I‚Äôve lost 55 in all, but the recent 16 have went by so fast now that I‚Äôm accurately recording my calories, exercise, and even my steps (calories burned) after I hooked it up to my Health app. 5 stars!

title: Amazing
body: I love that you can set up water, food and weigh in reminders. It really got me to drink more water and eat a small snack ( rather than over eat later). The tracking feature is great, but it can be difficult to figure out calories on home cooked meals. Might actually go ahead and try the paid version

title: Fantastic, but...
body: I actually love this app. I run long distance, so it‚Äôs important that I make sure I get enough calories to fuel me. The only issue (and it‚Äôs major) is that I don‚Äôt have the premium version of the app, so I can‚Äôt access what feels like 80% of the functionality of this app. I wish that you could buy certain parts of it, such as the day rating, without shelling out $50 a year. Otherwise, Lifesum is clean, functional, and helpful!

title: Disappointed
body: I thought this app was great at first since it pairs really nicely with my Apple Watch and all the meal plan options! My biggest and really only complaint is that the foods are inaccurate!! Like very very wrong! I would have to enter all the specs from every food myself for the accuracies which honestly defeats the purpose of entering! I have used my fitness pal for years and it was WAYY more reliable. Unfortunately it doesn‚Äôt pair with my Apple Watch, but I would take accuracy over luxury any day for my health!! I want a refund for this. Waste of money for premium.

title: Frustrating as a MFP user
body: Using this app after being spoiled by MFP is frustrating.  If you frequently record the same food unless it‚Äôs an every day thing you have to search and search for the food again.  The way the serving sizes are displayed are also confusing although I‚Äôm not sure how to explain it.

title: Really Great, but Could use some Extra Features
body: I really appreciate this app, and how easy it is to use. My main complaint or suggestion would be to add a setting for those who are currently pregnant (or breastfeeding). In that situation, tracking your meals is still be hugely important, but your goals, acceptable weight, and intake of certain things will naturally be different.

title: Almost
body: The layout is beautiful and fairly easy to use. I love that you can track your meals in the app without using a third party. However, the ‚Äúadd to shopping cart‚Äù function does not properly populate the shopping list; it doesn‚Äôt add the ingredients of the meals correctly. I‚Äôd also love an option where I can add the entire weeks‚Äô meals to the shopping list.

title: I love this APP but
body: Okay I recommend this APP to everyone. It has done wonders for me.. BUT it keeps returning to my start weight! My graph looks like I‚Äôve been on a crazy yo yo everyday of loosing and gaining almost 30 lbs. I use this to specifically to track my weight loss so that feature is now useless since it keeps reverting back. PLEASE update this issue! I have sent multiple chat requests on this.

title: 4 stars
body: I like the app, but there are a few downfalls.

title: Shouldn‚Äôt Advertise Grocery List
body: Lifesum has ‚Äúplans‚Äù which are just groupings of recipes they believe will help with your goal.

title: Great motivator!
body: I‚Äôm loving this app for the most part!  It‚Äôs gorgeous & pretty intuitive - I love how it scores Foods with the faces & discourages me from eating too much processed food. But.... one thing my husband &

title: Love it! One little bug
body: Low this app! Way prettier then my fitness pal, just wish it was a little bit cheaper. And one bug is that after you add food it doesn‚Äôt show up for a little while sometimes, if until I leave and come back to the app. Other then that I freaking love this!!

title: A personal trainer in your pocket
body: As long as you‚Äôre following your macros levels and being honest about what you eat, you will see results in 1-2 months. Results won‚Äôt show in a week like other ‚Äúdiets‚Äù promise and it may require some patience. With this app, I lost a total of 23 pounds in just 1 and a half months.

title: Glitching
body: I have used this app for a couple of years and usually have no problems. The past week or so my app has been glitching and resetting my weight to my starting weight every day ...so I am unable to track my weight loss. There have also been a few times where I enter my meals and they do not save. Other than this I really love the app....I just wish I could consistently track my weight loss.

title: Needed: Macro Summary/History
body: If I could add one thing to this app it would be the ability to get a better macro summary. Right now the daily view is the only way to see the numerical breakdown of your macros.

title: The Photo Scanner Doesn‚Äôt work at all 99.5 of the time it doesn‚Äôt!!!
body: I bought the premium because I want to take a picture of my food so I won‚Äôt have to wait 20 mins researching how many calories are in my food I got the 1 year plan and well it fine just wished the photo scanner worked but overall it better than my fitness pal!!!

title: Food diary is off
body: I hate how you can‚Äôt put exactly how much water you drink . You can only add either 8 or 16 oz at a time. I have a water bottle that is 20 oz so idk like to add 20 oz at a time but it‚Äôs not allowed. So my water intake is off on the app. You can also scan the barcode of your foods and so far everything I‚Äôve scanned has the wrong nutritional facts! It‚Äôs so useless. And you can‚Äôt edit them. I hate that I paid for the year subscription, wish I could get my money back. There are more useful and accurate apps out there. Don‚Äôt waste your money here.

title: Love this app
body: I love this app ive used it on and off for several years now. Its got just about everything u need to help with a healthy lifestyle. I gave it 4 because I know what would make it better is if it had some work out plans or exercises. It would cover food, diets, recipes, and workout that assist in the body type or goal you're looking to accomplish ? That would be dope!

title: Glitches
body: This app is good for the most part, except it has been glitchy for me lately. When food is scanned in or even put in manually the macros are way off. For some not all of the foods scanned in. So it‚Äôs hard to track everything consumed that day. I do like that you can set your macro preferences and keep track of water consumption. Although I do with it would let you manually input the oz of water drank.

title: Great so far! But wish the Apple Watch app did more.
body: I love the iPhone app, the experience is great, and so far it‚Äôs been the only dieting app that hasn‚Äôt been a complete hassle to use and track my meals.

title: Mostly good, some annoying areas
body: The layout and interface of this app are very good. It also stays focused‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt throw a lot of advertisements at you.

title: Wow üò≥ Are you serious?
body: This app is excellent. It has to be the best calorie counter app. It also tracks your steps, how much water you drank, helps with diet plans, and so much more.. Who‚Äôs the genius behind this app because you sir or ma‚Äôam are amazing... This app has only motivated me more to push my diet and exercise to the next level.. Thank you üôèüèΩ

title: 110% recommend
body: I love this app. It‚Äôs free there are plans but still it helped me lose a lot of weight and it tracks really well. It is so detailed and gives you every thing you need to know about the food you want to know about or about ready to eat. I just full on recommend this app.

title: I like it, but it doesn‚Äôt save changes to food log edits without repetition
body: When im amending amounts in the food log, it repeatedly reverts back to the original amount unless ive tried to edit it two or three times again.  Its pretty frustrating!  Also wish it was better at calling up specific foods that i eat frequently in the search function.  Otherwise its pretty useful and nice to look at.

title: Almost perfect
body: I love the look of the tracker. I feel motivated to add items to my food diary. Love the ease of tracking my water intake and that it automatically syncs my exercise.

title: Great interface but exercise bug
body: I really enjoy using this app. It‚Äôs efficient and easy to use. However, I have noticed on several occasions that my exercise is automatically tracked and imported from the Apple Health app but then disappears when I reopen the Lifesum app. This causes my calories burned and left to be inaccuywhich is one of the main reasons I downloaded the app so I unfortunately will no longer be using this product.

title: Serving size is more than often wrong
body: Unless you manually enter food macros into your favorites library, your macros to portion size ratio will be incorrect. The serving size of ‚Äúverified my Lifesum‚Äù items are almost always incorrect along with the listed macros. Otherwise, this app is pretty cool for monitoring progress. I just wish they would either fix these discrepancies or allow more freedom when manually entering food items.

title: Doesn‚Äôt sync with health app.
body: The app is very pretty and good to use on its own. I bought the premium and was very disappointed when it didn‚Äôt sync with my water data. I use WaterMinder since it has a simple and easy to use complication. When I add water to it - and therefore to my health app, this app doesn‚Äôt seem to read it.

title: Really inconvenienced
body: Unfortunately trying out this app was a mistake. I‚Äôve always used MyFitnessPal and wanted to try something that grades good, but, I was having difficulties inserting my meals also I choose an affordable payment plan for me but then ended up not even a month later getting charged for a whole year subscription, which has really set me back, when I never chose that option. I see no way of getting my money back and I had already went right back to using MyFitnessPal. It was a lose lose situation.

title: This app is keeping me honest.
body: I love this app. It‚Äôs generally easy to use, and it‚Äôs keeping me honest about what I‚Äôm eating and the macro tracker is super helpful. My own complaint is it has a limited number of body measurements that can be added, and there‚Äôs no way to remove or edit the added measurements once you‚Äôve hit save. Fix that and this app would get five stars for sure!

title: Great, with few problems .
body: I really love this app. I have the free version. It‚Äôs great and all but could you just have a little bit more options with the free version it feels like I‚Äôm limited to what I can do. Also I‚Äôm trying to sync it with Apple Health and it says it is synced but nothing is showing up in Health. Other than those problems it is great! Totally worth the time! ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Issues with purchasing premium
body: This app has been really useful for me for tracking my calories and protein. It has a very clean layout and I‚Äôve been using it for awhile.

title: Terrible App
body: Do not download this!  It appears to be in the same platform as my fitness pal which is FREE.  This does not allow you remove foods.  It indicates that swipe left to do so, but that does not work. Very glitchy.  Apple should remove this.  Horrible horrible App!

title: Sometime it doesn‚Äôt work on the watch
body: I really like this app in general. It has everything in one place which is great and I love the little motivator Apple you get on the Apple Watch but sometimes it doesn‚Äôt always work. It only updates when I have the app open on my phone and THEN refresh the app on the watch and sometimes the last page showing drink, stretch, movement is dark and won‚Äôt update.

title: Not the biggest issue but...
body: Love the app a whole lot however recently I‚Äôve been having to manually activate automatic tracking with my Apple Watch EVERY day which is pretty inconvenient when it was working fine for months. It‚Äôs not difficult to manually put it in, however the convenience is sorely missed... please fix it soon!

title: Love this app!
body: This app is so easy to use, especially when you can just scan the barcode! It‚Äôs great and keeps me on track! Also has great recipes for whatever your diet needs are. I highly recommend this app to anyone looking to maintain, lose weight or a way to gain weight in a healthy way!

title: Amazing App
body: I love Garrett Watts. This app was featured in this video, and reminded me this is he year I lose weight healthily. It‚Äôs the roaring 20s and I need to go into it healthy and confident.  Last year I lost a ton of weight VERY unhealthily, and predictably, gained it ALL back, plus some mental health problems. Not this time. I‚Äôm using this app to set maintainable goals, lose it slow and steady. Thanks xx

title: Nutritional info and sizing is way off
body: I keep finding that the serving size nutritional information is WAY off on many things. 100 calories for a whole cup of blue cheese? I wish. 160 calories for a whole cup of roasted pumpkin seeds? No. Someone needs to really fix this information - isn‚Äôt this a large part of the value of the app? And those were ‚Äúverified‚Äù listings! I bought a 6 month subscription but I‚Äôm seriously considering canceling it until this issue is fixed.

title: This app is fine just don‚Äôt get Premium
body: The app is fine and cool. If you upgrade to premium you are wasting your money. I upgraded, it said 5.99 a month I think for six months. I got access to plans like keto things, which I wasn‚Äôt interested in the diet plans they have and more diagnostics for your fat,  calories, etc and it wasn‚Äôt worth it. Then I tried to cancel my subscription and it charged me the full amount that would have been charged in six months.

title: Loving it!!!
body: Super helpful. I love this app. I never write reviews or rate stuff but I really have found this app to be great. It has helped me to be much more aware of the number of calories I am consuming. It has helped me to become a more healthy individual and I have lost weight using this app. I found It to be very easy to use. Great app.

title: I used to love it.
body: Until about a week ago, I loved this app! For some reason (I didn‚Äôt change any of the apps settings or the settings on my Apple Watch or phone), the app stopped accurately tracking my activate calories. At the end of the day, my calories were off by more than 200. Some days it said I burned more than what my watch and phone said, other days it said I burned less. Aside from that, I REALLY like this app and hope that this issue is resolved soon!

title: Ok
body: The app looks nice and seems helpful, but I'm running into issues with inputting food. I found the food I wanted to add when searching, but it didn't have the right number of calories. So I decided to manually input my food instead. But it only let me put in the calories and nothing else, so I'm on track for my calorie count for the day, but all the other nutrients are lacking. It also won't let me go back and edit or delete anything, so I'm stuck with the mistakes.

title: Great app but at a cost
body: This is a great app but really buying the premium package is the best option. It has a setting where you can sync you Health app on your iPhone and that is about the most accurate way to see how many calories you burn. But I used to just use the free version and still enjoyed it.

title: a lot of oooold bugs! üí©
body: Please fix the bug with random switching to TODAY instead of staying at the future day plan. It‚Äôs too irritating, when you‚Äôre trying to plan your future menu, looking for something in the list of products and then boom! you were switched to TODAY and all your food plans were added to today‚Äôs list! why?!?! I hate the fact that I paid so much money for this app and keep finding such stupid and obvious bugs! hello to your QA üëãüèªüò° hope you sleep well at night. and day. at your work! üí©

title: Amazing app, but has some bugs
body: I really enjoy the interface and food ratings! This has been a go-to app for me lately.

title: Totally just got robbed
body: I saw that they had a promotion going on for 30% for a 12 month subscription so I decided to sign up. I was billed and got a receipt but it‚Äôs not showing up on my app. The ‚Äúrestore purchases‚Äù button doesn‚Äôt even work and I tried uninstalling and reinstalling it and that did nothing also. I have no clue what‚Äôs going on but we‚Äôre not getting off to a good start. I‚Äôve emailed the company but I got a response back that they have a high volume of emails so who knows when they‚Äôll get back to me. I‚Äôm so disappointed.

title: Don‚Äôt buy premium
body: I canceled my premium subscription a few weeks in, because it wasn‚Äôt compatible to my new Fitbit watch as much as I thought it would be. They canceled the renewing of the subscription for a year from now, but didn‚Äôt cancel the premium like I wanted or send me a prorate of my money. What‚Äôs up lifesum? Did I sign a binding 1 yr contract that I can‚Äôt get out of? Same thing happened to my friend who also changed her mind...

title: Break it down now y‚Äôall!
body: I am a female 24 year old, start weight is 257. This app really breaks it down for me soooo well! I mean how many grams of fats carbs and proteins per meal, how far you are from your goal, how balanced your meal is, all of the above! This has been an amazing experience in teaching me how to fuel and nourish my body! I‚Äôm so glad I found this app!

title: This app recommends STARVATION
body: Hi, prospective doctor here. For people attempting to lose weight, this app recommends you undergo ‚Äútwo days of fasting‚Äù or the keto diet. Both of these options cut out sugar which is necessary for glycolysis, the metabolic pathway that fuels your body and synthesizes the ATP and Pyruvate that is used for Pyruvate oxidation, the citric acid cycle, and oxidative phosphorylation. All these processes keep your body alive and functioning. Eliminating glucose long term will lead to muscle deterioration and in severe cases, keto acidosis or self-canibalisation. Both are LIFE THREATENING. I suggest seeking a nutritionist who knows the bodily processes and not a trendy app that favors body image above health.

title: LifeSum is the best!
body: So well designed!! Beautiful simple layout that is flexible and accommodates a huge range of eating methodologies, personal preferences, and peeves. I‚Äôm having more fun with LifeSum than without it. I‚Äôm learning so much and finding great recipes everyday ‚Äî I doubt that I‚Äôll ever give up this great app, even after I reach my goals. Thank you!! Highest praise :)

title: Overly Restrictive
body: The app is beautiful and incredibly user friendly. However, don‚Äôt let the ‚ÄúFree‚Äù label fool you, to get any value out of this app you must upgrade to premium, which is a fairly pricey, monthly fee.

title: I do not recommend spending money on the full version.
body: I paid for the full version of the application for one month, it was written in the application that my subscription ends on February 20. I did not want to renew my subscription, because the functions of a paid application are not worth the money. I wanted to cancel my subscription a couple of days before the end, but I was withdrawn on January 14th! In customer support, they was answered that this is not their concern and need to contact the app store. So I do not advise using the paid version.

title: Lost 2 pounds already!!!!
body: I am in love with this app, got the premium subscription to have access to the recipes and meal plans, never thought I could go on a Leto diet but they have one called easy keto and it‚Äôs doing wonders for me!!!! The recipes don‚Äôt call for anything extravagant just the regular things I usually buy at the store.

title: Beautiful app but could be better
body: I love that i can track fruit and veggies. However , since I enter those in the log I think the fruit and veggie trackers could be automatically updated.

title: No doubt, THE BEST
body: I wish I could start using this app when I first installed 2 years ago. This app is the best, I've lost weight, and my sister also. I reccomend to all my friends, family. Calories intakes, water intakes, daily steps. wow!

title: Not worth premium
body: I love the calorie counter portion and all the tracking! I paid for the premium for 12 months for the meal plans and recipes, but I am so disappointed. The recipes aren‚Äôt awful, but there is very few that I would eat. Many of them are vegetarian (which is great), but I wish there were more options for normal, easy and healthy meals. I would totally give the app 5 stars if there were more recipes!

title: App is fine
body: The app does what it tells you but theres a SUPER annoying part about it that keeps me from using it more often. For some reason if I‚Äôm on the previous day and try to log stuff it will automatically put that log in for the day of instead of the day before. Its a huge inconvenience because you‚Äôll fill in a full meal just to have it show up in the day after.

title: Some potential frustrations
body: I just started using Lifesum. One of the first things I noticed was that i could not input the specific amount of water I drink. Personally I drink from a 40oz hydroflask and I would like an option to click 40oz of water vs clicking 8oz or 16oz multiple times.

title: Why can‚Äôt people customize their macros?
body: The app is nice; the only thing I can really complain about is how there is no option to customize our macros. Everyone‚Äôs different and everyone‚Äôs body requires different macros according to their goal. There should be options where you can create your own goals for fat, carbs, proteins, and calories for the day. I don‚Äôt like that I have to have the options set for me

title: A big feature missing to help making this App Perfect!
body: I have a huge problem adding my food to the diary after 12:00AM the target resets itself to the new day while this should be optional (when to start or finish the day) according to the different timezones and cultures. Much appreciated. Thank you!

title: I LOST 10 POUNDS IN UNDER A MONTH!!
body: I love this app, and I don‚Äôt even have premium! I lost 10 pounds! (including walking, workouts and more like that) but this app really helped me!! It tells me when I should eat more, less and reminds me to drink water when I need it!! I love this app and will keep on using it even after I reach my goal!!‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Frustrated
body: I paid for a year of premium and have stuck with it; it‚Äôs a beautiful app and does have many pluses.  The issues I have are: you can‚Äôt edit any of your saved meals and the calorie count is often wrong, making it kind of pointless.  It‚Äôs very rigid and not customizable enough which is discouraging. When I reached out to support in the app, my question went unanswered. Not horrible but not great.

title: Normal person recipes that are easy & delicious
body: I love this app!  I have used many other apps thru the years and am so glad I found Lifesum!  It makes tracking so so easy and intuitive. And the recipes are for actual normal people vs needing random special ingredients that nobody has on hand!  5 stars all the way!

title: Effective, interactive, foodie approved
body: Loving the app and its many functions! Simple to use and interactive make it more enjoyable to log

title: Decent App
body: Love how easy this app is to use. But it doesn‚Äôt save things. If I change how much food I ate. It doesn‚Äôt save. If I update my weight. It doesn‚Äôt always save. Super annoying. I wish there were more recipes and a way you can add your own recipes. Or import them. For as much money as I paid up front I wish it was a little more user friendly.

title: My only request
body: I‚Äôve been using the premium version of this app for a while now. I love everything about‚Äîhowever it is stressful getting some barcodes to finally scan. The biggest thing I ask is for Lifesum to have a way to count calories and macros from homemade meals.

title: üõë
body: I just got this app yesterday and I‚Äôve liked it so far, but opened it today to track my stuff and a pop up for 30% off keeps popping up even after I closed it, it‚Äôs every second I barley can even get a chance to track anything it‚Äôs plain out annoying I get it you have a 30% off going on right now stop telling me every second no sooner I hit the close button.

title: Great idea but horrible customer service
body: I downloaded this app and paid for premium. It worked great for a bout 10 hrs and then all of a sudden I didn‚Äôt have premium anymore. I have reached out on multiple platforms, and it has been a week and no one has responded. It‚Äôs a shame because this app was just what I was looking for. $50 down the drain and apple keeps telling me to contact the app provider for a refund... YET THEY DO NOT RESPOND. I have contacted the Lifesum customer support and it‚Äôs all just automated responses. What a joke. Thanks for nothing.

title: App thinks I‚Äôm lying about my weight
body: Just downloaded this app and it won‚Äôt even let me put in my weight of 75lbs. I‚Äôm pretty underweight, but this is a calorie tracker, right? Shouldn‚Äôt you expect people to be coming to the app with drastically low or high weights that want to change that?

title: A Problem...
body: When I want to change my profile picture, it will start to glitch and log me off of the app. It gets me a little upset. Could you please fix this bug? Thank you. I got a little frustrated with it, so I'm calming down. Once again, if you could fix this as soon as possible, that would be very helpful.

title: Ok app could be better
body: I paid for this app to go full on keto strict since it had the settings. What I can not stand is it has a section to add calories in keto. I am tracking carbs. You can key in long recipes if you have time and have it broken down per serving. Who wants to always key in recipes? Not everyone eats barcode items all the time. Please add a function to add carbs to your items for those of us who cook from scratch or follow meal plans. Please make this more keto friendly.

title: Hate.
body: I have requested to have this removed shortly after signing up, no more than a week. I have yet to hear from the developer or anyone else for that matter. I figured out how to remove subscriptions through my settings however it will not allow me to remove this one. I am not happy and I do not want to pay for an app that did not work for me. Nobody just has $44 laying around when going to college full-time. I really wish that there was a trial that I could have signed up for to get a feel of the app.

title: App is great but not worth buying premium version
body: I have used this app for a while, on and off. I liked it, easy to navigate and track your food. I figured I would upgrade to premium and get even more features, but they weren‚Äôt all that great. I paid for the full year, tried to contact their customer service via their website and just getting kicked out. I think the free version is 5 stars, but paying for it just wasn‚Äôt worth it.

title: Was better before...
body: I used to recommend this app to my clients all the time and I would use it a lot too, and now you have to go to Premium to do a lot of the features you could do before. You used to be able to adjust your macros and now you have to pay. I won‚Äôt be able to use this anymore since mine are changing. Otherwise it‚Äôs a nice looking and easy app to use.

title: Great first day, horrible the next
body: I loved the app the first day! I felt in control and it‚Äôs a beautiful and easy interface. Then day 2 came around and my goal weight changed from 185lbs to 0lbs, which is screwing up everything. I can‚Äôt even go into my profile and change my goal weight because it glitches and won‚Äôt let me click next. Fix this please. I was considering purchasing a plan, but not if the app is gonna be as trash as this. Disappointing.

title: Great app to track everything
body: I use this app and I‚Äôm so glad because it honestly reminds me to log my calorie in take and it‚Äôs easier to look for the food just by scanning the barcode or typing it in I‚Äôm am making progress with my weight loos and with the help of this app too!

title: Looks nice but wrong info and mostly useless
body: Food nutrition info is wrong for most foods I  scan. Doesn‚Äôt integrate much or at all with apple health. Diet plans are sparse and don‚Äôt include popular options. Doesn‚Äôt give detailed nutritional information on food beyond (usually wrong) Carbs/Fat/Cals/Sodium and Potasium. I should have saved my money and used a spreadsheet. I could do better myself in Excel in 4-5 hours. I seriously can‚Äôt believe they charge $9.99 a month for this.  This is a total rip off.

title: We love it!!
body: My husband and I are premium members and love how easy this app makes counting calories, tracking them and adding them to our ‚Äúmy diary‚Äù.

title: Good app but it glitches
body: After buying the subscription the app was working great, but now it is messing up my weight inputs. Two days in a row it has put me back to my starting weight. Yesterday‚Äôs weight data is just completely gone. I wish it would let me edit weight data because now it looks like I lost 7 pounds in one day!

title: Mostly great
body: The features are good (with premium) and the app is easy to use. Would be nice to be able to see macros per meal so if I'm short or over for the day I could see which meal needs to be adjusted. Also would be nice to be able to quickly move a food item from one meal to another when viewing it in the diary.

title: Pretty thorough
body: This is the most user friendly app I‚Äôve found for fitness so far. The only thing that it‚Äôs missing is ‚Äòexercise ball‚Äô under the fitness tracker. Most of my workouts involve a ball of some sort, whether it‚Äôs the weight or stability ball. That would be an excellent addition to be able to track and would make he app flawless.

title: Horrible App!
body: Please do not use this app to track your nutrition for weight loss.
