First do not get the premium, total waste of money and if you pay for more than one month to get the discount they off and you want to cancel the 3 month subscription after one month you don‚Äôt get your money back for the remaining two months. Then you can‚Äôt adjust your calories and macros to what you want if have to keep them to whatever meal plan you selected. The meal plans do not have any variety and are never updated.

title: One problem!
body: I love this app but the default number of calories for me in a day is definitely more than I need, but when I tried to change it in the settings, it doesn‚Äôt work. I‚Äôll type in a new number of calories, tap save changes, and then it doesn‚Äôt actually change it. Other than that great!

title: This app WORKS!
body: I love this app so much. Now, I am not obese or overweight or anything of the sort. I am an average size, however I really wanted to tone my legs and just lose a few extra pounds. This app helped me do that. You tell it your fitness goals and it tells you all the information you need about your diet.

title: Well done! Visually appealing and works well for Keto Strict!
body: This app is great, and would be even better with a daily intermittent fasting plan (I do OMAD, or one meal a day). Of course, I can use this app easily by only entering data for one meal, and maybe that‚Äôs enough. Is it silly that I want my meal to have a green smiley face as well as my day?

title: Great app!
body: I love this app so far it has been great for letting me track what I eat and teller me how I could have improved it! I do hope that in the future you add a functionality to the Apple Watch to be able to add how much water I‚Äôm drinking, because it‚Äôs a lot easier to just tap my watch than to pull out my phone, especially when I‚Äôm at work.

title: Nutrition & Calorie Information is 90% inaccurate
body: Just a heads up this has a great format, the different diet plans are great BUT the nutritional information is horribly incorrect. You can scan Sara Lee 45 calorie bread, pretty clear how many calories, right? Not on Lifesum and this is the norm. Once I started tracking with another App I discovered how bad the info is on Lifesum and alerted them, including examples. It‚Äôs too bad as I really did like the layout. Just not willing to use multiple source tracking...

title: Good overall frustrating nutritional inputting
body: I do love this app but I find the nutritional info to be very inconsistent. Sometimes I will look up an item and it will have different nutritional info regardless of serving size and preparation method - just the raw item itself. I only find the nutritional info to be accurate when I scan the barcode. Also I find it difficult to input a complete meal that isn‚Äôt in the vault.

title: Only good if you pay for premium
body: This app used to be a decent free app, but it is now useless unless you pay to upgrade. I paid for a year subscription but didn‚Äôt stick with using it enough to pay for a second year. Since the last time I used it as a free app, they have significantly reduced the available features to non subscribers. If you will use it daily, it‚Äôs worth the $45/yr. otherwise, there are many better free options out there.

title: Share meals and recipes
body: Decent app, needs a better food database.  Would be great if you could share meals/recipes.  My wife and I are both on a Keto diet and frequently dine together and eat the same thing.  It would be great if we could ‚Äúeat together‚Äù or at least I could send her my meal so she didn‚Äôt also have to manually build out the meal or recipe.  You release that and this‚Äôll get updated to 5 stars for sure!

title: Macros are not accurate
body: I was really excited about this app. I even signed up for the premium membership. After a few days of logging my food I realized that the macros reported on a lot of food is not accurate. I would have to go to MyPlate app to get the accurate macros. I understand allowing users to add foods but it should show if the macros have been verified like the MyPlate app does.   Also I signed up for the Keto Medium plan but many of the recipes are not even Keto. Very disappointed üò¢

title: Motivational
body: I downloaded this app because a had vacation coming up where I would get to see my family after Lamont 13 years. I love the water tips because it applies to the problems I‚Äôve been having. It‚Äôs also shows you the right and wrongs of dieting and whether what you‚Äôre eating is good or bad. I highly recommend this app.

title: Not worth it
body: There are so many free apps out there that will do the same thing as the ‚Äúpremium‚Äù subscription of this app. I thought I would be able to do a lot more with it if I upgraded for 3 months. Nope. Just basic features, a waste of $20 (non refundable). Within a month I canceled my account and deleted the app. Half of the foods I scanned would be incorrect entries. I‚Äôm glad I double checked labels because my calorie counts would've been extremely off. Defeats the purpose if I‚Äôm having to manually enter everything.

title: Eh
body: So far I‚Äôm enjoying the app, the only thing that‚Äôs annoying is how there‚Äôs no way for it to account for the hours I work so my eating schedule is always off on the weekends since I‚Äôm a server. Also I eat at my restaurant so I‚Äôll put in what I eat but I modify my food to take a lot of stuff off and there‚Äôs no way to modify the food you get in restaurants. You have to search each item individually and input them.

title: A good app, but I would like to see how close I was to my goal weight.
body: This app is great for overall health. Lose It displays pictures of every added item, add so to log it on any given day, you need only click on that picture. Would you consider such a function?

title: Doesn‚Äôt import recipes from web
body: This is a great app and it syncs up better to my Apple Watch for my workouts than myfitnesspal does, but it does not allow you to import recipes from the web directly you have to input them manually which is very frustrating. Other than that, it works well

title: Love everything except water!
body: I love this app and have grown to depend on it. I just hate the water options! It should be more detailed or we should be able to input our own.

title: Just learning
body: So far the app is pretty succinctly accurate. I study assiduously nutrition and am scrupulously learning about anti aging properties. This app helps to track things and offers wonderful suggestions for beginners in their wellness journey. I recommend paying the small fee for the year to enjoy all the app has to offer.

title: No thanks- doesn‚Äôt work
body: You have to pay for anything that isn‚Äôt just a notepad to track what your eating, honestly id rather look up meals that‚Äôll taste good and track it on paper and the app doesn‚Äôt even work right, I‚Äôll log my 2nd or 3rd bottle of water for the day and check back an hour later to see that it says I haven‚Äôt drank it, or today i logged that I‚Äôd lost 2 pounds and it tried to reset the score to my original weight starting this, ITS BROKEN!!

title: Great app but could improve one thing
body: Such a great app and more esthetically pleasing then using myfitnesspal although it would be extremely beneficial if the water settings allowed you to customize the Oz. Of your personal water bottle to track accurate water intake , I use a 40 oz bottle and it‚Äôs hard to track it accurately with the app. Otherwise this app is amazing.

such a GREAT app for logging food and calorie counting. i have tried many apps for this in the past and lifesum def has the most options for food and is the most convenient to use . i don‚Äôt have premium and there are no annoying ads or anything, very impressed.

title: Too many pitfalls
body: The app is beautifully designed but horrible when it comes to managing the subscription. I thought I cancelled during the trial period just to find out I‚Äôve been charged $50. It took a Google search for me to figure out how to manage the subscription and there isn‚Äôt a cancel button- it‚Äôs just on auto renew! BTW I‚Äôm calling my lawyer to see if that‚Äôs even legal. I should be able to opt out at any time with the guarantee it won‚Äôt auto renew. Also, you have to pay to connect the app to your Fitbit- boooooo!

title: Needs net carbs
body: I‚Äôve done keto and used a keto specific app to track. That app subtracted fiber and sugar alcohol from total carbs=net carbs. I am currently carb cycling and the carbs are throwing me off b/c I forget to remember how much fiber/sugar alcohol to subtract. Maybe it‚Äôs in the premium version? Idk. Other than that it‚Äôs the only tracking app I keep going back to. This app would be SUPERIOR if you could custom set your macros. Whew, what a dream.

title: Premium Features Not Working
body: I recently paid to use the premium version on my phone and none of the premium features are working. I paid a lot of money for the features not to work, such as the camera, improvements for my life score etc. Everytime I click on it it says download premium, yet when I click on the option I have it says I already downloaded it. I also have already been charged so I am not very happy. If this issue could be fixed ASAP that would be great.

title: Best app for tracking, hands down
body: It is so simple to understand. It‚Äôs so full with information. It‚Äôs appealing to the eye. It‚Äôs motivational. It‚Äôs everything one needs to be healthy! I downloaded it just in the look for a 5 week program as a small goal I had for myself, but I think I may extend this onto my actual every day life from now on!

title: I love it
body: I love this app and if you don‚Äôt understand theses is how I use and I love cause I have been losing wheat before you eat you check if the item is good and they may give you a recipe but I don‚Äôt do that and I took the one for a month and I loved it but I after that I could do everything alone

title: It can‚Äôt be serious..
body: I‚Äôm a small guy weighing 105 at 5‚Äô2‚Äù and looking to maintain weight. I put in all my info with weight, age and height and put that I was looking to maintain my current weight of 105lbs.

title: Force Refresh
body: I have loved the app so far! The main issue I am having is switching between devices. Generally I track my food on my phone but if I want to build meals or read recipes on my iPad. They do not always sync right away is there a way to force sync so that both devices are on track with each other?

title: Tricked by Instagram Ad (again)
body: The ad made it look like this app planned meals tailor made to your needs. Instead it just gives you the calorie count you need to hit in order to achieve your goals and then tells you to pick out meals. The entire reason I downloaded the app was because I‚Äôm not sure what I should be eating and was looking for guidance. So basically the app is sufficient if you‚Äôre looking for a calorie tracker but beyond that, you‚Äôre on your own. Def wasted $ Wee!

title: Good app if you‚Äôre serious
body: This app, like other fitness apps is only good if you are serious with your health. The premium does an excellent job of helping you track more than calories. Hey I had really helped me push into my fitness goals. But the app is sometimes clunky to use (things can be hard to find and it occasionally crashes.)

title: Not what I thought
body: Looks good visually but after I purchase premium and started looking at recipes and trying to import my own in there.  First off it‚Äôs too difficult to import your own and there is not enough variety of the recipes that I‚Äôm looking for.  Should have stayed with my other free apps instead of wasting the funds on this only find out it‚Äôs not what it seems immediately after I purchased it.  A lot of the things that I scan don‚Äôt even show up.  Would really like my money back.

title: Potential but flawed pricing
body: Seems like a fantastic app, but I can‚Äôt stand how you can‚Äôt do much at all without a premium plan, and most importantly, that the minimum plan offered is three months. Would prefer to see a one month or one week commitment, even if priced high (per month), with the ability to cancel sooner than three months. I don‚Äôt want to be roped into something for that long until I can at least spend a few days on it.

title: Can not access my Account.
body: In August 2018 I purchased a year subscription to Lifesum. In September 2018 I got a new iPhone and I have not been able to access my account it is say ‚Äúemail‚Äù not found. Under my Apple ID subscription it shows that I am subscribed to Lifesum. I have contact Lifesum multiple times via email and social media. NO RESPONSE. According to their site the best way to contact them is through the app but, unfortunately for me and several other paying customers we can not access our accounts.

title: Totally erratic, I can't trust it.
body: I payed a whole year subscription... I have written 3 times to the support email and NO answer at all... The menu planning and general menu recommendations are very easy to follow and prepare, that I love, BUT the calculations seems erratic and the Apple Health synchronizing is TOTALLY messed up, even after the latest update yesterday..

title: A breath of fresh air, great support
body: So much of a focus on simplicity compared to other apps in the same vein. Also, I did something goofy with my Apple ID/subscription/deleting my account and their support team got me fixed up within an hour. Will absolutely be sticking with Lifesum for my 2021 New Years resolution üéâ

title: Macros cannot be trusted
body: The biggest single problem is recording what you eat when the nutrition data cannot be trusted. More often than not I research with google. And yet the diary is the main point of the app. Just take a bottle of red wine for example: 100 grams (silly claim with 95% carbohydrates !!!and a wopping 210 gr. of net carbs!!! ) I pity someone who believes this.  I‚Äôve used the app for a couple years but I wish I had shopped around for one with an honest macros tracker. This one has never been edited.

title: Fantastic Interface to Apple Watch & Health data
body: I am very impressed with how this APP interfaces with the Apple Watch/Apple health App. A very large range of foods to enter with flexible volumes allow me to keep exact count on the calorie deficit I want to maintain to reach my weight gain goals each day/week/month and the app is super easy to use.

title: I love this app but they need to add something
body: I really love this app. It helps me alot. Im currently using it to gain weight and muscle mass. I just wish there was a way to put in our own recipes or atleast change the macros to our desired food. I want to add a dish that i found online that isnt on here. But i cant add the macros thats in it. I think that would be a really good feature to add

title: More options for water
body: I‚Äôve only been using this app for a couple days and I REALLY like it so far, but think it‚Äôs ridiculous that you only have two choices for the amount of water to log. It would be so much easier if there was a 12 oz option, or even the ability to set your own units.

title: Would recommend
body: I love this app, but have run into a couple issues. One is that I haven‚Äôt found a way to add meals straight from a plan into my diary. Another is that I changed my calorie intake number, but it still won‚Äôt update in the diary and is still calculating the old number. Other than that, it‚Äôs been really really helpful.

title: Premium payment
body: Love the app, but I just bought the premium for 3 months. It said it was $7.33/month and that I could cancel anytime. Thought I would be paying for each month individually, but got charged the lump sum for the 3 months. Wish the payment was more clear or there was an option to pay each month separately

title: So disappointed!
body: I am so disappointed with this app... I got it and paid for the premium for a whole year just to use the keto strict features... however! It STILL does not track net carbs! Totally defeated my purpose and I am really sad about my purchase if I could get a refund I would! Do not buy!

title: Not very good
body: Unfortunately this app looked beautiful but only partially worked. I even got the premium version but it doesn‚Äôt work. I reached out to to customer service but no assistance. Basically I can use the food diary, look at recipes and other diet plans BUT it will not sync with the fitbit and add in steps SO none of my steps count. This is so disappointing because exercise is a key component if you‚Äôre trying to lose weight. Basically don‚Äôt buy this, it‚Äôs useless if you‚Äôre looking for something that will do it all.

title: A fantastic app, but could be better
body: This app is great so far. There‚Äôs a lot of foods listed to choose from, calorie tracking is easy, and it‚Äôs all together very intuitive.

title: Good, but to an extent
body: It‚Äôs a very good app for promoting a healthy lifestyle, but I‚Äôm not giving it a five because all of its benefits aren‚Äôt offered so as to be easier and accessible for the consumers. You have to pay to receive the same quality as premium. A health journey is arduous in itself and I don‚Äôt appreciate how it‚Äôs limited to those who can‚Äôt afford premium.

title: Pretty but pointless
body: Paid for premium and I thought it was pretty, but the diets plans weren‚Äôt able to be edited. I wanted to check out all the plans out of curiosity but no matter what answers I put, I got the same plan. I also found putting certain foods into the app for tracking much more difficult than myfitnesspal. Eventually I just ended up going back to that.

title: Good but could use some new information
body: I love the app and paying for premium but I wish the app also tracked vitamins and minerals. I am a vegan and I need to make sure I am getting all my vitamins as well. Myfitpal tracks vitamins but I picked Lifesum because it takes my workouts right off my Apple Watch. If you guys could add vitamin tracking this app would be amazing.

title: ‚ÄúInstagram‚Äù Food
body: The app is user friendly, but the foods and recipes are super impractical. They‚Äôre ‚ÄúInstagram‚Äù recipes, with unrealistic ingredients. There are not options to input your specific food preferences (i.e. I don‚Äôt like salmon, beans, or avocados) so the meal options can be limited. Also, I really dislike that you can‚Äôt change the water input quantity to a specific ounce number. I find myself not tracking water at all because it‚Äôs so difficult to keep track of!

title: Nutrition Information is Wrong
body: I purchased a one year subscription because I was interested in the health quiz. However, when I started to try to log my food I found out that the most basic ingredients have incorrect nutrition information. Old fashioned oats are 150 calories per 1/2 cup. Every entry that I could find for old fashioned oats says 150 calories per 1 cup. This is off by a factor of two. I could adjust but I shouldn‚Äôt have to. I will be seeking a refund. Avoid this app. I am going back to my fitness pal.

title: Almost perfect
body: Love everything about it!  A few things would make it a touch better!  It would be great if it had more standard measurements!  And it would be great if when you accidentally put food in the wrong time of the day to have an easy way to just switch the meal time rather  then RE enter it!

title: Fasting options
body: Hi, I have been doing longer fasts in a row recommended by my doctor and I don‚Äôt really have an option for that on this app. It would be cool if you could add more days is all cause some people do 2-5 day broth fasts and there‚Äôs awesome studies on it right now. My app currently tells me my friends would be happier if I ate more and it just seems a little aggressive. The rest of the ability to see what I am eating and the break down of nutrition behind it all is great.

title: My recommendations
body: I am a new user & so far, I like it. Busy schedules do not allow sufficient time to log in with each meal.

title: The best app
body: I am using the free app and it is so easy and convenient. If I can stick to one month of using the app I will buy the premium for sure. I have already lost 2 pounds and it has only been 3 days. Nothing has worked for me until now! Get this app you can lose fat!

title: Tracking
body: This app makes tracking macros easy. The data base is Immense and accurate to the nutrition label within just a few calories if not completely true to label. Turn on notifications to get frequent reminders to stay on track.

title: Good looking app
body: I love the variety of weight loss plans my one thought though is that for intermittent fasting plans if you could also offer ones like 16:8 where you fast for 16 hours then eat. I am more partial to a plan like that but could use guidance and the ability to track it accordingly on the app. Is there any possibility to add this soon?

title: Liking it so far
body: I like the diet recommendations; this is the first app I‚Äôve used that has a high protein option that still lets you also tweak your macros. Really nice design also. I like that it reads my exercise date from Fitbit. My only wish is that I could sync my calories to the Fitbit app.

title: Buggy
body: Not sure what happened the app was working great but after the last upgrade I‚Äôm having issues with burn tracking and the having to remove then reinstall the app because it changes to gain weight instead of lose and it won‚Äôt let you change it back any other way.  Really liked the app otherwise. It‚Äôs one of the best trackers I‚Äôve used.

title: Gorgeous App
body: I really love this app. It‚Äôs easy to use and visually appealing. The only thing is I‚Äôve been using it for a day or two and I wanted to switch from the Keto burn plan to the Keto strict plan so I had more freedom with my meals. Every time I go to switch the app crashes. I‚Äôm sure this will be fixed with time and I still highly recommend the app.

title: Overall I like it
body: I think it‚Äôs a good app, the design is impeccable and the biggest pull for me. My only big let down is that if you want to go premium (which you probably do) there‚Äôs no trial option to see if you like it, and you only have packages where to pay at least a few months up front but nothing where you can pay monthly which I would like.

title: Keeps Crashing on Plans
body: Love the app and recently upgraded to premium. However, after picking my Plan and following a recipe, it just crashed. Now everything I select Plans at the bottom menu, the whole app crashes!! So frustrating. I can‚Äôt access my shopping list or meals for the week now. Hope this gets fixed, otherwise it wasn‚Äôt worth upgrading!!!

title: Where‚Äôs the planned meals?
body: I paid for the premium. Selected the diet plan. Went into the meal plans and can only see the first day. Can‚Äôt see any of the consecutive days and don‚Äôt see where I can create a shopping list for the week. Disappointed. Beginning to think I wasted my money.

title: Great App/Experiencing Issues
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for about 6 months and I love it. Easy to use and aesthetically pleasing so I enjoy logging everything. Unfortunately, it suddenly erased all of my progress and now has the goal as ‚Äúgain weight‚Äù and I cannot change it. So, I was extremely happy with it but now I can‚Äôt track my progress.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work
body: I would type in all info on ‚Äúbasics‚Äù page and it doesn‚Äôt let me move on to the next screen. The ‚Äúnext‚Äù button wouldn‚Äôt work when I clicked it and if you can‚Äôt advance to next screen nothing happens.

title: Cumbersome, confusing, and judgey
body: I really tried hard to like this app. I logged my food daily for almost a month and after almost a month I‚Äôm done. Not only is it excruciating to find the right calorie counts, the counts you finally find are inaccurate and the app judges you for what seem to be reasonable lifestyle choices. I don‚Äôt think I can handle another frownie face that I‚Äôm eating natural sugar.

title: Keeps changing setting
body: I loved this app so much so I updated so I can have better look on what I‚Äôm eating. It keeps changing my calories and macros for the day. Idk how many times I have to go back into my personal setting and see if it‚Äôs set at where it should be but it keeps glitching and adding more calories and macros. It‚Äôs very frustrating because it requires me to do so much double checking and adjusting when it should be a quick glance.

title: Looks nice but does not work well...
body: Dont let first impressions fool you... the UI is not up to the standard of other diet trackers and a little more expensive annually.

title: App crashed after 2 days and I can‚Äôt access my data
body: App is takes a bit to figure out.  I paid for the 1 year premium!  After spending almost 3 days to get the hang of how the app works and actively using it for almost 2 days it suddenly quit working.  Didn‚Äôt offer my meal plan, I tried emailing tech support- no response.  I deleted the app and then reinstalled, would send me an email to reset my password even!!!  So frustrating

title: Can‚Äôt share with friends
body: The biggest problem with this app is that there is no social networking feature. The biggest contributor to sticking to a diet is doing it with a friend and this app does not support sharing with friends. Big disappointment especially because after searching the web this feature has been requested since at least 2016.

title: Used to be my go to
body: I used this app back in January to track my calories and it worked really well, now it lags. This is an issue I‚Äôve never experienced before. The individual meals tell me I‚Äôm under my calorie intake by 400 and the large number for calories under says I‚Äôm under by 100. Very dis motivating to see it displayed as such in a large way when the number is not correct. Please fix ASAP

title: I love this app!
body: It makes tracking food fun. I‚Äôve used probably 3-4 food tracking apps and this is hands down my favorite. I like the simplicity, but if you dig around the app has so many features. I‚Äôve had issues syncing with my FitBit but Lifesum has been very responsive. I love this app!

title: Ok, needs changes
body: I purchased the premium version of the app and felt like I still did not get the ability to design the diet the way I wanted it. You can‚Äôt change macros, you can‚Äôt really change your own calorie intake and I felt like the plans were very one size fits all when in reality that doesn‚Äôt work. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend and I regret purchasing the premium version!

title: Easy to use- errors in nutrition values
body: This is a new app for me. Paid for the upgrade. It is simple to use so far though I have not used the recipe function yet. However,I find there are errors in nutrition values. I scanned a barcode today and the label said 90 cals per serving and 2 carbs.

title: Awesome app
body: I‚Äôm so glad I downloaded this app! I love the aesthetic of this app as well as the functionality. It‚Äôs very helpful with finding new recipes as well as tracking food via various ways such as photo or barcode. Wish the subscription was monthly rather than one payment.

title: Almost perfect!
body: Great for tracking calories and macros! Wish the water units were customizable for any bottle size and a full list of nutrients showed up (iron, vitamins etc) but this app definitely keeps me on track with my marathon training and general living! Just wish there were some small changes to track even more.

title: Amazing App
body: After just a few weeks, this app actually got me shopping for food and cooking most of my meals, rather than eating out. For the first time in my life, my diet is well balanced and I can already feel the difference.

title: Leads to ED‚Äôs (TW: anorexia)
body: I understand the idea of this app bc Ik some ppl genuinely need help with their diet. However, this app is what led me into my eating disorder. It‚Äôs the reason I‚Äôm still a recovering anorexic. The age limit should be much higher and there needs to be a relook at how they make things bc I put in my weight and height only to be told I could eat 1200 calories a day, at 12 years old. Insane. If I ate more than I could, I was told to workout. If I didn‚Äôt, the weight would go up on the app which made me feel awful about myself.

title: Great for counting calories!
body: Always wished I had the ability to count my calories throughout the day without things getting complicated but with this app and the ability to snap pictures of barcodes, I can track each serving!

title: Calorie tracking issue
body: I noticed that before I do a workout that is tracked by a third party app, Lifesum will show the estimated calories burned based off of the number of steps I have taken (tracked by Apple Health App). Once I complete a workout and it is recorded by the third party app, the calories burned from that workout is imported into Lifesum but then the calories burned from just my steps is removed. This then throws off the amount of calories left for intake. Is this a setting I can correct, or is it something wrong with the App?

title: Success!
body: Losing weight.  Becoming aware is a powerful tool.  Having yummy, easily accessible recipes that take into account for my dietary restrictions is invaluable.  It‚Äôs an adventure that entertains & corrects at the same time.  Knowing I am progressing & focusing on healthy in the middle of the swirl of life gives confidence and calm.  Thanks Lifesum.  Worth the money.

title: Update was on point
body: I was hoping you guys would soon introduce recommended meals since I never know how a balanced meal will look, but now you have a selection of breakfast lunch dinner and snack recipes which gives me an awesome selection to choose from. You guys are awesome please keep updating more recipes.

title: Disabling notifications still shows notifications
body: The idea and implementation of the app is great. The only bug is that when I disabled all types of notifications from the app settings, it still keeps showing notifications.

title: Way easier to use than other apps
body: I‚Äôve tried using a few other apps and didnt stick with it because they were so hard to navigate and frustrating. But I love this app! Super user friendly, easily pared with Apple Watch, and very intuitive.

title: Can‚Äôt customize macros
body: I loved this app, it was beautifully designed, easy to use, and kept me on track. I was able to customize all of my nutritional settings. Much more interesting than FitnessPal! However, now I have to pay to customize my macros? That‚Äôs ridiculous. Especially since it hasn‚Äôt been like that. Guess they didn‚Äôt have as many people sign up as they were hoping. Unfortunately, they lost me. Back to FitnessPal üëéüèª

title: Sorta Good
body: I‚Äôve used this app for about 3 months and it helped me lose weight but I don‚Äôt think it accurately tracks motion even though connected to my health app. Perhaps it‚Äôs a bug or just one less perk from not being premium? It says I only burn 7 calories and I have other apps that say otherwise and are more concise. Needs work on tracking movement and such to correspond with eating habits.

title: Bad functionality
body: Search of food is terrible. Have to scroll for 5 minutes each time to find anything relevant. Also makes really bad mistakes when entering food for previous day. Automatically adds it to today every time and you have to keep deleting and correcting it. Super unreliable. Also lots of junk stats in random entries that need to be cleaned up. Very few products actually verified by Lifesum. It‚Äôs pretty. But bad functionality means: Overall my least favorite diet tracker so far.

title: Would like a better break down
body: This app is good. It is brightly colored and easy to use. I like the individual meal plans to pick from. I wish there was an easy way to find which exact foods were associated with the breakdown. For example, I consistently go over my fat amount but I am not sure which food is the main culprit.

title: Couldn‚Äôt Get Past....THE ADS
body: I heard great things about this app. I was really excited to use it! I‚Äôm sure if you purchase the premium version, you won‚Äôt have any issues. However, I didn‚Äôt want to commit to premium version immediately. Unfortunately you are bombarded with ads/pop-ups ‚Äòencouraging‚Äô you to upgrade. Literally every time I tapped on the screen, another ad/pop-up would appear. It‚Äôs annoying. I‚Äôll stick with MyFitnessApp.

title: Good but could be better
body: Pretty good app, there needs to be an option to edit meals/recipes you make if you want to add or change some ingredients or add a picture at a later time for example.

title: Great App
body: This app is helpful. It gives solid guidance on how to eat, and you have enough calories and flexibility to keep your energy up. The barcode scanner works really well. And the search feature is programmed with typical fast food/ restaurant chain items.

title: Can‚Äôt find the meal planner. Bug or bad UI?
body: I like the app overall. The design is very nice so I had high hopes for it, so I got the premium.

title: It‚Äôs frustrating
body: I purchased the upgrade to get the recipes but I kind of regret it now. Some of the ingredients don‚Äôt make sense. There is a recipe called vegan mushroom pasta and it calls for vegetable cream. Wtflip is vegetable cream. I‚Äôve looked on the internet and nothing comes up as vegetable cream. Then I tried to make a recipe called vegan cauliflower garam masala and it called for chili flakes and then when I read the instructions it never tells you when to use the ingredient! I‚Äôm getting tired of trying to follow these recipes.

title: Great App
body: I started Lifesum 10 days ago and I love it!

title: Has it all!
body: I have tried numerous diet apps tracking apps and this one seems to have it all. There are a few things that are hard to find how to do etc. but overall its doing a better job than others.

title: Solid, but there‚Äôs a bug
body: I use Apple Health to track my walking. Before any other exercise app is used, it tracks the amount of calories burnt from walking. However, if I use an app like FitBod, the exercise is added, but the calories burnt from walking turns to zero.

title: Nothing but love!
body: My husband and I both use this app to lose some of the comfort weight we gained since getting together, and it has been awesome. We love how fun and bright it is, the little animations are so cute and encouraging, and the life score is incredibly helpful in our journeys to getting healthy.

title: I love this app, but...
body: This app is amazing. I subscribed for a year because I love it so much! The only thing I wish was different is that I order Hello Fresh and the meals don‚Äôt have a barcode so it makes it difficult to input what my meals are. I really wish that you could add more then just calories considering I know how much protein, carbs, etc. is in the Hello Fresh meal.

title: Exercise Tracking
body: The exercise sync from Fitbit only works randomly. You can try to manually sync but nothing happens. You can try to add exercise calories and it does add it to daily tracking.

title: Won‚Äôt Refund Me
body: I‚Äôve never left a review for an app before, but the process of trying to unsubscribe from this membership was absolutely ridiculous. And, not only did I have $48 immediately withdrawn from my bank account without my approval, but Apple won‚Äôt even refund it back to me after sending them a refund request! I may as well have crumpled up a $50 bill and threw it in the garbage! Do NOT bother with this app. The overall design and functionality is pretty low quality anyway.

title: Nice app... but couldn‚Äôt sign up for premium
body: The app is interesting and looks like it‚Äôs got a lot of promise; although I could not sign up for premium to access the features that I wanted.  I contacted the developer and got nowhere with them.  Finally, they sent me a link to sign up through the website (after the discount we‚Äôre no longer applicable) and that did not work either.  I am in the process of looking for another app that will meet my needs.  I do not recommend this app at all.

title: Lost 16 pounds!
body: I love this app, the only thing is that I input my weight years ago, before I started using it. Since then I gained weight, and lost 16 pounds once using the app. However, it used to say ‚Äúgained 2 pounds‚Äù since I was 2 pounds heavier in total than I was a while ago. Now it says ‚Äúlost 3 pounds‚Äù. It would be nice to update my weight retroactively so it accurately shows ‚Äúlost 16 pounds‚Äù

title: Apple Watch issues
body: While I adore this app, I find it annoying when it fails to sync with my Apple Watch- there is no manual way and the only ‚Äúrepair‚Äù I‚Äôve found is to delete and reload the app. It‚Äôs annoying for something I pay a subscription for üòû

title: I love it !!!
body: This app is so helpful and user friendly, even though I haven‚Äôt bought premium they still give me loads of helpful information in a really easy to read way! It shows visuals for your progress and I 10/10 recommend!

title: Can‚Äôt really choose what your lifestyle is
body: I would like to personalize my plan a little more or maybe have more options. I am a breastfeeding mom which means I need to consume 500 extra calories a day. I‚Äôm sure the people who created the app just don‚Äôt know a lot about post partum dieting so I probably should have kept looking for something else. I regret purchasing the three months.

title: Keto and this App has helped
body: So let‚Äôs start off by saying that KETO works. I‚Äôve used MyFitnessPal and it‚Äôs helped tremendously to know what I‚Äôm putting on my mouth. HOWEVER, I‚Äôm a sucker for layouts and organization. Lifesum beats them in that. MyFitnessPal biggest issue for me was NET carbs not calculating correctly. I had to use 2 different apps (carb manager and MyFitnessPal), to figure out next carbs.

title: I‚Äôm picky!
body: I have tried tracking my food with other apps in the past and found it to be counterintuitive and difficult. This one makes it easy. I wish it would give me a recommendation of what else I should eat to make it a balanced meal though.

title: Lovely app
body: So far a great app to track my intake. Every item I scanned with a barcode so far it recognized.

title: Smiles are weird
body: I‚Äôd like the smiley faces to be optional. They get to be really confusing where items I put in my meal get big smiles but the meal grimaces. Or if they could give you more info than just ‚Äúoff track‚Äù as to why they‚Äôre grimacing, it can help me learn instead of rolling my eyes at the innocuous rating system.

title: My go-to macro counter
body: I love this app, it‚Äôs easy and it has a substantial food database that makes it easy to track.

title: Pretty interface
body: Almost every food I have entered has had inaccurate information about how many calories there are. I‚Äôll scan a barcode and the information that this app gives me is about 10 cal off from the packaging. And it‚Äôs like that for so many foods, and it doesn‚Äôt have nearly as many foods as MFP. Also, the interface, while pretty, is not as intuitive as it thinks it is. Back to laggy MFP I go.

title: Love it
body: Last year as my New Years resolution I told myself to lose weight and eat healthier ,I looked into a lot of diets and apps and could never found one that sounded doable. But the I came across lifesum and I made my New Years resolution come true ! I love this app and 100% recommend it to people!

title: Great!
body: Great app! The layout is great and it makes me want to track all my food! I‚Äôve only been using it for about a week and I already feel the difference in my health! The only thing I don‚Äôt like is that i have to have premium to look at all of the recipes :/

title: Premium won‚Äôt connect
body: I just bought the year prescription yet the app keeps saying I do not have it! It keeps trying to ask me to upgrade then when I try to do it again it says I already have it, yet I don‚Äôt get the benefits! I tried to find a way to contact them but online it says I can only do so through setting and does not give clear instructions on how to get there except to ‚Äúfind settings‚Äù like what??? Pretty shady if you ask me. Bummer because I was very excited.

title: Connection Errors
body: I recently got the premium subscription and i‚Äôm trying to connect my account to facebook or email and it won‚Äôt let me! i click on it and it doesn‚Äôt take me anywhere or let me do anything. i‚Äôm trying to start a meal plan but can‚Äôt do so without creating an account. please help! i love this app.

title: Great design
body: This app gets right what so many other lead calorie counting apps get wrong. Adding to your food diary should  be easy with as few taps as possible, and Lifesum makes it easy. As a bonus, the interface is attractive to make me want to keep coming back. Love it

title: Great on iPhone, Terrible on iPad
body: While the experience is great on iPhone, the iPad app needs some serious work. The interface hitches and stutters when scrolling, and when rotating the screen the entire app fails to properly fit the screen in the new orientation, making it literally unusable.

title: Only if you are serious about adapting a healthier life style!
body: Don‚Äôt think about it just Get it! It‚Äôs a pretty amazing not just has all the information you need but it pushes you through the right path!

title: Would be perfect but...
body: The concept of the app is great and really a plan that anyone could enjoy accept for the fact that you pretty much have to pay to get any information, it gives you recipes but you go to click on it and you can‚Äôt see it until you give them money. There‚Äôs no point in downloading unless you willing to pay.

title: Big issues, no response from customer service
body: If you pay upfront for an entire year, be prepared to never hear from their customer service. A piece of the app has time/date issues if you live in America. At 6pm my time, the app‚Äôs journal and food log have already shifted to the next day and you can‚Äôt select for it to go backwards in time. The grocery list is ridiculous and doesn‚Äôt exist if you aren‚Äôt on a specific diet plan. The macros are incorrect and display properly. Be aware!

title: Ok...
body: The app itself looks great, love the various options for meal plans. The meal plans however do not have many great options. I don‚Äôt eat sea food and there was no option to opt out of fish, many of the dishes included fish or shrimp. Many of the recipes included speciality items that no everyone has access to. Cancelled my membership and will be looking for a better option.

title: Awesome
body: I love this app so far. I only wish there were more recipes. The other thing is that whenever I tried to upgrade to try the full version, I couldn‚Äôt because my payment method is none. I use iTune cards. Would you please solve this problem.

title: Food database difficult to work with
body: When scanning prepackaged items the information was incorrect almost every time. Fresh foods were often wrong as well. Wanted me to update weight daily. Going back to MyFitnessPal.

title: Easy to use!
body: I absolutely lovethe app. I upgraded right away and love all of the options. It helps me stay on track of my new keto lifestyle and sends gentle reminders to weigh in and log in what I ate. I cannot say enough. I have not even used all of the options yet, but I will! I lost 12 pounds!üéâ

title: Losing connection with Apple Watch
body: Frequently loses the connection to my Apple Watch to collect my Activity data. Is an update in the works to fix the bug? I‚Äôve done everything possible with both the watch and the phone to rectify the problem, but it still occurs.

title: Motivation required
body: Easy to use app. Some yummy recipes in case you‚Äôre have a hard time figuring out what to cook. This comes with premium subscription. Logs exercises when I use my iwatch. I think it‚Äôs worth the money if you‚Äôre serious about changing your eat habits.

title: 2 stars
body: 2 stars simply because the app doesn‚Äôt accurately track your walking calories after you run using your Nike app it will track the calories burnt on the Nike app but automatically stop counting the calories you burnt walking and will stop counting the calories you are using while walking

title: too many bugs
body: I really enjoy the aesthetics of this app and it‚Äôs variety of features, but even with a premium subscription, the statistics page is highly inaccurate. My average calorie intakes is off by 1k calories or more (plus, no bar graph is displayed beyond three months) and the calorie intake by category section gives categories that are not even full words. I am struggling to decide if this app is worth the subscription price.

title: Can we get a database of all the groceries we have in the house??
body: I love this but think I‚Äôd have an easier time if I could scan all the food when I get home from buying them so that they‚Äôre already on my phone and ready to be counted

title: WAY too many bugs, but could be good with fixes.
body: This app needs a lot of work! It totally limits your ability to use the measurement you need (eg, doesn‚Äôt offer cups, tsp, etc for all foods); many of the measurements are crazy incorrect (eg 200 calories for one cup but 5,000 for one TBSP); and it keeps deleting my exercises linked from FitBit. I‚Äôll be returning the Premium subscription I bought.

title: Great app
body: Love this app. It has been helping me make healthier choices and keep on top of my hydration. The only pitfall is the recipes. I so very much want to try all of the yummy looking recipes, but when I select one, there is no way to actually view the recipe. Just nutrition facts. If I could actually use the recipes provided, this app would be perfect.

title: New to the app
body: I suffer from chronic migraines, so that is why I got this app, to help track my eating habits. I wish it would total my carbs and sodium for me. It probably would if I paid for itüòí otherwise easy to use app and my 21 yo son is using it as well to help motivate him as he wants to bulk up and exercise and possibly enlist in the military. He likes the app as well.

title: Looks Nice, but the database...
body: ... is not so good. I search for Mountain Dew and find ~15 entries that are all mislabeled in some way. The top entry has the calories incorrect. This appears to be the case often. Verified items, if there are any, are not clearly labeled. The app looks nice though, which goes a long way for me. I‚Äôm not sure if it can overcome the database though.

title: Great App Thus Far
body: I enjoy the graphics... tight, clean look (easy on the eyes). Little fat green guy that whistles ... and waits for you to input your info.

title: Help.
body: My keyboard is stuck on the bitmoji keyboard and I‚Äôve closed the app, restarted my phone and removed bitmoji from access and I still can‚Äôt type. It‚Äôs only on this app that it is stuck. Very frustrated.

title: Needs Improvement
body: I use this app from time to time but one of my main pet peeves is how little is available to you without a Premium subscription. Key word - SUBSCRIPTION. I would 500% pay for this app, or pay for a Premium account, but I don‚Äôt want to CONTINUE to pay for it every single month I am using it. Please make a one-time purchase option; I‚Äôm begging you!!! I would love this.

title: Fun, simple, and helpful!
body: I love this app. I‚Äôve been to calorie counter apps, and none of them worked well for me. Then I found life sum, and it changed my life. I felt good and comfortable about tracking and it was just so easy! I‚Äôve lost almost 3 pounds already! I love this app so much! Thank you :)

title: Descent
body: It‚Äôs a really great app. I like how it‚Äôs free and it‚Äôs fitted to you. My only complaint is that you can‚Äôt do a meal plan without getting Lifesum premium. That bothers the heck outta me. That was actually one of the main things I got this app and I can‚Äôt do it without having to pay. Like I said that is my only complaint and everything else is great. I would still recommend it to others.

title: best nutrition calculator
body: i payed for the premium version and it works like wonders! usually it‚Äôd take me some time to think about before purchasing something in an APP, but if you‚Äôre seriously focusing on eating better and calculating what you eat, then this app is for you!

title: A Bit Buggy Recently
body: I love this app, but lately it‚Äôs been a bit buggy. The smiley faces keep disappearing. I‚Äôve uninstalled a few times and when I reinstall, they come back only to vanish when I open the app up again. Maybe this version isn‚Äôt compatible with the new model iPhones or the software.

title: Two EASY updates NEEDED
body: Number One: I create my own breakfast bars that have 10 ingredients. It would be so much easier for me to create my own breakfast bar item with all of its ingredients I add myself once and save that breakfast bar rather than having to enter each ingredient in daily.

title: Eh
body: I have had this app for two weeks now and I really enjoyed it. Well, thats when they had the daily ratings. For some reason that I don‚Äôt know the daily ratings are now something you have to buy. I can get everything else that‚Äôs free on here on another app too except for the daily ratings and I really liked those. Now it‚Äôs just like every other health app.

title: Too Heavy To Sign Up
body: The interface is beautiful, The ease of use is great. What turned me off was that the max starting weight one could enter was 300lbs. I‚Äôm 360lbs, and the app didn‚Äôt believe me, it asked if I was sure I put in the right number. Is there a certain algorithm in the app that is unable to compute anything higher? Sorry, maybe I‚Äôll check this app out again when I‚Äôm below 300.

title: Love this app just wish it had more Apple Watch features
body: This app is awesome for picking a plan that works for me.  It is very user-friendly. The only reason I gave it four stars is I would love to be able to record my food intake on my Apple Watch and have it be part of the modular face where I can see my progress at a glance.

This app really makes tracking calories/fitness so easy! Never have i ever come across an app that offers SO MUCH FREE stuff!!! I did however subscribe to the premium($3.75 a month) and it‚Äôs even better! Try it out for yourself and you‚Äôll see just how great it is!

title: üò§ Bad App...if only it worked with iwatch
body: DO NOT DOWNLOAD if you want to use with iwatch4. Does not sync with watch. Spent an hour on phone with Apple and confirmed no issues with phone or watch.

title: Recent Update Bugs ?
body: Since the recent update, my calories eaten and burned stay at the same number the entire day no matter what I log. I haven‚Äôt been able to use for a few days since that started happening.

title: Negative reinforcement
body: I enjoy the interface for adding food and counting calories. What I don‚Äôt enjoy is within my first use of this app I was given three negative judgements: I was told I gained weight, I was overweight, and that olive oil deserves an ‚Äúugh‚Äù face. Losing weight is fraught with feeling bad. This app needs to adjust its symbolism and approach to the user to lean more towards positivity.

title: Best tracker I‚Äôve used yet
body: I‚Äôve always struggled with counting calories or macros, but lifesum is the first app I‚Äôve used that made it as easy as possible. My only issue, and it‚Äôs small, is that the water intake can‚Äôt be customized to the size of your own water bottle. Otherwise it‚Äôs a fantastic app and I may get the premium version soon.

title: Beautiful App. Difficult to log basic food.
body: I love the look and simplicity of this app... but logging basic foods is more difficult than it needs to be. I‚Äôve used lots of calorie counting apps and this one is especially frustrating for logging the basics, like an egg. It seems to reward eating out ‚Äî the top items in search results are for restaurants etc. I eat mostly at home and prefer apps that are more geared to that.

title: Wasted $45
body: I got this app because the ad copy was communicating that it had features that I wanted. There‚Äôs no free trial and the developer‚Äôs FAQ says that I can get a refund from Apple if I request it in 14 days. Turns out that isn‚Äôt true. It hasn‚Äôt even been 24 hours and I put in a request for a refund to Apple and it was denied because it didn‚Äôt ‚Äúmeet their criteria‚Äù for a refund. Turns out the truth is all sales are final. I‚Äôd avoid this app at all costs unless you‚Äôre 100% certain that it‚Äôs exactly what you want.

title: not counting calories right
body: i recently downloaded this app again because it worked great when i used it last! nothing has changed much, except for the fact that every time i put in food it counts the calories wrong. let's say i had a lunch that totaled up to 300 calories. the counter would say i ate 300 calories but it would also say i was 300 calories under my normal goal. i tried this out again but only put in part of my lunch. the total was 50 calories, but the counter said i was 50 calories under my goal. i don't know if i did something wrong or if my app glitched, i deleted it and downloaded it again but i'm getting the same results :/

title: To make it even better
body: Along with other reviews, I‚Äôd love it if this app would give me suggested meals to get back on track. Other than that, it‚Äôs awesome and I‚Äôve lost 5 pounds in the first week, and more leaving as the days pass. Thanks to the team who created this.

title: Great app horrible customer service
body: I love the app it‚Äôs self the only complaint I have is that I‚Äôve been unable to sync my Fitbit to the app. It indicates that it is synced however the information is never accurate. I‚Äôve reached out and have even sent an email to tech support but they never bothered addressing my issue or even responding to my email. Great app but horrible customer service.

title: Don‚Äôt purchase
body: If you want to use the free version. I bought a year subscription and I can‚Äôt tell you how many times the app has said I have burned 500 more calories than what my Apple Watch has said (which is where it‚Äôs connected at). Not only that there are several calories wrong based off the actual nutritional information off the box itself. I just would not waste my money. Pretty sure that‚Äôs exactly what I did too and they won‚Äôt give me my money back.

title: No web functionality, even with premium
body: The website seems to contain more functionality, paywalled behind the Premium plan, but once you pay that, it turns out that there‚Äôs nothing additional, and everything has to be done via the app. That‚Äôs a dealbreaker for me when it comes to software for diet/nutrition tracking that includes recipes. I want to be able to use both ‚Äî app for meal entry and quick tracking, and website for meal planning and cooking.

title: Love this app but needs some improvement
body: This app is really great and it helps me keep track of my food and calories but I have a suggestion. There are many foods that I eat that I can‚Äôt find on the app so it would be really great if there can be a feature where we can create our own recipes.

title: Easy to Use
body: Very straightforward and I love the art designs. I just wish we could track micronutrients as well, like vitamins and minerals. I think it‚Äôd be really easy to implement since we can scan the barcode for most of the information anyway.

title: Could be better
body: The app is atheistically pleasing but the functionality is still not as good as My Fitness Pal.   I have had numerous issues with the app not loading, issues with logging foods and then dropping out and creating personalized meals/recipes/foods.  Wish I could get my money back as logging food has become increasingly frustrating with this app. Going back to MFP.

title: Not working
body: This app would be great if it functioned as designed. I added breakfast to my food diary and it worked. Now when I select a food item for lunch or dinner and select add, it goes back to the food diary without adding anything. Tried deleting breakfast and adding it back to test it. Nope. Now it won‚Äôt save anything to the food diary. Same if I relaunch the app.

title: Free app is useless
body: Free version doesn‚Äôt allow for anything other than for you to give them your personal information. Deleted app, tried to delete my account; impossible. There is a link on the webpage to delete but it doesn‚Äôt work. Why would I pay for an app when I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll like it or not? No features work in the free version. No recipes, no food tracking, etc. waste of my time and now they have my personal info and I cannot delete it.

title: It‚Äôs awesome, and worth the premium buy
body: It recommends food diet plans for you specifically after taking a personality test. You can log everything you eat and it counts calories. When you enter what exercises you do, it subtracts from the calories you‚Äôve eaten. I love love love it!

title: Add the ability to import meals
body: My wife and I both use the app. It would save us time if we could export/import meals between our accounts instead of having to enter all meals separately. Sharing meals currently only shows an image but doesn‚Äôt allow the user to add that meal. Everything else works great.

title: This app is rubbish
body: Whatever you do, don‚Äôt pay for a subscription. You might as well flush your $30 down the toilet. App requires an internet connection, and Lifesum‚Äôs servers are frequently down. Also, database of foods is wildly inaccurate, sometimes comically so. You absolutely cannot rely on it for correct calorie or protein counts. Which means you‚Äôll be using Google all the time to look up nutrition information, causing you to ask why you bothered to download this app and subscribe to the service.

title: Devs don‚Äôt listen / Fonts & Lettering Too Small
body: I complained to Lifesum for over a year for making the caloric wheel and word lettering fonts too small on larger size phones. These devs don‚Äôt care what looks good, but only for your money. MyPlate app dashboard is easier to quickly read without squinting and is more visually appealing because everything is bigger. Lifesum guys stared out making a quality app and then evolved into not giving a crap only wanting your money. I wouldn‚Äôt buy the Lifesum if it was 75% off.

title: Lost all of my data!!!
body: This program lost all of my data!!!  It refused to accept my login although I inputted it correctly. I purchased the premium plan and now cannot access my data!!! I cannot locate how to contact the support team to regain my app data and premium plan. This app was a ‚Äú5Star‚Äù app for me until this horrible glitch!!!  I don‚Äôt want to have to restart with entering all of my favorites etc plus I ALREADY PAID FOR THE PREMIUM PLAN!!!!!  Uggggghhhh!

title: VERY Inaccurate
body: I absolutely love the layout of the app, everything is extremely easy to use! The advertising is, however, quite excessive if you‚Äôre not a premium member. The worst part about the app, and the reason I no longer use it, is because the nutrition facts for food items were just HORRIBLY inaccurate! I have yet to find a food item whose nutrition facts in the app match the nutrition facts for the same serving size listed on the bag.

title: Best macro app I have found
body: All around very good app. At first I was a little disappointed because I was un aware that I could create custom meals and enter custom macros for at home recipes, but a developer informed me of that ability! That, plus the extensive food database makes it easy and fun to count!

title: Great for keto or regular healthy eating
body: I used this before I started Keto and it helped me manage my healthy eating.

title: Making a big difference in my life
body: Really appreciate this app. At first I was not sure what eating plan to choose. I tried different ones before landing on the Mediterranean diet. By using the app, I have improved my diet, gained awareness of what I am eating, and lost weight. Thank you!

title: Seeing progress
body: This is the first app that I use that I‚Äôve had any progress. Also feel very positive about it because the price was good. It offers plans along with grocery list. Therefore price is reasonable. Very happy with this app great design, great attention to detail.

title: Lifesum is Great!
body: I really enjoy this app. It‚Äôs hard to stay motivated in eating healthy all the time. I love the way it shows you how much fat,carbs, and protein you‚Äôre eating so you know how much you need to get the right proportions. If you are struggling with the discipline to eat healthy, try this app.

title: Good app- would like one more feature
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for almost a year now and whenever I am actively tracking it is really helpful. I saw on some old blog posts that you can share your progress/meals with friends but it does not look like an option any more. I would give a 5 star review if this were an active feature.

title: I need to speak to someone!
body: The app is great so far and it makes it fun and motivates you more to add the amount of water intake throughout the day.

title: Most frustrating app
body: Coming from MFP this app is way less user friendly, has way less items when you search for stuff, just all around painful.  The only reason people are even giving any more than one star is because it‚Äôs pretty.  Such a frustrating app.  If you reverse the word you search you get completely different results.  Half the times the searches aren‚Äôt even in there and you have to manually enter all the info.

title: Share meals?
body: My wife and I have been using this app for a while, finally updated for ‚Äúpremium‚Äù and we really enjoy the macros. The recipes aren‚Äôt the greatest but the part that we dislike the most is we can‚Äôt share our custom recipes so we can stay on track. Maybe something can be added a little down the road like carb managers app..

title: Good but incomplete
body: The calorie tracker is amazing for calorie intake. But it falls off for tracking calories burned. The limit on the type of exercises is damaging to the performance of the app. Also, if there was an option to switch from minutes done to reps/sets done, it would increase the accuracy of the workout portion.

title: Good... but could be better
body: I don‚Äôt hate this app. It‚Äôs a great way to track your meals and water intake, but it‚Äôs lacking in some areas. Maybe it‚Äôs because I didn‚Äôt get a subscription, but almost all of the exercises I do were ‚Äúunable to be found‚Äù when I went to log them. Also, some of the foods I logged were completely different on the labels than in the app, and I did not enjoy the massive discrepancies.

title: Good App
body: I like the app because it has most store bought items. I wish it had more meals and way to edit them. I use the paleo diet and I see meals and I would like to add them but state items I excluded so that it gives me a better reading. Just a feature I would appreciate . Including more meals on the paleo food.

title: Some bugs with the Goal setting
body: I set the goal to lose weight, but it will sometimes change to gain weight automatically for no reason. Also when you switch the goal, it won‚Äôt recalculate the calories again, but when you change the weeks needed, it will eventually recalculate the calories.

title: Glitch after new update
body: Great app for counting macros! Beautifully designed ged and user friendly. However, after new update there is a glitch that won‚Äôt show calories burned. It sets to zero for a couple seconds then shows calories burned. Not a big deal but is kind of annoying.

title: Import recipe
body: I've been enjoying this app the past week, nice user interface, tracks food, water, etc.

title: Great but wish there was more...
body: I love how easy this is to use and the info it does have but I do wish it had more info on examples of what is keto friendly and more recipes. I also wish they had a larger exercise library. Small wish list for a great app. The smiley faces that let me know how I‚Äôm doing are too cute as well

title: Poor performance for a great idea
body: Calorie count, fat count, protein count, carb count... nearly twice a day I add a food to my diary and the counts are all off. Milk doesn‚Äôt have 30 grams of sugar. The conversions are not calculating correctly either. This was such a waste of money and there is no way to get a refund. If the developers spent more time on getting accurate information and less time on looking pretty they would make a real difference, otherwise this is just a sham. Really disappointed.

title: Honest opinion
body: I like the layout and ease of adding a goal and foods to my daily log. However, I want to keep track of the total water I drink, not just the suggested goal. I surpass that water goal when I make it the max. I‚Äôd like to just keep adding oz by oz to my daily intake.

title: Would have been 5 Stars
body: I love this app. It used to work well with my Apple Watch, but one day it stopped working. I thought it was because I have the free version so I paid to see if that would make it start tracking my calories burned again. And it still doesn‚Äôt! I googled it and it seems to be a reoccurring issue with users. Please fix this!!!

title: Beautifully Bad...
body: I wanted to love this App so much bc of its visual appeal- I stop using it a couple months ago and switched to a different app. Today I used this one again with high hopes but the database is still messed up. I scanned some barcodes and wrong nutritional value comes up.  Also the measurements are random on different items so I find myself looking thru multiple items to find what works best.  Too much of a headache.

title: Best app I‚Äôve ever purchased!
body: I‚Äôve been religiously using this app since November 2018. I started at 312 lbs and I‚Äôm currently weighing in at 249.  This app takes the guesswork out of trying to figure out what to eat.

title: Wrong information
body: I wanted to love this up I really did. Second time I‚Äôm trying it too!

title: Lectin Free Plan Please
body: I‚Äôm new to this app, but have signed up for the premium version. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be able to use it very effectively because the food plan I follow is not available. Please offer a Lectin Free option for those of us healing with the Plant Paradox program.  I don‚Äôt want lectures about how healthier unhealthy it is, it works for me. I will delete the app soon if I cannot use it. Otherwise, I think it‚Äôs helpful for a lot of people.

title: Wont let me even sign up for it
body: I‚Äôm 20 years old and 4ft 11 and somehow it wont let me sign up for it. It won‚Äôt let me login through Apple ID, email, nor facebook. It keeps telling me that it doesn‚Äôt match the client secret. Which makes no sense to me because i have never used this app before so i literally have no idea what any of this means. I tried searching for what it means and I found absolutely nothing. I dont see the point in using this app if I can‚Äôt even sign in at all.

title: No need for premium!
body: Kind of annoyed that I upgraded to the premium to get the "plans" however they are not plans at all, rather a generic overview of what that type of diet consists of. Why would I pay the subscription when nothing changed! I could have still tracked my food intake without upgrading! Seems just like myfitnesspal. I was hoping for something better with this app and was hoping the plans were actually going to be something you can follow.

title: Okay so far; but UI issues take away from experience
body: It‚Äôs an okay experience so far because of UI issues. Swiping to go back in Settings is broken. If I‚Äôm in settings and tap ‚ÄúPersonal Details,‚Äù for example, and then swipe back, I won‚Äôt return to the Settings menu I was in. The app will glitch out and send me back to my ‚ÄúProfile‚Äù page. Please fix!

title: Major lack of thorough accuracy
body: First, there‚Äôs no way to connect with a support team or person. I‚Äôm not able to deactivate a plan so it‚Äôs changing my daily Caloric expectations, which I don‚Äôt want. And, I am also trying to change the protein, carbs and fat ratio for the meals that I create, because their system is not calculating anything correctly. There‚Äôs no way to change that, so what‚Äôs the point? Now I have to go through the inconvenient process of canceling and getting my money back.

title: An Idea
body: What if the app on your home screen had the circle actually fill up according to your actual calorie intake. So if I was half way to my calorie count for the circle would be half filled on the front of the app on your home page.

title: Really helpful
body: This really shows me what I am doing wrong in my daily health schedule and sense I am using this app I now know that my ‚Äúhealth‚Äù schedule wasn‚Äôt all that healthy what I‚Äôm trying to say is if you haven‚Äôt used this if you get it it will be a huge help in a diet

title: Recommend it
body: Best free calorie tracking app. Easy to use and you can get the most out of it for free than almost every other app I‚Äôve tried l. If you have and Apple Watch you can also add/ connect your workouts in to subtract your calories. Great app!

The design of the app is very user friendly and the overall layout is appealing. My only issue with this app was the use of smiley/frowning faces next to the foods. The whole point of calorie counting is to know the macronutrient breakdown of your food and the appropriate portions. There shouldn‚Äôt be an emotional connection to the food itself. There‚Äôs no ‚Äúbad‚Äù food, just food that needs to be eaten in moderation. It seems like an eating disorder in the making.

title: Wish there was a free trial
body: I‚Äôm already regretting my purchase and wish I

title: Love the app but..
body: I have been addicted to using this app for the past couple months since I‚Äôve wanted to track my macros and get a better idea of how I am eating. Love the look and feel of the app and how easy it is to use, but now it‚Äôs starting to not load/add my food entries. Please fix because I do love the app.

title: Horrible app, not applicable to most people
body: This app is the worst. Not only did it not allow for a refund after I decided within 8 minutes that the upgrade was trash, but it also doesn‚Äôt take into account different types of diets, allergies, and dislikes. DO NOT BUY THIS APP because it is a scam. I‚Äôm so mad I‚Äôm out $30 for an upgrade that was the farthest thing from helpful. Give me my money back & make it possible for people with different allergies to succeed with this horrible app.

title: Keto diet
body: Just started to keep track of everything I eat and this is the easiest and fastest app I‚Äôve ever tried. Would highly

title: Wish I could edit
body: If there was an app like this that let me put I‚Äôm disabled and can‚Äôt do the exercises or amount it wants I‚Äôd be happy and it would be the perfect app. I love everything about this one except that it takes points off because my exercise and walking is low.

title: Something is wrong
body: Pretty easy app to use once you get into the rhythm of recording everything. I would suggest perhaps having the ability to separate the different snacks and not just have them altogether.

title: Good feature, not so well functioned
body: The app has good features to track variety of items, but the app doesn‚Äôt refresh data well after updating/correcting entries of food, diet plan, etc. You end up being stuck with wrong data and records, which is quite frustrating. For the premium price of $45/yr, I expect better.

title: A great app with a little dodgy data
body: I would give this app five stars. But some of the foods in the database are wildly in accurate and could do with more careful curating. However, I realize that that requires human intervention and is costly.

title: Super Useless
body: I‚Äôm not sure who they paid (apple) to get featured but this app is essentially useless.  Why have recipes but not organize them into meal plans to make things easier on people.  The entire purpose of the app is to make eating and living healthy easier but good lord it‚Äôs such a terrible UX.  The whole favoriting and pulling recipes is terrible.

title: Pretty, but inaccurate.
body: Used LifeSum for a few weeks, and the database is incomplete and inaccurate. Maybe it‚Äôs my strict Keto foods, but reviewing my macros in several different apps and LifeSum being the oddball, lead me to start looking harder at the macros of the items input. More often than not, they were wrong.

title: Funny and motivational, occasionally flaky
body: For food tracking and helping you focus on the foods you want to eat this app is great. However, the synch between devices can be off and it has the odd moment (all your meal ratings go sad or a day disappears from your weekly chart ). I still recommend though. Hey, I‚Äôve lost 9lb...

title: Don‚Äôt like the set up
body: I looked at this app for awhile and planned it for my keto diet, finally signed up for the premium. I keep trying to scan food in or Type it in but it doesn‚Äôt know or have the info. Kind of annoying, my fitness pal is way easier to function and has more of a range with the food you tell it. I‚Äôm still learning the app but it‚Äôs pretty basic when it compares to myfitness pal, I tried it. Mehhh

title: Plan system doesnt work for me
body: Took the test and I said I was vegetarian and needed high protein for muscle growth snd it gave me the food for strength plan. This plan has meat recipes for it though? Why would it even ask if i eat meat or not if its just going to reccomend meat recipes. I thought it would give me recipes and a grocery shop list(definetly should if you pay a subscription) but it just gives me recipes that dont even align with my diet.

title: I love it. One little annoying thing...
body: I love this app with just one little thing that annoys me: it doesn‚Äôt read Apple health water intake. I use a different app to track water and remind me to drink water. I don‚Äôt want to track my water via lifesum. PLEASE fix this. It‚Äôs such a small thing but it would make this a 5 Star review.

title: Enjoying so far!
body: I really like this app visually. And I love the notifications - helps me stay in too if my water intake and eating st the right times.

title: Mostly Seems like a great app but prices need a little work
body: Me and my parents were interested in the app but we don‚Äôt think that the prices are fair enough. Instead of paying monthly, we can pay a one time fee/price in the apple store. That way we won‚Äôt have to spend too much money monthly and save the prices all up to one to pay for!

title: Not bad, but not the best.
body: There‚Äôs not an option in this app to create custom meals, so when you add up an omelette for example, you have to add it up separately every time.

title: Diet Plans the best!
body: I‚Äôve tried several apps for weight loss and this one by far is the best for me. It challenges me to eat better and that‚Äôs better than just the capabilities to count calories. The several diet plans are also a huge plus. Love this app!

title: Keto amazement!
body: So I decided to go all in. And this app is such a tremendous help! It keeps me on track, let‚Äôs me know when I‚Äôm not, and gives me smiley or frown faces to let me know if I‚Äôm doing what I‚Äôm supposed to. Thank you to the creators and designers of the app. You are helping to change a life!!

title: Love but could need some work
body: I love this app it has helped me lose a good amount of weight. However, when I went to connect my step counter with the app it will record the steps one day and then not record the next.

title: Better for someone who knows keto well
body: I thought the recipes were delicious! BUT when I purchased the plan, I thought it would give me a concise plan that counted all the macros for me.

title: Love it...when it works
body: I love this app but once I upgraded to premium it doesn‚Äôt seem to work as efficiently. My calorie intake and exercise calories are consistently mixed up and every few days I have go into the settings to manually turn on the exercise tracking again. It has the potential to be a great app but honestly it‚Äôs a little frustrating to use daily. Bugs need to get fixed - especially if people are expected to upgrade to premium.

title: Almost perfect
body: So I was looking at the food and recipes and stuff like that. I scrolled down to look at the nutrition facts but I couldn‚Äôt look at them because it was covered by an add for the subscription. I would like to know the nutrition facts of the food I am wanting to make without having to buy the subscription.

title: Beautifully designed and easy to use!
body: I've been using this app for about a month now and I love it! It's beautifully designed and easy to use. Somtimes the loading can take a little while, but they‚Äôve fixed the bigger loading issues with this new release.

title: Great except...
body: I love everything about this app except that it won‚Äôt stay synced with my Apple Watch so I have to reconnect it at least once a day to get accurate calories burned. Other than that annoying tidbit, I like how it‚Äôs focused on overall health and not just weight loss. The little icons are a cute touch.

title: Update weight
body: I had to reset all of my progress to fix the update weight setting. I kept getting a message that read ‚ÄúAre you sure this is the right number?‚Äù And it wouldn't let me update my weight. Other than having to do that this app is fantastic.

title: Wrong nutritional value
body: I would‚Äôve given it one more star but whenever I use the barcode to scan my food in, the nutritional values related to 90% of what I‚Äôve scanned so far is WRONG and I‚Äôm CONSTANTLY having to change it and reregister the barcode, it‚Äôs extremely annoying. Literally 90% of the time I‚Äôve had to do this over the last week.

title: Problem with Lifesum app
body: App can be very helpful with tracking what you eat throughout the day but a lot of their info on calories is incorrect and sometimes you can‚Äôt find info on certain foods. App also does not take into account people with certain dietary concerns. I have type 2 diabetes and the app often tells me I‚Äôm not eating enough carbs

title: Misleading subscriptions
body: I was interested in exploring this app as it seemed useful but the subscriptions advertised made it seem like it is a monthly subscription. That is not the case until after your initial payment of the full year...I don‚Äôt appreciate being misled into purchasing a full year upfront when I really only wanted to pay monthly. Now I basically have to ask for permission to get my money back from apple...who knows how long that‚Äôll take...

title: Would like the ability to edit or delete my own recipes
body: I would like the ability to edit and delete my own recipes.

title: Worst waste of time
