I choice this app over myfitnesspal for that reason and it just over all seemed better put together but now the free version is pointless. Nothing but a calorie counter and I can get other apps to do more. Sad to see you go üò¢

title: Wonderful App!
body: Easy to use. Worth the annual fee for the upgrade. Using it for 5:2 and it‚Äôs perfect. The emoji responses to food choices are great and I love that nothing gets a ‚Äúbad‚Äù response, just neutral. Like üòê instead of ‚òπÔ∏è or üò†.

title: Horrible App
body: This is one of the worst health tracker apps I‚Äôve ever used! Barely works, I keep scanning and entering food and it won‚Äôt even save anything to my diary! So many things you scan and they aren‚Äôt even in the database. So frustrating!

title: Amazing app!
body: This app has been my go to! So much better than my fitness pal or any of the other calorie tracking apps.

title: Often can‚Äôt start app frozen at splash screen
body: This app got pretty good content. For for many times in a day, I cannot start this app. It‚Äôs stuck at the splash screen. Often at a time I mostly want to look up nutrition or record down my intakes. What a bummer.

title: Review changed to 5 stars
body: Awesome app, I had to update my settings. Very easy to use. Customer service was patient and walk me through the process.

title: Overall, it‚Äôs a good app BUT...
body: ... they don‚Äôt have a recipe builder function in this App, and for someone who does a lot of her own cooking this is essential for accurate tracking. So my calories are probably off by a lot, which isn‚Äôt great to say about a weight loss dieting app.

title: Premium does not include all meal plans listed
body: False advertising! Premium only includes meal plans for 4 of the daily suggested nutritional valves. Why would I purchase an app to spit out macros I can easily obtain online for free?!?! Do not purchase this app if you‚Äôre simply looking for something to generate meal plans tailored to your goals. This is only for those wanting to lose weight or try out a vegan diet for a week.

title: Love the meal plans, but...
body: I haven‚Äôt used it very often as of yet but it looks like a good app. My biggest issue with it is that you can‚Äôt easily add your own recipes like you can in MyFitnessPal.

title: Great Help
body: This app is great. It‚Äôs the only calorie counting app I‚Äôve found that also helps me follow a Mediterranean Diet! I love the veggie and fruit trackers it as. I wish it has a tracker for alcohol that helped you keep yourself under so many drinks to help with weight loss

title: Very difficult to find food
body: Even for large retailers like Trader Joe‚Äôs. I think more time should be spent making logging food easier. I find it a bit lazy to make the users in charge of the database, and as we can all see it isn‚Äôt working out. If other apps managed to do it I‚Äôm sure lifesum can too. And as I‚Äôm paying to use the app I think resources should be delegated to this.

title: Be careful
body: The app says that your subscription is $2.99 a month which although is true is charged all at once!!! Which is confusing when using apps because we assume it‚Äôs per month and then you can cancel. Now I‚Äôm stuck again with an app that I won‚Äôt use probably!  Doesn‚Äôt even provide that many options for the price. Don‚Äôt buy

title: Ugh
body: Seems like a cool app but there should be a free 30 day trial for the premium features. Tons of other apps out there you don‚Äôt have to pay for to see nutrition details. I need to see if I like the premium details before spending money on the feature. Wanted to love the app since I count my macros daily. What a let down.

title: Best App for Tracking Calories, Macros, etc...
body: The free version is great; gets the job done. The premium(I think $40/yr) customizes a plan for you and is super easy to follow. Very smooth and calming appearance to the app. Great download!

title: Carbo loading goal needed
body: Good app but needs to have a goal option called Carbo Loading.

title: Love LifeSum!
body: I find this app easy to use. Visually appealing and well designed. Responsive and quick to load.

title: Good
body: 1 suggestion:Maybe y‚Äôall can make it support logging recent,frequent,and be able to search for food in the Watch app.

title: Please Fix The Apple Watch Complication
body: Everything else about this app is great. But the Apple Watch complication does not update reliably. Even deep pressing the watch and pushing refresh does nothing for the complication. The only way I‚Äôve found is to switch to a different complication and then switch back. I‚Äôm using Apple Watch Series 4 with the latest OS. Bottom right complication on the info graph modular face.

title: Worried
body: I‚Äôve been experiencing a lot of glitches lately. I‚Äôm worried because I paid for a year long subscription and as of recently a lot of the features have not been working for me. I was in love with this app but it‚Äôs just been aggravating me as of late.

title: User friendly and visually appealing effective app
body: Helped me loose 16 kg over 1 year (from 89 kg to 73 kg) by religiously tracking food and workouts. Highly recommended for those who want to loose weight using a free app.

title: Decent App
body: Good decent app comparing to myfitnesspal. The UI is beautifully done and Easy to use. End up not using this because it doesn‚Äôt give me an options to display total carbs/protein/fat intake. Only show me how much I go over and not net gain.

title: On Point!
body: This app makes it so easy to track

title: Useless
body: So, if you‚Äôre on a smaller side and don‚Äôt have too much extra weight but just want to get rid of last couple of stubborn lbs and tone your body the app won‚Äôt let you put in your weight and set a goal. It won‚Äôt let you proceed and will demand to change your starting weight (meaning lie about it) and the goal, making it completely useless.

title: Missing important information
body: The app is great, but it‚Äôs missing important information specially during these COVID-19 times.

title: It‚Äôs a good app
body: It‚Äôs a good app but the reason why I gave it 3 stars is because there isn‚Äôt an option to only pay once monthly..it only has 3 options for 12months 6months and 3months plans...at that point why not just charge the $50 to download the app instead üòíüòí

title: great app!
body: i‚Äôve been using lifesum for 2 years and it‚Äôs going great. it‚Äôs very helpful for loosing weight and focusing on a diet. just got a gym membership too and this app has definitely helped me stay hydrated. however i‚Äôd like to see more options in dietary requirements. for example dairy free or gluten free instead of it only being an allergy. also the recipes they‚Äôre very helpful but i‚Äôm not able to get some stuff for the recipes i think there should be alternatives recommended.

title: Great app with some bugs

title: Annoyed
body: App isn‚Äôt working after an update from yesterday and exercise part needs an update but for the most part I like this app just wish they fixed the bugs it takes away from the app.

title: App is good. But the lack of a single feature makes it unusable for me

title: It‚Äôs okay
body: I love the concept, however the biggest drawbacks are the water intake calculator and the scanning. The water intake calculator does not allow me to adjust the size of the water bottle I‚Äôm using to track my intake. Additionally, the scanning feature isn‚Äôt properly scanning my food.

title: Good, but some features lacking so far

title: Love it
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for only a few days, but I love it already! It‚Äôs very easy to use and does the job. Counting the calories has gone easy!

title: Great but needs some tweaks

title: Still doesn‚Äôt work with Apple Watch

title: Didn‚Äôt work and charged me for a year
body: Purchased premium which was advertised around $4 a month and then it charged me $42 for a whole year instead.

title: Stick with MFP

But it continually sends notifications to complete actions already completed (‚Äòupdate your weight and measurements‚Äô - ugh, I did that 10 mins ago), sometimes fails to save or display food log updates, and has a less extensive/trustworthy database of nutrition data than MyFitnessPal.

title: Buggy

title: I can‚Äôt even start...

(My BMI is 16.6) so I can‚Äôt continue because it just keeps asking me if that‚Äôs the right number :( makes me sad cause this seemed like an alright app that could help me out

title: I‚Äôm really enjoying the app

title: AMAZING
body: This app is so amazing and easy to use. I have lost three pounds in three pounds in three days!! You can scan a product for health info or search it in the app!!

title: Can I get a refund?

title: Terrible

It will not consider both peloton and steps calories, only one. Every few days all of the calorie burn data disappears. It‚Äôs just terrible.

Similarly, I wanted to delete a category under my measurements and it would not let me. Please fix these glitches.

title: Disappointed

Every time I type in my email it tells me it‚Äôs wrong even tho it‚Äôs 100 percent correct and I don‚Äôt know why it won‚Äôt accept my email but I got tired of just retyping in my email and I gave up which was disappointing because I was really excited to try out this app

title: 12+ or not?

This confused me and I wondered why it recommended the app for 12 AND OLDER but wouldn‚Äôt let me sign up as a 12 year old.

title: Pretty easy to use

title: Great App

title: A good app for weight loss

title: Misleading
body: A lot of calorie information in the database is incorrect. For example, under whole milk, a cup has 21 calories and a tablespoon has 308 calories. Makes me doubt everything in the database. I don‚Äôt always have a barcode to scan so the search results need to be accurate and they are not.

title: The nutritional info doesn‚Äôt calculate correctly.
body: The nutritional information does not calculate correctly for most foods. For example the grams of carbs will say 10 sugar 11 fiber but the total carbs is 71g.  This has happened for most of the food I have entered. Then the daily totals are incorrect and overall this app is not doing what is designed to do, so I end up manually calculating my daily totals.

title: Ability to export diary
body: I have a personal trainer and I need to be able to share my diet with him and there isn‚Äôt a easy way to export or share the data. In my fitnesspal I can share with Facebook friends. I would love to see this change

body: The app looks nice, but when you start digging into the nutritional information you realize it‚Äôs useless. It appears they are relying on users for updating and fixing info, which most do very badly. They can pay me to fix things, I‚Äôm not paying them for what I can get free elsewhere.

title: Amazing!

title: Buggy and inaccurate, try a different app

Also says I should consume 5222 calories today, seems to be adding actual intake on top of daily recommended.

I would like to have the option to select to coordinate weather it‚Äôs Two meals a day (TMAD) or one meal a day (OMAD).

The macro values are WAY off to the point that I have to cross reference EVERYTHING with another app. For someone new to a diet as sensitive as the keto diet, I need the data to  be correct. Looking to cancel ASAP if this is not fixed. People are stupid, so user data should not be included.

title: Love it! Just started using it.
body: I love this App however it‚Äôs hard to know exactly what to eat to be ‚Äúon track‚Äù I wish it had actual meal plans. Other than that it‚Äôs great. I just started so I‚Äôm not 100% familiar yet.

title: Awesome but

title: Are you sure that‚Äôs what you meant? Please try a different number

It asked me multiple times if I put the right number! It‚Äôs keep giving me this error! Either the devs can‚Äôt handle my height! Or the app just doesn‚Äôt work! Please fix

title: Garbage

Basically useless. Doesn‚Äôt give you the opportunity to even see if you like the app without having to pay for a stupid subscription. Extremely disappointed.

title: Fix net carbs calculation

title: You can‚Äôt get a refund!!

title: Needs a widget and a trail period

title: Judgmental
body: This app judges everything that you do. Didn‚Äôt eat often enough? You‚Äôre clearly hangry. You couldn‚Äôt be intermittent fasting. Ate something it deems unhealthy? I know what‚Äôs healthy and what isn‚Äôt, I just needed a calorie counter, not the heaps of guilt that came with it.

title: Amazing results

title: Good

title: Incredible and perfect
body: This app is with every penny. I purchased the annual subscription and have been using it for only about a week but so far it's been incredibly valuable. I have been entering in every meal, snack, and my water intake. Drinking water has helped me to be healthier and stay hydrated! I've been hitting my goals every single day. I love the design of the app, it's so beautiful. The designer did an amazing job at creating a very nuanced and detailed experience. It's a joy to use this app and it's fun! The illustrations and colors are fantastic. I was a MyFitnessPal user for years and since they were acquired by UA they stopped updating, improving, and evolving the app in any way. This is fitness and food tracking at a new and modern level. It's really a wonderful app. It is absolutely helping me to reshape my lifestyle. The added bonus is the integration of recipes that you can easily add to your meal tracking, not to mention the food is actually pretty good and simple to make. What more could you want? Also it's really nice to be able to choose between different types of diets, with each adjusting the calories you should be having at each meal. A feature that's really awesome is being able to see a summary of your intake for the day, which is broken down and categorized across protein, carbs, and fat, in a beautiful infographic of graphs and pie charts. I love just looking at this app!  So in that way it's quite personal, which makes the whole experience far more engaging than any other fitness app I've ever used. It's well worth the price and I will continue to use the app throughout my day to stay on track and be as healthy as possible. Keep up the amazing work Lifesum!

title: READ THIS
body: So I think everyone can agree that losing/maintaining/gaining weight or just even remembering to eat healthily can be a very tough thing for anybody. This app, is honestly the HOLY GRAIL of nutrition tracker app. AND YES I SAY NUTRITION, because it is not just a weight loss, cal counter, water tracker, it‚Äôs so much more than that. I know this because I can probably say I have used every freakin app to try and make the habit of healthy living stick. So there is a few bugs here and there but nothing I can say that would make me stop using it. Mainly just certain calories not matching up etc. but I doubt the makers of this app can control that due to it probably being inputted from other resources, BUT I will say, it‚Äôs almost 75% accurate if you‚Äôre not specifically measuring anything out. I‚Äôm saying this because I do measure everything out, and honestly if you do measure your food and put it into the app, it is extremely accurate, some of the work has to be put on your side because a phone screen cannot accurately calculate how much your eating. It is a tool!!!! An extremely useful, well made, and STUNNING tool to help you along whatever health journey you are going on. My FAVORITE function of the app of all is you can create your own recipes where it calculates the calories in what you made, let me tell you, an absolute game changer. If you have an Apple Watch, it pairs the app to your activityüòç. I lost 14 lbs and toned up (of course with exercise and such) but with this app by my side I honestly felt like it was effortless. Just try it for yourself I promise.

title: So many great features, but can be difficult to use.
body: I‚Äôve actually enjoyed the many many features that are all bundled into this one app, and I don‚Äôt think any app can compare! However, I think there‚Äôs still some bugs and things that make it less easy to use. For one, sometimes you can scan the barcode of the food you ate (thinking it‚Äôll be faster and easier), but then the calories that Lifesum logs are actually different from the calories on the package with the same serving size. I‚Äôm often having to jerry-rig the serving size to make it match the package because even an extra ten calories can make the app give you a frowny-face for the meal. Secondly, maybe it‚Äôs just my account specifically, but my weight is never recorded in permanence in the weight log. Everyday that I log my weight, it starts me right back off where I weighed before I started using the app, saying ‚Äúwow you lost 5 pounds today!‚Äù when really I lost one pound and the other lost pounds were logged on previous days. In my calendar of weight statistics, it‚Äôs a stagnant, flat line from my goal weight for about a week and then will drop down as soon as I update it. Tomorrow, though, it‚Äôll pretend I never logged a change yesterday and go right back to my starting weight. Lastly, I wish that the units the servings were marked in was more clear. Often ‚Äúpieces‚Äù will actually mean the one serving size as mentioned on the package of the food, yet pieces makes you want to type in te NUMBER OF PIECES you ate. Like pizza rolls. ‚ÄúOne pieces‚Äù is actually 6 pieces and 220 calories. In spite of all this, I think the app is beautiful in design and I love how many features are available. I also think that premium might not be worth it... I‚Äôm using premium now during a free month trial, and I don‚Äôt feel like it gave me a whole lot more. I don‚Äôt feel like having this premium month gave me a taste of anything I‚Äôd consider buying after my free period is over.

body: I decided to do the 3 month Lifesum. I've had enough time to determine it is not for me. (I only used 1.25 months) It doesn't scan food items correctly. I will scan in the package and the calories and protein wouldn‚Äôt be accurate to the item I just scanned per serving. I‚Äôd either get the calories right or the protein but not both. Over half the time, you have to measure your food by weight instead of doing it by cups. I have to tweak most of my stuff and you can't look up uncommon food items a little under half the time. And I haven't once used there meal plans because at least one item in the recipe we don't have in our home. It normally is an uncommon ingredient that poor people wouldn‚Äôt have in their cupboard. They don't set up planning for a weekly bases or grocery lists like I was hoping. And there recipes aren't exactly set to your style. Chose clean eating and most recipes still lacked the protein factor which is my hardest obstacle. (I can never seem to eat enough in my diet) So don't get this app unless you are only counting calories and if that is the case don't do the upgrade. Not worth it. But I'm glad I did it so I now know what it all entails. This was a good step to finding what I AM looking for. Calorie counter and meal planner combo. But even that isn‚Äôt needed if you have the Fitbit app. PS it also doesn‚Äôt hook up to MY version of the Fitbit which was disappointing. If you still decide you‚Äôre going for it and want to pay for the upgrade double check in your Fitbit app to see if you‚Äôre Fitbit is compatible. And if you DO have a Fitbit I highly suggest you just pay the premium for that.

title: Need help/suggestions
body: Hello! Thank you for what appears to be a really good app to get me on track for losing weight. However in just starting out it hasn‚Äôt been very user-friendly. For instance I wanted to input a burger, with bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise, no bun. It would be helpful if, next to each item I need to track, there was an ‚Äúincrease‚Äù or ‚Äúdecrease‚Äù button. For example, currently,  to input 2 slices of bacon, I have to type the word ‚Äúbacon‚Äù in the app two separate times and add it to be tracked, where it would be much simpler and less time-consuming if you had the ability to hit an ‚Äúincrease‚Äù or ‚Äúdecrease‚Äù sign next to each food to indicate that you‚Äôre having two slices of bacon (or three or four), without having to go back and input the bacon slice two, three, or four times (If that makes sense!) Also, the ability to delete anything on the ‚Äúpre-planned menus‚Äù that the app suggests. For instance, on the ‚Äúbeef burger and lettuce leaves‚Äù dish, I do not eat onions, and I cannot eat cheese. There is nowhere for me to subtract those items from the ‚Äútrack this item‚Äù so then my calories, etc, will not be accurate. Also during the ‚Äútest questions‚Äù there is no place to put foods that I wish to specifically avoid (ie in my case, cheese and fish). I‚Äôm not vegan/vegetarian;  I do eat beef, poultry, pork... but not seafood. And I don‚Äôt care for cheese and yogurt. So it would be nicer to have the ability to input foods to avoid so that I don‚Äôt get the suggested ‚Äúsalmon‚Äù meal ever! This is just my first day of using so I may have more thoughts as I go along but these are what jumped out at me to begin with! Thanks!

title: Severely lacking
body: I use Lifesum as a calorie and macronutrient tracker to help me take off the last bit of weight and build a healthier body. At first look this app tracks what it needs to and has a nice I terrace to watch your progress. All of this can be seen before you pay the subscription fee. It‚Äôs only after you pay that you find all that is lacking. Most important, you cannot go back and add or edit past data. I missed entering my weight yesterday and now it‚Äôs impossible to enter it. Lifesum has such little integration with health/fitness products that, yes, I had to enter my weight daily. My Garmin watch and scale had zero integration with Lifesum. And because of the lack of integration with standard fitness products I was unable to even track my steps or enter my step count from my Garmin watch. It is unbelievable that Lifesum doesn‚Äôt integrate with any of the  Garmin products. The list of fitness products Lifesum integrates with is unfortunately very small. Basically, if you have an Apple Watch you will get some benefit otherwise forget it.

title: Free version is great but do not buy the upgrade
body: I downloaded this app because I‚Äôm trying to gain weight after a serious illness. I‚Äôm recovering but still struggling with my appetite and have to stay on top of my caloric intake to ensure that I‚Äôm eating enough, and my doctor suggested using an app. I was looking for something that would be easy to use so I would be motivated to keep using it, and made the mistake of immediately upgrading to the paid version of LifeSum. Aesthetically the app is well-designed and functionally easy to use. However, the glaring flaw with the app is that nearly every food item plugged into the app has wildly incorrect calorie/other macro information.

Lifesum‚Äôs app though (when you aign up) tries to be helpful and did them for me and they are not correct, and there does not appear to be any easy option to manually edit them. So while the app gives me an accurate calories and macro count, the ‚Äúgoal‚Äù total that shows whether I hit my marks or not is always off base. title: I want to LOVE this app but there‚Äôs glitches...
body: I‚Äôve tried every calorie tracking app you can think of but I was never able to stick with it or feel motivated by it. Lifesum not only allows me to track my calories but it calculates macros and gives food/meal ratings. I really enjoy the food and meal ratings and the tips it gives to balance your diet. It does more than the average app. It feels more like a change for a healthy lifestyle than just a fad diet. I purchased the premium because it goes more in depth with ratings and how to better your ‚Äúscore/rating‚Äù.

title: Okay...
body: But there‚Äôs no free trial period for premium. Most apps give the option of testing out premium for a week for free which gives the user the option of purchasing a membership if they found the app to be phenomenal. I kept trying to see if there was a free trial period, but all they offered was a 30% off premium and like a dummy, I caved. Now, I‚Äôm stuck between continuing the membership for the $30 something I paid for or just dealing with the fact that I wasted $30 something dollars on an app I feel like I got stuck with because a lot of the reviews claim it‚Äôs hard to get the refund. Aside from this, the app is okay.

title: I wanted this to work.
body: I wanted this app to work, I really did. I feel as if I was a bit misled while researching an app. I needed a meal plan for every day with a grocery list. Well, guess what? You‚Äôll get that, but with only certain ‚Äúplans.‚Äù  I‚Äôm not vegetarian. I‚Äôm not into paleo. I surely don‚Äôt want to eat like Denise every day. You‚Äôll get enough meal options for a week.  I tried all meal tracts that came with grocery lists  (you‚Äôll get grocery lists for 4 plans, you‚Äôre on your own for the rest). I really did. For a month. The recipes provided are horrible. No taste, bland, and quite frankly, I‚Äôd rather pay $10 for bulk unsalted butter than a 4 oz container of ghee. I cooked enough for my family of four. We ended up throwing over half of every meal in the trash. The dogs would not even eat it. Money wasted because the recipes tasted like trash.  What chefs approve of these recipes? Please let me know because I‚Äôll keep an eye out for their names and avoid them. I‚Äôm open minded about different styles and food preps, but this is just bad. I 100% wasted money on this app and on the grocery store trips. The turkey on rye sandwich was the best offering of the bunch and even that‚Äôs a stretch. Yeah, I lost weight, but it was because the recipes were unappetizing, tasteless, and with the money wasted on groceries, I did not want to eat. If you are really and truly looking for help with weight loss and meal prep, please look elsewhere. This app could be great, but it‚Äôs not. So much potential, just not there yet

title: It‚Äôs good.... just some drawbacks
body: I will start off by saying that I‚Äôve been a MyFitnessPal user for years, so I‚Äôm not sure if this review will be biased or what, but I‚Äôll point out things I like and do not like below:

title: so many small annoying things!!!
body: This app is not ready! It looks to be nice initially and I ended up purchasing the pro version for a year. But after I really start to use it, so many small annoying things just keeps showing up!

title: Misleading
body: My family and I do a Paleo/Whole Foods lifestyle which means we eat very clean with sugars that are non-processed like honey, maple syrup, and dates in limited amounts. I found this app very misleading because certain carbs are rated unhealthy but it then tells you your carb count is low and to eat more???? Which is essentially what the paleo diet is: low carb and higher protein with healthy fat choices. As an example Cassava flour is 100% carbs so it is rated as üòê but your total daily intake of calories will tell you to eat more? If your rating certain carb foods as üòê but pushing increased carb content how in the world is someone supposed to eat carbs unless it is essentially fruit based. I will state white potatoes are rated 88% carbs but are also a great nutrient source which is misleading again. So I do realize the app is pushing a healthier choice of carb but when food is mixed in the right proportions cassava can be a healthy choice so again??? Secondly, cashews and other nuts are not a healthy choice if they are in flour form but again in the right proportions they can be. Third, Ghee, avocado, and olive oil are not considered healthy choices either. Lastly, you can eat meat sources on the app (red meat) which drastically increases your fat intake for the day which is rated as a great source of nutrients and minerals. The concept is a good idea but very misleading and costly if you pay for the in app purchases which I will not do. I will be going back to my FatSecret because there is no ‚Äúfood shaming‚Äù going on in that app. By the way if your going to rate foods based on ‚Äúhealthy‚Äù maybe developers should consider a system that rates the use of pesticide and herbicide exposure along with nutrient depleted farmlands that have even vegetables highly unhealthy!

title: Great concept, but could use lots of improvement.
body: I‚Äôm very conflicted in how many stars this app deserves. I finally settled on two for the reasons listed below. But first, let me lay out what works well in Lifesum‚Äôs app.

title: Buyer Beware
body: Yes, it‚Äôs easy to use. Yes, it‚Äôs easy to look at and understand how many macros you have left.  But, do yourself a favor and use it for a month before committing to a $50 year long plan.  I really wanted to like the app, but the macros were incorrect on the food about half the time. If you caught it, you could report the error, then look through the database until you found something similar, but that‚Äôs about all you could do. Also, it would incorrectly tally up negative net carbs.  There were several times I ended up with more net carbs left to eat than I started with, all because the app calculated a food and gave it a negative net carb total.   The serving sizes were often incorrect for the macros given, as well. That can really throw your Ketosis out of wack.

I have also had difficulty getting it to use the calorie goal that I input. I have tried over 20 times and it just doesn‚Äôt work. title: The best so far.. but still a lot of work to go.
body: Let me start by saying I think this is the best of all the calorie counting iphone applications. The User Interface is nicely laid out, the tabs are great and the icons are helpful. Even the food catalog is very nicely laid out with multiple levels of meaningful entries.

title: best option available!
body: I agree that this is the best app available on the iphone for tracking daily nutrition. I really love the pie chart showing the % of protein, fat and carbs - very helpful to keep those that eat too many carbs in check!

title: Good app.
body: Pros: Efficient display and breakdown of information. Ease of use. Several ways of displaying dietary information. Good library of foods and exercises.

title: Great app, worth the cost, getting better
body: I really like this app! They thought alot about what operations will take the most time and tried to make them easier. You can create custom foods, then create meals (sets of food items) and add them to the directory. The dirctory is well organized with features like searching and marking favorites. People complain about the food database, but these things take time to develop and it sounds like they will be user submitable, so they will be handled by the community. Also the nutritional information varies a lot between different brands, so you are going to have to end up entering in a lot of custom foods anyway, I don't see this as a problem or an issue that iShape could possibly solve aside from doing what they have already done and make an expandable database.

title: Excellent and Easy to Use
body: I use this app every day without fail. It has made me exponentially more aware of what I am eating and how much I snack throughout the day. By tracking what I eat carefully, I have been able to make smarter food choices and I snack mindlessly far less than I used to. I also love the water, fruit, and vegetable trackers because I have also been consciously drinking more water and making a point to eat more vegetables. The app is beautifully designed and very user friendly, and I enjoy it so much that I paid for the full subscription. I use this app more than I use social media. I appreciate that the app helps making healthy choices fun and simple, and I would highly recommend it regardless of whether you are trying to lose weight or not.

title: I'm enjoying it!
body: This is the first time I've ever tracked my food or paid close attention to how many calories I'm consuming every day. I'm not trying to lose much weight.. just working to get into better shape and improve my overall health. I really like using Lifesum so far. It integrates nicely with the Apple Watch, and my suggested intake changes based on my activity throughout the day. I love that you can add your own recipes and save meals! These features, along with the ability to save favorite foods will eventually save me lots of time logging food going forward. I also find that I save time by planning my meals in advance vs. logging each meal throughout the day. I haven't tried any of their recipes yet, but it looks like they have some good ones! Suggestions for improvement: This might be too complicated, but I'd love to see some integration with Allrecipes / the ability to quickly add favorite recipes from this site. I would also like to see more nutritional data (vitamins and minerals). I feel like most of their plans are a little crazy with the suggested daily protein intake (it's usually very high). All in all, though, the only thing that's really disappointed me is that I recommended this app to my mother and after a few days it wouldn't let her use it anymore unless she upgraded to a premium membership. I was under the impression that you could still use basic features without upgrading.

title: Love a lot of aspects but definitely still needs to grow!
body: As soon as I downloaded this, I loved how easy it was to use and how the interface was so visually pleasing and quick to get the hang of. I also loved how I could track my water intake as well as my exercise of the day. But as the days went by, some issues popped up that I really wanted to address in a review. Firstly is the accuracy of the food you can track. There have been more than a few times that the nutrition label read differently than what Lifesum had listed and because of that, I find this app not all that trustworthy on the nutrients I'm getting day to day and that's disappointing. I would also add that I wish the database had a more rigid system, it's a little weird to see more than one listing for a banana and not knowing which one would be the most accurate. Secondly I wish the targeted calories could be adjusted by the user if they so choose. I don't exactly want to follow what this app suggests when it comes to how much I should be eating for weight loss, I definitely think it overestimates. Lastly I wish there was an easier way to track meals you ate days before or ate for dinner one day and ate it for lunch the next. I will still continue to use this app but I hope in the future to see some changes!

title: Great app... BUT!!!!....
body: This app helped me lots and shedding the fat and start bulking. Great way to keep track of every calorie in. The new design is nice.. BUT!!! why take away the nutrient macro pie chart?!?!?!?!?!? That is just as important to know either you are slimming down or putting on some mass!!!! Doesn't help when you take in 3000+ calories when the majority was fat, or you didn't take in the amount of protein you needed. Please please please bring back the macro pie chart... That's is the only thing I ask for... Thanks....

title: So easy to track calories, protein, fat!
body: I used to do this in a spreadsheet. After adding foods I eat frequently that were not already in the huge database, I can easily set up my day and make changes if my schedule, dining out, grocery shopping changes. It's so clear I need to add exercise, as I know my precise intake and don't want to eat less. Things I would like added: ability to add a food to My Things when after scanning, finding it barcode was already in the database and verifying the food had been correctly entered, instead of only having the ability to add it to my diary. I had searched for it before I tried to manually add it, but it didn't show up. If it's in My Things, it will show up quickly at the top. I would also like to see a schedule of my nutrition, exercise and weight progress in addition to the progress bar that shows my starting, current and goal weight.

title: Disappointed
body: This app has great potential but after using it for less than 24 hours (yes, that's all it took), I must admit that it is a letdown. I entered my personal information, updated my goals, connected to my Fitbit, logged my food and exercise... Only to find out that the information I was inputting was not saved accurately. Regardless of how many times I changed it, my birthdate and starting weight kept reverting back to an incorrect amount (that wasn't entered by me at anytime). This led me to doubt about the application saving the other information I was entering such as calories or workouts. When I spoke to a representative, I was told this issue would be fixed in about 3 weeks. That is ridiculous! Don't launch your app until it's ready to be used. Especially one that customers pay for! Another complaint is the meal logging. It is very difficult to determine meals based on ounces or grams. There are few foods that I found that were listed by serving size or quantity. Lifesum's selection of meals is not very expansive and most days, I found myself looking up the meals with another application to ensure I was accurately logging them. NOT WORTH THE TIME.

title: Fan of Lifesum it's helped me a lot
body: So Lifesum has seriously helped me. I haven't had any glitches with my app and don't struggle with added food to my food diary tracker. It's really easy and simple to follow, it does the math for you, to figure out how many calories your eating, how many grams of carbs, protein, and fat your consuming and how many you have left to consume. I've done the ketone diet before I got Lifesum... I only lost 2 pounds a month and was completely confused why I wasn't losing more! I got the Lifesum app and it showed me (by tracking everything I ate) that I wasn't eating the right balance of carbs, protein and fat for the ketone diet. I was floored when I found out certain brands of food that I thought were healthy was totally ruining my diet. I lost about 10 pounds within less than 6 weeks solely by using this app. I can scan in barcodes of food items I get and see how much of it I can eat. It's great, Lifesum rates it for me too to see if it's a good fit for my diet. I'm gonna keep and use this app for a while. And they have awesome recipes too.

title: Lifesum
body: Lifesum to me is an application that represents the potential of how our mobile devices can assist in us reaching the best physical version of ourselves. While my initial review is only based on the free version, I believe I can note how beneficial this application is. The application begins by asking about your age, gender, height and weight. Lifesum incorporates a beautiful colorful yet simple to navigate design. The bottom menu tabs are where users can bounce from category to category whether it be diet, nutritional facts or another section. The app makes it easy to input your diet with a comprehensive database that caters to any meal of the day as well as water cup diagrams that fill up and mark your progress with a simple tap on the image. Users can read daily nutritional facts and articles to better determine what is best for you. The premium version allows you to receive specialized recipes. I feel I have only touched a tip of the iceberg when it comes to the effect Lifesum can have on my life and many others.

title: Lots of potential but improvement needed
body: I recently upgraded to the premium version after using the free version for about a week. I was very happy with the free version but found that the premium version has left me slightly less satisfied. One reason for this is the fact that you must constantly answer the 41 Life Score questions to get an updated score. To me, this is an annoying process and I wish it would update automatically from the foods I've recorded in my diary. Secondly, I also wish the fruit and vegetable trackers would update based off the food that I've recorded in the diary. It seems redundant to have to press an extra button to record this information. Finally, I was under the impression that the premium version would provide some sort of "eat this, not that" feature for the foods it deems unhealthy. I haven't seen this feature and I think it would be great. In the end, I really like this app but I don't feel like I'm getting a the best value for the premium version. I truly believe that it can get there with some updates and adjustments but for now I remain slightly unsatisfied. The app seems pretty new so I am more than happy to stick with it with hopes that it makes adjustments in the future.

title: Near perfect
body: This is my favorite app for tracking calories. It blows My Fitness Pal out of the water in terms of its ability to teach you how to eat right for your fitness goals and how to generally lead a healthy lifestyle. The only flaw is that it has crowd sourced some of its nutrient data from users, which means there is some noticeable human error as you start searching for foods and looking at calorie counts and serving sizes. As long as you are being conscious about your foods and understand the basics when it comes to measurements and serving sizes, you'll avoid improperly tracking your meals. As with anything in life -- it's on you to think critically even when you want an app to take care of the bulk of the work. Trust that Lifesum does a lot for the small fee you pay to unlock those features. It's incredibly well designed. They thought deeply about UX and how to drive reengagement and motivate the user to make good choices. Well done Lifesum!

title: Hugely disappointing
body: No room to customize, not even with the upgrade (based on the description of added features). We prepare a large number of ingredients and dishes from scratch, so logging food in Lifesum is not accurate, as we're restricted to what's in the database. Also, the inability to see what's in the upgrade, specifically diet plans is frustrating. The default plan limits users to breakfast, lunch, dinner, and a snack, all of which are calorie restricted. So for users who consume 5-6 small meals/snacks a day, this isn't helpful. If I log meals as meals, then I'm WAY under my calorie allowance as dictated by Lifesum, and some of my snacks don't get logged. If I log all of my snacks under the single "snack" tab, my meals are way under and my snacks are way over, according to Lifesum. There also isn't a way to log times food is consumed. Lifesum is probably alright for someone interested in very basic nutritional record keeping, but for someone needing to log for medical or serious health/fitness tracking, Lifesum has completely missed the mark. And to charge ridiculous monthly fees for a product that is mediocre at best is just ludicrous. Save your time, money, and frustration and use another method.

title: I like it even Better than my fitness pal, but not sure if it's great for newbies
body: I used mfp on and off for years, and it was an easy transition. It works very similarly. I love that I can log a photo of my meal along with the data. I like the smiley faces I get for healthy choices. And it's visually pleasing, which matters when you are trying to use it all day long. I just use the basic, free version.

title: Love!! but a few suggestions.
body: I love this app so far. It is very easy to navigate and I like getting the little smiley face by my meal when I made good choices. I have many reasons why I need to keep track of what I eat, mainly because my skin tends to react to what I eat and I have been recently cutting out dairy for health reasons. That being said, since this is a overall "healthy lifestyle" app, I would LOVE to see more options for tracking, such as dairy-free diets, as well as maybe incorporating other lifestyle habits such as hours of sleep (it plays a big part in our lifestyle!) I would also loooove to see a way to track specific symptoms or reactions so a clear connection can be made between our food and how it affects us, such as how well your skin is doing (breakouts specifically), energy levels, cravings and how to target them, ability to focus, and things of that sort. Overall the app is great so far and I'm looking forward to seeing it's growth!!

title: Not fully baked application
body: purchased december 22, 2008 -

title: The best of it's kind!
body: I've been using this for a little while now and while there was a slight learning curve the company has provided great tutorials and support. I actually like the fact that the entire database of food is not on here, there is a bit of a setup getting the foods you eat entered but once it's in it's easy and you don't have 50,000 others to go through to find the one you want. Having the database online didn't make a lot of sense to me at first but after using the app it was a well thought out way to go. A simple points calculator would be helpful so I don't have to leave the app to get to my other calculator and I'd like to see a notification icon telling me how many points/calories I have left for the day but these are extras that would be nice but are not necessary. The quality of this app makes me excited to see what they do with the updates as they perfect their already great design.

title: Great but poor nutrient information
body: I love the app , it is very simple and visually appealing but lacks a lot in functionality . The estimated calorie needs are very off. I also understand the food database takes time to establish but even the items already listed are incorrect. I scanned an item and the "verified " information that came up was different from the information on the package.

title: Disappointed:(
body: I had high hopes for this app. When I first got the free version, I liked it. I liked that you could customize it to work with whatever diet you are on.  So when Lifesum kept pushing to upgrade, I thought, "it is the New Year. Why not?"  I anticipated that the Gold version would be even that much better. It is NOT!   Adding food and snacks to this app is a nightmare. User-friendly it is not. I even tried to edit "My Food" on my computer by logging into the program via the internet.  It was no more helpful. In fact, it was a little bit more frustrating doing it that way. I do like how it imports my data from my Jawbone Up app &  how it relays information to the Jawbone app. It is very frustrating that there is no quick way to add food. I noticed that even when I scan the food items, the information uploaded to the app is incorrect. If you can't use this app to easily track and accurately record your food intake, what good is it?!

title: Wanted to live this app
body: Have been a user of myfinesspal for years. As a UI designer myself, when I learned of lifesum I was excited as the UI design is superior and some of the features are much easier to execute than mfp. After trying lifesum for a few weeks though, I'll be going back to myfitnesspal.

title: Good App, but not as advertised
body: My fianc√©e and I both purchased the one year premium subscription ($45 apiece), only to find out that the feature allowing you to copy food/meals from a friend's diary had been removed for some reason, despite it still being advertised. It can be somewhat cumbersome to find and add all of the ingredients for a home cooked meal, so we were looking forward to only having to do it once per meal, not twice!

title: Use it Everyday!
body: I am an 18-year-old soccer player. My mother and I have been using this app everyday for about 3 months. It is our little "game."

title: Would've given a 4, but the app crashes
body: I paid for the premium version of the app, and I feel like that should give me more weight (no pun intended) to my criticism. The positive part of the app is that it integrates the Apple Watch and the tracking feature works well. I could have gotten that from the free version however. The paid version gives you a few recipes and a bit more nutritional information about your food. The app is designed to make tracking an obsessive behavior, which is great for those trying to achieve their health and fitness goals. I can certainly say that I am much more aware of my diet now that I use Lifesum.

title: Love this app but it's missing a couple key features
body: This app has been so useful this past month. It gives me an opportunity to get some insight on my eating habits and how I can change them. I like how it inspires me to get smiley faces on all my meals and snacks as well as stresses the importance of water intake.

title: Great app + 1 Suggestion
body: I've been using Life Sum for about a week now and really enjoy it. I started with the free version but ended upgrading so I could take advantage of their features for meal plans and balancing meals. It's easy to use, usually pleasing, and doesn't have a lot of the shaming that I've felt with other apps.

title: Got me out of a slump
body: Started working out a while ago and had an initial loss then I adjusted and didn't lose anything for three months. Being able to track everything on a device I carry anyway was a huge difference maker for me. Quickly realized I was not eating enough on my workout days and over compensating on the rest days. Also does a great job keeping me honest on the weekends. Every improvement I can think of such as coordinating with say Subway to put all their data in is probably beyond the price. I usually end up manually putting in one meal a day so overall I spend 10-15 minutes a day which is way less than I exercise, but those are the minutes that are making a difference for me on the scale.

title: Super helpful
body: For those having trouble opening the app after the latest update just uninstall then reinstall the app. Uninstalling doesn't deactivate your account so you won't loose any of your info, just log back in once you've reinstalled the app.

title: Apple Watch Support Lacking
body: Good: This is a beautifully designed app. The UI is clean, intuitive and not unnecessarily cluttered with information you don't need (like car ads. Looking at you, MFP). The information tracked strikes a good balance between not enough and stats obsessed.

title: SUPER buggy
body: I really do like this app, but it's SO buggy it's become incredibly frustrating to use. For one, the app randomly changes my date of birth for no reason. No big deal, but it also will change important things. For example, on Friday it'll say that I can eat 1200 calories. Then on Saturday it'll say that my Friday calories went way over the limit - I was actually supposed to only eat 1000! There are a lot more bugs, like not registering changes I make to my personal details, not syncing properly with the web site, and this one really small but irritating thing it'll do in the search, wherein I'll type a search query and then try to go back to change it, it'll delete the whole query automatically and force me to type it again. Pretty sure that's what the "x" on the right side of the search bar is for. Anyway, until the MYRIAD bugs get fixed, it's more irritating to use than anything.

title: So pretty, but adding food is an exercise in frustration!!!!!
body: Whats the point of this app if after adding food, it 1) tells me the food is already added and erases my own inputs of items. Then, when I go to scan barcode, or search for the food, the food item does not show up on the list!!! 2) after successful food entry, I go to the webpage and the numbers dont match up?? For example, I go and add some Russell Stover‚Äôs sugar free candies, and instead of the calories reading 210 for 3 pieces, the total shows 99 calories/3 pieces, and all my macros show as decimals?? I added several foods and NONE of the values on the website was right.

title: So balanced!!!
body: Your don't have to eat small amounts to lose weight! If you exercise, they factor it in. They want you to eat healthily, not less, because they give you how many carbs, and how much fat and protein you've had that day. They have it automatically set to a certain amount, but if you don't feel that's how many carbs you should be eating, or how many cups of water you should drink, you can change that! There's even help for gaining weight. I don't like the grading system, but I can ignore that. This app isn't magic, you have to have discipline and patience to enter everything you eat, but it works. Dropped 5 pounds the first week. After I stopped needing to lose weight, I kept it around just to help me eat healthier. This app is üëå

title: Looks Great, Works Poorly
body: Edit: it's quite lovely when this app decides to just completely not sync with Apple Health anymore! After miraculously working properly for a few days in a row, it just ceases to sync. A reboot doesn't help. Force closing apps doesn't help. Lifesum's Help steps do not help. The last step is for me to send Lifesum a bunch of screen shots of the app not syncing? Huh? What, you don't believe me? The burden is on me to prove to you that your app doesn't work? Thanks Lifesum. This is what I get for giving this app another try in the hopes that it improved.

title: This App is the only one that works for me
body: I'm not a very self motivated person, I'm not driven for health or weight loss and I don't know why but it's hard for me (probably because prior to this point in my life I was naturally slim). Anyway, this app has been amazing for me, I took the test to see what diet would fit my needs and found that Keto-light was a fit. After reading up on it, I decided to give it a go. It grades my meals and tells me what to do to improve my food choices, helps me find recipes and able to save my own, I have been using the app for a little over 2 months and have lost 15lbs. This was with no extra exercise, just diet! I'm also a breastfeeding mom and I appreciate that it allows me to add to my calorie allowance to account for the extra that I need.

title: Great so far
body: I'm on day fifteen of the ketogenic light diet and it's been tough with cravings but this app is really a great guide and inspiration. I really love how it has the scanner and adjusts you calorie amount for the day based on what you eat. I really like the tips that describe the effects and stages of what diet your on each day. I was so excite when I saw it tested me to see which diet is good for me based on my wants and needs. I gave four stars because the scanner is a bit wonky and they need to expand the food from groceries stores like publix, Whole Foods and popular restaurants. The scanner usually is okay but sometimes it refuses to recognize basic food like a potato. Overall thought I think this app is going to be life changing for me and I'm hoping to lose 30-40 pounds with life sum!

title: Not for the everyday person
body: I wanted to love Lifesum.  The interface has a great aesthetic and the overall brand has a high-end feel to it vs my FitPal.  After playing with the free version I opted to pay for the full version to get a more personalized plan and recipes.  That where my disappointment came.  While I loved the questions to find a right plan for you.  The recipes are very intricate and not family friendly if you have small kids.  Not only that, but there are only a handful of recipes to pick from.  Add the fact I don't eat pork, and the list is cut even smaller. It does seem there's a bit of a rotation to a few.  And at least half look delicious.  If you're a foodie looking to get healthy.  Or don't have the constraints of super busy evenings and early bedtimes, this may be a good app for you.  I really wish you could see a sample of even like 3 recipes with the free version.  It would have saved me $50 for an app I'll never use.

title: Everything I was expecting
body: This app is pretty much everything I expected, and is definitely the best of its type. It could be improved by offering more foods already built in, like if it could access this info through the phone's internet.

title: I love IShape!
body: I love this app.  It is exactly what I was looking for.  I love the charts, the history, and the method to add food to the diary.  The only reason why I marked it down one star was because I really want to be able to change the amount of calories I intake per day.  I think this app should allow you to either choose the amount of calories you plan on eating or how long you want it to take for you to get to your goal weight.  This would  be cool because if you chose how many calories you plan on eating each day, Ishape would tell you how long it will take you to to get to the goal weight.  Also, if you choose how long you want it to take you, it could tell you how many calories to eat.  What if I don't want to lose 2 pounds per week?  I would like to only lose 1 or maybe even 1 and a half.

title: New app design is nice
body: The new app design is nice and pleasant on the eyes. There is one thing I am missing. Maybe I just haven't been able to find it yet?

title: new version should never have been released
body: The new website is useless: most pages (including all personal items, (body weight and other statistic tracking, lifestyle tracking, and my things (ALL personally added items such as food, et al) are "coming soon" and do not operate. Syncing is DOA. The old website works, sorta, but the new iPhone app does not completely sync with it correctly. For instance, personal meals entered on iPhone show up on the previous day on BOTH the iPhone and the website (but individual personal food items do seem to work ok going from iPhone to OLD website.)  Diary entries do NOT sync from web site to iPhone, so all diary entries have to be entered from iPhone if you want to sync.  I have not even tried to sync with my iPad.

title: Good but Has Glitches
body: This app is fantastic.  I have gained weight and have begun to each much more healthily.  It made me realize how much fat I consume every day and how little protein I eat.  I should be eating a lot more and this app is definitely helping me achieve my goals.  However,  there are quite a few mishaps in the programming.  For one, I just added in new info for today, yet it acts like it never happened.  On the home page I can see my calories and exercise and everything but the lifestyle section is screwed up.  My average does not include my new info AND when I add new weight data it doesn't show up on the bar.  This didn't star happening until today.  Please fix this and allow me to delete weight amounts because I accidentally added one and it needs to be fixed...

title: Nice but limited food search and poor implementation of syncing fitness trackers
body: I like the app because it's very fast and full of great features, but when I couldn't find things I'd definitely find on MyFitnessPal (which is free), then it makes paying for this app kind of ridiculous. I'd pay if I could search a food library like in MyFitnessPal, especially since you guys have cool things like choosing your own diet, in a pleasing-to-look-at app. HOWEVER, having to pay to sync my Fitbit (which I already paid money for) is beyond ridiculous when (you guessed it) MyFitnessPal does syncing for free. I bet people would still pay for personalized diets and you'd get more customers if you did these two things well AND for free.

title: At first...
body: At first the app was great! I was super psyched to have finally found an app that counts calories and has a nice UI but then the app started to screw with me... Literally within the same day. Apparently, I am supposed to be consuming -238 calories for snack... How am I supposed to do that? Plus, research has shown that snacking throughout the day (with healthy foods) is good for you! Also, the measurements are weird and I wasn't the only one to notice that (I saw another complaint above). I wish there was a way to turn off criticisms and just count calories! I'm not by any means overweight and the app seems to be telling me to become skin and bones because of how it rates my portions! I know it may seem like I have no idea what I'm talking about when it comes to portions but I assure you there is no reason to be limiting myself like this for an app.

title: Where are the recipes?
body: I signed up for the three month gold membership hoping to get more options on the meal plans. Well selected my meal plan and all it did was basically tell me my option was selected. Didn't give me meal plan or even meal ideas. Just gave me a picture of random food I could eat for every meal. There are seven days in a week. What the hell am I supposed to do with three ideas and some of the food is not in season or I wouldn't eat? They give you a teaser of three meals when you are doing your daily log but again that's it! I paid for something that got me nothing. A word of advice, do not pay for the gold. It has no extra benefits. I would wait until they develop it more and are able to actually offer you something with your membership.

title: Getting better!
body: I switched over to LifeSum soon after MFP was purchased by UnderArmour and the ads began to show up. I do like LifeSum's food plans and I have seen improvement in what I eat personally. Their premium options offer much better bang for your buck over MFP's, and the app is designed much better than MFP's.

title: Unreachable Goals
body: This app is nicely laid out, pleasing to the eye, and very easy to navigate. The one problem is that the goals they want you to reach are virtually impossible. I eat very well, what I would consider to be average-healthy. This app basically tells me to eat raw protein powder for every meal. If I input that I ate whole grain toast with Nutella and strawberries (pretty healthy I would say) it gives me a frowny face because I was supposed to eat 30g of protein. The amount of some of the nutrients it expects you to eat are actually unhealthy. The recipes they give you are not easy. They involve buying very specific health related ingredients only found at some stores. The only reason I use this app now is for tracking how much water I drink. I think you guys should really re-evaluate what is considered healthy and what is considered excessive. Make the goals more reachable for an average human.

title: Best Fitness//Diet Tracker for IPhone!
body: I have been using this for 3 weeks now and can't live without it.  It's definitly helped me keep better track of my caloric intake and burning.  I thought I was doing ok with pen and paper, but I would forget sometimes to write things down -- this is so easy, I have stuck to it without a problem.  The updates with this new version are great.  CONS:  It only saves 7 days (bad!!) and there is no way to email/save the data.  I work with a personal trainer and I don't have anyway to give him a copy of my log and it's hard for me to look back to see my progression week over week and analyze.  Please FIX!  If that doesn't bother you too much, it is WELL worth the $$.

title: Super Frustrating
body: Those are the first two words I would use to best describe this app. I spent HOURS trying to get this thing to work and finally had to use notepad to log my workout. The one good thing about this is the food database it has; it's very extensive. However, in terms of workouts it lacks - A LOT. Some of the most frustrating things are the way it logs workouts. You can ONLY use time and not sets, reps, weight - the main things I was wanting to use this for and figured that it would be there considering they do have workouts you can select from. It is only helpful if you are doing cardio. Other than that I would strongly recommend you pass and get the free app "Lose It!" which does the same thing but its FREE.

title: Great App!
body: This is a great app! Works much better than trying to keep a paper food journal. Love the ablity to take before and after pictures. BIG + is being able to start over and erase profile. I downloaded this a few versions back and used it for a while then kinda got off the bandwagon. Well, I am back on and it's great to be able to have a fresh start with this app. Food library is great. I did notice with this latest version when you add a food it won't let you scroll all the way down to enter sodium and fiber. Also, the custom minutes on exercise is not working quite right. Hopefully these minor bugs will be fixed so they work right again. These developers are doing a great job and I expect them to keep up the good work!

title: Pretty Good Overall
body: I wish I could do 4 1/2 stars but since I can't, I went with 4. The app is pretty good. I switched from MFP after they added the gaudy Under Armour logo to the app icon. The design and functionality is great and it's very easy to add food and recipes. The one problem I have is that when making food, you're locked in when you try to add the serving size. For example, I added peanut butter whose serving size is 2 tablespoons. I could select different units like cups or teaspoons but it would only let me have the serving as one unit like "1 tablespoon" or "1 cup." This isn't a huge deal for this, I just cut the nutrition in half but there are plenty of times where this becomes inconvenient like when the serving is "11 crackers" or "6 ounces."

title: Really good start to a great app
body: The app is so easy to use and very helpful in tracking meals and exercises for diets. It could use a lot of upgrading though. More diet plans would be nice, such as vegan and paleo as options instead of the standard, ketogenic, and 5:2. It also needs a A LOT more food tracking options. I can barely find some of the foods when I eat out if they're on there at all, or even basic foods that I eat at home. Also the suggested recipes could be a little easier for us cooking challenged folks. I don't have easy access to obscure ingredients and it's hard to tell how to substitute them for the recipes I really want to make. Most of them are labeled as "medium difficulty" but I wouldn't be able to make them if I have a culinary degree. Very great potential for this app, if only it was about 3 years more mature.

title: Food log/input should improve
body: This app needs to get it together/ generally make the food log better. It's great that we can see brands, but it's really hard to input things that are not logged as brand items. For example, today I had a bacon egg and cheese breakfast Sandwich on an English muffin. I typed that in and no results would come up. I searched just "breakfast sandwich" and it was mostly all Starbucks entries or other random things but not any homemade or prepared food items to select. I ended up just logging each piece of this food separately, which I find myself doing pretty often.

title: Up until now was my favorite diet app...
body: Before it became Lifesum this WAS a great diet app, and finally with all the updates it impressed me from my last review in 2014. However, something bugy has happened with accessing the food database when off line. I've always been able to access the data base when off line but all of sudden I can't seem to do that anymore. I'm not sure if an update with fix the problem but if it doesn't then it's really worthless to me. I travel internationally a lot and mojority of my time is not around easily accesseble WiFi. There are other quirky things that many of the users find frustrating but I've been able to do a work around with those, and having been an avid user since 2014, I'd say up until now it was the best diet up, regardless.

title: Pretty good üëç
body: Lifesum is a great app. It offers so much and helps me make better choices on what I'm eating. It is hard to follow up on. I did it for about 3 days, was super happy with it, then quit doing it because it took a lot of effort for a busy person like me, then started again a few days ago. It has helped me a lot overall. Another issue I have with it is that it has so many plans and recipes, but only premium members can use most of them. I have to pay for the food that it tells me I should eat to be healthier or reach my daily goal, and paying for premium is too much for me. Overall I think it's a great app that helps a lot, but there should be more options for free members.

title: Mostly good, still needs some improvement
body: I originally downloaded this app almost a year ago. All together, tracking my food (along with regular exercise, of course) helped me lose almost 30 pounds- which was almost 18% of my starting weight.

title: Stae has choices
body: This app is very good. I say do because there are many option to choose from regarding diet plans. The diet can be high protein, low carbs, healthy, etc., just to name a few. It reminds you to enter your meals, snacks, activities for the day along water intake. It breaks down the nutritional components for the most part. You can choose calorie count or not, that is great there are options/choices. What I do notice is the app will freeze at time where you have to log out wait a few and the log back in to put your information in. For a few days I was unable to put anything in at after updating the app. I must say, the company need to work on that part. Overall, I like the app other than that one major glitch.

title: Great idea but a lousy app
body: I don't write app reviews often. This app would be so great, if only for a few things. The graphs are great and I live the tracking tools. But, the app doesn't follow Apple's standards and it is extremely difficult to use. The touch screen is very unresponsive in this program, and there is no blinking cursor to inform the user where try are typing. This, and about a million other bugs, makes this app very hard to use. Many times I will click on a touch region and it won't respond. I have been having these problems since I bought the app months ago and they haven't been fixed. Also, the database could have more foods and it would be cool if it could track points. I love the idea an without bugs it would be 5 stars. The bugs are just so bad that it affects usability. P.S. I am on an iPod Touch with 2.2.

title: Unreliable app
body: I switched to this app from my fitness pal because the UI is much better and seemed less buggy. However, after purchasing a 1 year subscription, I found that while the UI is better, the app has huge problems with properly recording your data. Whenever I input a meal it will not show up until I force quit the app and reopen. About once a day, all of my data will disappear and the only thing that brings it back is restarting the phone.  Activity tracking has just as many problems. When it stops working even a restart doesn't work. I have to turn activity tracking off in the app and then remove all syncing in HealthKit to get it to work again.

title: Latest update going in the wrong direction
body: The latest update moves away from the initial simple design. It now takes at twice as many touches, or even more, to do anything.

title: What more can you ask for?
body: Keeps track of food, calories, weight, water, exercise, and macronutrients - all in one easy-to-use app. It even connects to step trackers and has a barcode scanner for food so you don't have to look specific stuff up, though you can. The design is appealing and easy to use.  Reminders are somewhat customizable (turn em on or off for food, water, or exercise). That's all the free version. There's even more stuff in premium that I have not explored. I saw something about tracking measurements that looked interesting but thus far I'm still too cheap to go for it. Honestly, it's the best app of this kind I've tried.  I highly recommend it.

title: Let me explain why
body: I love this app because it grades me based on ABCDE Grade on every single thing that I eat it essentially teaches me how to eat how to shop I use the skin option to scan every item that I might purchase at the grocery store. It syncs up to my fit bit my iPhone.

title: No no no no
body: I cannot begin to describe how angry and disappointed I am in this app. This app is working fine for me until I scrolled past their ad for their monthly subscription which said was three dollars and something cents a month. How misleading. I bought the subscription thinking I was going to pay three dollars a month, and they charged me the next day for $50 for a full year. Not to mention, they also say in their ad that you can cancel this subscription at any time, but that is awesome misleading and untrue because there is no option available for you to cancel it. And even if I was able to cancel it I doubt that I would see a penny of my money back. I have already emailed them I hope to get my money back, but with the experience I have had with them already, I doubt it will. I seriously would never ever recommend this app for anyone to use or buy from.

title: Great app- make sure you're double checking your nutrition facts
body: Great app, I've been using this every day and love it. Log your food, exercise, weight, journal your thoughts, plan your goals. This app does it all.

title: Fit and Fun !!! üí™üèºüî•üëèüèº
body: This is a great app if your are looking to gain,maintain,or lose weight it also keeps you on track to get moving when I look over the day It encourages me to do 30 or more exercise daily it helps me keep track of my water intake and let's me know how healthy I'm eating or how healthy a certain product or food I'm eating is they do offer recipes but I don't follow them exact because I personally believe everyone's intake is different but it gives you great ideas I do wish that they could show more then your carb,fat,protein intake maybe something different iron for example or Ect. although it is very helpful and Add possibly your daily fruit intake or less restriction to none paying members ?

title: My go to
body: I love Lifesum. I have used loseit and other trackers in the past but I really enjoy this one. I feel as though it is more accurate, it does a breakdown of everything including sugar and sodium and it lets me know if my diet is balanced or not. It tells me to eat more fish or if I need to eat more calories. It is all based on the plan you pick and there are many to choose from. It also has a water tracker that you can track either glasses or bottles. usually I will start tracking my food and then quit but with this one I stay tracking, even if I eat bad. It sends me reminders to log my meals but it doesn't hound me with notifications. Like my title states, it's my go to.

title: LOVE THIS APP, but...
body: i really love this app. it feels like a mini life coach. when you put in your food, it'll give you a smiley face according to how good the food item was, and i love when i get the big smiles! i also love the water glass counter feature, it feels like a game and makes me want to drink more water. i've been successfully drinking 6-9 glasses every day for a week and i feel great! but, recently the app has started crashing whenever i try to use one of it's features. sometimes my whole phone crashes and turns off. whenever this happens i delete the app and re download and it's good for a few days before starting again. i love this app but i wish that wasn't the case. hopefully this gets fixed soon.

title: Great App.!
body: Does everything it says, and does so in a very user friendly way. It has a food database that I can use for some of my foods, but I LOVE being able to make my own foods and meals. Especially the meals, since I can set up all my meals in the database and then just chose that one when I have it. No need to constantly enter each item individually! The charts, graphs, and photos make a great addition to the program, that makes using it all that much more fun and informative. I would reccomend this app. to anyone and everyone, definitely worth the money. Anything that makes tracking your diet and weight fun is worth every penny. ;)

title: Great app - Great Interface
body: I've used daily burn, daily plate, and some others, and I have to say that this app is the nicest looking of all of them, both the app and the website.  The features are great, as I'm using the free version.  The gold version is only $3/month, so it's really not expensive at all.  Daily plate and the others also charge for pro features, so nothing different in regards to having to pay for additional features.

title: App freezing up!
body: I've been using this app for months and loved it enough to buy a gold account. And I love everything about it. Until the last two days. I finally got a FitBit and synced the accounts, and since then the app consistently freezes up when I open it up to add a meal or snack. I shut down the app and try again, same thing. I've restarted my phone multiple times, freezes up every time still. I'd love to try to unsync the accounts to see if that changes anything... But they're syncing is set up through LifeSum, so if I can't open it, I can't do it. I'm grouchy and frustrated. Like I said, this is my only complaint, so you still get my four stars, but this is driving me nuts.

title: Beautiful, useful, yet frustrating
body: I love the design and the idea behind the app but it falls a bit short. I found that if I search a meal or food item to add, there aren't a lot of choices and most often I can't find what I'm looking for. This being the case, I can't add this to my daily meals, thus negating the usefulness of this app. I am also very disappointed in the rating system in that I could have multiple A items but it equals out to a D or E because of the total calories. I feel like the rating should be based on healthy choices and not the number of calories, seeing as I could eat nothing but raw vegetables and still get a low grade. I think this whole system needs re-thought and is sadly becoming another app that wasn't very well executed.

title: Great for diabetics
body: Recently diagnosed diabetic, so I tried the Ketonic diet in this app. Also tested a couple other apps side-by-side. Deleted the others. And lost 20 pounds so far. They make it easy to make intelligent food choices, even when eating out with friends, by putting all the data about your options right in front of you! And the recipes have been the real time saver. They really understand the different diets and push recipes to you that fit your diet, unlike the other apps that are totally calorie-centric (and completely untrustworthy for carb-sensitive people). A few more tweaks and they'll be the perfect app, but it's already a 5-star app.

title: Amazing
body: I personally love the app and love about everything on it cause it really helps me track that amount of calories I eat and burn off so I don't have to keep writing everything down and you can't figure out how many calories you lost like any other ways so this is easy it is also easy to keep track and make sure I'm hydrated through out that whole the whole day, really the only thing I would ask for is to have the carbs right next to the calories since that's really the thing that's making me gain the most wait so I don't have to add everything up throughout the day thank you so much for the app tho I love it a lot‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Great at first, but inevitably too time consuming
body: This app is great. It focuses on doing deferent diet types, gives a relatively small list of recipes that work with said diets, and allows a certain amount of customizability. But there are some functionality that seems clunky and slow, which makes this app more of an obstruction, than help. They have a custom meal feature, but it's not convenient.
