I'm not going to take the time to input all the products that aren't in the database, and the ones close to what I have seen strangely too healthy. It would be great to have more features that build custom meals in a less round-about way and an expanded database. Having a feature that recognizes nutrition fact stickers would be amazing. Now that is a premium feature.

title: Crashes
body: I was absolutely loving this app until about a day and a half in and when it started crashing instantly every time I open it. I've been trying for the past day to be able to get it open again but it won't. So it's awesome until it quit working. You put in your height, weight, age, your goal weight and it'll estimate how much weight you should lose over a certain period of time. It also keeps track of what you eat by entering in the name or scan the barcode and just hit The button and it'll calculate all the calories you had for that meal. It'll tell you if you've had too many or too little calories for that day and it will also keep track of how much water you drink by just tapping on a little picture of a glass.

title: Really helps with weight loss
body: I invested the yearly/ monthly fee in this app expecting it to help me loose weight. Well it did and I am 60 pounds lighter. There was a girl in my college English class that I liked, but I was 287lbs so I had no chance. Three months later I seen her and said hi and stuff, but that's about it. That night she started texting me and now we're going on our first date.

title: Great app!
body: First the pros:

title: Needs work
body: When I first got this app it was decent. I'm not too hot on the fact that it only shows active calories on the main screen next to consumed calories. It would be nice to have all calories (resting plus active) so I can quickly see where I'm at calories in/out instead of having to look up my resting and do the math myself. The biggest problem though, and this is a more redent one, which has caused me to cancel my subscription is the glitch that resets a lot of my food entries. I enter my dinner and the app says 1 serving = 300 cal then I go back to check it later and it says 1 serving = 1 cal. So I constantly have to reenter food in creative ways in order for the calories to be correct (ie 300 servings/300 cal). That's if I can remember what the nutrition facts were on the frozen dinner I had a few hours ago.

title: I use it everyday as a tool.
body: This is a great app. I use it to track my intake and outputs. Highly recommend using with a Fitbit or similar unit though, because you are constantly burning calories, not just when you're exercising. My favorite part of the app is the database of foods and the bar scanner tool. It's good for keeping track of caloric consumption and how much fluid you drink. But it changes the calorie limit depending on how much you exercise which can be misleading or confusing. I like that you can add unlisted foods. I also like that you can add your own exercise activity and calories burned, but you can't put how many minutes spent on that exercise. (It always just says 1 minute).

title: IMMENSE LACK OF EXERCISES
body: The variety of exercises is very thin. Also, the search engine on the app could be better. You have only one thigh machine, even though there are at least 8 that I know of. I'm sure they all burn different amounts of calories. Bicycle kicks not on the app; no planking, amazing exercise & still not on your app! Lying leg lifts? No. Flutter kicks? No. Leg raises? No. Russian twist? No. Plank kick throughs? No. Plank knee to elbow? No. It's really concerning the amount of exercises not on your app. CHEST PRESS!? How can you not have something so fundamental? Shoulder press, different variations of squats, back extensions, other back exercises.

title: Great App and Great Customer Service!
body: We all know how good the app is from the previous reviews but let's talk about customer service. For the past 8 days my Fitbit wouldn't sync because of a server error. I emailed them about it and they replied back almost immediately saying that they're working on it already. Not only that, they went beyond what most companies do when the problem is minor and emailed me again saying "Hey, it's working now. Here's how to connect Fitbit again." I'm pretty impressed!

title: Pretty good
body: Pretty visuals, very interactive. Theres a couple of text errors when you pick the gain weight option, like they added it in on a whim and didnt change all the text. The plan survey was... what?? Most of the questions were unintelligible the rest were not applicable to what i was trying to do.. but whatever about that. The database is pretty big and im not worried about being 100% accurate with my calories so i just put in approximates. Id really like a tutorial on like, what an ounce of food looks like, or like how much is an average glass, idk but i dont know that stuff. But it wasn't that hard to look it up.  Uh yea ive only been using it 2 days but no big complaints so far.

title: Amazing Fitness App!
body: I love this app and have been a premium member for more than a year. The team continuously makes the app better every month and actually listens to user feedback on what could be improved on. It's super easy to log what I eat during the week and be able to balance it out with my workouts. Some of my favorite features include a useful(though somewhat limited) recipe book and the seamless integration with Apple Health Kit and other smart health products(such as my withings scale). This app is extremely easy to use and I encourage anyone who needs help getting fit to definitely try it out! Thanks Lifesum Team!

title: Pricey, Unintuitive
body: You need to have a paid account just to see basic nutrition information like fiber! Ditto for syncing with other apps.

title: Finally something that helps me!
body: This app is awesome. It's easy to use, easy to track your progress, very helpful with meeting your goals. The only complaint I do have is sometimes the specific items listed do not have accurate nutritional information (Ex. A certain brand of something says 1 cup has X amount of calories, but it actually has Y amount of calories per cup). And fixing the inaccurate information is a process because you have to report it and it has to be approved before it is changed. Highly recommend this app, though. Keep improving it and it will be huge in no time.

title: Love it buuuuuut...
body: UPDATE: I've been using this app for almost a year and it really is a great tool to measure how much activity I do throughout the day and to utilize as a food diary.

title: Wanted to love, but ...
body: I saw a recommendation for this app on Pinterest for people following a keto eating plan. I purchased a 3 month subscription based on reviews that I read. I was so disappointed. There are many things I like such as the "on track" indicators and the food plans. However, the food database is horrible--especially for the price.

title: Simple way to lose weight
body: Played football in high school and got up to 265 lbs but once I graduated and entered college, I started on the reg and dropped down to 190 and felt 10 feet tall and strong as a ox. But as college is want to do, I got lazy and gained roughly 50 lbs (Mostly primanti bros and chipotle, had the munchies like woe). Now I weigh 224 lbs, down from 230 and I started two days ago. I've been trying to get back to 190 but to no avail because I lose track of what I eat.

title: Great option for everyone
body: Best part about this app is that it's not specifically for people who are trying to lose weight like most other apps like this are. There are options for everyone, whether you ARE trying to lose weight, maintain your weight but eat healthier, or even gain weight (muscle mass). Also, there are so many options for different foods you can put in to your log, including brand names so you know that the macro count is accurate. I recommend this app to anyone who wishes to track their eating habits! Remember, workouts won't get you anywhere without the proper meal plan!

title: Love it, but...
body: I enjoy this app much more than myfitnesspal because you have the option to measure your food in grams which works for my lifestyle. However I would like more options and customization when it comes to setting goals and counting macros. Sometimes the diet and percentages don't match the goals Im trying to reach and would like to set my macros in grams per day. Also would like a tab to view the entire day and sum of all the macro and micro nutrients like myfitnesspal does so I know how many macros I have, or don't have left.

title: Fantastic
body: I have used Lifesum for quite a while now and just loved how it is set up. I switched to MyPlate because I heard some hype about it, but found even with its features it just isn't nearly as nice as Lifesum. Lifesum is simple, easy to navigate, and has just enough on it to tell you what you need without clouding up the dashboard with things you don't want. It has nearly every exercise already on it (though I found when I input my climbing the calorie burned count seems high).  This app is amazing! If you need a macronutrient tracker or a calorie counter or a fitness tracker, use Lifesum! 100% recommended!

title: Things to fix in next update
body: This app has a lot of positive qualities and great potential. I have had a lot of success losing weight since this app sets a daily caloric intake goal for you based on your current weight, your goal weight, and the amount of time you want to lose the weight in. I also like being able input recipes and meals that I make often so they're easy to track. There is also a good database of foods and their calories.

title: Good but with inaccurate food info
body: The app so far seems great. I wanted to get this to try and eat healthier in general and also have a way to see nutritional info for things I'm eating so I can take insulin for all the combined ingredients (I'm a type 1 diabetic).

title: Mostly satisfied
body: It is a great and thorough app. Lots of features and plans. You can track water, exercise, food. It helps you set goals and it also tells you how you are doing at each meal and how to improve. It also has a quiz that shows you what you eat enough of and what you need to intake more or cut out. I have premium and it's $45 for the year which is cheaper than fitness pal. I think this app is better than fitness pal by far.

title: Would Love to Love It
body: I adore the smiley faces and meal/food ratings. They are so encouraging! I love the water symbols. Just touching the glasses to fill them up make me feel like drinking more.

title: Great app!!! Review from a nutrition profesional
body: I am updating my review based in the new update.

title: Fun with a little clumsiness like all apps
body: Fun calorie-watch app.  You can choose from a variety of ideal diets like paleo, low carb, balanced meal plan, whole grain emphasis,  etc and you get little smiley faces when your meal confirms to your plan.  You can find recipes that got with each plan to inspire you.

title: Keeps getting better
body: I've used ShapeUp for years, off and on. At first you had to add everything yourself and the app crashed often or was slow, but I've been delighted to find that every time I pick it up again it just works better. The copy from previous day is a dream and I love typing in recipes and having calories per serving automatically calculated -- saves guessing from similar foods on the web. Plus, the app is speedy and hasn't crashed in a long time. Thanks for continuing development and making this a great, reliable app that keeps getting easier to use!

title: Great for a freebie
body: I agree with most of the reviews.  I too wish there were more choices for exercises.  I really wish there was a better way to pick from recent meals rather than join a club. I am losing wt using this program.  Thanks

title: Nice but sync unreliable
body: I've used this app for about a week now, very intensely, tracking everything, even water.

title: This is great!!
body: I'm in love with this app! It's (VERY) easy to use which is great and it has a lot of food and exercise options which is great because all you have to do is look up the food, and click on it, it counts the calories for you! And he exercise options are great, especially with sports practices, because it has a lot of options like if I did easy, medium, or a hard workout! It also gives you tips and tricks to help motivate you, if fact it just told me a second ago, "you just danced, you need to stay hydrated! Grab a glass of water!" Sry for this long review I really just enjoy this app

title: Get This App!!!!
body: Amazing app to keep track of your diet and exercise! This app asks you your age, weight, height, and gender to calculate just the right amount of calories you should be eating. With notifications turned on, this app will remind you when its time to eat or drink some water. If you are willing to pay a monthly fee, you can go even deeper into your calculations by tracking the intches around your body parts. You can also get access to tasty and healthy recipes for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Even if you dkn't want to pay, this app will benefit and enhance your life to the very fullest! Get this app!!!!!

title: Best app BUT too expensive
body: Come to find out you can only save 2 recipes with the free membership.  So I'm thinking, "No problem,  I'll get a membership.  $3/month is doable."  Come to find out it's $9/month unless you buy 12 months.  Ridiculous!  This is my favorite of all the food logging apps but what is up with the ridiculous price tag?  I like getting grades for my meals although I feel like it wasn't always accurate.  There is also a problem with the accuracy of the food that I would scan in.  I was constantly having to double check that the calories and servings were right.  I'll probably go back to my fitness pal or 'lose it'.  Too bad because I like this interface the best.

title: I like it!
body: I just started using this app, I usually use my fitness pal. I have been using both and comparing both. I do like that this app has recipes and a specific plan based upon you desired goals. I do feel that there's a good amount of features though that you must pay for which is quite upsetting. Just to track my measurements I have to pay, yet my fitness pal, I can do all of that. I do wish there was a way to customize your water intake. I maybe not finish all my water and prefer to just input the correct dose. I do love the smiley faces next to the each food and for each meal, as well as, the recommended calories for each meal.

title: Love it, love it!!
body: I hate calorie counting, this app goes beyond. Is not about just the calories but the quality of food you eat and Lifesum does that.

title: In love
body: I seriously love this app. I've never been able to consistently track food and I've been at it almost every day since march (2 months) and have been on and off since January. It's been so helpful, so easy and Kees me motivated. I've struggled with counting calories before. It made me feel super restricted but this app somehow makes me feel in control and makes me want to stay on track to reach my goals. I love tracking my food as crazy as that may sound! This app makes it fun and easy and gives you helpful, informative guidelines along the way!!! 10/10 recommend

title: Absolutely Wonderful!
body: I have been using this app on and off now since the beginning of the year, and because of it I have lost a grand total of twenty two pounds. I still have some ways to go, but it is completely worth the time and effort. Although, I never did use the premium packaging because I cannot afford it, I do believe that this app has truly changed how I feel about my eating habits. If there is anyone reading this who feels nervous or humiliated about the awkwardness of using a fitness app, don't. It will get more natural and easier the longer you use it, so don't be worried.

title: This App is SICK! But....
body: I just got this app a few days ago and I LOVE it. It is exactly what I was looking for since Calorieking has nothing coming out for the iphone. The only thing I would like to see improvements on are:

title: Updated With HUGE ONLINE FOOD DATABASE!
body: I paid $9.99 for this app and will not complain one bit about it. It is worth every penny. The GUI is great, it responds nicely, works as promised, and they have just added a *HUGE* online database of food. Yes, I no longer have to skip over foods because I don't feel like typing in the nutritional facts myself! How great is that? Searching for words like "Stuffing" and "pot roast" will bring up numerous choices that you can chose from, then once you pick the one you want, you can add it to your database with one click. It works seemlessly over the 3G, great app. Let's lose some weight!

title: Great...but you  can tell it's a new app
body: It's a great idea, love it much more than lose it, but like everyone has said, the system has a lot of flaws that seem weird for an app that looks as good as this one does. Biggest issue because it's crucial to what the app is for: Because portion sizes are really confusing to set when you add a food, calorie values are just all over the place. If I hadn't been tracking calories so long I would have no clue how many calories is actually in anything. Finally, navigating is a bit tedious, even when entering food. If they can work on the above this app will be in a much better place.

title: Arguably one of the best nutritional apps out there but needs better price options!
body: I love this app so far. The interface is clean, simple and easy to use. Adding food is a bit tricky at times but this is the best attempt by an app I've seen thus far. My only issue is the subscription options. I'm not one to sign up for monthly plans. Especially via the App Store. I like to purchase in blocks or buy 1 time and done. I also wish they would offer the first month or 2 for free. I can't see the full potential of the app until I buy it for a month. If they offered the first month free, I probably would have loved it so much that I would have subscribed. IMO. Other than that, love this app!

title: Just what I was looking for
body: Let's be honest, I'm terrible at paying attention to what percentage of my food intake is carbs, protein, etc.  With Lifesum, now i can have that information with the least amount of effort!  You can document your meals consisting of raw food (fruits, eggs, etc), homemade meals (honey balsamic chicken with broccoli and cheese), and even dining out!  They make it so quick and easy to keep track; there is even a barcode scanner for expedited food entry.  Props!  You also get recommendations for items that would benefit your diet, such as adding peanuts or a specific protein like fish.  It's like having a professional nutritionist right at your fingertips!

title: Much More Than A Journal!
body: Lifesum is absolutely the most useful app I use. This app does not sit idly by, forgotten, like so many that are cumbersome to navigate with little reward for the work. With Lifesum I jot what I ate or scan the barcode and the app automatically notes all of the nutrition info for me. Even better, it syncs seamlessly with apple health kit, and also provides a range of nutrition plans (they are not "diets") to choose from to help you reach your own goals! It also "learns" your usual foods and keeps them at the ready for selection. Exercise log/calories burned? Water consumption? YES! It has those too!

title: Switched from MyFitnessPal
body: I'd been using MFP for more than 6 months, and started growing tired of its poor user experience - too many steps to log entries, slow loading times, and not to mention random crashes.

title: 40lbs lost and counting
body: I love this app and have tried a couple other fitness tracking apps. This one is different because of the day ratings & food ratings which gives you a better idea of the overall health of the food at a glance, without having to do calculations. I like the ability to see the breakdown of fat/carb/protein and set goals for yourself based on these values. The app itself is very well designed, has great graphics and feedback, which makes you want to open the app and log your food every day!! Buying the premium membership is so worth it!

title: Have been using it for more than one year
body: Just like I said, I've been using this app for more than a year and it works for me most of time. It helps me tracking down my everyday intakes, though the seven day calories calculator is never correct, always missing somedays' exercise calories. But the one month or three months count are quite accurate. Though after several updates, it didn't show (or lost) all the data from three months ago. So far, there's still space for improvement and I will keep using it. :-)

title: Love it but needs tweaking
body: I love this app and bought the premium version to put myself on one of the diet plans the energizer which is very similar to what my personal trainer suggested as a diet for me.

title: A versatile application
body: UN NO!!!! -----UPDATE JAN. 1st------ !!! Very very sorry I used now. I had many notes each day n used all things well without subscription based!!

title: Good for the price
body: I have used other food trackers and I like the simplicity of this one and the lack of ads of the website version. I upgraded to hold and I have no issues with it linking to RunKeeper. In fact I love that I don't have to manually enter my exercise!

title: Perfect for What I Need!
body: I love this app. I'm trying to track my diet without obsessing over it and Lifesum makes it so easy. I like that I can search their extensive database and even scan barcodes!

title: Great App, Read My Review.
body: This app is great for tracking calories and the amount of water you drink during the day, also, If you exercise with your phone or Apple watch it will account for the calories you burned during your workout and add to the amount of calories you may consume for that day. The only thing that can be tricky with the app is when you eat out at privately owned restaurants which do not list calories. In this case you will have to add each individual food item. Overall, great application and I love that they have the app for the Apple watch!

title: One of the best trackers available
body: Ease of use is an understatement. You can scan items into your daily log. Track and understand how your food choices are meeting criteria for your chosen diet. Recipes are ok, could use more on the daily feed or a database to directly access anytime, include shopping list too! Easy to log exercise and water intake. Add foods or recipes if the library doesn't have it. Never had a functioning problem, this app opens and works perfect every time. I strongly recommend to anyone who wants to track their food and exercise. Thank you!

title: Not worth it!
body: I was very excited about this app because on top of being able to track my meals and work outs each day, it would provide me with suggested recipes. The catch is though, that in order to unlock all of the recipes, I had to upgrade to the gold version. BIG mistake! Logging anything is difficult. It's nearly impossible to get accurate food portions or even exercises for that matter.  There's some type of arbitrary grading system that makes no sense whatsoever. On top of that, I haven't gotten any new recipes! I can't believe I bought a year-long subscription to be told how to put avocado on toast everyday.  The most disappointing part is once I paid for my subscription, I'm stuck with it for the full term. There's no way to cancel it until it's over. Save your money!

title: Beautiful UI, Good functionality
body: I've been using this app for a while now and find it very useful for it's purpose. I have seen a lot of bad reviews for this app from people lacking knowledge of how to properly use certain features (deleting food entries, update vs adding food, favoriting food, creating meals) all of which this app includes. My only suggestions are the following:

title: If I could give 4 1/2 stars I would ....
body: I purchased the paid version so that I could take full advantage of the app.

title: LOVE this app
body: I have been using another calorie-tracking app for a couple years now, but downloaded this to try it out. LOVE it so far. I did buy the year subscription, but I feel it was money well spent if you're serious about eating better. The interface is very simple and intuitive to use, and is very supportive and informative on what to expect from your body with your desired plan. I strongly recommend this app. The only suggestion/desire is for the app to have a weight tracking function to keep track of personal progress.

title: Great but...
body: This app is awesome! Helps me keep track of how much water I drink a day, how many calories I'm actually consuming with a snack, breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Also helps me keep track of my workout and how long I do it for. This app is great for losing, or gaining weight but also maintaining the weight you're at. It also offers the option to help with eating healthier and getting leaner.  The only thing I'm not a huge fan of is the fact you have to pay a fee to be able to get the full use out of the app. Overall it could use a few minor changes but I really do love this app. Highly recommend.

title: seamless programing, great interface
body: I really enjoy this app and cannot wait for more updates. They listen to all of the feedback you submit and I have never been so satisfied with a digital food diary. I mean they even have the activity calorie count for body pump! The database will soon grow, but I have put in plenty of foods already so Im not complaining. I love how you can track calories, point, grams of carbs and just about anything. I have waited two months to write this review so I really hope you take my advice and look no further for another diet program.

title: Never dieted before, love this app!
body: I have always been very physically active and never gave a thought to portion control. I'm in my mid-forties now, and work plus family makes it challenging to be as physically active as I used to be. Portion control had not changed. Add in a slower metabolism, and my doc recently informed me I was 35 lbs overweight.

title: Pretty great
body: The only thing that's a bit iffy with this app is the portioning and the averaging, but otherwise it's great. It's just how am I supposed to know how much of something I ate? Oh well, it's still good to keep track and useful for developing better eating habits. Especially once you realize what you've been cramming into your face hole. Another great thing about this app worth mentioning is the fact that it also has a lot of the different brands of certain foods too. I really recommend this app, it's very worth while and worth a try. Give it a chance!

title: Beautiful and Streamlined
body: Beautifu, streamlined and simple service that makes up for a slightly wonky food tracker with amazing recipe recommendations and a great system for inputting your own.

title: Useful for Bodybuilding
body: I love this app, because not only does it help you track your macro-nutrient requirements and caloric intake, it gives you ratings of the food you're eating. It reminds me to stay hydrated as well. You can also track your exercises and it will change your macros based on exercise. The only problem is that it doesn't have all the exercises you would do in the gym, but I usually assume all chest workouts under the "push-ups" category. Also negatively, you have to pay to be able to track all the micro-nutrients.

title: Teaches you how to eat correctly
body: I'm kind of ashamed that as a 29 year old guy I had trouble keeping track of meals and making sure I ate enough food. I work on the computer a lot but I'm also physically active, this app makes eating good well-balanced diet a lot easier. It helps, it has become such a habit and helps me keep on top of my calorie and nutrient intake. I highly recommend Lifesum if you want to step away from eating so much processed or junk foods, the food ratings make decisions a lot easier and helps reaffirm my food choices throughout the day.

title: Best Nutrition Tracking App EVER!
body: This app is the best app for tracking not just calories but nutrition! You can see your macronutrients, calories and foods for the day. Very easy to find any foods you have eaten in their database. Also LOVE that they give you an option to be on meal plans and rank your day based on the plan. For example, I eat low carb so I'm on their Keto diet program that way it tells me when I've eaten too many carbs. Most apps will only tell you the standard American diet recommendations, but this one has multiple options! Highly recommend!

title: Great and beautiful app
body: I think this app is awesome because it holds my attention and the design is something I enjoy looking at everyday (unlike myfitnesspal). My only complaint is that the inventory of food they have is quite poor. I've noticed that entries done by real users are not accurate and then get circulated around. Example: There is a sweet potato entry that at 0 grams is over 2000 calories! Clearly incorrect... with that being said this app is great and I use everyday! Super easy to customize the setting to your needs without upgrading to premium.

title: Perfect For Tracking Nutrition, Exercise, & More!
body: I love this Lifesum! This app has helped me tremendously! I have been able to loose 20  pounds so far! It's easy to use, and you can personalize everything. The in app purchase is a must if you are serious about weight loss though. I used the free vision for the first two months which is great for calorie tracking and logging exercise. I then decided to buy the 6 month subscription which now allows me to make and log recipes, coaches you on food choices, gives awesome meal idea, and much more!

title: Too many bugs for an app that I am paying for
body: This app is a great concept. It's easy and user friendly, when it isn't crashing. It gets me to drink more and eat more vegetables and fish. However, it crashes multiple times a day for me. It will not allow me to input food for the next day, as it puts that food on the current day. It's so frustrating. Also, recently it is not correctly searching for food products that it has brought up in the past. I am very disappointed. With each bug fix, these problems get worse. In fact, ever since I started paying for it, I have had more issues than before paying. I will continue to use it since I paid for 3 months, but at this time I absolutely cannot recommend it.  Use any other app.

title: very good
body: This ap is really pretty good.  Not perfect.  You will run into situations where what you eat in not really covered by the included data base.  You can usually fudge it by putting the components of what you ate into the log separately.  Just takes a little more time. However, I will say that the ability to track what you are eating really helps.  That extra piece of cake, nope, gonna push me over the limit.  I think that the new update and the ability to add foods will add to the utility of the program.   It might sound fussy, but no olive oil, really...  For us short fat white guys it is a hope for redemption.

title: Great Weight Watchers Tracking App!!!
body: After looking around extensively for an app to track my weight watchers points, I am very pleased with iShape.  Not only does it let you keep a calendar that tracks points and daily percentages for you (with some effort), it also allows you to search an online database and save submissions as favorites.  Then, you just need to add that favorite to your daily food list.  I also like the weight tracker with added charts to see how you have progressed.  It even lets you add exercise points, though adding the info yourself is sometimes necessary.  I have found that this app works great alongside the free iPoints app, which allows you to calculate points based on calories, fat and fiber.  Definately worth the money if you are serious about losing weight.

title: Love it!!!!
body: I just started using this app about 3 weeks ago. I always knew how to eat healthy, but this teaches you how to balance a meal. I was down 5lbs by the end of week 1. Not because I did anything out of the ordinary, I just kept better track of what I was putting in my body. I like that it links with the health app and automatically inputs movements in a day.

title: DEVELOPERS AND BUYERS;
body: This app is beautiful. It is simple to navigate, and has lots of great features. I would give it five stars, but; THERE IS ONE PROBLEM. I have other health and fitness apps, and they all contribute to Apple Health along with Lifesum. HOWEVER,

title: Couldn't ask for better.
body: My whole family is trying to lose at least 10 pounds. We're not overweight, but we aren't where we want to be. The fact that there are friends on Lifesum helps keep us motivated to log, and we can each other's food. if they didn't log, we sent each other reminders to do so. Our first day on Lifesum we were surprised on how many calories we usually eat and got many E and D ratings!!! Long story short, I lost 9 pounds in 4 weeks! Get this app if you don't already.

title: Great. But needs ironing out.
body: Lifesum has helped me to be more conscious of my eating habits, and gives me a greater sense of how many calories I am eating. However, the Apple Watch app doesn't always keep up with the iOS app; for example when I track water and exercise in the iOS app, the Watch app shows that haven't had any water and have not exercised at all! I'm not sure why this happens but it is a bit frustrating. There is a lot of potential in Lifesum, I suggest that the developers keep at it! I would recommend this for anyone who wants to eat better and drink more water.

title: A Dime a Dozen
body: This app is pretty, with a cute interface and other small features that make it appealing to use, like the smiley faces next to each meal item to indicate what is "better" or "worse" for you to eat.

title: I'd love to love your app but..
body: Unfortunately Myfitnesspal is light years ahead in the size of the foods database. I've given you guys a chance many times throughout time but the food database continues to be seriously underwhelming. While the app is beautiful, I much rather not have to enter foods and nutritional information manually as it takes much longer in time than I can afford which is the reason I've kept on renewing premium with Myfitnesspal.. Get your food and nutritional database to match Myfitnesspal and I'll switch over and go for your premium. In the meantime, bye bye again for now. :(

title: Calorie and weight tracker not working
body: I saw the great reviews and started using the app a week ago. I was excited to use it but have been pretty disappointed with the glitches. 1. I have it synced to Apple health for steps, and on the day I walked 8000 steps, the app told me I burned about 200 calories. Then, the next day when my phone only recorded 2000 steps, the app said I burned 500. 2. I have been trying to record my daily weights, but instead of adding it into the chart as a new weight, it changes the starting weight. 3. The faces seem to have no correlation to the food I eat. It told me that grilled zucchini was bad but rice is ok? I'm debating whether to keep using this app or just switch to another one.

title: WAS IN LOVE ... until
body: i was so ready to give this 5 stars and say how in love i am with this app, it's your average calorie counting app BUT IT ISNT . i have the free version because i'm broke but it's still amazingly helpful and way more aesthetically pleasing than other ones i've use, so that makes it easier and nicer to use. i'm terrible at drinking water , but the little water glasses filling up feels like a game to me, I NEED ALL OF THEM FILLED FOR THE DAY! but now after about a week of using it every single day, it's crashing and exiting the app when i try to click any of the features. please fix this i love this app so much ::((

title: Stupid update!
body: Ever since last nights update my app has been completely messed up. It has pushed everything a day back. Apparently i ate nothing yesterday  and what a actually ate yesterday it says i ate the day before. And it has doubled everything i have eaten. It's all on there twice so it messed up my averages and my goal date. And so i deleted it and redownloaded it hoping it would fix it but then it pushed everything back another day. So with the original day and this one everything is two days off.  And if i try to delete one of the doubles the next time i open it both the double and the one i left are gone. Fix your crap before you release it!

title: Nice but could improve
body: I am currently doing IIFYM and I really like that this app quickly shows my macros. However, I think there could be some improvement with tracking food. I think you should be able to quick add calories and carbs and protein so that if you go out to lunch and look up the nutrition, and they don't have it on the app, you can still track it. Also, the exercises could use some improvement. I like to track everything with my workout, like how many lunges I do and with what weight. That exercise is not on here, and it doesn't give me an option to create my own like My Fitness Pal does.

title: Impressive Improvement
body: This update has really increased my motivation to track my meals and drink more water. I love the notifications and graphs! It's improved so much since its last update. My only concern is the lack in the food library. I've been using other resources to create my own foods and it doesn't have enough diversity in cuisine. Also, the built in step tracker is very inaccurate, which doesn't bother me as much because I have my own pedometer. But it can be inaccurate in calorie burn with its built in system or when adding my own exercises.

title: So helpful, So healthful!
body: This really is a genius idea! I tried counting calories with the app "myfitnesspal", but I always got frustrate or unmotivated to use it. With Lifesum, I'm excited to see how my macros are divided from my calories with a beautiful layout and encouragement!

title: Great, but a few suggestions...
body: I love this app and I am more successful with it than any other food tracking app out there. That being said, the food database needs to be expanded. Having to put in foods by hand can really be annoying. In addition, it doesn't sync my Nike+ workout (probably because it's a Runkeeper), even after it's exported to Apple's HealthKit. I really enjoy the grading system, but if the Lifesum team could work on those two things, it'd be enough for me to be a paying subscriber.

title: Lifesum
body: Since I've purchased the Lifesum app and have become a gold member. It has given me a sense of guidance and knowledge of food and nutrition. I'm not an expert not claim to be on nutrition, however, it has given me awareness in what I'm consuming  and makes me think twice about certain meals. Since I've started I've lost 9lbs in 3 weeks.  I love this app.

title: Awesome concept with some flaws
body: The app closed on me when I tried to make my own meal. I sadly paid for the year today without checking out some other apps too. The app does not help you figure out how to tweak your ideal carb, fat and protein intake or your calorie content - but if you're fine researching it yourself then it's very easy to adjust.

title: Simple to use
body: I normally use MyFitnessPal but decided to try this out and have been using this for the last couple of days since it works with my Apple Watch. Not a lot of food info yet in the database so alot of the food I was eating had to be entered in manually. Overall it is a good app. Simple interface and easy to use. But not as detailed as the MFP app. Will give this a couple weeks of further use and update my review. But if you're looking for something simple and easy to track your calorie, fitness, and water intake. I do recommend this app.

title: An app that ACTUALLY works
body: This app is a must get, whether you want to lose weight, gain weight, or simply eat healthier. It's easy to use and can connect with your health app to sync all data. It can send helpful notifications (only if you want), and it doesn't bombard you with ads. It allows you to input your entire diet on a day to day basis, and allows you to take quizzes to customize what you need in order to get your diet and body exactly how you want it. Plus, it's super fun to use. Overall, such a good app.

title: Love Lifesum!
body: I really love this app. It is the first all in one fitness and nutrition app that I have found with a great layout and ease of use. The way you can save your foods to favorites and it also pulls up recent foods saves so much time food logging, and I love that it automatically tracks workouts and steps through my Apple Watch. I wish the premium wasn't so expensive, being a college student it is hard to pay a monthly subscription but I feel like it would be worth it so I do want to try it soon! :)

title: Outstanding!
body: The weight loss program I'm following stresses journaling food intake and exercising.  iShape enables me to do that efficiently.  I don't care if I have to add some of my own foods.  I can put them in a Favorites list and access them again and again with ease.  I like that this app has macro-nutrient info as well as calorie info.  And best of all, before I decided to spend $10 on a app, I was able to visit the developer's web site and get a full video tour of the program.  Made the decision process a breeze.

title: Has everything you need to get your diet on track & lose weight!
body: This is the first app that actually tells you how many calories you have to have per day in order to lose weight, it has a great database of foods/calories & excercises/calories burned. You can also add your own foods & excercises. The other weight loss apps in itunes do not have all the features that ishape has, this is totally worth it! Since using it I have lost weight & I am on my way of meeting my goal.

title: Love this app!
body: I wish I would have found this earlier. I had my last baby three years ago, and instead of losing weight after he was born like I did with my other two children, I have continued to gain and gain. This is the first thing I have found that actually works AND is convenient enough to use without it seeming like a hassle. It's motivating and it's helping. Three days in and I am already down four pounds. Great app- I paid for the gold version (subscription) and it is worth every cent. :)

title: Love it
body: Ive used this app for a few years now to track various things - calorie intake, weight, & help get in the nutrition I want in the percentages of fat, carbs, & protein, plus track exercise. It's got it's flaws in that you have to dug around to find things sometimes, and i still have problems with trying to add a food & it telling me the food is already there, but I cant see it. But 98% of the time I'm pleased with this app & use it daily. Being able to plug in ingredients of a favorite recipe & not having to re-enter a portion each time is time saving.

title: Beautiful design, cumbersome UI, confusing ratings
body: The graphics are beautiful. I WANT to use this app. But the ux is cumbersome: a lot of extra clicks and taps and swipes to get your food added to your meals. Meal database is limited when using the search function compared to myfitnesspal or lose it. Adding weight should be available from the plus button so it's easily accessible at all times. Lastly, the ratings are strange. Oatmeal breakfast got a D and vegetable and chicken soup got an E (worst grade possible). I will give it a few more days but will probably switch back to myfitnesspal. Shame. Hope you guys can get things straightened out.

title: Need a little help getting started?
body: This is an awesome app that will help you keep track of your fitness goals. With this app, I was able to set myself up for success once I decided to change things for the better. I suggest it to anyone that needs a nudge in getting started with living a disciplined life. Success in fitness is 70% diet and 30% exercise and it helps to have an app that helps me keep track of my progress. Feel free to reach out to me in the app's community, I'd love to help coach you to success!

title: Good App, could improve.
body: I really like Lifesum. I've been using the basic free account for quite a while.

title: Excellent tracker and tips
body: First, this app really improves the tracking experience through design. I love the look of the UI, it's easy to use and beautiful.

title: Useless unless you go premium: greedy
body: There are so many out there with a freemium model or AT LEAST OFFER A MONTH OR THREE OF PREMIUM to try it out.   I would like to see if it's for me, but I'm not paying the premium price to do that.  If I could buy maybe one single month then ....possibly.... But the lowest they go is over $8/mo for a three mo min.  That's over $24 just to try it for three months.  The full year is like $49.

title: IN LOVE
body: I have tried many different calorie counting apps and have never been able to stick to them. However, I have been using life sum for a while now and am absolutely loving it!! I even bought the premium version! The design of the app is beautiful and easy to use. I also have an Apple Watch and love the little green apple that motivates me to move & and drink my water! ‚ù§Ô∏è I am loving my experience with Lifesum and don't have a single complaint! Five stars! 11/10 would recommend! üòäüëèüèº

title: Lifesum
body: So easy to use!!! Motivating!!! Fast, no searching around trying to add foods.  Scanner speeds  thing up.   Love it!  I am losing weight with it.   This is the best I have ever used.    I like it better than weight watchers.   Wish it had more exercises but I manage with what the have.! Do not upgrade.   It is very inaccurate on its grading method of foods. Same item can be entered twice with different values.  Tap water is a bad choice because of too much sodium, salad dressing,  very poor guidance on which to choose.

title: High hopes turned bad
body: This app was sent to me in an apple email. I was excited to use a calorie and nutrition app with my watch. I normally use fitness pal but it doesn't work with the Apple Watch. The layout it great I love how it rates the food and the easy dash board. I know it needs new members to add more food but it's a lot of work. And if you add a new food the measuring system is weird. A handful is not a good measurement. Also because I am going out to eat tonight I tried to put in my planned meal but nothing even close came up. At least with fitness pal I can usually get a pretty good idea of my meal based off of hundreds of other options. This app needs a lot of work

title: A Good Simple App For What It Does
body: I find that the free version of this app is very good for the things that it does. I like that you can track your daily, weekly, and monthly eating habits, exercise, and water intake. The app has reminders it sends you which is nice to help you stay on track. It seems pretty simple to use and is a helpful tool when used often. Overall, I enjoy using this free app which helps me stay more organized and progress in my short and long term goals of losing weight and becoming healthier. Thank you Lifesum!

title: Helping so much!!
body: So I just downloaded this app about a week ago with the goal of achieving a toned summer body and it already seems to be helping a lot!!! I feel very comfortable with my weight and the food that I have been eating. Also, the food and recipes that the app has recommended and provided me with taste delicious, are simple, quick, easy to make, and are extremely low in calories, carbs, and fat. I will be using and loving this app for years to come, and that it is a guarantee.

title: What happened?
body: Something is so wrong. I updated to this version last night before I went to bed. Woke up this morning, and now my diet plan changed, all my ratings for the past few weeks were significantly lowered. I looked at updating my diet plan, and when I found what was most like my original plan, now it is rating nearly every day as an "A" when there is no way that the lasagna I ate a few days ago should be an "A" meal on an LCHF plan!? Plus many meals or food options are reading "(null)" next to them when before it would read how carbs. Also, I miss my meals telling me my carb goal rather than a calorie goal for the diet I'm on... My subscription is up soon, so I may cancel of this what I am left with.

title: Love the Integration
body: This apps integrates with my FitBit, which in turn integrates with my Peloton spin bike. So in essence, this app integrates with Peloton. The barcode feature is really awesome. I can scan most items and it'll pull it from its directory. This saves a lot of trouble. The only draw back is when you go eat out and it's hard to record correctly (e.g. Korean BBQ). I have the premium version. Overall, I recommend and hope they continue to improve it. First heard about it from Megsquats.

title: Awesome!!
body: Great app! I was using lose it for a few weeks and I wasn't satisfied with the app. This app is way better in my opinion. I love the fruit, vegetable, and water trackers. It has really motivated me to eat cleaner. I also like that this app allows you to personalize your dietary needs and gives feedback on your daily consumption.

title: Missing Customization
body: I would love to give it five stars, but it needs more meal options. I eat 6 times a day and smaller portions later on in the day. But this only has the option for breakfast, lunch, dinner and a snack. I love have beautifully it's designed and how easy it is to use. Also, I love the smiley face ratings, so cute! I would gladly pay for the year subscription if it would allow me to customize my meals and their calories a little more.

title: Spelling error
body: There's a spelling error when I update my fitness level, it confirms that my calorie intake will be changing and displays the word "okey" instead of "okay."

title: My favorite!
body: This app is by far my favorite fitness tracker. I used to only use my fitness pal but when I found this it changed. It's very user friendly. I enjoy the smiley faces put by your food choices and how you can change your diet plan. I also like that I can add my body measurements.

title: Helpful and easy
body: I have used this app to monitor my weight and also to help lose my baby weight after having twins. It's mostly a helpful reminder for me and keeps me on track.

title: All the basics in one place
body: I had to get a new fitness tracker app as the one that goes w the new apple watch leaves much to be desired eg I'm used to the Jawbone UP24. I looked at a lot of them and this one seemed to have pretty much everything I was looking for in the basic/free app. The only thing that we make it better is if the activity tracker actually synced w the apple watch tracker like it can w Jawbone and Misfit. And add a barcode feature for food labels. I don't think I've seen that yet, but it's only been 2 days. Thx guys and keep up the good app!

title: Promising six months, discouraging update
body: A free app that counted my calories per meal and activity--that's all I wanted.  Lifesum did that, until it's newest update.

title: Great app needs better search system
body: I actually switched from MyFitnessPal because of the rating system. I loooove that it shows you the daily pie charts with the current nutrient intake. It really puts your food choices in your face.

title: Great but a little frustrating.
body: I love the interface, tips, water tracking, and over all functionality. I just wish there were a couple more features.

title: Love the app, but...
body: Ok, so I absolutely live the app, although I do with there was move of a variety when it comes to smiley face ratings, I wish there was a sad face instead of a ton of middle faces.

title: I love this app!
body: I would give it 5 stars, but there are still some things that bug me. I used to use the free version of the Lose It app, and I loved how expansive their food and exercise data base is. Lifesum still doesn't have nearly as many options in that sense, but I love the recipes and the provided plans! Plus the little grading system is surprisingly really encouraging! I think with time, the app will really come together. And it actually isn't very expensive at all compared to other tracking apps!

title: I love this app
body: I am so happy with the premium version of this app. I normally don't pay for apps but the additional features like offering recommendations for not only calories but also the macronutrients for the day makes it so much easier to eat right. Doing the questionnaire led to an eating plan that matched my needs perfectly. The tips are very helpful and the day rating are really helping me learn how to make better eating decisions. I definitely recommend!

title: Amazing!
body: I am using the free version and it is just as good as what people say it is when they are paying for it! You can still scan your food and it rates each of you meals so you can figure out your average day without paying to get that bonus. You don't get recipes with the free one, but that's no bother to me. The app is helpful and if you keep up with logging things in, then it really helps you at healthier. And for me, it reminds me to drink water!

title: Great design, could have better functionality
body: I've been loving this app. I started using the free version just to track my diet to see if there was correlation with my energy levels. I was surprised to find so much more available than just a good journal. I'm on a month of the premium membership and love the extra details provided in the ratings and the recipes I've tried have been fantastic. I've had a couple instances where the app has frozen up with bad timing but overall highly recommend it.

title: The best
body: Much better than My Fitness Pal. Great interface and very usable. The database of food I think is very large. I'm Italian and I find food better than in My Fitness Pal. Same story when I buy food in Germany, the barcode reader always find the right food. Very good to manage your recipes, your favorites and frequent foods. If you cook your own meal with fresh ingredients this app is the best choice. Try the subscription plan just for 1 month to see what this app can do.

title: Good exercise app.... Not great
body: It's great that it tracks your diet but doesn't do much to help you improve what you're doing. You set a goal, tells you how healthy the food you add is, and tracks your calories intake but gets annoying if you eat the same thing everyday and have to search for the same food. It would be helpful if they add a "favorite" list or an easier way to add the food you eat on a daily basis. Overall it's worth it if you have a little time to add your diet and info. Would recommend

title: A great App!!!
body: I have been using Lifesum for about 6 weeks. But is a simple free way to track what you are eating.  It syncs to the health app which will keep your weight and steps.  You can add exercise and activities which allows your to see what calories you have burned through the day.  The scanning tool is great for home as you prepare meals.  I would highly recommend this app for anyone looking for a easy and simple to use for beginning to get healthier!

title: Calorie counting completely off - Health App
body: Ever since last weekend the calorie count has been completely off. It appears that the Health app is syncing days from my Apple Watch and iPhone. There has to be a way to only count my Apple Watch the way MyFitnessPal does. I purchased the premium version of this app in October because I love having food plans. However ever since the update I'm frustrated that Lifesum is over-counting my calories and making it hard for me to leverage the great things about the app and making me do double the work by figuring out which exercise values I should be using. I would like to see a fix soon because I really do love this app when it works well.

title: User friendly.
body: This makes dieting so much easier. Calorie counting, macro counting, clean eating, whatever you're into this makes it easier to do. Also helps you see how big potions should be. I love how it helps me keep track of my meals and what areas need improvement. One downside is that once you add your exercise it recalculates your goal for the day and that throws me off so now i do not add exercise and that helps me stay on track. Otherwise i love this app!

title: Wonderful App!
body: I love this app for tracking my eating and exercise! It's visually appealing and rewarding, which makes me want to use it daily. It's super easy to track food with the barcode scanner! There's plenty of information about how I did on a particular day and everything. I love almost everything about this app. The only downer, for me, is that I haven't been able to add friend or family because of a strange glitch on the invite page. If the Lifesum crew were to fix this it would be the perfect app!

title: Great but fix the bugs!
body: I really enjoy this app. Even with the free version, I've managed to lose almost 15 pounds in about a month. It's really awesome at not only helping you with calories, but evaluating the overall quality of the food you eat. It's also very aesthetically pleasing. The only issue I have is that lately I can't log anything, because as soon as I finally find the food item, it crashes and takes me back to my home screen. Please fix this guys! I don't wanna have to stop using it.

title: The free is totally fine
body: Lot of bad things said about the free access but I've been using this app for a month and have never had any issues! If you notice a discrepancy with nutrition info there is an option to connect your own set of info to the barcode as well! Remember this info is put in by other users and you should double check for accuracy on your own part. Works awesome for personal nutrition tracking!

title: Work Around Needed for IOS 10.3.1
body: Let me start by saying this app is the best visual food diary apps developed. No other app comes close to what they have done. The point of a food diary is to want to use it to become more aware of what your eating. Lifesum has accomplished this for users. At this time the app is ill for anyone with Apple iOS 10.3.1.

title: Buggy & too focused on weight loss
body: Seems like a good app, but after only the second day of using, it's freezing up and crashing. Was already on the fence since so much of the data and motivation is focused on losing weight, no matter how I set it up. I don't want to lose weight, I'm working more towards a holistic process for pain management, taking into count WHAT I eat and how it can relate to pain/inflammation. It also seems to only share some data with the iPhone Health app. May try again with an updated version, but will keep looking for the right app.

title: Best Calorie/Exercise Tracker
body: I've tried many, even online, but this application has been an integral part of my daily life. It has enabled me to "budget" my calorie intake and adjust it for the desired results. So far, I've lost 18 pounds since I've started. To lose one pound a week, calculate your BMR (basal metabolic rate) and input your desired cals per day. Easy-peasy. Weight Watchers? Never tried, never will. Don't need it. This is the most basic tool you'll need for effective weight loss.

title: Useful, best so far, needs bigger food database
body: I like this program. It's pretty user friendly. I believe it's worth the money. However, I don't like that grams is the default measurement system when entering foods. I want it to be ounces. It takes extra time entering foods. So, I would like the program to remember the amounts and units I usually enter for my favorites. That would reduce input time. Please put more national chain information in the database (i.e. fast food chains, restaurant chains).

title: Not a fan
body: Pretty user interface and nice diet plan options but I'm ditching my premium subscription and going back to myfitnesspal. I have a ton of complaints- the Fitbit calorie adjustments are WAY off, they have a much smaller food database than MFP, you can't see all your food for the day on one screen, you can't easily import a recipe and when you try to adjust serving size it sometimes throws the calorie count off (my 1/2 c of yogurt is not 1,300 calories). I do like the diet plans, the meal grades, the look and feel, and the way they make carb and calorie recommendations by meal. But until the bugs are worked out its not useable.

title: Everything needs to be FREE!!
body: It's a great idea for the app, but the free version only limits you to so much stuff. If everything was free on this app, I believe that more people would use this app on their day to day basis. Especially since the app is to supports "healthiness," why not just make everything free so more people can benefit from all the food plans and recipes?

title: Pretty good. Emphasis on pretty.
body: The app is very aesthetically appealing. It is easy to use. I use it to track my caloric intake and macros daily. The setup is great as well. The major downfall is the discrepancy in the food stats. For example, this morning I logged a fiber bar and the app says it was 120 calories when the box says it is 140. This can make a big difference in your results when it happens on a regular basis. Hopefully they will work it out so that the app is accurate because the app is really well done otherwise.

title: Step counter needs attention
body: I have found this app very useful and I am on it daily. One concern is that the calories burned from steps (synced from Health) vary wildly from day to day. One day may be 2000 steps and 888 calories burned while another will be 6000 steps and 31 calories burned. It is inconsistent and inaccurate. This should be addressed. I will echo others concerns with inability to add foods and exercises. You must rely on logged activities with questionable calories burned, or food with fishy nutritional info. If these issues were solved there would be absolutely no complaints. All in all, a good app.

title: Makes you want to be healthy
body: Makes you want to be healthy with friendly reminders that are not nagging. Excellent meal suggestions. Integrates well with the Apple Health app, one of the few apps that seems to be fairly accurate with nutrition information. Versatile diet options with the paid membership. Speaking of the paid membership, it is a little pricy at almost $50 a year, not sure if the paid membership is worth it.

title: Great for tracking macros!
body: This app is fantastic because it allows your to adjust your macro intake to your specific needs, even on the free version. Though, I think it would be awesome if they adjusted the water tracker so that you can input the fluid ounces rather than the set 8oz or 16oz because various water bottles hold different amounts. I also think it would be great if you could update your water intake on the Apple Watch app. The suggested recipes are also delicious, even the low card options!

title: Good App, but could have more customization.
body: I really enjoy this app (especially the recipe section). It's easy to use and visually pleasing. My one suggestion would be to allow more customization with your macronutrient goals, especially per meal. I always get enough fat and carbs throughout the day, but my meal ratings are often imbalanced.

title: Room for improvement
body: This app is great. Really fantastic. Not only does it correctly calculate your BMR and how much you actually need to eat (a concept so easily lost with people-it's more than you think!!) but it is a visually pleasing set up to show you your goals compared to your current  eating and exercise. The only room I see for improvement here is more eating plans. Especially when you're a paying customer. There's a few, but I'd really like to see a "bulking" and a "cutting" plan. Simple!

title: GREAT APP!  Very Easy to Use.
body: I've been using this app for about two weeks, and I'm able to keep on my diet and exercise routine.  The app helps me to keep track of EVERYTHING that goes into my mouth, and the exercise that I'm getting on my treadmill.  I've lost 5 pounds since I started using the app, and I don't have a Shape-up account.  It's very easy to use.  I could go on and on about what I love about this app.  I just find it the perfect solution to changing my lifestyle.

title: A hot mess as of right now
body: I had high hopes for this app, but was disappointed. Watch/phone/web browser sync is shoddy at best and hardly works at all. The app continuously changes my age for whatever reason. My selected diet resets to standard every hour or so. Water/food tracking from Apple Watch doesn't work at all.

title: Well worth it!
body: I had tried lose it and myfitnesspal and I'm in love with Lifesum. I feel it does a better job at helping me prepare for my future meals instead of eating, entering, and realizing I went over. Haven't used it for more than a week so I can't say I've lost weight on it yet, but I love the water reminder, and the free version is already very useful! I can only imagine that with all the paid features you would be set up for success!!

title: Amazing
body: This app is amazing! I have been trying to lose those additional "Christmas" pounds and was looking for an app that would give me that motivation. Not only has this app helped me lose those additional pounds, but it had given me awesome tips and they make it easy to track the food that you eat without counting the calories your self. I love the notifications too! Helps remind me to drink more water, which I don't do enough. Obsessed.

title: Nice design, poor features
body: I originally gave this app three stars but after using it for a while, I have realized it is really worthless‚Äîeven after paying for a premium subscription, I find their competitor MyFitnessPal more useful. Most importantly you can't set your macronutrient goals, so if Lifesum thinks you should have 35% carbs there's nothing you can do about it. Also their product data base is much worse and less accurate than MyFitnessPal's. Lastly, it doesn't always make sense, like when each individual meal is under my protein target for that meal, yet I am over my protein target for the day. It's a shame such a nicely designed interface is going to waste.

title: Pretty good
body: This is a calorie counting tool which came recommended by CGP Grey. Assuming most of your meals come from the grocery store, you can easily scan product bar codes and log what you're eating. You can in some cases look up fast food, too. There's more functionality if you pay money for the upgrade but my free experience has been fine. I do wish they'd better develop the exercise tracker but just pulling walking data from my phone does well to show what I burn daily.

title: Way Overpriced
body: The shortest time you can try the paid version is three months at $9. I will not pay $27 for ANY app, let alone one that has literally thousands of free competitors.

title: Don't recommend
body: Clicked the subscription button and now I'm stuck with this app. This app is beautifully designed, but so unhelpful.

title: ‚ù§Ô∏è Measurement and üçé and üåΩ tracking
body: After enjoying the user interface and the positive reinforcement so much I upgraded to premium to get the measurement tracking. It's really convenient to have everything all in one place and I love the visual for fruit and veggie tracking and the quick summary that keeps me on track throughout the day.  Meal feedback has been very useful in making small tweaks and improvements each day.  üëçüëç

title: Great but...
body: I love using this simplistic and functional app to keep a food and exercise log, but as someone who doesn't currently have the funds to pay for a subscription, I am disappointed that "fixing the day rating UI" just meant moving it behind the pay wall where users like me, who used to enjoy seeing the overall value of our daily eating, no longer can. If this team cares about ALL of the people who use and recommend their app, they should stop constantly limiting functionality for those who don't pay.

title: The best application I've found.
body: Some settings are locked without the service, BUT the service cost is less than a cup of coffee at Starbucks per month. If you are serious about making some wellness changes this is the app for you. It does what it took three separate apps on my phone to do. I have never had an issue with the application running. No crashing. No bugs. Clean interface. Worth every penny.

title: A Well-made App
body: The quality of this app is very nice to see. Easy to navigate and I like the design‚Äîit's pretty to look at. I'll be testing this app to see how well it complements my lifestyle. The free version is very good and the Gold membership features seem well worth the price. I only wish that they will add support for the Garmin line of fitness tracking devices. That would be amazing, considering that I use a Garmin Vivoactive; not any of the devices currently supported. 4 stars; 5 if/when they add Garmin support!

title: So far so good.
body: I like it but I wish it had a wider selection of items in the list. I'm assuming that with time this will broaden out. At least I hope. Also I would love maintenance so that people can't put the same item or foods twice. Makes it very cluttered and hard to know which one is accurate. If Lifesum can get a team to keep the items people add accurate and organized; so that once there's an item added correctly, It can't be resubmitted, that would be great!

title: Simple, easy calorie tracking
body: This is a great app for simple and easy calorie tracking. They've done a good job getting big food brands in their app for more accurate tracking. I don't agree with how they add calories back into your diet after working out but really that's my only criticism. I can't really even complain there because without paying for the service it's more a personal calorie tracker than anything and its great for that. The water reminders are awesome too!

title: Such a great app!
body: I LOVE this app! It takes the work out of calorie counting, tracks exercise, suggests recipes, helps set goals for nutrient distribution, tracks water consumption, and lays everything out on an easy-to-use interface. My frustrations are that it doesn't have every single food accurately graded (which I'm sure will get better in the future) and there are typos in some of the recipes. I would highly recommend this app!

title: Rating System
body: Like many people before me have mentioned, I really wish the letter rating system would be turned off, or at least have an option to be toggled off. With many healthy meals, I still get a C or D rating, simply because my portions aren't large enough to fit the magic number required by Life Sum. When trying to loss weight and find what lifestyle modifications work best, this is extremely discouraging. I'm very disappointed that the company still has not taken this into consideration especially with how many people have complained about this in previous updates.

title: Definitely get this app!
body: This is only my first day using Lifesum, and I've already lost in not even ONE DAY with its help. I've always been heavier then most people, and I didn't feel good in my body. So I went out in search for some fitness apps. I looked online and a YouTuber that I like watching suggested LifeSum. So I tried it out and I love all the great features you get even without paying. The only con is, I wish you could get more features without paying money. Other than that, I love it!

title: Too Exclusive
body: it's a fun app, i like using it a lot more than other apps, especially because it gives you small tips like "drink some more water after lunch .. " etc. I just think it's annoying that there's so many things that you can't use or see without having the premium. That's too exclusive and you should be able to see more, it makes people not want to use something when they can't use half the app without paying monthly.

title: Best calorie counter
body: Tried them all. I used Lose it the most but but layout was not really eye pleasing. Lifesum is amazing! I'm actually happy to track calories.

title: Battery Hog
body: 8.6.1 makes improvements in stability but the app is still not fully usable. Some days it's smooth and easy to record meals, other days it sticks and crashes, bringing my iPhone 7 Plus to a screeching halt. When it works, this app is the best meal+exercise tracker and an essential part of my day. When it doesn't, it's a constant thorn in my side. There's something really good here, but it's gets covered over too much

title: Really cool app
body: This app basically has everything you need in a weight loss app. Includes downloadable nutrition info from other users, calorie goals, water intake, exercise, waist measurement, body fat, and more. What might be useful would be some type of nutrient tracker as well (vitamins, minerals). I am a vegetarian and it's difficult for me to recognize which nutrients i'm lacking. But this is a weight loss tracker after all, so it's not entirely necessary, I guess.

title: Great Calorie Counter App
body: I love this app the most because you submit your target weight and it gives you a set calorie limit and how many wks it could take if u stick with your calorie intake. The only thing I would change is maybe having to pay for full access but the limited works fine for me. I have been using this app for 11wks and have lost 27lbs so far so I highly recommend this app.

title: Quite Helpful!
body: Using this app, I have been able to keep track of my calorie intake every single day. I have lost 35 pounds since January just by using more calories than I'm eating.  This has been a valuable tool to help me keep track of every single thing I eat or drink. I love the charts that show your weight loss and calorie consumption. I find myself looking at it just to give me a boost of self-confidence that I CAN do this!;)

title: Amazing app !
body: Whether it's to lose weight, gain weight or simply keep track of your eating habits, this app is great for it. I've tried many apps and when I came across this one I knew I was never going to have to try another one, it does everything I need it to do. It even gives me advice on whether I should eat more or eat less, & reminds me to log my meals ! Only downfall is the meal barcode scanner! Needs fixing.

title: First app of its kind to click with me
body: This is like a personal nutritionist at your side at all times without the superiority complex and food shaming.

title: Really good but always crashes
body: This app is super helpful in caloric tracking, food and water intake management, helping you pinpoint your goals to help you stay on track, and even suggests meals for you. Lately, the app nonstop has crashed either right when I open it, when I'm trying to update my food diary, or just 30 seconds after I open it. If I go back to the app or close and reopen the app the same thing happens. I can't do anything on it now because it's so buggy, but when it's not, it's a great app.

title: Love it!!
body: I recommend this to all my friends looking to eat more healthily! It's so great at getting you to alter what you eat to be better for your body with the way it grades you. The key to benefiting from the app is logging what you're going to eat before you eat so you have time to rethink your choices if they generate a low grade. Overall I find the app much more health oriented than other similar apps.

title: Horrible app prejudges your weight
body: I got this app to see if it could help guide me to gain weight, but apparently I am so severely under weight that when I input my weight, it told me "Are you sure that's what you meant? Try a different number."

title: Motivation booster
body: This app has been keeping me motivated to eat healthier and to be more active! The food database is off by a tiny bit at times, and I try to help by correcting info or adding new products. The app is beautifully designed and easy to use. One thing that is kind of bothering me is the fact that they push premium features too strong. I would like to get premium but I don't think the price is worth it. Overall great app, recommend it 100%!

title: Awesome app but..
body: I'm in love with this app! I love that you can set your own custom plan and goal calorie intake, etc. My complaint is that I wish upgrading was only a one time payment and not a monthly payment, it's way too much. Because of that, I can't upgrade to premium, and premium adds SOO much more to the app but unfortunately I can't get it I would love to get all the custom recipes and extra tracking features.

title: A Nice app.
body: If you are looking for a good diet plan to loose, gain, or even maintain, this is the app for you.  It works great on iPod touch and iPhone.  You can look at you statistics and even plan meals for the future.  Its not just a diet app.  You can also keep track of your exercise, too.  If what you did is not in the library, simply add it just like you would for foods.  This is a great app for those who would like to get(me) or stay in shape.

title: Nice looking, but edits need to be free
body: I like the look and feel of this app, but what I don't like is the fact that apparently only Gold members can edit the entries. I guess that just means free members just can't make mistakes, then (which is stupid; if I'm trying to track my kcal intake and exercise amount I'd expect to at least be able to change errors as a just in case, not be forced to pay for an account to do so... or maybe this site gives so little features that they have to lock out editing as an incentive to gain more customers; either way they lost this user)

title: Awful for tracking carbs
body: A lot of the carb counts are wrong. This is a very big deal if counting carbs. So with those wrong I question everything and have to look at other sources so I end up not using the app for that. It also has lots of names brand and restaurant food. Which makes looking up just basic raw food you cook or prepare at home a chore. If you already do not eat processed foods and rarely eat out this app becomes tiresome. On a good note they said they would refund my gold account since I contacted them right away and the one good thing I like is drunk water reminders.

title: Waste of time
body: Thought this would be a great way to kick of a healthy eating plan for the new year, then found out that more than half of all useful information was behind a pay wall. Also when you add an item, it also puts half the info you put in behind the paywall too. You can't even view nutrition info that YOU PUT IN. Also when I scan a barcode, app says it's not in the db but after I spend time entering all the info, it says it already exists! So frustrating! Two stars for app and UI design only. Functionality usefulness is next to nothing.

title: Great app that could be more!
