body: Really love the app! It really gives a visual way of tracking calories and your diet rather than having to just put numbers. I was maybe thinking of adding a budgeting part of the app because we all know how costly it can be to eat healthy. So adding maybe a price range or just by putting how much each meal cost could be a benefit to healthy living and saving money.

title: Love it
body: Life sum really helps me stay on track.  It has you take a quiz and configures a diet plan that works for you. I like how it encourages me with little reminders throughout the day to drink more water and if you haven't been very active.  I so far have lost about 20 # in about a month

title: Do not pay for this app.
body: Not worth the money at all. The # of recipes is laughable and you're better off just using Yummly. The meal and day rating system is generic (not tailored to the plan you're on as is implied during the sales pitch, very vague and not helpful). The scan barcode feature to register food items almost never has the food items in the system and in the rare event it does the nutritional facts are always wrong. I have to spend a ridiculous amount of time manually inputting the nutritional facts for each ingredient I use. Basically, you are paying to build up the database for them. Very unhappy customer.

title: Love it
body: Great app. Very useful and I love the barcode scanner and daily calorie counter that keep you on the right track for your goals. Only downside is that if you want to keep it free, you have to deal with TONS of ads telling you to get the paid app not only in the app but through emails as well. It would be much smoother without the ads but I'm not paying monthly just for those to go away.

title: So Helpful!!
body: I have been using this app for a couple of weeks now and it has been very helpful to my weight loss journey! I have it automatically paired with my Apple Watch and it tracks my movements throughout the day. I also love how you get a rating on each of your meals and the day by what foods you've ate or if you've hit your calorie goal! Overall a very useful app ans would highly recommend

title: A little misleading but good overall
body: I'm a health nut who fell off the wagon and desperately looking to get back on so I will admit I'm a little more critical than the average user. Overall, it's great. However, I wish there were more opportunities for customization without having to pay so much. Also, confused as to how eating an apple for a snack is off track, especially when it also gave me the goal of eating 3 servings of fruit a day, tracked by icons shaped like apples?

title: Great iPhone app!!
body: Bought this app today after viewing iShape's excellent video...  i particularly like the ability to enter favorites and customized food entries... by itself the food items list is the perfect tool for those who shun pre-packaged and prepared foods in favor of maintaining a whole-foods diet... much better than the other app i tried with a built-in food nutrition database which was based mostly on packaged foods.

title: good but...
body: Good but not exactly what I was hoping for.  It would be nice to have more freedom to just enter caloric intake on some items rather than to have to estimate oz's etc. till I get close to the actual calorie amount.  I keep close tabs on what I am eating - and watch labels.  I would be able to enter more precisely what i've eaten if the app allowed.

title: Works great!
body: I've used it for about a month now and it works great. It all depends on how much you're willing to put into it. It can be a bit tiring putting in how many calories you eat every meal but it's eye opening when you realize just how many calories certain foods have.

title: No longer free
body: I have had this for a few years BUT when I got a new phone & had to download it again significant parts REQIRE you to join their "shape up clu". I wrote to them but have received no reply.

title: Just downloaded it
body: Well I downloaded this thinking it looks like a pretty cool app but I can't really do anything with out paying. And its reoccurring payments but there isn't anyway to turn off automatic payments on the app.  I would rather have a free trial before fully committing to something I've never used. I would however like if the app had a lifetime buy. Where you pay for it once and that's it. I don't want to pay for months or years. I would like it if they made a free trail for this before I invest money into it. I can't even look at the recipes. üôÅ

title: Lost 19 lbs in 5 wks--and counting, literally
body: Lifesum works better than any other food tracking app I've tried. Love how it supports different diets with guidelines, suggestions, macronutrient targets and good recipes (although some recipes need to be rewritten for clarity and/or missing steps or ingredient amounts). I've tried eating Ketogenic before, but this is the first time I've had success with it, because of Lifesum's encouragement and knowledgeable guidance.

title: Accessibility Lacking for VoiceOver Users
body: I love the promise Lifesum for iOS holds out; but since its developers consider requests by users who are blind to make the app accessible as feature requests to be voted upon according to overall popularity and awareness of the issue, I can't actually use the app The developers' attitude toward accessibility, seeing it as an additional feature that might be nice rather than an essential element of good design, means that the company loses customers because of its effectively discriminatory attitude, and that people like me, who rely on VoiceOver and accessibly designed apps, can't benefit from the promise of Lifesum's otherwise enlightened approach to wellness.

title: FRIENDLY USE app
body: Great app to keep on track your food and water intake as well as mark the amount of workout exercised per day. You can scan the barcode of almost every food available to get accurate info on calories, fat etc..The app allows you to customize your PERSONAL GOALS. Easy to use. I wish some of the recipes could be for free as a sample to see whether to upgrade or not :)

title: Broken
body: I tried Lifesum for a few days instead of my usual trackers. I liked the interface and layout. I also liked how it broke out vegetables and fruit instead of just calories like other apps. It made you focus on a balanced diet. Now to the negatives. The "health algorithm" for meals is broken. I get a poor rating for a healthy salad with tuna but Hostess cupcakes and combos get the highest rating for a snack? Today the app started crashing after exactly 8.2 seconds from opening. You could use the regularity to set a watch. I chose to delete and return to my normal, less colorful, app.

title: Easy to Use fun app
body: My boyfriend and I love this app. We are both very competitive and thought downloading a fitness app would be a good idea -  that it would push us both to eat healthier - and we were right. My only issue is the free version has barely any features. It track our food, gives basic recipients and remembers my weight and that's about it. I wish there was a test trial to see if we would like to buy the premium version. 25$ is a steep chance to pay for a college student ya feel?

title: It is actually a good app to have
body: Even though that it is an application that I can't used supposedly because of my height and weight, thid app doesn't give me the accurate BMI.  However, it is a very good design.  I had the chance to play with it and I like the graphics and it has many exercises available.  I hope in a future update there is a fix for the BMI Calculation.  Overall, excellent application to keep track of your calories and exercises.

title: Like this so far
body: I have only been using this app for a couple days.  It is easy to add additional food items.  It does seem to have a little math difficulty (I entered two beverages at 4 calories each, and it is showing the total so far as 7?)  It would be nice if they would add a place to enter cholesterol, if you are watching that in your diet as well.  For under a dollar, it's a good little ap to keep careful track of your calories - something I have never been able to do with any consistency!

title: Works
body: Of course it works. The most comprehensive weight loss studies show that measuring calories out vs. calories in is the best way to lose weight. I've lost 5 pounds the first week and a half by keeping careful count. I would like to suggest getting verifications on nutritional information input by users. There are some numbers that are wildly off and I edit them when I can, but it makes a tedious process (counting calories) even more time-consuming.

title: Simply crashes
body: As others have said, this app just crashes upon opening. Specifically, when I attempt to enter my dob. I can enter all the other information just fine, and even let it sit open for a little while, but as soon as I attempt to enter my birthday, bam! It's crashed. The app looks good, though, so I'm going to keep it on in the hopes that a fix is on the way!

title: I love it!
body: I have done MyFitneesPal and it was pretty good but I love this one because it's a simple clean design and very user friendly. You can do the free version or choose to do one of the paid options. I am doing the $3.33 a month program and I get great recipes and tips that really take the app to the next level. And you can also taper your suggestions for different types of dies and lifestyles. It's a great app!

title: Great app
body: This app is pretty cool!!! I recently lost a lot of weight and I needed something to keep the weight off, the water reminder is cool. The only issue is the connection to my Apple Watch. It seems like there is a bug somewhere that's preventing me from updating and it keeps reminding me even when I click dismiss. However, I am continuing to use this app every day. Also the food recommendations are awesome and I've tried a few of them and they taste amazing!

title: Great app for the most part
body: He app is awesome and the interface I find to be much cleaner and more attractive than myfitnesspal. Premium appears to offer a bunch of neat diet plans and the app will help you see how well your meals are in line with your chosen diet. However, I don't like that you can't even track basic nutrition information like the sodium of a meal without premium. Myfitnesspal beats them on that. All in all though I like the app and will continue to use it.

title: New Update Won't Sync and Crashes
body: Since installing the new update the app refuses to sync with my Fitbit and while this has been solved by logging out and back in, the last time I did that it completely corrupted a day to where it wouldn't boot up until the next day and every time I try to access the bad day the app crashes. Very disappointed by the new update!

title: Great tool
body: I really enjoy this, especially that you can scan an item. I feel like their calorie expenditure is off on the workout side- the treadmill/elliptical says one number and this app says another. It makes you miss out on food! I have been telling everyone this app has changed my life, and I mean it. I LOVE THIS APP!!!

title: Highly recommended to get fit LOVE THIS APP
body: This app is so much more than just counting calories which wasn't my aim to begin with, it also keeps in mind carbs protein and fat while creating a personalized plan for you. The quiz at the beginning was so accurate and I've been eating so much better even after a couple days. Never thought I would be able to do it.

title: Shape Up
body: The old version of shape up was great and probably my most used app as a bodybuilder. The update removed custom water intake, pie charts, and entering anything takes an extra step.

title: Love this App
body: Lifesum has been super easy to navigate and enter all information. It has a lot of information about recipes and foods for you to stay informed. I also really love that it keeps track of your water intake and reminds you to drink more! It's really cool that Lifesum also gives you charts for your daily intake of protein, carbs, etc.. This has been the easiest app for me to keep up with so far.

title: Almost The Best
body: I absolutely adore this app and I just started using it a little while ago. I find it to be both visually appealing and easy to use. The only thing I ever wished an app like this had was the ability to put blog posts or information into the app and look at it for inspiration or advice and exercises. Like how you can use the app pocket to save or bookmarks things you like.

title: weak app, better ones available
body: The app is extremely simple, making it almost unnecessary for any diet, but it could help for simple weight loss. Any function besides just tracking calories and making a bad preset goal is locked behind the gold version. Ive used Myplate for a long time now and that works much better, it allows me to customize my goal calories and my own macros, while having a simple to use and decently sized archive of foods. This app has potential, but it is far too basic for most people who care about their nutrition.

title: Wonderful app
body: This is one wonderful app! Very neat and nicely arranged features, and 60+% off if you purchase for one year! It is considerate for your health and help you build health. Really reminds me of a lot of foods that would help me!!! Keep getting better and better by widen the range of it so I can easily obtain food recommended in MY region, Chinese and Indian and Mexican people can find it hard to obtain food recommended!

title: Uninstalled
body: My favorite is when the calories burned goes backwards. Now I'm suddenly allowed 700 extra calories in my diet? Nutritional information relies on individual input, which is often (read almost always) inaccurate. Not sure why sausage and egg on an English muffin has an "A" rating and a steak and lettuce wrap gets a "D." Also math is wrong - my breakfast, lunch, dinner and snack can each be 200 calories under individually and my overall calories will only be 200 under. This app is getting worse. Not reading calories burned from my tracking app. Walked the city yesterday and it says 3 calories burned. Customer support are boneheaded.

title: Beautiful + Functional App
body: Discovered this app after hearing about it from a few of my favorite YouTubers. Lifesum is a beautifully designed app. The interface is highly functional with loads of customizable features. Perfect app for those looking for support in living a healthy lifestyle. I love that you can adjust the nutrition tracking tools, track water intake and workouts all in one place!

title: Great App
body: This is a great app, it's sad to see it compared to myfitnesspal (which didn't even let me register smh) since Lifesum deserves more credit. It's really helpful when tracking calories, and I just started the free trial which has helped me balance the nutrition distribution in my meals and be smarter about eating choices. Please download this it's much better than any other nutrition or "diet" apps I've used.

title: It's hard to tell...
body: I think I would like this app, if I could do more with the free version.  Everything I want to look into makes me buy premium.  I don't want to invest if I don't like it.  Right now, I'm ready to uninstall after trying it for less than a day because MyFitnessPal gives me more options in the free version.  I think this app would be better than MyFitnessPal in the premium, but I can't tell.  A trial run would be nice, but until I know, I'm going to stick with MyFitnessPal.

title: Very user friendly
body: This is the only calorie tracking app that I have stuck with. The beautiful interface makes it seem like less of a chore to log all of your food and exercise. I use the premium and I love how personalized it is on all fronts. I can edit my macros and it offers recipes that fit my dietary restrictions. I think it could improve in an area or two so I gave it 4 stars but overall I love this app. It's really changed the game!!

title: Great for Gainers too!
body: I love this app! I am coming back from some health issues and have been using ShapeUp Club to help eat more balanced, healthy meals and GAIN weight. I especially love the water tracker - that was why I bought it in the first place. The charting is great, love the before and after photo, I use it all day long! Excellent job developers! Thank you, your app is really, really making a difference in my life..

title: Disappointed...
body: I paid $40 for a one year subscription but this app needs some work.  Please convert recipe and food measurements to the country in which the user lives.  I hope there are plans to add some sort of a recipe builder so that the carbs, fat and protein can be calculated for healthy recipes outside the app.  Also, I've had daily issues with Lifesum syncing with my Fitbit.  Sometimes it records my steps and sometimes it doesn't.  Very frustrating... With some improvements, I would give it 5 stars.

title: Awesome app!
body: Lifesum has really helped me put in perspective what is going into my body and how much I was really consuming. It also motivates you to work out and burn more calories especially if you have eaten over what you should have that day. To see your overconsumption go down just by working out it makes you feel accomplished. It's a great app and I would recommend it to even those who aren't watching their weight.

title: Love it! Easy & teaches healthy eating
body: Super easy to log food. Visually delightful. Lifesum makes it really easy to learn about the nutrient balance of my meals. It tailors your calorie and nutrient guidelines based on your current weight, height, goals, etc. I have it pulling activity data from my apple watch so it adds caloric needs based on that day's activity level.

title: Intuitive, Cute, Works
body: Full disclosure: I paid. But I'm really glad I did. I love the interface of this app, it's so cute and helpful and the little tips somehow feel more personalized ("you're going to crave carbs if you're stressed this weekend, try taking it easy") than my fitness pal or spark people. The meal plans are great and overall just really enjoy the app. Only thing is I wish they had more recipes up and indoor workouts you can do at home.

title: Vegetarian....hello?
body: I do not understand why this app does not understand that I am a vegetarian after indicating that I do not eat fish meat eggs or other sources begotten of cruelty.  Why does it still insist, to recommend recipes with fish and meat? One can eat a healthy diet without killing sentient beings. I would love to take advantage of the other diets, but I am forced to use the classic die because the other ones insist that I eat meat.  After this free trial, there will be no premium subscription for me, until the developers figure this out.

title: App has helped me change my eating habits
body: This app gives clear view of how many calories I'm consuming and the amount of each macronutrient I'm consuming. Also helps track water, exercise, vegetables, fruits, and fish. I also appreciate the different diet plans you can choose from when a premium member. Last but not least is the weight loss. I've lost over 30 pounds since I started with this app in March 2017.

title: Great App But....
body: I do think this app takes the cake in interface department. Easy to use, the layout is great. I wish some of the things in the premium version were a part of the free version. Some things won't sync unless you pay for the premium, you don't get some of the details of your full days tracking without premium. Signed up for the 30 day free trial of premium and makes a world of difference I think.

title: Helpful App
body: Started using this app a while ago to help when I started back working out and trying to cut down before vacation. Paired it with fitbod workout app to track both food and workouts since I don't have a Fitbit or Apple Watch and it works great. Wish there was a little more variety/customizations in some of the diet plans, but overall a very solid app

title: Plagued by bugs since day one
body: Notice every release emphasizes how they've fixed all the bugs. This app will never improve because they keep focusing on useless things like recipes. I just want it to track my meals and i dont want to pay to track unsaturated fats! Recipe inputs are complicated, but once you get used to it very versatile.

title: Easy to use
body: Great program. Easy to use and track meals. There is a place for personal recipes to be stored and edited if needed. The free version really is nice. I chose to update because it included so much more. Ive lost weight because of this program. Its hard to eat on the run when ive committed to track my meals and the ease of the program on my phone meant success for me. This app works.

title: Helping out a lot with meal planning
body: This app has been awesome so far! I've only had it three days now but it really has helped to keep me more on track with what I consume and when I consume it. I especially love the water feature that tracks how many cups of water you drink. I could definitely see this helping me with fitness goals well into the future! üôåüèΩüçå‚ú®

title: Super confusing user experience
body: I have a 3 month membership.

title: Like the format but terrible ratings
body: I tried to contact the app directly but there wasn't an option. The format of this app is great and I like that aspect a lot. However, the rating system is very, very poor. How can coconut oil be rated an "E" or an organic fully green juice a "D"? It seems this app takes data from the early 90's to rate the food rather than current nutritional information. There should be an option to turn off the rating system as it has me questioning my meal choices when, in reality, they're some of the healthiest options.

title: Amazing, Love it
body: It's wonderful, I think everyone should have this, if nothing else, just to see the impact of the food we eat. I love that it can accommodate my celiac disease/lactose intolerance. (Can't have bread or milk) and how accurate the products are. I like how easily you can add products that aren't there. I kind of wish I had the paid stuff for free, but that's kind of the point. 10/10. üòä

title: Not for broke people
body: This app seemed very nice and very simple to use. It looked like a great tool to start helping me try and become healthier all around. I created an account knowing that there were parts that required payment to use, but I assumed that still meant I could use most of the features. I was wrong. With not spending any money, I couldn't do very much or track very much. I didn't even keep the app for very long because almost everything I clicked on was something I had to pay for. I'm a college student that can't afford to spend any extra money. Overall a disappointment.

title: Great app for counting
body: Recently I've been trying to start living a more conscious lifestyle. When I came across this app I was pleased to find it had everything I was looking for when it came to looking at the food I eat. The subscription to me is a little pricey but I find myself satisfied at the moment, will definitely update this in the coming months.

title: Data keeps changing and doesn't connect to Strava
body: I wish I had purchased the premium version of one of the other meal tracker apps instead. After using this app for a few months I continue to experience the same issues over and over: my date of birth keeps changing, my weight keeps changing and my goal calorie intake keeps changing to ridiculous values. I also noticed that a lot of the nutritional values for commercial foods are incorrect. I'm also disappointed that it doesn't connect to Strava.

title: Like app but...
body: I purchased the premium version of Lifesum on 7/29. I downloaded it on my iPad but cannot get the premium version on my iPhone without it needing to upgrade to premium. Anyone else have that problem? I've deleted it on both devices and reinstalled. I do not have more than one apple I.d. or account so that's not the issue. I've wasted literally hours trying to figure this out. Appreciate some help installing the premium Lifesum without paying another premium upgrade.

title: Minor tweaks but great app overall
body: I don't think I use any app as much as this one. I depend on it immensely to count my macros, track my water intake, and (sort of) track calories burned. I do have to say that the calories burned might need some work because I don't think it's super accurate. I wish the app had more foods available to choose from but otherwise, I love it.

title: Always room to improve
body: Great app, loved it so much I purchased a year of premium use. However, food look up could be a little better.. They don't always seem quite reliable or correct. I like that you can choose between a couple different diets (for premium users). Nice look and easy to use to stay on track with your diet!

title: You need this
body: Great app. The upgrade is well worth the extra though. I thought "no way do I need to spend $8 per month on this"... As I drank a $9 whiskey at a bar. Perspective kicked in. A surprisingly large number of restaurants and food retailers have already inserted their specific data for you so your food diary is extremely specific.

title: Makes me want to get an A
body: I've tried other apps that just count calories but that doesn't do anything for me. I love that it grades you for each meal/the day. If I get a low grade on my breakfast it motivates me to pull myself together the rest of the day so I can get an A or B!! Preferably an A! I've tried other apps that just track calories but that doesn't do anything for me.

title: Everything is fine so far.
body: I was reading some of the reviews and first they said it was bad, but for right now, the app is working fine. I liked that you could set the number of pounds you wish to lose/gain, as other apps don't and they pick by their best option. This really made me think about how I eat and how important it is to get an A! ;)

title: I usually don't bother to write reviews
body: ...but this app is sooo handy especially for a young college student who does not know much about portion control and nutrition value!! I'm trying to lose the weight I gained from freshman year and I'm surprised I found an app I like more than Fitnesspal and Lose It! I'm even considering paying to upgrade to Gold/Premium version of this. Looove this app!

title: It's a helpful app!
body: I really love Lifesum (although I've failed to log in days)

title: LOVE
body: This app has great design and a friendly user face. I've tried to track my food before and have always given up but this makes it easy and not feel like a chore. The food library is huge and has everything I eat. It's super comprehensive to know what I'm putting in my body. I only have the free account but am thinking of upgrading.

title: Easier to add recipes
body: I am really enjoying this app. The way it looks and function are both mostly great, however, it would great to be able to add your own recipes and foods from the home screen. It doesn't make sense to have to go through "add to my diary" to get to favorites when I'm actually just adding recipe and not to my diary. And it may not be a favorite either. To simply add a recipe would be more ideal.

title: Needs to be fine-tuned
body: It has made a huge difference in my eating habits, but the calorie tracking is questionable. It doesn't let me add my own nutritional information or at least let me import the info from a recipe I used online (one that wasn't provided by the app). That would make things helpful. All in all, the interface is great and I enjoy tracking the water, veggies, exercises, and meals that I eat daily.

title: I love the app....
body: I love this App! I wanted to give it 5 stars BUT there are a few reasons why I couldn't bring myself to do it. The first is that it's was spendy. $45 A YEAR to get the plan I wanted and one of the main reason I buy the bullet and bought it was for the recipes and there honestly weren't enough to justify the price. üòï

title: Great App.
body: This app is great. Really well designed and looks great. The database is full of preloaded foods helps getting started. It is very user friendly and some features that help you analyze the data you have input into the app. This company is really responsive to emails, support, and seems like they want input. I would recommend to others and buy again.

title: Other Diets: Nutirsystem, Jenny Craig, etc.
body: This is a very helpful application. I have tried all the applications that iPhone offers regarding nutrition and diet plans. All have their pros and cons.

title: iShape
body: Good start on a potentially great program for a food/exercise diary, but some tweaking and bugs need to be addressed. Entering data for food items can be frustrating and confusing. For example, entered data disappears when moving to another field. The diary page is way too busy! It needs to be simplified. The database is quite inadequate and lists many food items I've never heard of.  But, I bought it and hope that improvements are made in the near future.

title: Not worth it
body: I have long used Loseit. But I decided to give this one a try because of the Apple Watch compatibility. These app does not play well with others though. It links with up, but wasn't actually pulling data. It barely communicates with Apple Health. It could write weight and water, but could not read anything and could not write food. The one thing it's for.

title: Best way to get healthy & ripped
body: I took the quiz for what diet I should be intaking and have been using it on a daily basis to keep making progress. Ketogenic paleo has changed my life and my body for the better! Thanks lifesum!

title: Needs improvement
body: Signed up for gold and was bummed to see all the recipes using the metric system as well as British lingo (aubergine for eggplant). Existing recipes use ingredients that are not all readily available at my nearby grocer. Recipes are also limited and food database limited vs other apps. Would be nice to have an option to see what would be a healthier option before we ingest the food. I.e. Scan a cookie and then an alternative pops up or a recipe. UX is def warmer and design is beautiful.

title: One dangerous detail
body: This is a clever app with great graphics but I am alarmed at how it seems to encourage undereating. I have it set to the "maintain weight" setting, but the best daily ratings I get are on days when I go to bed hungry. The best day rating I've gotten so far, I was 500 calories under the recommended value. Please fix this -- as a person who has struggled with being underweight in the past, this feature makes me very nervous.

title: Love
body: I absolutely love this app, I bought it after a month of trial. I love that it helps me really keep track of all the exact grams of things I'm eating. With out it living a keto lifestyle would be impossible. I love the new step counting feature. I would love if the tips and words of encouragement would vary more, it would be nice if there was an accompanying blog or community for all the lifesum people to communicate with each other on.

title: Love this app
body: I've tried other apps for food tracking and didn't stick with any very long. I love the "reward" of getting the smiley face when I make healthy choices and it encourages me to stick with it. For some reason today the app keeps crashing. Which is frustrating bc I use it multiple times every day. Will definitely upgrade to 5 stars once the glitch is fixed. üòä

title: Great for Anyone!
body: I'm an upcoming college freshman. I'm very fit but want to keep it that way and this app is really helping me. I take medication that messes with my appetite so this app really helps let me know when I need to eat, what I need to eat, etc. You don't need to be a bodybuilder or nutritionist to find this app useful. It's a great way for you to become more familiar with how you're fueling your body! I highly recommend it to anyone.

title: Please update with these capabilities !!!!
body: I would say this app is between a 3 and 4 star > I wish is had a better search. I use it for weight watchers and I wish it had a point calculator built in  !!!! and I wish you could manually add  food and points > like for breakfast I have kellogs corn flakes with strawberries and I know its 2 points instead of having to go to all the trouble of searching and getting a very generic answer . If it had these 2 capabilities it would be a 5 star !!!!

title: Had to request my money back
body: I purchased the full version so that I could sync with the Moves app. BAD DECISION. This app is insufferably glitchy. The biggest of which is that you can enter a food and have no idea what date the app will log it in. Could be today, yesterday, or 3 weeks from now. Seriously. They even acknowledge this massive glitch in their FAQ section. The second biggest nuisance is that the website does not interact with the app. Log a food online and expect it to sync with the app? Haha, good luck!

title: Great app, some serious bugs
body: I signed up for the 1 year subscription, and it works fine, when I close the app, next time I open the app it says I'm a standard member and it offers me to sign up for gold again, then I hit yes, it says I'm already a member and shows me as gold, until the next time I open the app again, same thing. This is amateur and not very user friendly. This needs to be fixed, makes this app look like it's not ready for prime time yet.

title: Finally the perfect app!
body: I have tried a lot of apps on the market to count calories, exercise and life. This is by far the best and it makes me happy just to interact with it! Great UX/UI and it has almost everything I need. The only thing that would make it better is a Vegan diet option. I have already tried some of the vegan recipe options and they are awesome I would love to get a whole diet for us vegans! Thanks for the awesome app!

title: Love this app!
body: This is, by far, my favorite health app!! I rave about it to my friends. It has changed the way I diet and I am seeing lots of results. I can't wait for what changes will be

title: I live this app so much
body: This is going to sound sponsored but it is not. This app is really giving me motivation and helping me eat right. For years I have had a toxic relationship with food, and Lifesum helps me plan and see what I eat. It is so easy to use. You can just enter the brand or scan the barcode and all of the health related info is there. A must for me

title: Save your money and go with MyFitnessPal
body: After a short test run, I decided to purchase a subscription (splurging $50) so that I could enter my own recipes (otherwise, you can only enter a maximum of 2). Lifesum doesn't have a website so all ingredients have to be entered on your phone-- it's a hassle, but I could deal with that. What I can't deal with, however, is the total lack of structure. Anyone can enter anything, and then you'll have to weed through it all when you search for foods. If you try to enter a zucchini, for example, you'll get 50 different entries.

title: Seriously, this is an incredible app.
body: This app was worth every penny. I payed the full amount for it and I don't regret it at all. It has everything you could need: a meal plan, a layout of the nutrition facts, a scanner to scan your food products, and reminders. For anyone who has no clue how to eat healthy, this app is for you. It's basically "eating healthy for dummies". Love it!

title: Love this app!
body: This is the only app that has ever worked for me. I have never been someone that can use an app to help with my weight-loss goals but since I started using this app I've lost 47lbs! It is super easy to use and I love that I can track my exercise even when I do at home workouts like Jillian Michaels. I've recommended this to many other.

title: Good but needs some work
body: Good app, however, doesn't have a food database to search from, so you have to manually enter or scan a barcode.  Also crashes a lot.  There is also only a 3 main meal and 1 snack option, so those of us that he 5-6 meals a day have to log it under the same category.  Won't rotate to landscape when using on ipad either.  Wish they would allow for free trial period, i would have probably got my money back.

title: Excellent Program
body: Have been using this program for only two weeks & have lost 10 pounds.  This is a great tool to help one become aware of what they are eating.  A graphic way to teach better eating & exercising habits.  There is a short learning curve but well worth the investment of time.  The tutorials are excellent as well as the prompt response to questions.  This is a great motivator!!!    THANKS

title: Clean, Smart, Easy
body: As a teen looking to create a habit of healthy living, LifeSum gives me all the tools I need to track calories, exercise, weight, etc. to help me visualize my own lifestyle goals. The attractive and clean interface is intuitive and innovative for people of all ages. Updates are regular and thoughtful. I have never had a problem with this app. Thank you!

title: Love this app!
body: I have been upset about noon weight loss coach not being in the App Store. I've refused to keep trying apps because none of them were as great as it was! I decided to try one finally after seeing it on Facebook and I love it! It has everything I need to track foods and exercise! I love having all the healthy living articles too!

title: Gonna be healthier!
body: Love this app! It's making me more conscientious about my food intake and can't wait to gain my body back!!! Only thing that is lacking is the way the food listed isn't always what I'm eating. If there was a way to put the food I'm actually eating in a search bar that can research the internet so I can be more accurate, that would help more. Maybe offer it in the premium package?

title: Almost perfect
body: The only thing preventing me from giving this a 5 star is how annoying the app can get if you're not subscribed to premium.

title: Glitchy but great for macros
body: Love this app it makes it so easy to track my macros! It usually runs super well although lately it's been glitching on my IPhone 5s (maybe it is unable to keep up with older systems). I love the ability to scan foods in and also add water and exercise! All in all really love this app (and right now I only have the free version)

title: Don't even need pro
body: This app is so amazing! It counts calories lets me know how many carbs, how much fat, I should eat though out the day! You can Search up almost any food and it will tell you how many carbs it is and which category (fats, proteins, carbs, etc.) the food goes under. I love it and it's can be like a game! I love it and it keeps my diet in check.

title: Mostly good. When it works.
body: I really like this app, but very recently it has either arbitrarily stopped including data from my Apple Watch or iPhone, or went crazy with too much of the same thing (I.E. doubling my steps, etc.) This throws everything off. If it gets fixed, I'll change my rating. I would go with another app, but this has the best interface out there.

title: App is dope!
body: Awesomeness! I love this app. I get reminders to drink water. Update my weight. A bar that lets me know when I'm staying on track or doing well based off what I currently ate. I can't complain. I like it. I will upgrade at some point. And I don't feel pressured to upgrade either. That's the best part. I can stay with the free portion and still monitor my weight if I like.

title: Awesome but....
body: Two really great things that my fitness pal has is the ability to copy and paste a website recipe into the app and add it to your daily logs. Also, it would be fantastic if I could create my own recipes from scratch on this app and have the nutritional info calculated for you. Please consider doing these two things bc right now I'm still using mfp to do these for me!! Otherwise it's a great app.

title: Disappointed with the changes
body: When Lifesum was ShapeUp Club, all my gadgets were synced. When I entered it into the iPad, it synced with the iPhone and my computer site. Now, it does not. I do not want to enter everything more than once, nor do I want to wait until I have access to the iPad or computer. My iPhone is the quickest way to keep track, but I like to review and keep notes on the iPad or computer.  If everything would sync again, it would be the perfect app it was before. As of right now, I will not be renewing my Gold Membership. It's no longer worth it.

title: ALMOST five stars
body: the calorie count in this app is perfect!! very realistic and effective. I was able to break through my plateau with the limit it had set up for me. my favorite thing about this app is you are allowed to lose more than 2lbs a week. that is heaven for me. the only bad thing about this app is the food inventory, and exersice inventory, that needs to expand and be updated. please. it's this apps only downfall!

title: Would be a good app but fails
body: This seemed to be a good app the first couple days I used it but then I accidentally added an exercise and could not remove it. When I tried it kept adding the same exercise again and again. Now my entire diary is all jacked up. Read directions for app and online and could find no guidance for this other than swiping left to delete which I tried and didn't work. Reset app and phone to no avail. Going to delete this and find something that works.

title: Needs work
body: I love this app, especially for the water tracker but trying to put in food is sooooooooo frustrating. Most of the info for the food that I scan is wrong and it doesn't give you the option to fix it so I can't even put it in. & what's the point of using it if I can't track my food as accurate as possible. I hope this is fixed soon because I'd really like to keep using the app & was considering upgrading.

title: I like it!!!
body: I've used a few different apps to track my eating and this is the best one I've found. It's easy to work around. I enjoy the reminders and the diet categories. I've been using it for 2 weeks and I've been consistent with tracking every meal. I would recommend it!!

title: Excited so far
body: I have been using the app for a few days now, and I am really enjoying it. I tracked before with weight watchers and myfitnesspal, but lately I'd given up on tracking because I just found it too demanding of my limited time. This app is fun to use, and the integration with my apple watch is great. I hesitate to add another monthly expense, but I am seriously considering upgrading to a paid membership.

title: Automatic setting not working after the update
body: Hate to break the bad news, but since the update yesterday my automatic tracking is not working. I tried reset everything and no luck so far. I have a premium account and use an iPhone 7 with the latest iOS 10 update available.

title: Good
body: The design is very cute and vibrant. Without a premium membership you can't do much, but is a very good food/water/exercise tracking diary. Based on lifestyle quiz, you are given meal suggestions (not recipes unless you're premium), and you can look up how to make it if you don't feel like spending $45 on a membership. Good app overall.

title: Need A Larger Food Library
body: I love the layout of the app. It is very user friendly. I love the look of the app as well, it is fun to look through, and the recipes are very easy. When I am not making my own food and out eating I have a hard time trying to find different foods or brands. That is the only reason for the 4 stars, otherwise a great app. Disclosure: I paid for the full features

title: Pleasant to look at and just as pleasantly easy to use.
body: Helped me achieve my summer bod goals.

title: Okay, but could be better
body: I've been using for about a month. Generally, the food options are okay, though somewhat limited. There is an ability to edit foods, but it's bulky. The portion sizes are very clumsy--in ounces, in many cases, for example, rather than teaspoons. I came from a Treo background, where I had used CalorieKing--which is MUCH better, but sadly not available for iPhone. I've tried a couple of other apps; this seems to be the best of the bunch.

title: Unable to update to Gold Membership
body: This is a great app! However, I would really like to be able to go to the screen where I can upgrade to the Gold Membership. The screen never goes past the white screen with the "loading" animation sign. Would love to avail of the additional features...but I would need to get to the right screen for that to happen. Please help!

title: Love it so far!
body: I love the easy-to-use interface! And even with the database not quite as large as other apps, it's so simple to add packaged items with the barcode scanner. The one thing I would love to see (unless I missed something) is a reminder notification setting for water . I've been trying to increase my water intake so I don't get dehydrated & having a little nudge would be good. üòä

title: Rating system is nonsense
body: I was mainly interested in this app due to the rating system. However, after a few days with it, I‚Äôm not convinced that the ratings are worth anything. My fried egg in the morning earned me an A, but the fresh blueberries were rated a D because of added sugar. I‚Äôm not sure the developer understands what added sugar means. This app also seems to have some issues with internationalization. My 42 mile bike ride on an American English system was listed with a comma as the decimal separator. I‚Äôll be cancelling my gold membership.

title: This app works!
body: Seriously, it isn't just a shallow Fitbit style app that counts calories.  This app, and service is a deep dive into thinking about food in a healthy way every time.  Yes, I am losing weight, but I also feel great!  I am more active and feel like I am winning.  Lifesum is a tool and if you use it, you can build healthy habits and change yourself.

user_name: I only rated this to get coins
title: This app has helped me so much!
body: First of all the layout of the app is absolutely beautiful and for some reason this is the only app I have found that has actually helped with weight loss. Some how it just gets me motivated. They have different diet plans to suit your needs such as "Low Carb" and "High Protein" but right now I'm still on the standard diet.

title: Great start, good potential...
body: Great app. It has helped me get a handle of where to concentrate, visualizes what's important and stays out of my way.

title: New update messes up exercise calories
body: The app update inaccurately tracks your activity data.  It drastically increases your steps.  They are pushing an update soon but in the mean time follow these steps that worked for me.  1. Turn off automatic tracking 2. Delete the app.  3. Re-install app 4 turn on automatic tracking.  It fixed my issue.  Other than that great free app and the yearly subscription is cheap.  I love it!

title: Great App for the new Year
body: This app is beautifully designed. The UX/UI was the first thing that grabbed my attention, after that I found that it was highly functional as well. It syncs with Fitbit and apple health so all my data is consistent in every app.

title: Good but room for improvement
body: I've really enjoyed my experience with lifesum thus far but there are definitely aspects of the app that could use improvement. Entering new foods to the database is clunky and confusing at best and frustrating at worst. The diet options are more limited with less information than I expected with the paid membership. Also, I wish there were more vegan recipes and encouragement as that is the diet I'm doing.

title: Overall great app
body: I really like this app makes it easy to add things quickly. The only thing I've had a hard time with is the calories for exercise. It seems inaccurate to me. I have verified the calories on other sites too and typically those sites are less calories than what it does here. Any update to this would be greatly appreciated since I like using this app so much.

title: Excellent for my limited use case
body: I am really benefitting from this app but I must say that I'm only using it to track food consumption and water consumption. It does that very well. I find many of the foods I eat already in the database and I have added a few custom recipes of things I often eat. It's really raising my awareness of my food intake.

title: Pretty good app
body: Super fun and easy to use! I love how you can easily add foods you eat, and it tells you the nutritional info. The only thing I don't really like is that there is limited workout information. Whenever you try to add the exercises you've done, the only ones listed are machine workouts, and you have to add them manually. I would recommend using the 8fit app along with this one :)

title: Great when it doesn't freeze
body: The food tracker is great but the app freezes and crashes every so often. You need to delete it and then reinstall to get it working again.

title: It's ok but it could be better
body: I like this app and paid the extra and went pro but, honestly it's just ok. I like that my fitness pal has a community on it this doesn't you have to request for your friends to join and I don't have friends who like to work out and watch what they eat. I didn't see a huge difference in the pro and the regular but this is a good app just not amazing. I would probably download it but not go pro.

title: Nice Functionality, But Needs Better Syncing
body: So far, I'm enjoying using this app, at least on my iPhone. However, it doesn't seem like there's any way to sync data to a second device (like my iPad) even if both devices are signed into the same account. Not really sure what the point of having a separate account that doesn't sync data is...

title: Wow. Just wow
body: I have used the app for a couple of months now and like it more every day. I can see exactly how I am doing with carbs and other nutrients. I have tried several of the diet plans before I settled on low carb. I couldn't have done that without this app. Thank you so much Developers for the time and effort you put into this app.

title: Amazing! But....
body: I went on a 30 min walk and before it I activated the Step Tracker but it didn't track my steps. ü§î I still love this app though, but I also wish I didn't have to pay monthly for premium... and not having much on the free version. Other than that I love this app! üëç

title: Love this app
body: So far my fave nutrition app, and I've tried a lot. Beautiful, simple interface (no ads/clutter like the leading nutrition tracker). I've tried premium and enjoyed the benefits but am currently using the free version to save money. May upgrade again in the future when I'm back in weight loss mode (currently pregnant), as I think it's worth it.

title: Life changer!
body: This app can literally change your life and help you get in shape. I use it everyday! I don't care to buy a full version because I cant stand any subscription type purchases, but even the light version is a great help.

title: Needs a better food database
body: This app is exactly what I was looking for in all aspects but one.  When I'm on the go and stop somewhere to get food, I usually don't have time to ask for a nutrition sheet and enter the information.  I'd love to see an online nutrition lookup added with all the common restaraunts accounted for.  For now, I'm sticking with mynetdiary specifically for this feature, and would love to switch back if this feature is supported in the future.

title: Had high hopes but terrible experience
body: I started out already kind of being skeptical about this app. But I read the reviews and downloaded it. Then I saw the potential it had so I upgraded to the Gold version. So I thought anyway. They charged me for the upgrade but never converted me over to Gold status. Contacted customer support by email and got the run around with computer generated messages. It has been a week now and still no refund or anything. I don't recommend this app to anyone

title: Why is this still free!?!
body: I love this little app! I've deleted all the other apps I had like 'lose it' because this one does it all. Keeps track of my water intake, workouts,food, what portions are carbs,fat, protein. Lets you know how much longer you have until you reach your goal weight. Gives you healthy food recipes depending on what diet you follow. And it's really easy to use!!! Try it!!!

title: Simplifies tracking of everything!!
body: Awesome how simple it is to search for various foods and beverages for meals. Then it also pulls in my exercise from my watch and phone to give me my caloric intake to meet my goal of losing 15 lbs. Seamless, simple, and very useful if you have always found it annoying and troublesome to track what you eat.

title: Obsessed
body: Perfect for my obsessing over what I eat. Helps me keep my sweet tooth in check and I have yet to consume a food that isn't in their catalog, which was a problem I've had with other apps. They even have menu items from popular restaurants. Barcode scanner is also very handy. Will continue to use forever.

title: Great App, missing HealthKit integration
body: App looks great and good design which makes it easy to use. Unfortunately there is no HealthKit integrating which makes it pretty much useless. Pleeeeease add this! Every fitness and health app should have his by now, I have to use MyFitnessPal in the meantime but their UI is a total mess (Oh, and also fix the terribly old Facebook connect WebView you are using where you have to re-login, and just redirect me to the native FB app like everybody else does).

title: THE REVIEW OF LIFESUM
body: I downloaded this app when I focused more on eating healthier. This app really helped me with that and it's very helpful for those trying to lose weight. Lifesum is great for tracking the foods you ate every day and gives you and honest daily rating and honestly tells you how healthier you have to eat. Lifesum really does help your LIFE. Hope you enjoy!

title: Recipes
body: I wish you could add your own recipe or add one you found on Google.

title: Great for someone like me
body: I've never kept track of anything I ate, or the water that I drink until I started using lifesum. I've used this app for almost a month and I'm down 15 lbs. I did upgrade so that I can have access to everything. I highly recommend this app to anyone to wants to be healthier and/or lose weight!

title: Best food tracking app I've used so far
body: This is the best app I've tried so far - including Weight Watchers and My Fitness Pal.

title: Not Bad
body: This is not a bad app but it does need a bit more functionality. Not everyone wants to lose weight at the rate of 2 pounds per week. That is the MOST the average person should attempt to lose (or you are actually losing muscle as well). There should at least be additional options to lose 1 pound and 1.5 pounds per week. Also you should be able to adjust the percentages of protein, fat and carbs if you are following, say, a lower carb diet.

title: Has potential to be the best
body: This could be the best food diary/tracker I‚Äôve found if they didn‚Äôt push so hard for Gold upgrade. The interface is much better than MyFitnessPal but basic functionality that MyFitnessPal does for free costs $3/month or more in Lifesum. I understand paying for a subscription if I want an ongoing meal plan but why can‚Äôt I just pay a one time price for basic functionality like logging my own food?

title: One of my favorite tracking apps!
body: I really like it so far! It's a quick and easy way to track food and activities. I love that it tracks water intake too, that's such an important component to a healthy lifestyle that I think sometimes falls by the wayside. I'll likely stick with this app whenever I'm looking to manage my weight.

title: Latest release is worse
body: This most recent version has made some changes for the worse. For example, searching for a food doesn't result in your favorites showing up first. You have to click on the favorites tab, and then search for your favorites to show up. Second, I can't figure out how to make a new recipe. I've been trying for the last two minutes. I did this just fine in the previous version, but can't figure it out now.

title: Great for baby boomers
body: As a 50-something woman, I really like this app.  It's easy to use.  That's so important for my generation.  In addition, I am learning a lot about better choices with the food rating system the app uses.  I don't feel like I have to stress when I enter my foods.  I just choose the closest option on the list. Good job guys!

title: Apple Watch vs phone app
body: The apps are somewhat different and do not sync correctly. When I input water intake on my watch it does not sync on the app on my phone. Also, if I add an extra glass of water by accident I can't remove it. Minor things like this make the app very annoying to use.

title: Gets Use!
body: I don't find many of these kinds of apps that keep my interest, but this one totally does. Totally easy to use. I adore how the water cups fill up with the lil' sound and everything~ I think there is plenty of use in the free bits so i get good use, so good that i'm planning on actually getting premium. Worth my while anyway :)

title: It started so well
body: I really loved the aesthetics and graphics and I liked that you could choose a goal instead of just weight loss. Things got rough when I saw how few foods were pre-logged and ready to add. They got rougher when I began to add recipes and found out that on the free version you can only add two of your own recipes. As a grad student I cook a lot of my own meals and paying for the premium version is not a bill I need right now when there are other free apps on the market.

title: Easy to use fitness/nutrition app
body: Very user friendly interface and layout. This app introduced me to consistently tracking calories and I've had good results from always knowing where I stand in terms of caloric intake during the day. One drawback is the app is a little glitchy at times but this really hasn't had a big impact on my daily use. I recommend.

title: Love it!
body: I started using the app on a Monday and tracking my food, choosing my plan, and being super honest.

title: Taking away features
body: They recommended an update with "important issues" and all they did was take away the option to track points. That is fine, but at least *tell* people you are nerfing the program. Without that feature it is of little value to me. If you just want to track overall calories, this will still work for you, but beware the next update, when they do more things to the program WITHOUT telling you!

title: Great help
body: Shape Up is a great tool to keep me motivated and informed.  I've not yet to stump the search feature.  I eat a lot of sushi and it has it all.   If I want treat myself with something extra I can quickly figure out how much extra time I need to spend in the gym to cover it.  I have recommended to all of my friends and family.

title: Best fitness app I've used
body: Lifesum is honestly the best app in comparison to other fitness apps. It's organized, clean, super easy to use, and most importantly, it's extremely helpful. It recommends meals according to your health goals and provides calorie counts so you can keep track of the food you eat. There's a lot more to it, but so far I am very happy with Lifesum.

title: Excellent way to count calories, protein, fat
body: Trying to gain weight, and now I can evaluate what I eat and how to balance my diet. You can use the barcode feature to scan items, and some fast food items can be searched for. However, its hard to add homemade dishes with multiple ingrediants, or add items from University dining. I wish they could add a custom food feature

title: Much more potential.
body: I love using this app already, but I fear down the road it's not going to work for me the more serious I get. One major thing: it doesn't sync ANY information with the health app for iOS, which I and several others use frequently. Macros and a feedback ability to even just submit new food, brands, et cetera would be huge. I love it now, but later on it won't work out unless it gets upgraded.

title: Lifesum
body: OMG! Lifesum has helped me soooo much with keeping track of how many calories I put into my body each and everyday!üò±üôäüå∏üíï Who ever created this app has to be a genius! 5/5 stars‚≠êÔ∏è I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this app for someone who wants to take control of their eating and not starve themselves. Back at it AGAIN, with full force, anonymousüòí

title: Bugs Fixed! App works great again!
body: So great to have this app back! The Nov 6 update seems to have addressed all the bugs with exercise tracking and Watch syncing that occurred with the Oct 31 update.

title: This app is great!
body: This app helped me figure out just how many calories I need to consume to lose weight by a certain time. I've lost 10 pounds already in a much shorter time than if I had just been trying to alone. Additionally, I like the feedback it gives on the quality of food that I am eating.

title: Garbage
body: So far this app does not work well at all. After just one day I realize that the accompanying watch app is completely broken and does not work at all and even though I set up Lifesum to write data to the health app, it's missing a bunch of the data like water intake which seems pretty important. Something as simple as water intake in which I straight up tell the app I drank one glass of water and it can put even get that right. In an effort to some eating some much garbage food I have come to realize that this app is itself, garbage.

title: Great app can use some updating
body: I love this app! It is great to track calories and I love that it teaches you what to improve on eating. The calories for some things are really off. Someone needs to delete and filter through most of the food so just be careful when logging. Other than that it's a great modern calorie tracker!

title: One of my most favourite apps
body: I got this app originally to help me with my daily diet to help reach my goal.  Been using it everyday for the past few months.  Found a few bugs, and reported them.  Response in emails were great.

title: Ruined
body: The system is junk since the update in December. It won't sync with mobile devices 50% of the time. Get a message about 20% on the web that system is being updated. Already looking at other systems.  It is so frustrating because you get an email back from "martin" 1 or 2 days after being submitted.  By then the problem might be resolved or you have lost two days on the system tracing calories & exercise.  Would not recommend due to the sporadic nature of service and very generic customer service.

title: Great Weight Loss Tool!
body: This is an excellent tool for losing weight by tracking calories.  I have been using it for 5 weeks and have lost 10 pounds and it's free!  Don't really need the gold.  Only negative is that the exercise calories are WAY off.  They are much too high so I have created my own exercises with mote realistic calories burned.

title: Great way to hold yourself accountable!
body: I have really been able to keep up with what I'm eating & it helps me make better choices. I love being able to scan  barcodes too. Before this I would try to mentally keep track of what I was eating & that was ineffective. Definitely recommend this app!

title: Great app but I have one suggestion
body: I really like the app because it helps me focus on how much and what I need to eat to live healthy. I just wish that the Apple Watch version would support voice integration. For example, it would be great to just tell the app on the watch what I just ate, instead of just giving me the option between small, medium, and large meal input.

title: Switched from MFP
body: I've used My fitness Pal for three years now and have managed to lose 70 lbs and manage it. I recently discovered Lifesum when browsing apps and decided to check it out. I like the interface and design over MFP and it seems like this app is on the right track. Looking forward to updates and improvements in the coming months.

title: Still needs work
body: Love the design, UI is alright. Adding food via scanning is nearly always incorrect and won't let me edit it if it's "already in the system". Doesn't  sync correctly to my Fitbit and I can't see my calories burned until the day ends. Customer service has been no help. Also, I wish there was a way to track cups of coffee / caffeine intake.

title: Love!
body: What a great app! I love that it helps me see not only how many calories I've had but also the nutrients and if I'm on track or not with my healthy choices. I did opt to not have my exercise count in with my calories for the day because it was saying I needed to eat more due to my workout. Easy fix. I love it!

title: All About Premium
body: I get that they need to make money, but this app doesn't make it possible to accurately track your health without paying. Shouldn't it still help, regardless? I could get a similar app (fitness pal) and get some of the features that this app locks up. The only reason why I stick with it is because of the little smileys and the overall appearance is a good change from the other app.

title: So far, so good...
body: I like the app and ended ip paying for premium so I could personalize it to my needs. It's been a week and I feel better, healthier. However it bothers me when I end with the right amount of Carbs and it says "over" at 0 remaining. I would like this updated because I look for the overs and when I'm on point, it's frustrating to see "over."

title: This Program Is Amazing!
body: I can't tell you how much I love this program!  I went to your website first, and watched all the instructional videos before I began using the program.  It keeps so much information - and is so easy to use.  It couldn't be more perfect for my needs.  Thank You Thank You!!

title: Love This!!!!
body: I use this app every day!  The functionality is great and it really helps me hold myself accountable. Also love that it keeps track of calories burned. Just wish that my calories burned with exercise weren't added back into my "left to eat" calories since I am working on losing weight, not maintaining it.  Other than that, I love it and all of the features!

title: Forced gold account signup is obnoxious
body: The new version will not let you into the app without signing up for a free trial of their "gold" account... I do not want a free trial of something that will be paid later on, so the app gave me no choice but to go through the trouble of throwing it out and reinstalling the previous version. Now of course all of my data is gone. I paid for the app a long time ago when I bought it, making me pay more in order to continue to use it is just obnoxious. Zero stars would be better.

title: Great App!
body: Very helpful with weight and calorie management. My whole family uses the app to keep calorie intake and portion size control in the right limits. I've used this app since March 2010 and not experienced many glitches at all. No glitches in the past many months. There have been many updates.

title: Helpful and user friendly
body: This app makes it so easy to track calories and input exercise. It has so many food choices and portion sizes. Being able to favorite foods also makes inputting meals much quicker. Would highly recommend over other calorie counting apps

title: I have never left a review for something in my life
body: But seriously this app is amazing. They have thought of everything! I love it! I'm a whole new woman! I've never counted calories in my life. I had no clue how much I was putting in my body! Thank you the free version! Although I will probably upgrade as my addiction continues! :)

title: Great App! Meeting my calorie goals!
body: This app is great. Very modern looking and you can find just about every food item you will eat! The barcode scanner is super clutch too. I love that is tracks my water intake and exercise as well. I've been able to meet my calorie goals by tracking and I couldn't be happier with LifeSum!

title: Nutritional information needs to be updated
body: I like using the app and I think that it is great that they help you choose a meal plan that fits your life but when entering info for lettuce the nutritional info is hilarious there is no way romaine lettuce has so much sugar in it. I like the tracking and accountability but accurate this app is not. I will continue to use the app mainly because I paid for the year after that I am not sure.

title: Not all aspects of the app work
body: I pay for premium and I expect it to work, I tried taking the life score test and I'm at 97% complete and it won't load I've tried multiple times I've tried closing the app and restarting it I've even tried shuting my phone down and it still doesn't work, also I invited a friend who downloaded the app and it won't let us be friends through the Lifesum app. for a customer paying $50 for this app it really should work

title: Love interacting with this app!
body: I really enjoy entering my food and activity into this app. I've tried to be consistent with it before but this is the first time I've continued to do it more than a few days. I've been consistent for about 2.5 months now and it makes a huge difference in my training.

title: Ugh, don't update to the new version
body: I loved this app but the update has just wrecked it.

title: Battery Killer
body: The app it self is pretty, I'm still not sure what's the gold option is bringing to me? I literally don't see the point of it. However recently this has been killing my battery! I would open the app it would "froze" my battery is at %67 i wait couple minute and force quit the app and my battery is below %50 please fix this. Also I think it started when I hooked it up to my Jawbone Up

title: This app is a huge help
body: I really like this app. It helps me stay accountable and keeps track of my food for me. Make it so easy.  Especially when I can just can a barcode on food package and all the info is right there without me having to type it all in. I highly recommend Lifesum.

title: Easy to use
body: I think that this program is very easy to use and I love how it tracks the water that you drink and reminds you actually drink because sometimes I forget whenever I'm busy. I like the recommended recipes that they have I wish that they would use a larger variety and maybe even show community and start a blog section.

title: Not what I thought but love it
body: I absolutely love the app!! It's wonderful for keeping me on track with calories and nutrient distribution for every meal!!

title: Meal grades are off
body: I like a lot of things about the app, but the way it "grades" your meals and your day seems inaccurate. It's based on a balance between carbs, protein, and fat, which seems like a good idea. However, it doesn't work in practice. I put my lunch in today - a salad and some steamed vegetables and it gave me a D because it said both were heavy in carbs. So, I add in the two chocolate cookies I had, and it jumps up to a C! How does that make any sense?

title: Best app I've ever used for tracking
body: This app is awesome!! You choose what your overall goal is and it gives you a daily caloric intake goal and provides you with your macros needed for the day! If you get premium which cost as much as a fancy coffee at Starbucks every month it's definitely worth it!!

title: Needs Landscape Mode
body: Lovely app! Switched from LoseIt to Lifesum and even started moving my recipes over - however, I realized on my iPad I can enter everything into LoseIt in Landscape with my keyboard and LifeSum does not have this feature. Unfortunately, it is not easy for everyone to type easily into phones. üòî I would strongly suggest adding this feature to the app to make it easier for more folks to use it.

title: Significant Bug
body: I like this app. I've only been using it for a day and I really enjoy the free features and have been considering premium. HOWEVER, after merely a day of use I can no longer use the app. When I open it, it is very slow and unresponsive. It stays frozen until I close the app or until the app crashes on it's own. Nothing on my phone has changed between these past two days.

title: So much better than MFP
body: Easy to use, visually pleasing, gentle (but not annoying) reminder notifications. Way more fun and pleasant than MFP. I have the paid version, am using it to follow a ketogenic light diet, and it's been an essential part of my success so far. My favorite part is tracking macro goals throughout the day.

title: its ok.. but should be able to customize calorie intake
body: I like everything so far, except the fact that you cant adjust your calories you want to consume each day. it automatically assumes you want to lose 2 pounds a week and it told me I need to consume 1099 cals a day. the minimum healthy requirment for ANYONE is 1200 they should fix that plus allow you to customize it.

title: Has Potential
body: The app is easy to use has great tips and tools but the nutritional information is not accurate even on branded items. When I attempt to add an item via scanner it tells me the item already exists, asks if I want to go to the item but when I click yes the app crashes. When I go back in and look for the item I find it but nutritional information doesn't match.

title: Livin' It Up
body: With a clean and minimal design, Lifesum is a standout among the plethora of food-tracking apps available on the App Store. It is fast, simple, and intuitive. The most notable feature is its all-new water tracker, which sends you reminders and encourages you to stay hydrated with your diet. It also has an Apple Watch app that brings quick productivity on the go.

title: My push and hug
body: Lifesum pushes me to be accountable and loves me with encouraging notes. This app is helpful for seeing what your eating down to carbs, protein, and fats. It's quick and easy to in put my meals. I can put in snacks and exercise. It balances my calories and gives me info on how to do better. I use this app all day and everyday. Love it!

title: Love app, trouble with glance on Apple Watch though...
body: I love this app. It keeps track of everything I want and has a nice Apple Watch experience. My only complaint is I can not get the Apple Watch glance to update. Even after opening the app on my watch. The app updates but the glance still shows no data. When this is fixed it will be my go to health app.

title: Almost perfect
body: I love this app. I like it waaaaayyyy more than myfitnesspal. UI is beautiful & intuitive, but what's keeping me from rating this five stars (and from buying a subscription) is the inability to create a recipe and apply it to your diary like in mfp. Until this happens, I'll just have to use Lifesum and mfp on different days, depending if I'm cooking a dish for multiple people or just myself

title: Looks nice, but free version is worthless
body: Recipes are locked if you are not a paid premium user. Additional meal planning suggestions are locked unless you pay for it. All you really can do is log your own food and personal recipes - I already know what I eat and that its not working for me. I could have written my meal planning on paper faster than using this app.

title: Great Health App
body: I love how it has the macros calculated for you. Also, the database of food such as a California burrito is a great feature. So, I don't have to calculate the macros myself. Lastly the recipes are great! I can search by an ingredient too. For example, if I want to cook something with cottage cheese, it will pull up recipes I can make! My new favorite app!

title: I like it but....
body: I am a breastfeeding mother, I really wish there were ways to adjust the advisory content accordingly. I am required to eat a minimum of 500 calories more than the normal amount in order to account for the calories burned while breastfeeding and yet it shames me ( so to speech) for doing exactly that.

title: Love this app!
body: The custom diet plans are perfect fits, the food diary is the easiest to use (especially with the scanner)! I love how you can easily see how balanced each food item & your diet is! Also, the recipe suggestions are amazing & you can customize them for specific allergies & food preferences!! Two thumbs up!!

title: Great Tracker
body: I love the easy to read pie graph that lets you know more than just how many calories you've consumed.  There are 4 different graphs to track your progress and an online list of foods to compliment those that are standard in the database.  You can also add and share foods and track water intake.  I love it!

title: Pretty perfect
body: This app is great for tracking your meals and reminding you when to drink water. It helps me be more aware of the calories and fat I'm taking in as well as how much water I should be consuming. However, it is inconvenient that there are set meals installed in the app, even if the meal you had doesn't match any of theirs. That is the only problem I have found. Other than that, great app! I use it every day.

title: Awesome! It's earned my 5 stars
body: I usually can't keep enticed to use these calorie/food tracking apps, but LifeSum makes it fun, easy, and engaging.

title: You can't improve what you can't measure
body: Lifestyle helps me be conscious about my weight loss effort and resist temptations by keeping track of the efforts I made quicky and easily. It becomes easy and fun to catalog what you ate and how much you lost. In turn seeing it makes you commit to it even more. The right motivator.

title: I adore this app.
body: I'm only a few days in, but I have big hopes that this will help me get my overall health and food awareness back on track. I adore the vivid colors, fun and encouraging pop-ups, and the layout of the application. This app feels more interactive compared to other fitness apps. 2017 Weight loss goals-- Fingers crossed!

title: Simple, informative and beautiful!
body: Super simple meal and exercise logging - so helpful in keeping me on track towards achieving my health goals. Integrates with apple's health app too, so your steps get counted automatically! Not to mention, the UI is gorgeous. Very tempted to upgrade to premium for the recipes, considering how solid the rest is! Great work Lifesumüëè

title: Like it so far
body: So far I like it. Navigation is a little clunky at first but it certainly has what I'm looking for. I needed an app for some guidance on diet and this seems helpful. Update: man honestly it's great, the only problem I ever have with this app is m forgetting to fill it in. Needs a reminder notification but

title: Love it so far
body: I've had this app for about two weeks and it definitely helps keep me on track. I'm looking to lose fat and gain muscle and since this let's you track your macros it helps me understand how well or poor I'm eating.
