I'm quite dissatisfied and thankful that I'm not paying for the frustration.

title: Hilarious
body: You have to buy a membership just to have the ability to pair fitness trackers (heart rate monitors, Fitbit, Apple Watch) to the app.

title: I like it
body: I do like this but it needs to be easier to use. I want to be above to easily creat foods that this app doesn't have. Also choose how much water I specifically want to drink. I do like this up but it needs some improvements

title: Best Nutrition App I've Used
body: This is probably the only nutrition app I have ever used consistently in my life. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.

title: Love it!

title: CRASH

title: Misinformative
body: Lifesum oversimplifies the information it tries to present, and in doing so it ends up giving you a very warped understanding of your diet. Healthy, wholesome foods like bananas, hard boiled unsweetened applesauce, and mushrooms are given poor scores for "high in natural sugar" or "calorie dense." Also, the nutritional facts such as serving size and calories are wildly inaccurate. There are many better apps out there!

title: It's awesome, helpful, and motivating, but could be even better.
body: I've been using this app obsessively for about two weeks now and I absolutely love it. It is SO motivating for me and I'm so thankful I found it, because it has helped completely transform my eating habits. The app itself is designed very well (love the graphics, colors, and animations). I really love the food diary, meal and day ratings, lifescore, the different food/water trackers, as well as the daily and meal-specific calorie tracker. The ratings are what really help me, because they guide me on what foods are best and not-so-good for my health and for my goals. The smileys are awesome. Lifesum even has a weight/body measurement tracker so you can see how many pounds you have lost/gained, as well as an exercise tracker so you can see how many calories you have burned, which is so helpful. I purchased the premium version pretty quickly after downloading, and while it is a little more than I'd like to pay yearly, it's definitely worth it in the long run for me personally.

title: User updatable online database a good think, but a fiasco in practice; Cumbersome to add food/recipe
body: Tracks water. It does not track sodium although screen shots of the upcoming version suggest that sodium will be trackable. While you can enter total fat, you cannot break out the saturated fat or trans-fatty acid numbers. It covers the other major nutritional items and gives you the daily totals of each. Foods are in categories and that works most of the time. However, why are muffins under snacks and not under breads? You can edit just about everything, and there's a trash can where you can go and undelete an item you've deleted. I can add an exercise and edit it. I can "edit" a database exercise but the only thing I can change is the name. Can edit everything about custom foods as well as database foods. When I add a new food to the database, I can't enter the nutritional information by serving as it is listed on the food label -- I have to enter it based on 1 of whatever measurement I've chosen. While on the one hand this makes sense, on the other, I now have to have a calculator so I can convert the nutritional information from the food label serving size to 1 of my measurement. That's what computers are for -- I don't want to have to have a calculator on hand when I'm doing my data entry into the app. I could enter a recipe from a cookbook that already has the nutritional values as a custom food. However, if I'm cooking a recipe that does not already have the nutritional values I have to figure it all out manually before I enter it as a custom food in this application. When I add a food to my diary, one of the categories I can select is "Brand Name" but it's empty. When I search for a brand food, for example "General Mills" nothing is found, so I have to do an online search. I saved a cereal from my online search for "Genera Mills"; *now* if I go to "Brand Name" category I see an entry. If I search for "Cheerios" on line, there are tons of entries for "Cheerios" -- all different (two different "1 cup" servings had totally different nutritional information) -- so I either have to sift through them all to find the accurate entry for my serving type or I have to create my own entry, which would then end up as still another "Cheerios" entry in the on line database, adding to the chaos. The on line database needs more brand foods and restaurant foods and once that's done, the on line database needs to be cleaned up. That would solve the problem of everyone making their own entries a la this "Cheerios" example. We cannot use this app right now because some of the nutritional items we need to track are not available. When the next version comes out and if tracking the additional nutrition items, cleanup of the online database, food entry with "per serving" data entry of nutritional values, and recipe entry with generating of nutritional values are added we'll be happy to use this app and will change the score.

title: Wow‚Ä¶ just wow. What an excellent app
body: I never write reviews, but this one is so good that I felt compelled to applaud the developers and company in general. Can‚Äôt believe how robust this app is and how simple it is to compile ‚Äúmeals‚Äù out of individual ingredients just by scanning a bard code, and saving them for use later. Beautiful UI and fluid and intuitive UX. Love the detail of verifying nutritional information with a little check mark next to each product as with most calorie tracking apps you‚Äôre given a slew of products and never know which one to choose from the search results.

title: 5 stars for organization
body: While I am happy to award you 5 stars for your app, I found it to be lacking for me and my diet restrictions, so deleted it after just 2 days. I would think that just 2 days use would grant me a refund of the majority, if not all of my payment of $24.95, but have yet to see it. Any help you can give Apple, I‚Äôd greatly appreciate. Thank you!

title: Not Suitable for Vegans
body: I wanted to start counting calories in order to lose weight. I saw that this app was highly suggested by a lot of doctors that I watch on YouTube. So, I gave it a shot. Spent money for the premium version and it‚Äôs not able to track my vegan food that I scan into it. Waste of money for me.

title: Not Bad
body: Design of the app is good, but it should be more customizable to input my own measurements. The water log on the watch app is supposed to be easy, but it‚Äôs needlessly frustrating, making you choose between a full cup or a full bottle for one-touch input. You have go into the settings to change the amounts each time you want to log a different type. I assume this is because goals are set as cups/bottles per day, but people don‚Äôt always drink water out of the same size containers every time every day. I don‚Äôt know why I can‚Äôt just input by ounces. It‚Äôs also not possible to edit your intake via the app, so good luck if you don‚Äôt have a watch, and don‚Äôt have a 8.45oz cup or 16.91oz bottle. Most of my daily logs are inaccurate so the water feature is pretty irrelevant and needs a major overhaul.

title: Review
body: Great app as far as calorie recommendations and healthy advice. I love the bar code scanner and it makes tracking a lot easier. The calories burnt during a workout seem a little high and it‚Äôs difficult to track restaurants

title: Love the app but could use some tweaks
body: I have been using Lifesum for exactly 347 days according to my ongoing streak. Everything works great for the most part other than some rare times the app doesn‚Äôt boot and my phone requires a restart to get it working. My main problem lies in the lack of sharing towards others who use the same app. For example, my sister made a different more low calorie lasagna but even after making the recipe and putting the steps on Lifesum, she couldn‚Äôt send it to me. I know there is a feature coming where you can share recipes with people, but if we could add to that and make a way to also friend other people, it would allow some cool features like looking at more creative recipes other people might‚Äôve made, as well as ingredients people have favorited.

title: discounts dont work
body: i had been thinking about upgrading to premium, so i searched around for a discount code and none of them work. then i opened the app again and it offered me 30% off! great! but i navigated away from the page for less than a minute and it took away the offer for the 3 month and 6 month subscription. i was bummed so i restarted the app and the 30% off wasn‚Äôt available at all! listen, if there‚Äôs no free trial, i‚Äôm not going to purchase a full years subscription. $17 for three months was pushing it already, but i was willing. oh well! guess i wont get premium at all.

title: Not Giving it up Quite Yet
body: I like the *idea* of this app, but the food database is not easy to use, nor is it accurate. I purchased the 3-month premium but regret doing so.

title: Great app!
body: This app is very easy to use. I am a person horrible with the conversation of the food that I am eating to oz, cup, pounds. This helps me to figure it out.  It's so cool to be able to scan the bar code on products right into my phone to get the nutritional value.

title: Good, but needs some work
body: Great calorie counting app that has a bar code feature to make calorie counting super streamlined. I also like that is breaks down your meal into grams carbs, fat, and protein.  I don‚Äôt like how it rates food by smiley faces because it is not very accurate. I am not diabetic and using the classic diet plan, but it rates a medium apple as not a good snack food. I can tell you that an apple is a much better snack than chips, yet they get practically the same rating?? Other things that don‚Äôt make sense or could be changed: it adds your calories from exercise to the total number of calories you need to consume. In other words, the app wants you to eat as many calories as you burn???? The whole point of exercise to help you create a calorie deficit to lose weight. If you burn 600 calories working out and then go eat several slices of pizza you just defeated the whole point!!! Because of this the app always shows that I am consuming only 700-800 calories a day, but in reality I am consuming about 1300 a day and also exercising. I also don‚Äôt like that you cannot adjust your daily goal calorie intake‚Äî I would like to choose 1300, but the app is set at 1500, so I just watch the total number of calories consumed instead of looking at how many calories I have left. If you are total novice at portion control, healthy eating, and exercise this app could make it difficult to actually lose weight. I also don‚Äôt like that I have to manage my progress by weight unless I wantto purchase  the deluxe version. I don‚Äôt need meal prep plans, meal ideas, or all the other bells and whistles. I would like to track my weight by body measurements, which is a much more accurate approach since a person can gain and lose up to 4 lbs on average during a day in water weight alone. Also measuring by inches instead of lbs is less disheartening for the above mentioned reason. I just track this on a weakly basis on my own, but the stupid app asks me every morning to input my weight. Overall good for calorie tracking if you are mindful of the pitfalls.

title: Add more fasting options
body: I would like to add more fasting options. I do OMAD which is one large meal (1200-1400 calories) a day and 22 hours of fasting and weekends I eat like normal. You don‚Äôt have this as an option so I‚Äôm forced to go over my intake for the day when I‚Äôm fasting since it‚Äôs a 500 calorie limit. Please update this.

title: Good tracker poor synching with apple health
body: Most food that I buy at the supermarket is available to track in the app which makes the bar code scanner feature very practical. The process to add foods that aren‚Äôt recognized is pretty simple. Only thing is the app inconsistently syncs with apple health. Sometimes the calories match most times it doesn‚Äôt.

title: Good for casual use, but not best
body: I tried Lifesum premium a few months ago and it was pretty good. I am not sure it is worth it to pay for the added nutrition facts and nutrition goals. If I‚Äôm doing the work to scan an items bar code (that I have in front of me) why wouldn‚Äôt the app show all the nutrition facts? MyFitnessPal pal is definitely the better app if you are not looking to pay a premium fee.

title: Limited control
body: When I saw this was voted ‚Äúbest health app‚Äù I wanted to give it a try but it turned out to be so much less than I expected. The food tracker is so dumbed-down, it lacks the option to customize your entries in the most basic ways. For example, you tap a water glass icon to enter your water but you can‚Äôt adjust glass size- it‚Äôs 8oz or nothing. My glasses are 12oz pints. Yes, I can do the math but for a $49.99 app, I shouldn‚Äôt have to. It also doesn‚Äôt sync accurately with my Fitbit. Only a fraction of my steps show up in Lifesum- it seems to sync once early in the day but doesn‚Äôt update. I do like the look of the interface and the way it shows your macros- very easy to read & understand. Just overpriced for what it is- I have found it more frustrating than helpful so far!

title: Discouraging
body: I wanted to start counting my calories so I started the day off with 400/535 calories I ate a snack to catch up on the missing calories it was TWO calories over and it criticized me for it. When I start planning lunch it tells me my snack was now 21 calories over I know for a fact that it said 525 calories before. Not to mention that you shouldn‚Äôt have to PAY to be healthy. That‚Äôs ridiculous. I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed and feel even more discouraged than before.

title: Android Version was Better. iOS has Issues
body: Beautiful app. Gorgeous design. Love syncing with workouts for calories spent, and being able to customize my macros. It‚Äôs got more problems than I had with the android version tho.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work as expected
body: I initially was trying to download the Myfitnesspal app and this one popped up instead. I decided to purchase it after reading a few reviews, and I‚Äôve only been using it for days now, but every time I open the app my calories that I have remaining change.It‚Äôs like it basically keeps syncing and un-syncing with my Fitbit so whenever I want to eat something and I open up the app to see what I have left Calorie wise, it shows negative because it‚Äôs no longer sync‚Äôd with my fitbit. I just can‚Äôt deal with it.

title: Lifesum

title: Get this!

title: Very inaccurate
body: I really wanted do you like this app. The layout is great but had some issues with making a meal. It‚Äôs can‚Äôt do good math and has a bad glitch. It thinks 267+120+66+81+23+79=15569  ?????????????

title: Sanity!
body: Sooooooo, I can get a little wrapped around the axel.  I am all the type A.  I tired weight watchers once and promptly became anorexic, which they praised me for.  The counting and tracking brings out the worst in me.  How low can I go?  When I got back some lab work that made it clear I had to watch my nutrition more closely and switch off the high protein diet I had been following (history of kidney disease in my family and routine blood work showed some early detection red flags) I started looking for a way to track my protein intake and maintain my sanity.

body: Great app but could be better about recommending/searching previous foods

title: It‚Äôs Amazing!
body: I first heard about this app in a YouTube video. I decided to try it out and it‚Äôs really good. I‚Äôve lost weight and stay on track, all thanks to this app. I recommend it. The best part is that it‚Äôs free!

title: Beautiful App but really buggy
body: So the app itself accomplishes everything they were aiming for and even more. Helps you in every aspect you can account for when you‚Äôre trying to plan or follow a diet. But the major drawback is the app is bug-ridden. For instance, when you add food to a meal and leave the app and come back, that good is shown 2 times. Also if you remove one, you come back to see that the item is completely removed. Then the total calories will show 400 or some random number cals left even though you have had 1500/1500 cals.

title: Helpful app but needs some work
body: The daily tracking of meals, water, and exercise is helpful to staying motivated. The recipes are great but if you pay extra for the meal plans it‚Äôs a bit odd. Sometimes when you log the breakfast from the plan In the diary it says you are ‚Äúoff track‚Äù.  It‚Äôs a disconcerting way to start the day.  It would be great if you could enter and save your own recipes so that you don‚Äôt have to enter individual ingredients every time. The bar code photo is a very helpful feature. Overall it‚Äôs a  decent app but I‚Äôm not sure the meal plans are worth the extra money.

title: Great Job!
body: The bar code scanner makes it very easy to input a number of foods. The step counter is a great feature as well. I would like a larger food catalog or the option to input foods but the current catalog is large enough I can find an equivalent option. Overall Great job!

title: Charged for Full Amount for Subscription

My account was charged $49.49. That‚Äôs not what I wanted to do. Currently waiting on a refund from Apple. The subscription amount is misleading.

title: Like the app

It recommends I have about 900-1100 calories for dinner but the highest calories dinners are only like 500-600 calories. Also it would be nice if for the water tracking it had customizable amounts.

body: As i‚Äôm writing this, I have officially lost 30.8lbs in around 1 & 2/3 months. title: It‚Äôs fine
body: This app is just okay. I have been using it for 2 years (the free version) and recently upgraded to premium after trying other apps as well. I was very disappointed to see that there isn‚Äôt a complete nutrient distribution like Chronometer has (including individual amino acids in each food, etc.); it just shows you the nutrient breakdown as it appears on nutrition labels, which is not that useful to me. Additionally, it has a giant box that says ‚Äúeat healthy, not hangry‚Äù at the top when you don‚Äôt meet your calorie goal, and this isn‚Äôt something I appreciate given current food shortages in stores from COVID-19. I also think saying I should eat ‚Äúhealthy, not hangry‚Äù because ‚Äúmy friends will appreciate it‚Äù misses the mark. I get that it‚Äôs a joke, but this food tracking app calling me a b*tch is not my favorite. Thanks tho.

title: Never Works
body: The app should be great. And if it actually functioned it would be. I get pretty angry at this point when I get prompted to spend money on this thing because I‚Äôve had the basic app for ages now and every time I resolve to use it I‚Äôm reminded why I stopped before the day is even out. I can never even add all of my food to my daily intake because it just will not load anything for days at a time. Then it magically works for maybe 24 hours, and then asks me to pay for their subscription. I say no, and the app won‚Äôt load anything again. I don‚Äôt know if this is intentional but honestly it‚Äôs frustrating because I want to be able to use it, and I pay for other health and fitness apps, but this thing just never lives up to expectations. Editors choice my butt, I don‚Äôt believe all these 5 star reviews aren‚Äôt just fake with how shoddy this app actually works.

Trust me, they know this is misleading. They bank on that. I spent 20 minutes looking the app over before my purchase, and now I‚Äôm flat broke for the month. Incredibly angry.

title: No Response to Support Emails

The ‚Äúrestore purchase‚Äù doesn‚Äôt work (dead link that doesn‚Äôt respond). When I try to renew with the offer, it prompts me to accept purchase at the full price. title: Disappointing

title: Full of bugs. Not worth a subscription.

This includes adding food and not having it show up, changing total servings and not having it show up, foods disappearing, bar code not scanning even in well-lit situations, etc. It‚Äôs not worth the price

title: Mislabled prices
body: They labeled their sale ‚Äò$14.99 for 3months‚Äô and in reality send an email and statement for $21.99 with no ‚Äòper 3‚Äô or ‚Äòper month‚Äô indicator. To me this seems like a scam. They also have no easily accessible email or contact within the app, leaving you to find it yourself after noting this discrepancy. üëé

title: Great app but needs more fine tuning options
body: I work offshore and I‚Äôve been using this app now for a little over a week and it‚Äôs been great for helping me cut back and really monitor what I‚Äôm eating. My only problem is the lack of fine tuning for your personal goals. For example I‚Äôm following the 5:2 diet plan and for the 5 days that I‚Äôm not fasting during the week I‚Äôm expected to eat close to 3500 calories a day? That‚Äôs absurd considering I put in the same information (height, weight, etc.) on a separate website and I was told I needed to take in at the most 1700-2300 calories a day depending on how active I am during the day, to lose weight. The math doesn‚Äôt add up and it‚Äôs kind of frustrating to have the app telling me I‚Äôm failing at meeting my daily goals outside of my 2 fasting days. I suggest a future update that allows members to pick their diet plan and then be able to fine tune it to their individual needs. Other than that it‚Äôs an outstanding app that‚Äôs been really keeping me committed to eating healthier!

title: Scam.
body: They offered a 30% promotion for the Fall/2019. I signed up for premium annual, and they said I was going to be charged $31.49, but I was actually charged $44.99.

title: Scam
body: Beware that even though the app states $3.95 per month and can cancel anytime they will charge you $44.95.  Then you will notice you cannot adjust your carb level...not everyone can have 50g of carbs on Keto.  Also the calories and Marcos are way off on a bunch of items. title: Don‚Äôt get scammed
body: I don‚Äôt care how elegant the app is - when you download something and it asks you if you want the premium version and you say no . . . And the next thing you know your iTunes account is being charged $16.11. Something is off here and I suspect it is Lifesum!

title: Barcode scanning
body: There should be an option to scan a bar code for faster recognition of what People are consuming ! I‚Äôm sure I am not the only one with this feedback.

title: My opinion
body: This app has helped me shed 3 pounds of body fat in 3 days and the tips given by life sum are better than any YouTube video or workout option.

title: Bar code scanner is not included on free plan
body: Immediately deleted this app because all food must be manually entered unless you pay for a subscription.

title: They steal your money
body: I bought the app and used the regular version for a few weeks until I decided to upgrade to premium since it seemed to be worth it. It really was for about a month then I got a new phone and re-downloaded the app. Suddenly, not only was was I no longer able to connect to my premium membership, the app said my account no longer existed at all. So logically, I went down the ‚Äúreset username‚Äù and ‚Äúreset password‚Äù routes multiples times each, but the emails never arrived. I‚Äôve given up on the app. Biggest waste of money I have ever spent. The app was great until that, so beware they just steal your money then act like your account never even existed and ask you to sign up for premium all over again.

title: Do not buy from a third party and read everything!
body: To start, I got the app from one of those promotions on internet, paid for the plan ‚Äúthe convenient package,‚Äù and then when I tried to opened the app and submit my username and the usual I noticed that wouldn‚Äôt work. I tried couple of times and nothing. I tried to cancel but there is not cancelation ‚Äúwhenever you want‚Äù because I got the ‚Äúconvenient package.‚Äù

title: With a few tweaks, this would be awesome!
body: I‚Äôve tried many apps for diet & fitness tracking, and specifically for tracking macros in Keto. This one is up there as one of my faves.

title: You took my money.
body: I got the app and I wanted to get the subscription for 12 months for $3.75, $44.99 for the whole year. The whole $44.99 was just taken out of my account and all I would like a refund of the $44.99 and to know why you would even put the $3.75 on there if you are going to take all of it at once.?!

title: Very pretty but very buggy
body: I used this app for a year with zero success with weight loss. The app had me eating way more calories (1600 if I was not active and 2000+ if I had an active day) than any other food tracking app I‚Äôve used. Other apps I have tried such as My Fitness Pal and Lose It! would have me only eating 1350-1600 a day (I am a relatively small person so these numbers make more sense for me.) I thought the app was very visually appealing and I saw a lot of positive reviews, so I trusted LifeSum over the other two apps when it came to the calorie goal it set for me. It was obviously way too high.

title: Not worth 29.99
body: This app has served its purpose but the recipes are limited and there are virtually none for gluten dairy sensitivity. I purchased it because of all of the great reviews and feel taken advantage of now that I have the app. Go with a cheap food tracking app and get recipes on Pinterest.

title: Not able to select gain muscle
body: I really want to use this app. All my friends have android phones and I‚Äôm on iOS and it won‚Äôt let me select the gain muscle option. There is not an option for me to select my ideal weight. Maybe this gets fixed and I will be able to use the app. Anyone else have trouble on iOS

title: Can‚Äôt edit portions
body: The app would be almost perfect if only you can edit the portion sizes. An example being, a cup of water is set as 8.45fl.oz. You can only change the units and the amount of ‚Äú8.45fl.oz‚Äù cups of water you drink. My cup is 8fl.oz, so when i input my data, its inaccurate.. This is same with other foods and drinks. Please make an update where we can change the portion sizes!

title: Couldn‚Äôt log in!
body: I understand that the login has to be very protected.I was very interested in this app but you had to be 12+ which I‚Äôm not.If you are under 12 then either wait fo a few years until you are old enough or go and find another app.

title: Unfulfilled subscription
body: Purchased a three month premium subscription. After following the Lifesum support suggestions the app has not upgrade to premium service. I sent an email to Lifesum support I received an automated response of ‚Äú

title: Calorie counter is TOO HIGH
body: This would be a great app, but it allows you to eat too much. I know it‚Äôs healthy to do so, but I‚Äôd rather it allow me to lose weight faster by limiting my calories a lot more. Other research has shown me that it‚Äôs perfectly reasonable to eat less than the 1600 calories LifeSum believes I should eat to ‚Äúlose‚Äù weight as fast as it will let me. I end up gaining weight instead even if it‚Äôs perfectly clean eating because that‚Äôs A LOT of food. Sometimes I‚Äôm sedentary so I logged my lifestyle in to fit a diet for that, but 1600 is impossibly high for my low metabolism to keep up with & I start to feel bigger and bigger & the scale reflects that. I do want to be more active, but that has nothing to do with the app so any progress I make that way is now help from LifeSum. Many other approved sites suggested I subtract 500 calories a day from my regular intake (about 1600 more or less) to lose 1 lb (3500 cal) a week. And then raise my cal intake back up to 1300-1400 to maintain my weight once I reach my goal. So if I don‚Äôt BURN 500 extra cal per day while eating 1600 cal, I‚Äôll never see progress, and I may actually see worse. It‚Äôs annoying that it will not let me lower the counter one bit. 1600 cal is hardly a weight loss diet for anyone! It‚Äôs just about normal for maintaining for most people (especially sedentary) & easily well fit for GAINING for sedentary or less active people in general.

title: Horribly inaccurate!
body: I used Lifesum for several months a year ago and it was excellent because of the accuracy and ease of use. Using the app to track my macros really helped me accomplish my goals. Over time, I fell out of the habit of tracking my diet because, well, life.

title: HELP
body: So the app it‚Äôs self was wonderful but a couple hours after I did the 49.99/1 Year subscription I changed my mind and ended the subscription will I get a refund ? Or what do I have to do to do so?

title: If you‚Äôre counting carbs or care about accuracy at all, skip this app!
body: TLDR: bought the premium app at 50 percent off since the user face is so beautiful (that‚Äôs my one star). If you‚Äôre looking for any sort of accuracy in the recorded nutritional content, you're best using a different app like My Fitness Plan, Senza, etc. So utterly disappointed that nearly every barcode scanned calculates the wrong information. I can accept some errors here and there since the data could be user submitted, but holy hell, how many things could be so far from what the nutritional content is for mainstream products like Fage yogurt cups. 17 carbs in 5 ounces of yogurt? Can your app even read?!

title: Do not recommend !!!
body: I bought a year subscription for 29.99 using my PayPal account. My account was never updated and I can‚Äôt get anyone to assist.  I have sent 3 emails with my receipt and nothing. I was suggesting this app to everybody but no more!!!!

title: This company stole my money
body: I purchased a premium membership on May 24th, 2018 for $29.99. It is now February 27, 2019. For several weeks I used the Ketogenic Strict diet plan and then tried out several other plans in the app. After a few months I fell off the plan. I never deleted the app but did log out. I am now attempting a lifestyle change again and logged in to my account using the email I originally purchased my membership under. The app now tells me I need to resubscribe to premium and am only on a free access account. On the free account you can‚Äôt use the Keto diet plans. I should not have to resubscribe when I already purchased a subscription that has 2 more active months. This app stole money from me by changing my account status without my consent. I do not recommend this app due to this shady practice. No telling how many thousands of other people have had this happen to them without realizing it.

title: Amazing to use
body: I have been on the hunt this year for the best of everything. I‚Äôve literally downloaded 8 different apps developed for the purpose of losing weight and/or living a healthy lifestyle. I downloaded and learned this one, sadly, last. It‚Äôs so straight forward. I just wanted a little push to help keep me on my goals. And I‚Äôve seen the competing apps, some I didn‚Äôt even understand what they were asking for me to input. This one has everything I need, in a comprehensive and straight forward layout. It‚Äôs detailed but simplistic. I think the only way I could do better is if I hire an actual nutritionist and personal trainer to follow me around everywhere, and goodness knows I‚Äôm not doing that. Thanks for the great and easy to use app!

title: One request please
body: I‚Äôm currently using the premium version. A visually appealing app with some nice tracking features.

title: Great app, quick and easy
body: I‚Äôve been using Lifesum premium for almost a year now and I really do love it.my only thing is I wish I could tailor my macros and calories myself

title: Latest update issues
body: Only allows for me to gain weight, does not let me choose maintain or lose weight. Wish I had saved my 39.99 now. So disappointing!

title: Not saving my goals AT ALL
body: It asks for my goals and I input all of my information but it doesn‚Äôt save it at all. I‚Äôll look back the next day and it‚Äôll say I want to gain weight and my profile picture will be gone. My password ends up being my username. This app is not working with me at all. I upgraded to premium and it still advertises upgrading... IM SOOOOO CONFUSED AND IRRITATED.

title: Renewal
body: Paid $44.99 which I did not want and it was not purchased through iTunes.  The app did not update to show the renewal was purchased and would not let me log out and back in.  Tried to send email to support and I get an automated message saying there is a longer response to emails and they will answer me as soon as possible.  I want a refund.  Paying for something that is not working.

title: SCAM!!!!!
body: I haven‚Äôt even started using this app because initially they were offering premium packages for better results while using this app. It varied with different packages but the prices were stating $3.33 a month and other prices around there. When I selected this premium package, willing to pay that amount a month for their services and if I ever decided I didn‚Äôt want to use the app anymore I could just cancel the subscription, right? Well when I selected this package and allowed it to charge my card, the total said $47.51. At this point it had already processed through and the only thing I could do was cancel the subscription, which I did immediately. I also immediately contacted the app support and informed them of the situation. I didn‚Äôt hear anything back from them, and the next day I got a receipt from apple saying the charge went through. I contacted them as well and only received an automated message back saying they could do nothing about it. I now am dealing with overdraft charges and can‚Äôt get through to a single person about the situation. Leading people to believe they are going to pay minimal prices and then charging $50 is completely ridiculous. And anyone who thinks paying that amount for an app that simply calculates your food intake is insane. Worst app experience ever.

title: Couldn‚Äôt read bar code
body: As titled.

title: Fantastic App
body: Now you can monitor what you eat efficiently. The app's bar code scanning feature makes using this app so much more convenient. Loved it!

title: Wonderful but could have some improvements
body: This app is wonderful. I would definitely recommend. It‚Äôs easy to input food and exercise. But for water intake, please, please, please give an option to set the amount of water per cup. I drink from only a 24 oz water bottle and I can‚Äôt customize the amounts. The only options are 8.45 and 16.91. It makes accurate tracking really difficult.

title: Good
body: It‚Äôs great but  if don‚Äôt get premium you don‚Äôt get all the delish looking recipes but I love the bar code scanner and that you can create your own recipes

title: Great App - 1 Request
body: Really well made love the interface and best part the integration with Apple Watch. Seeing my budgeted calorie count increase with activity throughout the day is an amazing feature.

title: Unhappy with customer service
body: This app is advertised as being a certain price per month so I purchased the one advertised as being $3.99 a month for a 12 month subscription which would be $44.99 for the year. I expected that I would be charged monthly as it was advertised but when I received an email with my bill I was charged the full $44.99. I reached out via email to ask about this and get a refund and the company responded that I must get permission from Apple iTunes to get this refund. So now I have to jump through hoops to get my money back and what is their response when I ask why it is advertised that way instead of ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry‚Äù or ‚Äúhow else can we help?‚Äù?? That I should have read the purchase before subscribing. Now that is just sneaky. Do NOT advertise your company as being a monthly payment then charge people the full amount. I‚Äôm sure it was written somewhere in tiny font that no one can even read. That is just bad customer service too. I am very disappointed with this company and how they handled this.

title: Great app, bar code scan doesn‚Äôt work well
body: This is an easy to use app. I only use the free version. I can pretty much find all foods I want to log. However the bar code scanner doesn‚Äôt work well. I can‚Äôt gat many of them to scan at all. So in return, it takes longer to log my foods.

title: Wish it was like the Android version! ):
body: I started using the android version of this app and was COMPLETELY smitten - this version makes me a little disappointed. I do wish the smiley or ‚Äúmeh‚Äù faces were optional to remove from the diary and that it would split the difference in calories between meals for the day as the android version did. As in, not telling me I‚Äôm 100 calories over for my lunch meal when I had 15 calories for breakfast. I still give it 4 stars because it does truly help me stay on track either way, I just hope future updates will help it match up with the android version.

title: ‚ÄúOk‚Äù
body: There are SO MANY food items that are just flat out wrong in this app ‚Äîmany incorrect calculations. You need to do a way better job of keeping it cleaned up. Users beware - make sure you double check everything or use the bar code scanner most of the time.

title: Inaccurate
body: I‚Äôve only had the app for 8 days. I really liked the idea of the app and the layout. I even got my boyfriend to download it because he was curious about it. After a week of tracking our food, water intake and steps. We realized that it was inaccurate on certain items. For instance large sonic fries said it has 57000 calories but when we looked it up on the app because we thought that seemed high it says only 470 Calories. Also I dislike the fact that I can‚Äôt customize the meals I make and it gives me options for meals in restaurants that I‚Äôve never heard of because we don‚Äôt have them in the south. As well as the water intake. It only gives you options for 8.45 & 16.91 fl oz. The cup I use is a 32 oz. I feel like there are a few things that need to be fixed if they‚Äôre going to charge for a subscription.

title: Buyer  Beware
body: Beware...it says 14 day free trial and if you cancel before that you won‚Äôt be charged. It charged me whitin 5 min of me subscribing to the app. They will not refund you either. Also Apple will not refund you either. I‚Äôm out $59.99 now for an app that is not even that great

title: New user
body: Is there a way to add a new custom food item?  I‚Äôve don‚Äôt the bar code add. I don‚Äôt see an option to add when a bar code isn‚Äôt available (i.e., Starbucks or homemade recipe).

title: Disappointed...
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for a little over a month; starting out with the classic diet then 2 weeks in switched to keto strict. I love the setup, the meal ratings, the tips & the ease of use but I‚Äôve found that SO MANY food nutrients are incorrect, even when scanned. For example: International Delight Sugar free Coffee Creamer is labeled on the bottle as <1 carb per tablespoon. When scanned it says 0 everything & even when I go in to manually edit the food for correct information it changes back to the original incorrect information. I was trusting the info in the app when scanned & thought wow I can have more than I thought. Come to find out my few cups of coffee with cream that I thought was no carbs was actually 9g of carbs! That‚Äôs half a days worth of carbs in 3 cups of coffee üò≥ also Ground Cinnamon says you are -2.5 per teaspoon; also incorrect. I scanned the label & got so excited that I was negative carbs! Wrong again. I had to go out of my way to find the correct nutrients online & come to find out it actually was adding carbs. Too late though, cause I had already ate the food. I feel that paying $49.99 for a yearly subscription is extreme when I have to go out of my way to research anyway to ensure what is in your system is correct. I really loved this app until I found out that information on things I‚Äôve been eating was wrong. Now I‚Äôm questioning if I‚Äôve even been in ketosis at all because who knows now what my carb intake, fats, & proteins really were for all the times I just scanned & trusted your system. Also with the exercises, there are so many standard ones that aren‚Äôt even listed. I‚Äôm just really disappointed.

title: Love this app!
body: Found this app randomly. Downloaded it accidentally. It‚Äôs been love ever since. Shared it with a table of friends at dinner who couldn‚Äôt stop asking me questions about the app and my results. I chose the Keto Strict, and will move to Keto Moderate when I‚Äôm ready however there are many great options with inspiring meal plans, Mediterranean, etc.   I never knew how sated I could feel. Ever. The app showed me how much fat, carbs and protein it wanted me to have at any given meal for my ‚Äúdaily diary,‚Äù and even made adjustments to allow me more food after exercising. This makes me want to buy myself more calories and fat just by exercising‚Äîagain and again. The app made me feel good about not following it perfectly. (Since when was guilt never part of dieting?) anyhoo, I love the reminders and alerts. Know that Keto is not the ‚Äúhigh protein low carb‚Äù and this app has made all the difference in my education on the issue. I have found that Healthy fat is King and is probably the vital nutrient missing in most people‚Äôs diets these days. ...Never knew how much fat one could/should have in a day on a Keto strict diet. Freaking amazing! Once I got up to par on my daily intake needs, the rest was a piece of cake, without the temptation!

title: Immediate buyers remorse
body: I don‚Äôt understand how this app is getting good reviews. There are so many issues with it. Here are just a few:

title: Awesome, but would like to see a few more things
body: I like this app, I like you can choose which plan you want, I like that it shows macros for the day. I like that it tells what is good and bad in food choices, and that it reminds me to eat fruit and fish. I paid for the premium, to get the most out of the app, but these are some things I would like to see: 1) I can edit my macros to my ideal goals. Right now my goal is kinda in the middle of being healthier/cutting fat and gaining muscle. I‚Äôm skinny, a tad muscular but have some fat to lose. My macros I like to aim are 30-50/30-40/20. 2) more choices/variety for the ‚Äúhow much‚Äù. It‚Äôs pretty difficult to exactly see how much I eat or drink but how I would measure it isn‚Äôt on the list so it‚Äôs difficult to track on the app. 3) recommendations for food products. If it‚Äôs saying the slice of bread I‚Äôm eating is high in sodium and is processed, show me breads that would be better choices.

title: Excellent tool!
body: We love Lifesum. Any food you want can be entered in to track nutrition info, either already preloaded or entered manually as a good or a recipe. The bar code scanner is an awesome timesaver. Thank you, Lifesum!!

title: 1st Time
body: Love this apps it amazing I feel like this give you  encouragement positive vibes never giving up on you it make you accountable for your action.Wish  me blessing since I have a goal to achieve by March 2019!!!!!

title: Help

body: I follow Amy Macedo on YouTube and she has the 30% off the premium subscription of the app in a link and when I followed the link and filled everything out it still ended up charging me $45 for the year instead of the discounted price üôÑüôÑ

title: Awesome
body: Awesome

body: Very well designed, beautiful app. But EVERYTHING which might make it different from any ol‚Äôcalorie counter is hidden behind a paywall. With no free trial it‚Äôs impossible to say whether any of the hidden information is worth paying for, so I passed on this app.

title: ...IDEK
body: It is an okay app, but I am rating it 2 stars ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è because the app is made for you to get healthy and at first everything is free, but then you start to play around on the app and you have to pay to get premium, and you cannot get the recipes unless you upgrade!!! What is the point of the app? If I were you I would just look up recipes online and search for exercises on YouTube.

title: Premium
body: Not a bad app. It makes me feel guilty for going over in calories or fats that I‚Äôve started to go more on track. The only thing I don‚Äôt like is that a good offer for premium is $29.99 for a year. Come on, I could write my stats on paper but I got this app to do it for me. I guess if the price was lowered I‚Äôd buy the premium.

title: Goinging vegan
body: Love that I can use the bar code and know how much calories I‚Äôm eating.

title: It‚Äôs great butt
body: I like the app and all but I hate that u have to be premium for almost everything and I tried looking at the recipes but it shows a pic but doesn‚Äôt tell u have to make it but otherwise it‚Äôs okay

title: Not good for specific diets
body: If you‚Äôre planning on Keto or Palio or any specific diet, this isn‚Äôt your app. It‚Äôs ok for just counting calories or basic things. I wasted $30.00 trying to get it to do the protein diet accurately and the way it‚Äôs supposed to be done. Canceled it but no refund.

title: Needs net carbs calculation
body: Pretty good app. Recipes are great. What is seriously lacking for Keto diets is the calculation of net carbs. For a day that is limited to 20g carbs, the app calculates based on carbs and not net carbs (g carbs - g fiber), so you have to manually calculate how many carbs you have left and be ‚Äúout of sync‚Äù with the apps recommendations. The food nutrient database and accuracy of bar code scanning also needs expansion and improvement.

title: Used to love this app
body: I'm on a strictly keto diet, and this app was the best thing since sliced bread to track all my macros when I first started. I found it way easier than the ones others were swearing by, that I won't name.

title: Could be better
body: I understand that not all kinds of foods and specifically where this foods were bought at will show up on the search. But I don‚Äôt know why every time I add an item and put in the calorie number that the app retaliates it as a way way higher number than it is. Today I only ate about 748 calories but it‚Äôs showing me that I consumed 16708 calories.

title: Needs a free trial of premium
body: I love this app, it‚Äôs great to use and pleasing to the eye. HOWEVER, I‚Äôd like to try the premium version before spitting out $34.99 for 6 months of it. I don‚Äôt really have that kind of money to just throw away on an app so it‚Äôd be nice if they offered a free trial. Otherwise, it‚Äôs a great app and I recommend it to everyone I know!

title: Buyer Beware!!!
body: This is a beautiful app but so far barely any of the nutritional information is accurate. I wish I vetted the app better before paying as I really regret this purchase. The team at Lifesum should spend less money on marketing and more on getting he core feature of their product (nutrition information and tracking) accurate. Literally even SCANNING the food‚Äôs bar code produces incorrect data,and there‚Äôs so way to change or update it, which is incredibly frustrating.

title: It‚Äôs a pretty good app
body: This app is laid out pretty well, it takes the guess work out of hitting macros and has a pretty large list of single food items in its data base.

title: Ripped off
body: Downloaded this and decided to go for the premium. Said it would be a monthly charge.  Nope they charge the whole $ 44.99. Wouldn‚Äôt have got it if I had known.

title: Highly Recommend
body: I never write reviews for apps, but this one is an exception. I‚Äôve been going to the gym a lot lately and wanted to start to balance out my food calories and burned calories. I downloaded LifeSum and MyFitnessPal just to see which one helped me better - LifeSum exceeded my expectations by a long shot. The layout is aesthetically pleasing and super easy to use. To be fair, it might take some time to get a hang of logging certain things, but I keep finding new features and I love it! As a rule I never buy premium versions of apps (with the exception of Spotify) but I bought the premium version of LifeSum and I don‚Äôt regret a penny of it. This has helped me out so much - I highly recommend the Clean Eating Plan, or the Keto Easy Plan (even if you aren‚Äôt keto ‚Äî I‚Äôm not, but I am trying to cut down on carbs and Keto Easy helps so much). I love this app

title: Premium Pricing.
body: The app is great in itself, but in order to make it more accessible and reasonable, instead of charging the full price for a subscription to Lifesum premium at once (i.e. $44.99), simply just charge the basic price ($3.75/month). It‚Äôd be more preferable to make recurring payments of that small amount and be able to cancel your subscription at any time, rather than cancelling your subscription and losing an entire $45 for an app.

title: My weight management journey
body: I began using this app Dec 31 2017. I weighed 193lbs. (I‚Äôm a 52yr old 5‚Äô10‚Äù man) I‚Äôm know, May 25 2017, 172lbs. This app allowed me to be mindful of my food and exercise habits. I‚Äôve simply done calories in calories out.

title: Update ruined it, deleting too
body: After losing 70+ lbs over the past 2 years, they ruined my favorite app...

title: Better than Lose It!
body: This app may not have as many reviews as Lose It, but trust me this is the best calorie and exercise tracker in the app store. The daily diary format matches your day, but more importantly you can choose any measuring system or unit. Try it for 1 or 2 days and you will see what I mean. ;-)

title: Great Way to Keep in Shape!
body: This app is great. It helps you to monitor what you eat and drink on a daily basis. You also can input your weight goals and what type of nutrition plan will best fit you. The only thing is if you want to see some of the meal plan ideas, you have to upgrade to premium which is like $24.99 for the year... which isn't bad !

title: Was great!    9/29/17
body: I don't know what happened! When I first started this app it was great......as of the September 27th update, all of my history is gone and when I type in my meals the options that come up for names of foods and company's are vague, very few options. I DON'T LIKE THE UPDATE! I was going to upgrade to the premium version.....not now......$44.99 for 12 months is too much for a bunch of recipes I probably won't use.

title: Clumsy, incomplete, not intuitive.
body: Trying this out for the first time with my daughter for our New Year‚Äôs resolution.  The user interface is awkward.  Features are not logically arranged to make entering data convenient.  The bar code scanner does not work most of the time.  The developers leave it to the user to enter food and create their data base so you see the same food entered 20 different ways.  The button layout should walk the user through the process of using the App. Instead you spend a LOT of time back tracking.  It‚Äôs a total mess...but hey, it‚Äôs free. You get what you pay for!

title: Deceitful Advertising
body: They advertise on their app that the price for a 12 mo membership is a little over $3 and in tiiiiny print above it, it says $44.99. Oh and then they have it advertised in the App Store as $29.99, but they only give you the discount if you go from the App Store and buy the subscription there. Super screwed up way to do business.

title: Turkish language
body: Please add turkish language.this app will br amazing with it

title: This is getting annoying
body: I‚Äôve had the app for a while even when I had an android phone, it has worked perfectly fine. I just the iPhone the end of December and the app was working fine until now. When I click on the app it‚Äôll stay open for a good 5 seconds then shuts off. I turned my phone off tried it again, didn‚Äôt worn, deleted then redownloaded and it‚Äôs still acting up. I love the app but that‚Äôs getting on my nerves.

title: Junk...makes you buy a "ShapeUp Club Gold"
body: Paid full price for the old app. Never updated it. Liked it a lot. The new app is garbage. Umm, I think that defeats the purpose of buying an "app". If I wanted to go to my computer & browse the web, why would I pay you a subscription to be limited to just you site?...because it syncs to your app? Just purchased LiveStrong app. Hmmm seems you can search right from the app...genius!

title: Basic but very helpful. (pre-update)
body: I am happy with this app. Not thrilled but happy. It's helped me lose 5 pounds in 4 days (since beginning my New Year's Resolution) but that is a testament to counting calories in general. I enjoy very low-cal crash diets and this app doesn't hassle you about not eating enough like others do so that's a plus. I often have to enter my ready-meals myself as this app doesn't have as many entries (brands and varieties) in its database as I would like. It doesn't do anything special but definitely serves its purpose and was free when I uploaded it. However, I am reading the newest reviews and see that it is no longer a free service as of the update. Some have mentioned a recurring membership fee?!? I'm sorry you guys were duped but I thank you so much for warning me before I updated this app. I do like this app but it is not worth paying for. Sorry. If you folks are willing to pay, I'd recommend the Calorie Counter Pro by MyNetDiary which is much more comprehensive and user-friendly. No recurring membership fees, just $2.99 up front and worth every penny. I was unable to transfer that app to my new iPhone4 because my MacBook operating system is antiquated so I tried this app instead. I will continue to use this for as long as I can without updating but I would not pay for it. It just isn't worth the money. Especially since I have no interest in joining their club. I just want to log the calories I eat and burn and there are other apps that make doing so simpler and more fun.

title: Calm down people
body: I updated this app to v3.3.1. My backup data is still saved within my iphone. You only need to sign up for the account and get the Gold feature for 3 months such as complete sync etc. After gold expire, you'll status is just back to free account like before, and you still can use this app for its core feature. The free account is only lack feature of complete sync(etc.?), and you can only backup your data for last 1 month(maybe?), the data older than that will be deleted. I still love this app.

title: Update killed this once great app

title: Fantastic!

title: Pretty good
body: I have used this program on and off for three years. I always lose weight when I use it. I generally get tired of entering everything I eat individually and wish the database had more commercial items, like common restaurant items at major chains. Even if the exact item I ate wasn't in there, I could more easily find a substitute. It's a good program overall and for the price I think it's a great deal.

title: Great!
body: Easy to use, tons of foods available through the online database. My only complaint is that there aren't enough activities. And I question the number of calories burned for each activity. Seems a little high.

title: My all time favorite!
body: I've tried several apps, as well as old fashioned paper & pencil.  Shape Up is the easiest to use.  I love the meals I've created as well as the huge database of foods.  Sure held keep me on track.

title: Nice functionality, poor search quality
body: I like the form of this app better than MyFitnessPal, but unfortunately the search algorithm needs some work. The two searches I did--eggos and Illy--were found immediately by the MFP app, but this one required the qualifier "waffles" to be appended to "eggos" and only found "Illy" as parts of other words (e.g., Philly). You've got the form nailed--make the function match it, and you'll have a 5-star app.

title: Great app!!!!
body: I lost 4 kilos since October) it's very useful)) now I just can't live without this great app! Thanx)

title: Overall good app.
body: I like the app. However, I think there should be away to manually write your own fat, protein, and carbs in as a custom meal. It will allow you custom calories, but why not further that and also allow the fat, protein, and carbs which should then auto calculate the calories. There are times when there are unique foods you cannot search for, and would be easier just to estimate the fat, protein, and carb grams manually. If you could do that, I would give it 5 stars.

title: Wonderful management tool
body: I like counting calories instead of points (too complicated). This is easy to use, has an extensive food database plus you can add your own favorites and custom meals. I've tried other apps but keep coming back to this one for its simplicity.

title: Good program

Lots of settings for goal planning and like yhat you can go online on pc or Mac and print stats out for a week or month, etc.  Food database isn't as robust as others I've used, but still good.  Highly recommend for low carb dieters.

title: Using for ketosis
body: Great UX. Wish we could modify macros for ketogenic plans (to 75/20/5) without it making you switch to a generic plan. The keto tips are helpful but following the Hopkins ratios can be tough for "civilian" use. Also wish net carbs are the carb counting.

title: My honest opinion
body: This App is great and on the rare occasion it isn't.

title: Great app, but
body: Very useful for weight loss or gain efforts, but since I'm also trying to monitor my water intake I'm frustrated by the fact that the container sizes are fixed. I don't own any glasses or water bottles that hold exactly 8.45 or 16.91 fluid oz. and try to avoid mental math where I can, so for now I'm using a seperate app to log my water intake.

title: Better, but premium is not worth it
body: I am a premium member. Aesthetically, this app is leaps and bounds better than MyFitnessPal. However, it's extremely biased towards on the calories-in-calories-out paradigm. There are very few customization options for paying members. For instance, there is no way to easily view net carbs, and viewing the carb breakdown takes several clicks. The weekly graphs dont display much more than your caloric intake, which is frustrating if you are trying to figure out how you did on your macros. There's some weekly test that a)doesn't work most of the time and then b)grades your responses by some pop culture nutrition nonsense. There is also an annoying emoji that reprimands at ever.single.meal if you for not adhering to the standard American diet. Most of the navigation options are useless. Why are plans so incredibly persistent? I don't need to see that all the time after I've picked a plan. Strangely, low carb and keto plans are listed, but they lack any customization options. You're stuck with whatever white girl nonesense the app has decided is good for you.

Waiting for the day when it is cheaper to eat healthy and to loose weight. Until then, guess I need to look for another app to help me.Edit: Fitbit sync fir free would really be nice. But your response shows you have no desire to help, only make money.

title: Love it, can only get better
body: Invested in myself with the premium version and use it on both my android and iPhone. Slightly different interfaces but both good. Some nutrition macros are off, but I don't mind correcting them. I Iike how I can add recipes, and the ketogenic "fat burner extreme" meal plan tool offers exactly the kind of tracking I was looking for. After years of different eating plans, this app has been a tool that helps me stay on track, its day 12 and I'm 8 lbs down in ketosis. I like the graphics and feel of this app more than others. A desktop version would be great for rapid entries, but I'll still use this without it.

title: Well, it's a good try.
body: They layout and interface are beautiful, gave me hope for over all experience. But even with an upgraded plan I still wasn't able to adjust my macros, I was just given three choices. I like being able to set my own protein/fat/carb instead of having to choose what they give me and then having to figure it out on my own. The app also has a very limited database of food with the bar code scanner. It also does not sink with Fitbit/garmin. Also, some food is WAY off. For instance it told me that 4 large eggs had 135 carbs. Ummmm...escuse me? I didn't eat Cadbury eggs, just regular 'ol chicken eggs. That was more carbs than I was supposed to eat for the day. Since I KNEW that was WAY off it made me wonder about the rest of the food.

title: Don't pay to upgrade!!!
